review_body: Travelled here as part of a mini-holiday before attending a conference on the West Coast in Jan. Room was well stocked and had great views of the Freedom Tower and 9/11 site. Convenient location to access Midtown from the Subway. While I understood that the there is no restaurant on site, I was not acknowledged in any sense as a Marriott Platinum member. That was the only downside though as the facility was well maintained.

This Hotel is in a good location..close to Wall Street and the 911 Memorial and museum. Helpful staff!It is in need of some serious upgrading in the hallways and rooms.... Looks like it was last done in the late 80's!!

Well located for the Financial district this hotel has a funky style, but is still partially under renovation. Evening room service was limited to pre-prepared food which was adequate. My room was small but nicely laid out and extremely comfortable. The hotel has a nice bar with big sofas.

Even though the restaurant is closed I am really excited. They were honest about that and I appreciate it. I am going to get food at one of the thousands of places around lol. Also I just dealt with a nice person at guest service who answered a ton of questions for me. She was very helpful. Then when I was ready to book the lady transferred me to booking. I just booked my room. I'll post again with pictures when I get there. It's a ultra corner king room. I am hoping the view is visible from the bed. We shall see. So excited to go there. This hotel has such great reviews. Happy Valentine's Day everyone. Five Rate Customer Service on phone so far!!!

I’ve been here before to meet with friends but this was our first stay here. The location is great, close walk to everything in lower Manhattan. Rooms were updated and clean and staff was mostly friendly and courteous. This hotel is modern in both design and amenities. For example, a key is needed to operate the lights as in Europe, the mini bar had condoms (very smart) and there is 1 lobby restroom for everyone. Currently the hotel is going through some exterior and exterior renovations so there is no restaurant in the hotel. The mats in the elevator are changed throughout the day which is a neat touch.

This was my first time staying downtown as I usually stay around midtown. The hotel is accessible enough from JFK either by train/subway or taxi and when you get to the hotel the lobby is located on the 5th floor.The friendly staff checked me into my room "with WTC views" on the 15th floor (#1505), and what amazing views they were! The mood-lit room was big and had a large bed, but the bathroom was a little small.Being on the 15th floor meant no noise at all apart from the occasional siren, but that's to be expected in New York, but no problems at all with sleeping.The bathroom was clean and well-stocked, but the shower was tricky to turn on without getting soaked in freezing water whilst you turned the taps on, a bit of a design flaw. Once the water was hot and you were showering, it was fine.As others have noted, there is no restaurant at this hotel at the moment, only the lobby bar which is available for drinks. The staff at the bar are friendly and chatty and made you feel welcome. However, I was surprised to return at 10:15pm Sunday evening to be told the bar was closing. I thought this was very unusual for a New York hotel bar to be closed by 10:30?!Being downtown is fine, there's plenty to see during a stay here, but if you're in New York for tourist reasons, you'll more likely to be on the subway to go to mid/uptown quite a bit.The free internet was ok, usually around 7-10Mb down/up. The hotel is a great choice and I would stay here again. But note there is no restaurant at the moment and multiple subway trips to midtown/uptown as a tourist.

You should be aware that they are refurbishing the eating area, so there is no food, not even for breakfast. At least, they could have something for breakfast apart from just beverages. Not sure it is clear on their web site. And not sure how long this is supposed to last. This is made worse as in Downtown, there are fewer eatery options. Staff was helpful and effective, not super warm. Reception is on the 5th floor. The entrance is a bit grotty. The common areas feel a bit small. They tried to make the Reception area a bit funky. My room was clean, nice and quiet, not huge though. It had some views. Overall an ok stay but not great. I will stay elsewhere next time.

We booked a meeting room here for a 2hr meeting. We were quoted $400, without then mentioning a 25% "service charge" that would be added on. They also tagged on another $400 for use of the video screen in the room. Total of $1100 for 2 hours. During our meeting the staff started setting up for another event which resulted in a tremendous amount of noise (since it was in the adjoining space that just had the little partition dividing). This went on for about half the time. Nicole offered to do something about the price and then refused after the fact, saying they had instead offered to extend the meeting time (which wasn’t an option since my team had other commitments). Completely unacceptable.

Nicely located at down town with nice staff supporting and a good overall rooms Resturant is under renovation and not working and also no room service only option is to go out to have food Price is high compared to the current status they have

Opportunity to stay overnight for a business meeting at the W Downtown. Entrance to hotel is modest in size and obscured by scaffolding; consequently, taxi dropped off after passing main entrance in pouring rain. Lobby is an elevator ride to the 5th floor; it is dark and small requiring check-in to involve lining up against an adjacent wall. Check-in (2 stations) was labored but friendly. Assigned corner room was nicely adorned with the expected W-esque furnishings and decor (eclectic) but is showing its age. Room was functional - there were ample power outlets, but bathroom was small with limited landing areas for toiletries. There is no restaurant in the hotel but concierge provided good suggestions for nearby establishments. Overall, a decent W hotel but overcharging for its condition.

We stayed at the hotel for a weekend. It's located right next to several subway lines and the 911 Memorial site. Very convenient. It takes about half an hour to get to Times square, so you need to be prepared for that.

We spent a weekend at this hotel and were extremely pleased. They were very attentive and responsive to our needs. The rooms are spacious with an unbelievable view of the 9-11 Memorial and the new World Trade Center. It was very easy to hop in a taxi for a quick ride to mid-town. Highly recommended !

Stayed here as part of our one year wedding anniversary. Hotel is in a great location for exploring lower Manhattan and Brooklyn. The first thing you are presented with is the restaurant being closed, which is evidently opening soon. This is a big drawback as there is no food in the hotel or room service beyond very basic room temperature items, which feels very sub-par for a W. Lobby is visually stunning, and all staff is lovley and very accomodating. The woman at the front desk was great and when I mentioned it was our anniversary- she took my keys back, made some adjustements and gave us a great room with a view of the world trade site with very cool window seating built in. So nice of her. Housekeeping staff in hall was excited to welcome us and gave us some free water bottles, which is always a nice touch. The room had a great view and bed was very comfy. Most W's I've stayed in have had some kind of ambient or indirect lighting and this one seemed like it should, but room was quite dark at night even with lights on. The bathroom is the saddest part of this experieince. I don't think the whole hotel has been renovated since it opened, but you can only tell in the bathroom and the hallways on guest floors. It has no counter space, and the shower, which should have a rainfall head and be lush, was weak in water pressure and kind of had an odd smell. Very dissapointing. Guest hallways were scratched up and felt more like a sad Sheraton than anything else. Due to staff I gave four stars as the hard product isn't their fault. Hopefully a reno is coming soon. One last thought is my worry about the W Hotels brand. What was once a vibrant brand with personality and quirkiness has kind of turned into what feels like a drunk party girl vibe judging by the lobby and such. It feels to have lost is place amongst some stronger brands in Marriott's portfolio like Edition and AC... Hope she can find her way again.

Stayed here recently for 3 nights on a business trip. 420 bucks a night for a small room. No restaurant or breakfast facilities and the last evening an event meant no bar either. Although close to the office, for that price I expected far more. Not recommended and will not stay there again.

This is the worst hotel I’ve had the misfortune to visit in the last 10 years. From condition to cleanliness to service this hotel hits the failure trifecta. I expect better from Marriott properties..

This is not a positive or negative review of the hotel, only a warning that the property is surrounded by scaffolding and under a remodel. The room I was in was also very old and dingy, not what I expected from a W. I’m hoping that with this remodel the hotel will be back at the standards of the brand. For the amount spent, there are plenty of available hotels in the surrounding area. Surprisingly no discount was offered for staying in this construction zone.

I very much enjoyed my stay at the W Downtown. The building is modern and easy to find. The front desk staff were extremely accommodating and friendly. My room was in perfect condition and featured a perfect view of the Freedom Tower. Would definitely stay again
user_name:
jmerc91
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The hotel was nice and clean and modern. The staff was fantastic. The hotel was undergoing some construction so the restaurant was closed and there wasn’t any room service. The bed was very comfortable. The location isn’t that great unless you are in the financial district for world but it’s wonderful looking out the window seeing the 9/11 memorial. It is close to shops and restaurants so that is a plus too.

Booked here to attend the tunneltotowers. My first impression... dark. I did notice it in pictures and wasn’t a fan when I saw online but stayed here because it was close to the event. Small rooms and very muggy/musty smell. The ac hits you in the face and there’s no way to change it.. (double bed room) I am not a fan of the bathrooms. Everything is just dark.. feels dirty. The floor of the shower is the floor of the bathroom with a curtain to block the water. I think that’s why the rooms smell. The view is great and love the big open windows but I probably will not return to this hotel when visiting New York in the future. I also don’t like that we have to get an elevator up to lobby, then from lobby another elevator to room but maybe that’s how it is in NY.

I book hotels for my company every week in this area. I've probably made reservations with 20 or more different hotels around the country and this is the first hotel that doesn't allow credit card authorizations. So if you're going on a business trip, you're company can not pay for it before hand. It was not stated anywhere on the receipts or confirmation or before you book. I called Marriott customer service and they said they cannot cancel because I missed the cancellation period. I would not have booked this place if I had known that fact.

Lifesavers, smiling and very helpful! Big shout out to Roxy - you made my day. Hotel rooms are a perfect size with great views. Very central! Only downside is the missing restaurant, but luckily there are a few places nearby. :-). Definitely coming back!

Nice New York hotel. Great view of the world trade center and the financial district. Small rooms, but that's pretty typical in New York. The hotel restaurant is under renovation which is kind of disappointing. Also, the concierge was very helpful, and check in with Roxy was a breeze she’s very friendly and helpful. Will definitely stay again!

I have stayed at this place several times. It amazes me that the restaurant is constantly closed year after year. Reception is as cold as the decor. Do not expect any requests to be honored. My "spectacular" room smelled musty and was tired and sorely in need of a refreshing-like an old Fairfield Inn. There are plenty of nearby hotels for the same price or less that are way more appealing than this hotel.

Hard to get too excited about a hotel with rooms a small as the W downtown. Always a concern with the W brand, this location is a particular problem. The staff are normally pretty nice but the location makes it hard to find cabs and isn't ideal for anything other than downtown business.

Took a quick girls trip to the city on a Saturday night and stayed at this hotel. Check in was quick and professional! Lobby is very sleek!Ended up hanging out at the hotel bar balcony and having a glass or two of wine while taking in the beautiful view! Moderately priced drinks for NYC!Room was clean and comfortable. The glass enclosed bathroom with pocket door was not my favorite, but it was well maintained!

Great stay at the W! The staff is super friendly and so helpful. I needed something printed and was having a problem connecting to their printer. The front desk staff immediately jumped in to help, having me forward the document to their email so they could quickly print for me. Room and hotel were impeccably clean. The bell staff was also super helpful with storing bags for us and then helping to get them loaded. Thanks for a great visit!

No breakfast option available, no coffee machine in the room... what you get is really good location (if you want to be in the World Trade area. For the W, I feel like it's lacking amenities that you get elsewhere for a comparable-priced stay.

We had a quick overnight stay in Manhattan and stayed here as a downtown option for a change. A bit hard to find and the taxi drivers don't know unless you direct them but it is a nice property with a nice outside bar w/ a view of the WTC and nice amenities.

The W downtown was my 1st W property and 1st Westin aka Marriott hotel I’ve stayed at. I was very impressed by how much of a great hotel the W is. Hospitality at its best. Lobby is in the 3rd floor or so, and as you walk out the elevator you are greeted to music, front desk to the left and a stunning view of One World trade center. Check in was easy and fast. I don’t have any status with W, so i did not get any perks, can’t comment on anything other than the standard room. Another set of elevators will take you to your floor, i was about half way up, as far as the number of floors, and my view was looking south, nothing to brag. Honestly nothing really to see. Room was spacious. Good comfortable bed. Loved the bathroom set up, behind the bed wall/headrest. It truly was a nice experience. I would love to see other W hotels around the world to compare.
user_name:
gabeochoa
New York City, New York

review_body: We had a great time at the W Hotel Downtown. Typical NYC hotel small but friendly staff. Walking distance to new WTC, Westfield Mall and Eataly - loved their gelato! Small park nearby, and close to tourist attractions in the lower Manhattan and Financial District area. We were in the 16th for corner room nice view.

Where to start, the rooms are old, musty and very tiny. The bathroom is incredibly small and poorly lit. There is little to no privacy from the bathroom to the bedroom. The “full size” mirror is in the closet and again, the lighting is so bad in this room I had to use my iPhone as a flashlight to do my makeup for the evening. The elevators are a huge hassle. You have to take 2 separate sets just to get to the hotel room floors. The noise from the hallways was as if there was no wall or door separating your bed from the guests walking down the hall. The bar terrace was closed for no apparent reason the entire 2 days we stayed, even under perfect weather (which is the whole reason we booked this hotel). Very disappointed. The W brand should be ashamed. The only thing going for this hotel is the Starbucks located across the street in the Marriot hotel building and the bed was comfortable.

Beautiful hotel two steps to WTC and surroundings. .We stayed at 8th floor with the magnificent day and night view of WTC.The lobby is very stylish and has balcony - again with the view.The check in and out was a breeze and receptionists are very friendly.The room is big enough and beautifully designed (the design looks like sixties which I love). We stayed at "Spectacular Room, Room, 2 Double Beds, View, Tower - Spectacular Double"Also we didn't here any noise from outside whatsoeverThey offering some snacks and water - obviously for the price, but you can grab some free water in the lobby. Bottom line: We loved it and would stay again.

W properties are meant to be quirky, fun &yet luxurious.The so called NEW W Downtown property is a bust. I get its NYC & I dint expect large room but i was expecting beautiful corridors, beautifully done, plush interiors of the room.My parents were visiting me to mark something special from India,I booked a 2 double bed room accommodating 4 people for 3 of us so that we could spend time with each other.Apart from the WTC view the room was a 3 star level room, old style carpets in corridor and rooms, old doors and super basic toilet (NOT TO MENTION THE TOILET DOOR IS SOO HARD THAT IT WAS IMPOSSIBLE FOR ME TO USE MY FULL STRENGTH AND BOTH HANDS TO SLIDE IT SHUT!)The booking was for 3 people, but right from water bottles to towels everything was still set for 2 people &when asked for another towel etc the service guy took forever to come, when asked for another water bottle, his answer was to call DINNING for the same, like WOW so much for W &its Tag line! No welcome treats, no service, and a room which is nothing but a disappointment (by the way you have to ask for electric kettle there is not tea/coffee tray available in room! even inns have those!)IT LITERALLY FEELS AS IF W TOOK AN INN &SLAPPED ITS NAME ON ITFYI THE RESTAURANT IS UNDER RENOVATION!!I have stayed in 7 W properties before & i feel sad i chose this one to bring my parents along to!This is my first day in a 4 day booking, i shall write another review once i check out about all my experiences.
user_name:
Seseme
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: What makes this hotel great is the location, as it is literally a block from the World Trade Center. They views are currently unobstructed, and your views are truly amazing, however; it looks like a high rise is going up right across the street, which is going to take away how special this hotel is. The rooms were bright, and had spectacular views. The location is great, and is walking distance to all things downtown, including the Oculus, Wall Street, 9/11 Museum, etc. I typically am in NY for business, and stay in midtown, so it was truly a treat to stay here, as I got to see NY from a new perspective!

The W Downtown in New York is meant to be a new, swanky W hotel. Get this, the lobby isn't even on the ground floor. It's on level five! Boom. How cool is that? Not. Not cool at all. It's weird and awkward when you have bags. And that's where the fun stops. The W Downtown is a fake-out. It's nice from afar, but far from nice. I stayed on the 14th floor and walked into to scuff marks on my room door, at eye-level which was weird. The hotel room itself was going for "cool" but pealing paint, a towel holder falling out of the wall and some weird bits of tape near my bed falling off made the room look like it was made by teenagers doing odd jobs on summer break. Location wise, it's solid. The bar on level five is OK but the fancy pictures make it look better than what it is. But really, it's the shoddy workmanship in the room that put this in "do not recommend" bucket for me. Save your dollars on this pretend four star room and go somewhere else where they don't water-down your stay with fake hipster coolness masquerading as swank when the room has weird scuff marks on the door.

No restaurant due to renovation. No roomService either. Small room which I get for NYC but also pretty grubby. Platinum for life gets a low floor and next toThe elevator. Stains on the bathroom wall. Don’t stay here.

Really nice hotel located just a block away from the Oculus and Eataly downtown. Rooms are new, clean, large and comfortable. My only suggestion is to replace the existing black out curtains by real ones. The existing ones don't cover the light and the room is all illuminated by the sun at 5:00 am!!!

Not only was this hotel extremely clean, very modern, very quiet, and super comfortable, but I found the staff extremely helpful for all my needs. This is one of the nicest stays that I've had in a New York hotel in this price range. The fact that they don't have a restaurant on site shouldn't make a difference to anyone, the area is chock-full of a huge variety of places to eat. It ia well-situated for anyone wanting to visit the World Trade Center Museum and and site, and there's so much more. I highly recommend it.

Entering the lobby of the W, you feel like you’re walking through a party or club. The lights are dimmed and the bar was packed. The staff is extremely friendly and accommodating. The rooms are a bit small and outdated, but nice view of the 9/11 Memorial. I would recommend the W if you’re looking for a more lively hotel downtown.

I recently stayed at the W Hotel Downtown NYC and was incredibly disappointed. As an SPG/Marriott Platinum Member, I frequent a number of these properties around the world and am very familiar with the level of quality. And this location did not live up to the brand name in any way.My concerns are as follows:-On check-in I told the attendant that I was a Platinum Member and requested a room upgrade. When I went to the room, I did have a nice view of the towers but definitely not a larger room or suite as I usually am upgraded to.-The room was dirty with marks on the walls and a big stain on the fabric next to the window. The sheets were too short for the bed and the air conditioning literally blew right onto me during the night which definitely didn't allow for a good night's sleep.-There was a group of guys partying in a room down the hall at 1230 AM and when I tried to call the front desk, everyone I dialed either of the phones in the room, they simply hung up. I looked up the number for the hotel on the internet but when I dialed this, it said that the number was out of service. -The restaurant is under construction and so there is no room service-The hallways were dirty and there were bags of garbage in the hall from the cleaning crew in the morning. While I understand that hotels in NYC traditionally have small rooms, I am used to cleaner hotels and much better service. I will definitely not be staying here again.

I can't say enough good things about the W's staff. I left several items behind when I checked out, including an expensive cashmere sweater. The housekeeper turned them in, Melvin in security held on to them and locked them up, and Robert in shipping FedEx'd them right out to me. This is wonderful service!

The W NYC Downtown was phenomenal when it comes to the room and value. Overall the rooms look pretty modern and were very clean.The bar in hotel is very active and added to the lively experience. I would rate it a 5 however upon checking in circa 2AM I had to stand around a bit to wait for front desk staff to appear.

Good location if you need to be at WTC (which i had to) and short walk to Tribeca but else not too exciting neighborhood. Hotel works as expected from a W. I guess size of rooms are small but typical NY. No upgrade but understood hotel fully booked. Will probably stay here again but missed a coffee maker in the room

This place is average. 2* is a reflection of bad value for money. It has no restaurant, which is inconvenient for work travel. It is very darkly lit and has no personality, fees like an empty nightclub. It’s hard to get to your room, as you need to go to the fifth floor and change. And feels impersonal.

Super clean and modern hotel. hotel staff was friendly. Right next to the World Trade Center memorial and close to shopping and the river. 25 minute uber ride to/from the airport. Would definitely stay again.

Great location right by World Trade Centre memorial, Oculus, Century 21 dept store and Broadway. Take elevator to 5th floor reception, where staff were very inattentive despite my Titanium status. Room clean, and great view of WTC. However...bathroom lights very dim, no bedside power or usb sockets, NO Coffee brewer !!!! I'd recommend staying at the Marriott at 85 West, just 5 min away!

We visited this hotel early March . The room was very clean and had great views of the 9/11 memorial site and WTC 1 tower !. The staff were very welcoming too, This hotel is in a great location downtown with no resort fees as of March 2019, so really would recommend it. It’s also close to the subway system.

We stayed in February 2019. Low season of the year.Pro:Customer service was amazing. From concierge to housekeeping. Made us feel warm and welcome. Gave us everything we asked more.The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was clean.Location is awesome. Since is right across from Ground Zero/World Trade center, it is a short walking distance to basically all subway line.Cons/disappointments:Blankets had few stains on them. The white wall weren't as white with black marks on them. Made the room feel not as clean, warm or stylish as it can be.Similar to many other hotels room in downtown Manhattan, our regular guest room is on the smaller side of the scale. (Probably not a Con since is in NYC. Just wanted to point out to those who haven't been to other regular hotel rooms in NYC)Overall, it was a comfortable stay and will return in the future.

Please do not book here if you do not want to be scammed. I booked here and cancelled 24 hours in advance and was giving a cancellation number only to be charged for $229 because I did not read the fine print “you need to cancel 72 hours in advance “‘! What a scam to charge customers for days that they did not stay. When I asked for the manager by the name of Helen Amponsah. 1st all she was foreign and had a extremely strong dialect. I had to asked her over and over what she said because it was impossible to understand her broken English. And this is who is considered the manager! She asked me tocforward my confirmation email and she’d take a look at it.!to my supplies she denied my refund bu tried to shake me down to book another reservation and she would consider refunding my money. What kind of sham is this! As a Marriott Reward member of over 15 years I’ve never received this treatment. All I wanted was a refund for a hotel stay that I did not use. She need customer service training. She don’t not represent the prestegous W brand. I contacted the Home office with my complaint and they took care of me right away! I will be booking thru them now often.

Always good back to NYC, the W is well located if you want to stay at Downtown, close to WTC.The Hotel is OK, rooms are confortable, but the noise outside was huge, because all the area is under construction.But nice bar, and commin areas.Good hotel for the value you pay.

Front desk staff: Always friendly and helpful.Bed: Always comfortableBathroom: Always cleanLocation: Perfect for me (I come here on business)Now the ridiculous part: Since I come here for business, it is totally ridiculous that they are waiting for "the restaurant to be refurbished" in order to be able to offer in room dining that one would expect from a supposedly full service hotel. The last thing I want to do after putting in a 10 hour day at the office, or checking in at 8pm, is to have to go out and find something to eat!Is there any other W hotel that doesn't offer in room dining? I don't think so.Come on already. Get a kitchen and in room dining staff and stop this charade about "we're renovating the restaurant so we can't offer any in room dining at the moment;"

The W couldn’t be more different from its Marriott sister around the corner. It’s cool, comfortable with great service and a fantastic location. Really comfortable bed and lovely room. Even the fact that the restaurant is closed for refurbishment doesn’t take away from a great visit. The concierge has a list of delivery and local restaurant services which are as efficient as room service. And they still do a breakfast service. my delicious parfait tray and latte delivered with speed and efficiency. I was especially keen on the free WiFi and bottled water - lots of it.

We came earlier than the check in time but front desk told us our room is ready and we can use it. We arrived at 11:00 am and check in was at 4:00 pm. We had a nice view of Memorial 9/11. Room was big enough for three people. Decoration was beautiful. It has a beautiful lobby and at the weekend it has DJ at lounge area. All staff was friendly, specially Sabrina helped me to find an excellent tour to see Liberty statues and she recommended very good hair salon. Highly recommended.

When I lowered my blinds, I got a little startled because it looked like there was blood splattered all over. Turns out it was wine stains, but I had to look at it whenever my blinds were down. The base board of my window seat was coming falling off too. For being a relatively new hotel, it feels like it's aging quickly. Showing up in the evening in New York and arriving to no restaurant or room service was really tough, as there isn't a ton nearby, and because I happened to arrive during the arctic chill, venturing out was not pleasant.Then I had and still have a lot of issues with my billing. 1) They charged my wrong card, and it took me multiple follow-ups to get a response, 2) they didn't credit me the correct Marriott points for my stay, and 3) when I opted for points instead of starbucks money for premier platinum breakfast (since there is no restaurant currently), I still haven't been credited the points.Overall, not worth the money.

Please do not base your decision to stay here on the negative reviews. What are these people expecting for a hotel that is affordable, in downtown nyc? It is clean, trendy, and nice for a family or couple. Free coffee at the bar in the morning (yes, you have to leave your room for about five minutes, oh no!). It’s close to the subway and you can go literally anywhere in Manhattan on 1 or 2 trains (or walking only a short distance ie. WTC and Staten Island Ferry/the Battery). The views are great and the hotel staff is friendly. To the people who were stating that nobody said hello to them: maybe it’s because you’re an unfriendly complainer! Anyhow, we would book again. We have had a great time. And the bathrooms are to die for!

I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights this past weekend. First impressions, the lobby is super cool and at night its very dark with cool lights on the ceiling. We ended up with a corner room which was awesome having huge windows on 2 sides of the room. I was hoping for a view of the WTC but this view was nice as well. Cons: the toilet ran the ENTIRE time we were there, and the heater made a very loud, weird noise at night. Other than that, it was a very nice place and I would definitely stay there again!

We stayed here for a mother-daughter weekend getaway back in September and we had an amazing experience. The staff, from the front desk to the porters were nice and very helpful. My teenage daughter and I felt very safe around the area and walked everywhere. Metro station is only about a block away, super convenient! Lots to see and do around the hotel. Starbucks right around the corner was very convenient for grabbing morning coffee on the go, although I should mention the hotel does have free coffee and tea in the lobby area. We were given a room on the 14th floor and the views were SPECTACULAR!We would love to stay here again!

I've spent eight days in this hotel over the last three weeks -- I work in FiDi four days a week, so in my quest to try most of the hotels in the area, the W was on the list.This hotel demonstrates how hard it is to maintain hipness. It's 10 years old and tastes have moved on from the dark, foreboding entryway and lobby. The lobby is mostly empty because it is, in a word, bleak. It’s also uncomfortable in the way that only “fashionable” people can make something uncomfortable. The decor in the rooms -- sort of an IKEA vibe in white -- is getting shabby from a hard decade of use. The hallways are both ugly (I know, I know, it's a matter of taste) and beat-up.The views of Ground Zero are impressive if you want to pay for it. And I do like the showers (in fugly brown tile).But there are two things about this hotel that really put me off.First, it stinks of what the staff calls "W Scent." It's _everywhere_. And no matter what you do, no matter how many times you ask, no matter when you ask, even if you use the mobile app for Marriott gold members in advance of arrival, you'll get a room that smells of this low-rent perfume. (How good can it be when they must buy it by the gallon?)I've tried using the app to request a scent-free room; I've tried calling; I've pleaded with the front desk people. On my first visit, they gave me a room that smelled like 20-year-old stale W Scent; the window wouldn't open the crack that it was designed to so no ventilation was possible. It was agnoy.On my second stay, I got a room that smelled like only a small puddle of W Scent had been used before my arrival. On the second day of this stay, I left a note for Housekeeping pleading with them for fresh pillows that didn't smell like aged-in-the-barrel W Scent. That reduced the odor to a level where shallow breaths didn't choke me.But on the morning of my third night, I forgot to leave a note for Housekeeping. Returning from a long day of work, I discovered the room had been made up with what must have been a garden spray container's worth of W Scent.And that brings me to the staff. They're as inhospitable as one would expect of the gatekeepers to a dungeon, which is the best description of the lobby. Only the freakishly hidden lurker -- I mean doorman at the (dark as night) first floor entryway -- even said hello or good day to me during either stay.Expect Housekeeping to know you are scent-sensitive because you made a stink (ha, ha) about getting a room that isn't perfumed? Come back from work to discover an extra helping of the smell. Ask the staff on the mobile app chat for a W Scent-free room? Don't expect an answer. Ask for a paper bill at checkout? Be met with silence. Expect a smile from the dungeon keepers? Fuggadaboutit. It's as if the staff thinks that because they are in a "boutique" hotel (how exclusive could a Marriott chain property be?), they can be as snooty as they like.The bottom line is, neither the hotel nor the staff's attitude are aging well. I can only recommend this overpriced hotel to travelers for whom a whiff of fashion and smelling like dime-store perfume are your idea of a high-end hotel stay.

So to start it’s a little bit annoying to go in one set of elevators then have to go out and around to the next to even get to your room but it’s not the worst things ever. The rooms are nice but small which is to be expected for NYC... and of course it’s downtown which can be a pain depending on where you going ...a quick suggestion is better mirror placement and lighting. The lighting in the room is dim and could use a bit more and the one long mirror inside the closet door just doesn’t do the trick. But for a NYC hotel good enough size and nice room the cleaning staff was wonderful and they accept pets so that’s always a plus as my friend had her dog with her during the stay!

Had a truly exceptional stay at W Hotel over Xmas. Was really surprised at the size of our room and the large picture window, great window seat and outstanding view !!! Room cleanliness was superb and services provided however disappointed no tea / coffee facilities in the room. All staff were really friendly especially the night porter Eric who was super friendly and couldn't do enough for us - a true credit to your company. You cannot access the rooms from ground level having to change lifts at reception, great security feature. Lots of facilities nearby including Starbucks, Dunkin Donuts, lots of Metro Lines and shopping centre. Walk away from great views of the Hudson, Statue of Liberty and Staten Island Ferry Terminal. Would thoroughly recommend a stay at this hotel and I will definitely re book on returning !!
user_name:
Ceonothus
New York City, New York

review_body: We reserved a spectacular room and the view was amazing and the size of the room is good, but....The room shows some age: the counter of the sink is stained, which doesn’t give a nice feeling and there is just little room in the bathroom lay down your stuff.The room was not always made up with attention, not replacing the missing amenities or towels.The welcome at the check in and check out was very cold (unexpectedly)

I want to preface my remarks by saying I am a Lifetime Platinum Member. I mention this only to provide some perspective as to how much I travel and to demonstrate my loyalty to the Starwood now Marriott brand. On January 1, 2019, at approximately 10:40 pm, I arrived at the W Hotel in Downtown New York and was greeted by the Front Desk Attendant. It should be noted, I have stayed at this property on a number of occasions in the past. I asked if I could be upgraded to a suite and I was informed that this particular hotel does not upgrade Platinum Members. I was also told because I had several different reservations for different nights, I could not be upgraded to a suit. There was mention of a policy where by upgrade to suite could be no more than two night. I had several reservations because modifying a reservation on the website could potentially lead to me being charged for a cancellation of the original reservation - that could lead to a forfeiture of funds....so I customarily make additional reservations. At this point the Welcome Talent Coach Candice Baynes was introduced as the Manager. The Front Dest Attendant did inform me that there were only three suites in the hotel. So I asked Mrs. Baynes if there were any suites available and if there was, could I be upgraded? I was told that one suite was occupied, and one suite was reserved for the following day and the third suit was not clean. I asked if I could wait for the third suite to be cleaned I was told I could not. I asked if I could stay in the suit that was not reserved until the following day knowing that I would have to move the second day because of the "two day policy", and Mrs. Baynes said something about splitting the reservation being a problem. I thought I was fairly familiar with hotel vernacular but I must admit I didn't know what splitting the reservation meant. At this point I am totally frustrated. I have been in other W Hotels when the Manager has actually cleaned a room when housekeeping was not available. Mrs. Baynes not once offered a possible solution to my problem. On this particular night, Mrs. Baynes' managerial decision adversely impacted the bottom line. She literally lost money for the hotel when I walked away. I own a company...I am an employer. If I were Mrs. Baynes employer or Supervisor, based on the situation that I have described, I would have to question how many times a day is making decisions that are costing the hotel money?

Brought my extended family for a visit to NYC especially to visit the Freedom Tower. Was treated nicely to a nice suite upgrade facing the tower! Needless to say, my family, nephews were thrilled to see the room and the views. Also treated to champagne and treats for the kids! Great job making a platinum member feel welcomed. Will be back!
user_name:
swg999
New York City, New York

review_body: The staff is friendly and the decor definitely gives you that WOW factor. The lounge area and Manhattan views is to die for. The standard room and bathroom is smaller than I expected. The big window with the lounge bench is the best feature. The bed was comfortable and bathroom was clean - no issues there. However, there are a few things that made be not rate this hotel 5 five stars (which may not be a big deal to some - just my preference): 1. They may be understaffed because there was only 1 valet guy/bellhop guy my entire stay which means I didn’t get my car valeted lol He was gone taking someone else’s luggage upstairs. So he did valet and bellhop services. Never seen that before. 2. I called downstairs to get more towels and no one answered. 3. I woke up ready to get room service and ordered breakfast, but the menu wasn’t hot prepared food. All they had was continental breakfast ( no hot prepared food like eggs or bacon) and snack boxes. Disappointing for someone that wants to relax in their room and eat breakfast. I guess it makes you go out (check out early lol) and go explore the city. Overall, it was a good stay. Outside of the menu food options they just could’ve been understaffed that weekend. And I liked the location. Not too congested like most of downtown but still close to everything.
user_name:
Skymiles W
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Loved this hotel. Great location, and good amenities. Would come back for sure.Everything you want to see in lower Manhattan is an easy walk from here. Just note that many restaurants in the main financial district tend to close on weekends, but hotel has good food options in-house.

I had a very enjoyable stay this past weekend at the W Downtown! I was in town for a wedding in Brooklyn and the location was excellent for everything I wanted to do. It was quick walk to the Freedom Tower, Oculus, Eataly, and plenty of shopping. It was also pretty conveniently located to Tribeca, Soho, and Little Italy and easy to catch a cab. We had a corner room and the views were lovely! The bed was very comfortable and the staff was helpful and accommodating. I called down for additional water bottles and slippers and they were delivered in a very timely manner. I also appreciated the free coffee in the morning and Photo Booth! Overall, I'd definitely stay here again!

What major or minor hotel does not have a coffee/tea maker in their rooms - W Downtown. Yes they have coffee in the lobby but you have to get dressed for that - no bottled water. Room upgrades are substandard vs what u could get at a Marriott or Westin or Sheraton property. Overly dark lobby bar - a design theme throughout this chain. The other theme is small rooms even with upgrade and being nyc! Many other options in the area - would not recommend or be back.

The decor is nice, very chic and modern. The atmosphere is definitely more for adults, the lounge is very open and connects to the front desk, has a bit of a club like vibe just a bit more toned down- music always playing. Surprisingly the roof top bar was quiet (at least when I was there).

Fantastic stay from check-in to checkout. Highly recommend the Ultra Cool Corner Room as the views of the WTC memorial are spectacular. Free coffee served daily at the bar and it was delicious. The Living Room bar was so relaxing and sexy for a pre-dinner drink or evening night cap. The happy hour is reasonable. Convenient walk over to the water and Brookfield Place (a high end shopping center). Only complaint was that the bed kept sliding off the frame. Other than that, I would absolutely stay here again.

So the w in nyc proved every thing I had felt about the merger takeover. While it’s a nice property the rooms just are not as well finished as Marriott hotels are. More important lily not one staff member said good morning or good evening to me as I walked into the hotel. I write this on my 4thnight. Tonight I even said good evening an the 2 receptionists dove deeper behind their screens. When u get to the details the sheets are not fitted and are too small leading to a rucked mess after a night the bathroom walls and floor are stained. My advice turn the lights on and stop hiding dirt inadequate housekeeping poor construction fix the issues and get back to qualityLet’s hope the Marriott management kick the complacent w team into touch. Until then I’m back to Marriott PropertyS

First, the context: I've stayed here several times before and it has never been amazing, but now it's barely a hotel. I'm a Gold loyalty member.Now to review the latest stay of five nights this month: - Had to request a coffee machine...and once I got one, I had to request that the coffee capsules be refilled each day because they ignored it in the regular housekeeping cycle- The button on the lift to the seventh floor only works on one side of the elevator. I told staff twice. Nothing changed. I don't like a guessing game when I get in a lift! - The ice machine on my floor was broken the entire time. I reported it 3 times. When I ordered ice three times from room service as a substitute, I had to repeat the order twice to actually get it.- I gave up on having the minibar refilled. I drank a small bottle of white wine from it on the first night and it was not replaced despite my repeated requests. - The restaurant was under renovation, so no food available. Instead, I was given a card with some restaurant phone numbers on them. Not menus, mind you...just phone numbers. Since most guests aren't from NY and the Wall St area, they will have no clue what the food offerings are without embarking on research. Thanks for the food research assignment versus (as a minimum) giving me a handful of menus and concierge recommendations. Just wow. - The room contained no guide to hotel services. I asked twice. Didn't get it.- Front desk staff and doormen were kept busy talking among themselves- Calls to the front desk were greeted with zero energy or interest- Had to call down to have dirty glasses replaced in my room. Housekeeping took the dirty ones and failed to replace them.- The "do not disturb" sign was ignored to deliver my laundry. Thanks for waking me!- There was hair in the shower drain the whole stay- Pizza boxes and various other pieces of food delivery trash littered the already grubby looking hallways. Apparently having no inhouse food delivery means they also decided not to service the hallways for used items. Disgusting.- My keycard stopped working and they couldn't figure it out. After me traipsing up and down for two failed re-attempts, they eventually got someone with a master key to let me in. All of this adds up to an incredibly damaging experience for the W brand. These are EASY things to fix. It's table stakes. Not getting the small stuff right doesn't give you a chance on the big things.

No idea what happened to the @Whotel but they have nothing to offer. Checked in late to a dirty room, was told they no longer have a restaurant or room service. They gave me a handicap room as they were sold out (although I booked weeks ago) so I cannot hang my clothes and the shower is the size of a shoebox. I was woken up at 7am after getting in at 1am to all the street noise and construction and now the internet is down so I cannot work. When I called for assistance they were rude and unapologetic -including the manager. Avoid this hotel if you want any kind of service, sleep or the ability to eat anything.

For such well nominated hotel / within the luxury league - I would have expected a little bit more than just a room without a water kettle and slippers / not even a bottle of water upon arrival, but they got face wash and other items such as a shampoo and conditioner and a wash lotion. At least they could have offered breakfast and lunch options, but their bar is open from 0300pm onwards, however, there was coffee and tea in the morning available in the lobby and ice water all day, as well as a chess table game, green apples were also being provided. Location was great, people were decent, not over friendly, not rude, just average and professional without emotions. Good stay and lovely rooms, will come again actually. It's worth paying a visit.
user_name:
SQUALO85
Al Ain, United Arab Emirates

review_body: You can tell a lot about a hotel from the interaction before and after your stay. I was hoping for an upgrade as a Platinum Premiere Elite, however, they did not have one available. It was my GF bday, and as a kind jester they sent a bottle of champagne to our room. During the stay staff was awesome, bar was trendy, location was great. Post stay, had one small issue with billing, was corrected in less than a minute. This was very impressive! I manage a Delta Hotel by Marriott, and being in the industry this hotel met every expectation! Thank you again! Will definitely recommend!
user_name:
MrHotelAndThings
New York City, New York

review_body: I guess it all depends on what you're looking for in a hotel. If you want something with cool sleek design, that has a night club/bar for a lobby that's really dark when you walk in, and a hotel room with angled designs and a modern look, then this could be a good hotel for you. Also the location is absolutely wonderful – – close to the subway, to the World Trade Center, cafés and shopping. The things that disappointed me are not aesthetic but matters of functionality: No electrical outlets by the bed. Even two star hotels have lots of electrical outlets by the bed these days… What on earth? Most two or three star hotels also will offer a complementary coffee throughout the afternoon. This hotel has very good coffee but only until 11. There is no kitchen or café or anything inside to get some food or a cup of coffee; they tell you to walk outside to a Starbucks or something. The lobby looks amazing but when you walk in it's so dark it's hard to see. So if I were going for a night on the town and wanted to stay in a cool looking place and I didn't care about practical things like coffee or food or electrical outlets and all the little things you just need, then I would recommend this place. For my trip I needed to plug things in while I was sleeping and would've liked to be able to get some coffee after 11 or a late night meal. 3 star hotels anywhere in the country have more practical conveniences than this hotel. However I am probably not the target demographic. If you don't care about any of that stuff, then this could be a great place to stay as it is really cool, has a great location, and has a really neat bar instead of a lobby.

A quick overnight stay for a wedding in NYC. Very nice amenities and staff. Average size rooms for the city. Great place to hang your hat if you're staying down in the area of the Financial District and the Freedom Tower.

I stayed a couple of nights in this Hotel and I must say that between kindness, education, cleanliness and value for money, I have nothing to complain! Rooms with all the comforts, quiet and a very varied TV programming.I advise!

Quick two day business trip and all other Marriott properties were sold out so I chose the W which I’ve always categorized as “too trendy for me”. The inside was as expected, the dark clubby atmosphere that others enjoy and expect. Was greeting warmly at the front desk and checked in quickly. As per usual with Marriott (a drawback from the merger) put in a basic room and in the middle of the hotel even though I maintain Platinum Status and have my profile clearly marked that I prefer high floors - I’ve never seen a profile preference addressed by Marriott.Anyway, the room was pleasantly appointed. Looked out over the 911/WTC memorial. All amenities were replaced daily, the room was clean and functional and surprisingly quiet for NYC. If I were to stay downtown agin, I’d definitely consider this property if I was in a “hip mood”.

This W is located very close to the Freedom Tower and walking distance to Battery Park, Wall Street, and TriBeCa. We were upgraded to a larger room, which was nice. The rooms are generally small, even for New York, but clean. The bathroom was a decent size and also clean. We were only there for one night. It was fine. Nothing great.

Good location, nice modern rooms, comfy bed. Only negative is the bathroom does not have hardly any counter space so no room to do makeup easily. I was lucky to be on the Liberty Tower side so I got a spectacular view! The coffee in the lobby is nice quality too. I would stay here again.

Excellent location for visiting World Trade Center area. Staff friendly and helpful. Rooms extremely neat and clean. Great king size bed. Interesting architecture. Small room but view was excellent. Inviting social area with some food snacks, free bottled water much appreciated. I would definitely recommend.

Disappointment 1: Once you get into your room, you can smell a very strong chemical scent. I noticed the hotel do spray an odor neutralizer when they clean the rooms. I wonder if I can request ahead of time for a room not to spray any additional chemical. That's also why I rated this hotel at 3 stars. Disappointment 2: When the front desk asked about your credit card at the check-in time, the hotel will charge you $100 incidental fee without letting you know. I wish they can tell me ahead of time. Disappointment 3: I check in at 3pm, and booked 2 rooms. I told the front desk that I would like have 2 rooms on the same floor, and the front desk said ok, but can only give me key access to 1 room, due to the other room is still cleaning. After dinner, when I get back, they give me another key to a different floor, say I didn’t check in to another room. This means, you can't trust what the front desk say until you get the room keyLocation: This hotel near WTC, it’s a good location, and quite at night. You won’t hear too much taxi honking at night. Parking: Many parking garage around, you can check out the overnight parking price before you park. Room: Not too big, they already add window seat to add more space to put luggage or to sit down. Consider the location, this is not an issue.If you are looking for a room away from the elevator, it’ll be hard, because most of the room area surrounding the elevator. Coffee/tea: They have free tea and coffee every morning from 6-11am, but no coffee or tea machine in the room. You need to request that when you check in

This was a quiet yet very productive location. 1Block away from World Trade Center memorial and other sights. Within minuets to lincoln tunnel, china town and the brooklyn bridge. I travel very often to NY and this is one of my "Go To's" from business, leisure and last but not least Night Life! Is Amazing!!.It won't dissapoint.

The service was good but no one went out of their way to be welcoming. No help as you enter (which would be nice since the entrance is on a separate floor from the lobby, some direction and assurance you were actually in a hotel would be nice), no greeting. And a complaint that is general to all W hotels, that hallways and interiors are so dark. Otherwise, it is well kept, and in a great location. I liked the layout of the room, with glass between the bedroom and bathroom, but it wouldn't have been as comfortable if I was not staying solo.

When staying at any W hotel, the expectations are always high and this one did not disappoint. Beautiful lobby, amazing rooms, and if you're facing the right way, an absolutely spectacular view of the Freedom Tower. Easy walking distance to several great restaurants and bars.

The W Downtown is a truly remarkable facility and hotel. It creates memorably vacation experiences that is excellent for families, couples, and friends. A great place to have a pre-evening drink and an area that is increasingly busy on weekends and always bumping on weekdays. The service levels are unbelievable. The concierge and the front desk (JC) were very helpful helping me ship a FedEx package. Then when I messed up the label, Robert went above and beyond to get the package hand delivered to the Fed Ex location across the street! Their commitment to service made a very stressful situation, incredibly easy and manageable.

It’s been some time since I have returned to the W Downtown on 9/21. It is a beautiful property with historic, breathtaking views of One world Trade center. You couldn’t pick a better one! As a platinum Starwood, and “ lifetime gold” member, now a platinum marriott member, I know a little about what makes a fine property....and most importantly the people. It was soo nice seeing Trevor at the stylish , comfortable lounge bar. He made me feel at home after several years, and I truly enjoyed the conversation and his kindness. In addition, it was a pleasure meeting Aaron, bar manager. I knew her from the W New York ( now Maxwell) in a different role. She was the consummate professional and very attentive to my needs.  The only negative, was talent at reception upon arrival. That’s what prevented an “ excellent “ rating.Four higher room categories were available for an upgrade upon arrival. I was not told about what upgrade I had until the room key was being activated. When I learned it was for a spectacular room, when ultra cool and fabulous rooms, and W suites were available, I asked for a more appropriate upgrade and did receive 2106 which was quite nice. I come to Manhattan essentially weekly or biweekly. My experience was soo great because of the people and property, I might begin to enjoy the W Downtown more often instead of other Marriott members( The Maxwell) in Manhattan! WELL WELL DONE!!

We chose this hotel because of it's proximity to Battery Park - Plans to visit the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Is on a Monday morning so we wanted to have a quick walk. But we also saw a show in Times Sq the prior evening. Subway travel was quite easy from this property.Our bed was extremely comfortable and even the pillows were great (usually this is a problem for me - I hate big thick pillows). The view of the Freedom Tower was awesome. The manager Jamila Pough was really sweet.Would definitely stay here again the next time we plan to do NYC sightseeing.

What an awesome hotel! Check in was a breeze in the very cool 5th floor lobby. Incredible view of the Freedom Tower and reflecting pool from our 19th floor room. Comfy bed with great pillows. Awesome lounge (outdoor terrace closed due to rain) with great music and drinks on Saturday night.

The Downtown NYC hotel scene is far from ideal. I just tried the W for a week and loved it. It is a bit like the premium discount airline: for a reduced services hotel, the W has a vibe and upscale decor charm that is designed to be provocative and edgy. I found the 5th floor reception area/lobby/great room/outdoor seating area/bar -- a compact space of about 800 sq feet to be very functional, upbeat and fun. I loved stopping by the casual bar to grab a beer. The game was always on the TV. Nice escape from the madness of the NY streets.The exercise center was never busy at 5am or 6am and had the treadmills and free weights I needed. I liked that the W has BLISS body products. Room was nice and the desk was very functional. Had a good view of downtown from 21st floor.This is a reduced services hotel. So I had to get breakfast delivered from one of the restaurants in the area -- breakfast came in about 20 minutes and was good. Room was quiet (21st floor) and no hallway noise either. Good sleep quality. SPG had my room preferences ready to go when I arrived.Would definitely stay here again, and some real advantages over the Marriott Downtown and the Millennium Hilton Hotel downtown. Staff was very friendly. Dry cleaning was good, etc. My only negative comment/constructive criticism was the delay in getting change at the front desk: Front desk doesn't seem to have any petty cash.

This is a great hotel, it’s downtown in front of ground zero but just 4 stops from Times Square so you can escape the ‘buzz’ and come back to chill. The rooms are very comfortable and chic so you feel so relaxed . Great view of the world trade centre and the footprints at ground zero.The bathrooms could do with a little thought... include shower screens instead of shower curtains as the whole bathroom gets wet!

It's 17:35 and I'm still waiting with my bags in the reception as my room is not ready!!! Check in supposed to be at 16:00!!! This is ridiculous! I am extremely exhausted as I just had a 14 hour flight plus check in and airport drive etc adds up to atleast 18 hours of travel. One would expect to be able to get a place to relax after such a long journey. This has only made it more stressful. Not even looking forward to the rest of the 5 day stay I have booked. Won't be coming back here again.
user_name:
Abubakr E
Dubai, United Arab Emirates

review_body: If you're looking for a quieter part of town to stay in this is a great option. This hotel is in the financial district and across the street from The Freedom Tower and 9/11 Museum. Short walk to Wall St subway.Rooms were clean and we had a great view of the Freedom Tower! Lobby bar and patio were a cool place for drinks.

Don't be confused by the extremely dark entry and lobby, the W Hotel rooms are quite bright. The location is excellent for work or for sightseeing. It is very close to the 911 Memorial. While my room was clean and, for a NYC hotel, pretty quiet, the decor is getting a bit worn looking. Time for a refresh?

We stayed here for two nights. We arrived at 8:30 am and our room was ready by 10am, so we checked in. Our room was not specious, which was fine with me. At 11am a room service person showed up to check the mini-bar which was surprising to me! I think they should have checked that while they are cleaning and servicing the room, right after the previous guest is left and before arrival of the new guest.Our room was not clean as if they were in a rush to make the room. The bed sheet had dark stains on it and even though we called the room service for that, no one came to change it. The next day, we put the “do not disturb” sign out till 10am. While living the room, we asked the room service person ( who was cleaning the room next door) to service the room and he noted that. When we came back to the room at 4pm, our room had not been cleaned. We left our room again around 7pm and asked for it to be cleaned. We put a note on the bed sheet ( right next to the dark stain) asking for it be changed. When we came back to the room around 12 in the morning, the room was cleaned but the sheet had not been changed! There was no coffee maker in the room, which I think is normal for NYC hotels. They do serve coffee at the lobby from 9-11am, so if you are a coffee lover, you should go outside for your afternoon espresso or order through room service.We like to hang out in the Meatpacking area and this hotel is far from there. It was hard to find Uber or Lyft especially around 5-6 pm from the hotel to anywhere because of the traffic in the area. However, after 10pm it was easy to find a ride back to the hotel.

I arrived on my birthday, after a 13.5 hour flight from Asia, and no one asked to carry my bags upstairs (you need to take an elevator to the lobby). Ok, I can carry my own bags, but I was surprised more than anything at the lack of service. The hotel is dark and dreary. Maybe it’s the look they are going for. Not cheerful, for sure. We have a gold account, and that usually gets us a perk - nothing here. Let me start if by saying there is no breakfast, although there is a Starbucks across the street and coffee in the lobby. The service is non-existent. It’s feels like there is no one working at this hotel, and when you do get someone, they aren’t that friendly. For the price, better amenities in the room would be welcomed. They seem to skimp on water bottles, shampoo and soap. Plus side, the have a nice terrace.

Stayed here with a friend and got a room on the 23rd floor. The view of this corner room was amazing, facing the World Trade Memorial and the newly built tower.The bar was nice as well, as was the outside terrace. One major point of criticism however. I found it unacceptable that a bar gets completely closed off from hotel guests for a private event. We got pushed into a corner in the lobby where we could "enjoy" our drinks. Even worse was the fact that the party arrived more than an hour later than they were supposed to, meaning the bar was closed off for hours without anyone even coming close...

Very impressed with this hotel, this place is clean. The staff is very helpful and the ones we had contact with look act like they enjoy what they do. We were in town for the first time and as we entered the room we knew this hotel was the right choice. We wanted to see the 9/11 memorial and One world trade. They are right across the street, 2 minute walk. We will be back, just that simple!

If you're lucky enough to get a room facing the World Trade Center you'll have amazing views. Nice hotel, a bit rough around the edges. Part of the molding in the bathroom was coming off, floor stained, sheets torn, and no hair dryer in the bathroom. I had to call down to get one. Otherwise, modern room and good service. Would stay here again.

If you're looking for a good location to stay in Tribeca, the location of this hotel is excellent. It's a block from the Freedom Tower & 9/11 memorial, as well as other downtown sites. It's also a quick walk up to Soho, Nolita, and other fun parts of NYC.However, the hotel itself is just okay. We were upgraded as Platinum members to a corner room, which was a decent size. The facility itself is being overhauled so there is no restaurant service at all. Things like the elevators were not in prime working condition - just about every day at least one elevator was not working properly.The staff were simply okay. They didn't have much enthusiasm or passion. Pretty laid back. Mostly helpful, but nobody went out of their way to stand out positively.The hotel also lacked the typical W vibe. There was not an ounce of "hip" in this place. In fact, the fifth floor (main lobby area with bar) was dead every time we went down there.One final thing. Several reviews talk about the roof top bar. This is a misnomer. You can't access the rooftop as a hotel guest as the top floors are residences. The supposed rooftop bar is actually a terrace on the fifth floor, outside the bar. So, if you fancy a view from floor five, go right ahead. But it is clearly not what we pictured when we heard roof top.This is not a bad place to stay, but we certainly won't be rushing back.

If name is most important to you then you should stay here as hotel was nicely decorated with ok rooms. However no restaurant, limited bar and rooms much like the club quarter across the street makes it way overpriced for what you get. The first night I was there I was awakened by fire alarms going off. Few days later phone kept beeping keeping me up. AC was turned off and required engineer to come an turn it on.

Loved the artwork in the lobby and the views over the memorial pools. The location was convenient for getting all around Lower Manhattan with several subway entrances within a few blocks. We also walked down to the river several times - beautiful!

I am a platinum, lifetime gold, and soon to be lifetime platinum SPG member with almost 9 years platinum and more than 500 nights at SPG properties. I have stayed at this hotel multiple times ONLY because it is very close to WTC4 and my client when I am in NYC. The facilities and service are poor, as noted by many other reviewers. The restaurant has been under renovation for more than a year! But the straw breaking this camel’s back is extraordinarily poor (even rude) customer service. As also has been noted by other reviewers, it makes no difference what your SPG status in this hotel—there will be no accomodations. If there is a problem, the front desk staff consistently are unconcerned and slow to resolve it. (I was once told by a W FD manager in San Francisco that they hire people for attitude. Really. Certainly this hotel seems to do so!)I called down to the desk on the third morning of my last stay at this hotel because there was no bottled water in the room (this is a frequent problem here). The FD person I spoke with said that I needed to stop. I was on my way to an 8AM meeting and told the staff member that I could not do so that morning because I was on my way to a meeting. I asked why and the FD member did not give me a reason.On my return to the hotel that evening after a full day of meetings and a business dinner, I was locked out of my room. There had been some issue with my business credit card and the FD insisted on a new card. I do not willingly put business charges on my personal card. So after I realized that I would not be allowed into my room to resolve the issue, I asked for the FD manager. He, Alex, eventually came out and told me that I would not be permitted into the room unless I gave them a different card. We argued about this for a very long time. I called platinum customer service and they spoke with Alex. After some further lengthy discussion with Alex, he told me that he would send security with me to my room with me so that I could resolve the issue with the business card. That was fine with me and said so. Alex ended up giving me a key, but did not send security to escort me. I went to the room and resolved the issue in about two minutes after I had access to my computer. I then packed up and called the front desk to say that I planned to check out. After a brief argument about that, Alex agreed that he would not charge me for that night. I moved to another hotel. I will never return to this hotel. The entire FD staff was rude. I was locked out for more than an hour. I am certain that it is illegal to seize possessions in a circumstance like this. It is within the hotel’s rights to terminate a stay, but not to hold a guest’s possessions hostage. I realize that the credit card issue needed resolution, but this was entirely the wrong way to go about it. At one point during our very uncomfortable conversation, I asked Alex if he was concerned that the hotel would not be paid for my stay. His response was “no”. So the whole interaction seems to me to be about power. So I will exercise my power to never stay there again and to tell others what kind of treatment the hotel gives guests. One other point to make—the hotel apparently left a message for me on the hotel phone. That is a poor way to contact a guest. The phone systems in hotels are universally awful. One SPG hotel in LA where I stayed frequently sent marketing messages every day. I learned to ignore them. Anyone of interest who wants to reach me calls me on my mobile phone. There are other ways to reach guests. The hotel had my phone number. They could have left a note in the room. But assuming that a guest will listen to hotel messages on hotel phones is a bad assumption.If you want to enjoy your stay and be treated with respect by hotel staff, I would recommend staying elsewhere.

I have travelled more than 45 countries, and I can say that this is the worst service I have ever received. We had a confirmed and paid booking and our flight was late. We sent them an email notifying them of our delay. They resold our room and they refused to refund. They didn’t even apologize or try to compensate us. This hotel should be given a one star at best. Absolutely terrible.

I lived in this W hotel residence for 7 months this year with my 4 year old daughter and Loved it. The staff was so kind and helpful, the structure and location perfect, the roof deck unbeatable views. This location is unbeatable the real new New York. Great shopping, restaurants and kids activities and parks.

Stayed here on a recent business trip to the city and will definitely be back!Great location only a few blocks from the World Trade Center, 911 memorial, and subway. Room size was what you would expect from NYC and bed was excellent. I highly recommend the Cool Corner Room and you request a high floor as the views are amazing!Front desk staff were a blessing as they allowed me to check into my room early and supplied me with deodorant when I realized I forgot to pack. Thank you again!

The upgraded corner room is spacious with decent view. Great SPG platinum recognition with late check out and upgrade compare to other SPG/Marriott hotels in Manhattan that I have been to. 2 minutes walk to subway station. Coffee machine in the room is by request only and should have been a standard amenity.

This is a smart hotel located in the new WTC district. Currently, the hotel enjoys incredible views of the Freedom Tower. At some point, this is likely to be at least in part obscured by the WTC5 building - soon to be built. Inside is pretty much typical for a W - and the decor and furnishings if anything lacks the usual show-stopping WOW... Good linens, nice bathroom and expensive minibar drinks. Free wifi is a bonus with W loyalty program. If there's no other reason to view than for the view, book this hotel - soon.

I’ve been staying at W Hotels and Resorts all around the World and had the best experiences in some of them but the W Downtown is by far at the very end of the line. I can’t complain about the location, view & design of the lobby is equally impressive. I am not even being bothered of having no option for breakfast because that will be solved after they finish with the renovation. Where this place falls ‘very’ short is the Customer Service! It is terrible! - Aside one girl who’s name I didn’t catch dealing with WW requests. She was sweet and helpful - No mails prior to arrival, No eye contact, no greetings, very unfriendly and bored staff! I understand that is difficult to find the right and capable employee in a city where there are so many opportunities but at this level the management should put more effort in finding those and should definitely invest in trainings for the existing staff. I know that luckily this Hotel doesn’t represent the W idea and I will continue booking with brand but for someone who is having their first experience with the W here at Downtown I’m relatively certain he would never book another W!

i think the most important about this hotel is the view, and it’s really exceptional. as platinum guests we got an upgrade to a higher-floor corner room facing the wtc. the room itself wasn’t really great, but the view compensated.the hotel itself a typical w - dark lobby and hallways, vivid lights, exotic design choices everywhere. there is no breakfast facility, so we got a $20 starbucks gift card per night instead. this was a bit unusual solution, but in fact it was a pretty good deal for us.there was a nice terrace in the 5th floor, but it was closed the whole weekend, because it was “wet” - don’t know what they expected from an open air terrace. fortunately, a manager-looking guy allowed us to take some pictures from there.speaking of the price: for a short stay, the experience is absolutely worth it - especially if you are able to catch some preferred deals, like we did. for a longer stay, i’m sure you can find a better value for this price level.

I had three issues with my stay and when I tried to discuss these they were dismissed. The first issue was that none of the analog TV stations worked, which was about 2/3s of all channels, including CNBC, which I always watch in the morning. When I told the front desk when I was checking out, her response was "did you report this?", like it was somehow my fault because I had not asked them to fix it.The second issue was that I had a ice machine right outside my room that sounded like a water fountain because it dripped and drained so much. While a fountain would have been nice, the ongoing loud draining sound was not.The third issue was I had a colleague who was staying at another hotel, but we were going out for dinner first. I asked if they could store his bags and they just said no. The hotel has a very mediocre gym, that is nowhere near as good as any of the other hotels that surround it. Having to take two elevators to get to your room and the gym is annoying. I have stayed at many SPG hotels and a number of W hotels, this is the worst experience.

Pros: Great location central in downtown. Rooms are comfortable with modern decor. Many offer stunning views of the Freedom Tower and the 9/11 memorial. There is also a hotel terrace bar that seems quite popular. Cons: no free WiFi, and our second night, we could hear our neighbors through the walls in the other room. For those reasons, particularly the noise through the walls, would probably pick a different hotel next time.
user_name:
DC5Jen
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: If you want a hotel away from Time Square closer to the Financial District and the Freedom Tower, this is a good hotel. Hotel has a modern feel to it. Rooms were clean and a lot of the rooms have views of the Freedom Tower. Service was pretty good. Not over the top, but not bad either.

When we first arrived tired from a long flight it was disconcerting stepping out of the elevator into the dimly lit mood liit reception area on to shining black tiles - it felt like falling into a black hole. (See pic)Then all was good. The room was compact, bed comfortable and staff were helpful. Coffee and tea were available in the bar for a period in the mornings.The location was great, walking distances to all downtown points of interest and close to a subway station.The bar area, a very nice relaxing place to sit in lounge chairs after a busy day.On the walk to/from the subway station we noted a couple of restaurants and a mini food mart and it was a nice quiet area.We dined in the area including a bar opposite - there is a Starbucks in that building.An enjoyable 4 days.

I stayed in a room with two separate beds. However the shower had a clear glass screen which you could see from the bedroom! Completely ridiculous when you have booked a room with two separate beds for a reason! We had to try and cover the glass which was not ideal. Would have put four stars down if it wasn’t for that. The staff were a bit miserable too but the hotel bar looked super modern and trendy. I would stay again but they defiantly need to sort the privacy out for the showers in rooms with separate beds!

Celebrated a birthday at this property. We had a wonderful view and enjoyed they layout of the room. The front desk employees were very sweet and accommodating. Utilize the concierge employee. I would definitely stay here again!

My room was dirty, I found hair, stains and dust in my bathroom and the rest of the room. There was no breakfast nor restaurant service available for somewhat reason. Overall I found the hotel in bad shape needing to be renovated and not to the standard of other W hotels I stayed at. I would not recommend saying at this hotel.

Good location. The service from the doorman, concierge and housekeeper were friendly and helpful.Their service was fast and reliable. We were given a room with nice view of the 1WTC. Walking to the Wall Street & Trump Building was just less then 10mins walk. The only thing that I am not that satisfied when compare to other hotels that I've been too is the personal touch.
