I have inform the staff that on that particular day was my husband birthday and well i do expect a small gift(a cake) from them. But sad to say, we did not receive anything at all. We are not being calculative but for other countries(just name a few, Sydney, Australia, BKK, Bali, London) we were being surprised with cake & flowers in our room. Maybe thats not the culture in W New York. Personally to me having this personal touch to the guest will make it more memorable. Anyway, the whole experience in NY and in W New York Downtown was still awesome and great experience. W Hotel is one of the brand hotel I love. Hope to visit you again.

I was supposed to stay there from June 1st to June 3rd and because of the tropical storm in Florida I asked for a refund or move of dates, they made no type of effort what so ever to accommodate or help me. I explained to them the circumstances and when I asked to talk to the manager they said I already talked to the manager that is why I put you on hold. Basically the person would not let me talk to the manager at all and then when I asked for the manager name he told me the first name Jamila and when I asked for the last name he said I can only give the initial. Basically they all hide so no one can take responsibility. Beside being curt and rude on the phone the manager hides behind the employees instructing them to not even give their names out. I’m highly disappointed that they didn’t try to work with me. They have my 300 dollars and a empty room they are probably renting to someone. I never come across such inconsiderate staff and they are smart to not give their names on the phone so that way they can hide because that is all the staff does. If you want to pay top dollar for bad service and rude people who don’t solve any problems go right ahead and book here. There are plenty of nice Starwood or Marriott properties in New York with nicer staff and centrally located choose one of those. Unless you like inconsistent, inconsiderate people who do nothing to accommodate you. Manager needs training and staff needs major training. They have 300 dollars but will never get my money or business or anyone I know’s business again.

We choose this hotel accidentally but it was the best choice in our trip , room had amazing view of 9/11 memorial , clean room , and when we arrived there they up grad us with no reaso ! I love them ! The only bad thing , their Resturant was not working
user_name:
parvin1966
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This was our first W hotel. Normally we stay at the Marriott across the street when visiting family in nearby Battery Park City area, but it was too expensive this weekend, even with Marriott platinum status. Since Marriott and Starwood merged, we decided to try W this trip. When we arrived Sat AM on the Redeye flight from California, we were allowed early checkin and also given an upgrade to a room with unobstructed view of WTC site! We also were given late checkout Monday ( as late as 4pm). The lack of current food service was not an issue, since there was an incredible variety of choices within easy walking distance. The room decor was very Euro modern, and the lighting actually fit quite well with the design. We even had drinks at the bar at dusk one evening and the view outside was stunning! We will consider coming back on our next trip to see family.

I stay at w downtown for a night as i need to take early trip in battery park. The location is convenient to world trade centre and lots of attraction like wall street and the statue of liberty. I know the restaurant is close so dont expect there is food service. The spg recognition is the worst i have ever had, i have to be forced to take 500 points as welcome gift, there is no even other choice. The room itself is simple, unlike other w hotel in asia, to me i would say it is a 4 star business hotel like sheraton, but bear in mind marriott classify w as a luxury hotel. I totally dont understand why part is luxury, except the price. You cant even get some basic amenity like coffee or tea, as if given by other spg brand as a platinum member, or you can choose to pay. The only complimentary is the display green apple in the front desk.There is an outside bar downstair and it is very noisy. The lobby is always playing hyper volume of music which is disturbing and annoying. They keep playing until mid night. Staff doesnt care about your feeling and they dont even ask you how yr stay is and not initiate any conversation, instead they just work like a robot. This is totally not the energy W should have, i wont count the noise from the bar as energy though.Overall a disappointing experience for spg hotel. I will not stay here anymore.
user_name:
porkypugpug
New York City, New York

review_body: I stayed here last week and the accommodations were ok. My review is based on an incident I witnessed. A police officer asked the two male bell hops if he could use the bathroom. The bell hops told him he couldn’t use the bathroom and he could “go F himself”. I couldn’t believe that outside the 9/11 memorial where so many police officers died this was happening. The officer left the location, a man better that I. This is ridiculous. I will never stay at another W again and can’t believe that the W would hire such hateful people. Shame on you....

Stayed here one night because my plane to Minneapolis got delayed. Was a perfect spot for one night on Manhattan. Close to ground zero, Battery Park, ferry to Liberty Island.Room was really nice and clean with a great view against Ground Zero. There is a breakfast place just outside in the corner.But if you go to Manhattan for vaccation I would pick a hotel closer to Central Park.

The only reason I didn't rate my experience as terrible is because the staff was friendly, although my wife and I had to carry all our bags to ourselves to the room when it wasn't busy, as evinced by the bellhop socializing instead of assisting us. FIRST, there is no parking at the hotel and the website is misleading as it FAILS TO SPECIFY that you MUST park around the corner and deal with people that simply were not friendly. Why not just let travelers know up front about the parking being offsite. SECOND, the room was not nice at all! I would have used another word, but TripAdvisor doesn't allow it. Not that the room was filthy, i.e., dirty, but instead, there were HOLES IN THE CURTAIN. The holes allowed unwanted sunlight to enter the room, waking us up when we wished to sleep in. Really unfortunate given that we traveled from far to visit NYC, and rest, relaxation, and room service were all we wanted. THIRD, and even more egregious, THERE IS NO DINING OPTION OR ROOM SERVICE AVAILABLE! Look, I truly understand that renovations happen, and reasonable people would expect downtime as a result. BUT THE HOTEL SHOULD INFORM GUESTS PRIOR TO BOOKING ABOUT THE CONDITIONS, AND THEY SHOULD NEVER USE THE WORD "LIMITED". Again, my wife and I visited for our anniversary and the front desks description of a "limited" kitchen amounts to no more than bagels and free coffee in the lobby. THERE IS ABSOLUTELY NO HOT FOOD FROM THE HOTEL. For what we paid to stay here that, it is borderline criminal (fraudulent) that this is what the W provided us. Fortunately for the W, I am not a complainer, nor do I believe making a scene at the hotel is good for anyone. So I took what they gave us, and hightailed my tush back to California with the wife, but I am extremely disappointed that my anniversary was spent this way. TRAVELERS BEWARE. Pictures of the holes I referenced will be uploaded momentarily.

The room was nice, but as a Starwood Platinum I was very disappointed. I received no upgrade. Also the restaurant seems to be closed and no room service available, which is a big disappointment. Overall for a luxury hotel this should be standard.

With the SPG status match I got from being Marriott Gold, I decided to give things a try on the other side of the house-- and I regret the decision looking back.While there was nothing insanely wrong with my stay, I just didn't feel I got the best value I could get compared to spending the same amount at another hotel. Service was OK but didn't feel welcoming-- staff should probably get some pointers from their cousins over at Marriott. The room was small, and the layout made it feel claustrophobic, the taste in decor and color was borderline tacky and looked better in pictures. The lobby and other common spaces were always way too dark and it always felt like we were in the middle of a blackout.I stayed at the W San Francisco right after this trip, which literally felt like going from night to day. Definitely check out some other properties before settling here.

The Hotel was very odd to say the least. The main entrance is located on a side street. Had to run inside to get someone to assist us with luggage and valet the car. The hotel is part of a larger residence building so it is an odd entrance. One door, with access to both the residence and the hotel. Bouncer like person directing people one way or the other. Appeared to be call girls lingering at the main doors. No doorman was available in the evening to assist. Once inside the hotel the vibe was strange. Felt more like being in a fun house than an upscale hotel. The attempt was to create a boldly delineated atmosphere with geometric shapes and intense lighting, but they missed the mark in my book. The room was extremely small with very poor lighting (yet another failed attempt to create a cool vibe). Definitely not worth the price. Stay at the Marriott across the street!!!

Recently spent 4 days at this W. Front desk made a big deal of upgrading me due to my Delta Platinum status to 9th floor with a view. All my colleagues got similar rooms on higher floors, so I am not sure what the fuss was about getting on the 9th floor. Housekeeping was really sporadic. Never knew when they would replace water, towels, or bath supplies. Room was comfortable, but beginning to show its age. Built in closet needed repair. I had iron replaced since it was leaking water. Currently very limited meal service/room service available, which was a pain.

The W Downtown is in a great location for exploring Wall Street, World Trade, TriBeCa and Soho. There are good subway lines uptown and the new Westfield Worldtrade mall almost opposite. Frustratingly there was no food or beverage outlet as the restaurant was closed for renovation which also meant no room service. Really comfy bed, great bathroom, good sized rooms for New York and relatively good value for money.

Ok so this is likely to be my worst Starwood review ever. Had a room there for a Saturday evening. Flew in late to White Plains and called the hotel on my way to Manhattan to tel them that we are running late and will head directly to dinner and then check in later (online checkin somehow didn't work). As an SPG100+ I asked if they could confirm an upgrade on the phone given that we come in very late. Lady on the phone started barking at me that i will get what's available when i physically show up at the hotel. I explained her once more that i am late for dinner and would kindly ask her to confirm a room upgrade for a Plat100. More barking from the other end of the line. We decided to stay at the Andaz instead (got upgraded to the Prez Suite). I called front desk the next morning to ask for a refund as I really didn't want to spend our Saturday evening dealing with this unfriendly hotel. Gentleman on the phone was very polite, understood the situation and told me he will talk to accounting about the refund. Two weeks later no one got back to me I emailed the hotel. No answer. I remind them another time. No answer. I involve my ambassador (which i should have from the beginning on but usually i think this can be dine without calling "Mommie"). Ambassador gets immediately back and days he couldn't do anything about it but talked to the hotel. So the W apparently received my emails but didn't care answering...If that's how they treat top elites i dont want to know how they treat other guests. No Starwood in NYC for me anymore. Andaz it is if you want to stay downtown!

This evening I had the worst encounter with the manager Jamila Poughkeepsie. I travelled from Miami, Fl to celebrate my daughter’s birthday this week. I booked with this location but decided to go with another hotel due to price and the reviews. I was under the impression that I cancelled my reservation with the W hotel. Today while at my daughter’s birthday dinner I received a notification that I had been charged over $280 from the W hotel. I was very upset as I paid $1000 to stay at the existing hotel that I am at. I called the location to speak with a manager to see if there is anything that can be done. Jamila was very condescending and combative. She talked very loudly and rudely over me.... she wouldn’t let me get a word on edgewise. I explained to her that I am from out of town and a mother of 5 and I could not afford the fees. She showed no empathy and did not offer any solution to help. She threatened to have security escort me offf grounds if I dared come into the hotel. Jamila should not be the manager at such a professional business if she cannot conduct herself properly when speaking with a customer. Jamila could have had a better delivery. I asked her for the number to corporate and you won’t brliece that she gave me the number to Starwood’s customer service. Smh....How could a manager not give you the correct customer service number? I asked who her manager was and she said she didn’t have one. Jamila was untruthful to me and she did not act the least bit concerned about my situation. If Jamila is a reflection of the W hotel I don’t want to stay here ever. Belonique Charles spoke with me and was very empathetic and professional... she should be the manager.
user_name:
preciousakal
New York City, New York

review_body: Confusing lift, very good location, no executive lounge, arrogant and unfriendly service personnel , rooms are tiny with very few proper facilities, dark and almost depressing... Not nice..at least the big windows for a nice view is positive.

First of all, the kitchen is closed and there is no room service between now and June. However, the hotel neglected to advise me of this when I made the reservation. Usually Starwood hotels will tell you if there is a major amenity, such as the pool, that is closed. The W downtown however, decided to bait and switch its customers and didn’t tell me there was no restaurant and no room service. As a business traveler, room service is important to me and I am really angry about this. Next, the hotel is really beat up. Check out the photos. The hallways look like someone was trying to run away from a murder. The doors are scratched up and the wallpaper is beaten up. What the heck goes on around here? And there are so many broken and marked up parts of my room that it’s worse than an old Holiday Inn.The staff appears to be super neglectful as well. You know how W hotels say good morning or good evening on the rugs in the elevators? Well here it always says good morning. Seems like a lazy bunch.

This hotel hasn't had a restaurant or room service for over a year. I wish TripAdvisor would have some way for us to report that to them so they would remove that from the list of hotel "amenities" listed here.Quite frankly, you get better service at the Courtyard by Marriott just across the street.They are a brand new hotel, have a restaurant and breakfast service.How they can charge the same or higher rates than the full service hotels like the Marriott NYC Downtown or Millennium Hilton New York Downtown which are both within a few blocks of this hotel is beyond me. All you get at this hotel is a clean room and comfortable bed. At the end of a long day of business meetings, the last thing I want to do is have to go out searching for some take out place for a hamburger that I have to bring back to my room.And yes, I know you can order from one of the deli / take out places in the area and have them deliver it, but you still need to go down to the lobby to "meet your delivery person" to pick up your food and take it back to your room.It's borderline fraud that this is still marketed as a "W" hotel. The no restaurant and no room service situation has been in effect for a year and there is no indication at all that this hotel will actually start offering room service anytime in the next few months. And there is no sign of construction in the space where the restaurant used to be.

I was booked to stay here in January and because of the bomb cyclone in NYC, flights to NYC were canceled and we couldn't make it out there. Because of this, it also caused us to miss our entire vacation which was onward to London and Paris. I tried to get a refund because of the disaster and this hotel wouldn't do it (booked through priceline). All of our hotels and flights that we had booked ALL refunded us because of this weather situation EXCEPT this hotel. Now I'm sure they'll quote some policy as to why they won't refund, but as all our other hotels and airlines did refund, it goes to show the opportunistic nature of this hotel....taking advantage of a natural disaster that affected so many people and their travel plans. I travel very often and because of this, I will never book a Marriott/Starwood hotel again. Happy to know that other hotel companies (like the ones that refunded us despite whatever policies they have) have a heart and won't take advantage of you as a customer and understand that keeping my dollar in the immediacy does not work out in their best interest because then they would miss out on all the business I would give them in the future.

Stayed here for a week at end of Jan for work. Selected this location for a change as I usually stay in midtown and found that to be not great. First impressions are of lobby. It was so dark with the low ceiling and wavy lights ... don’t get it. Checkin was fine and took the elevator to my room. Room was really small compared to midtown , amenities were usual. Nice big shower which was a plus for me but it leaked each time because of a gap in the shower door at the bottom. Sink area was ok - again curved walls and base which meant that you could not keep anything vertical on it for even a sec. Bed was fine no issues - lighting was dim and low and no option of turning it up. Closet space was pretty decent. The iron and ironing board - why bother putting one on the room if you don’t want it to be used. the board cover was wrinkled and the iron barely heated to iron an non-iron shirt! There was a stain from leaked water or coffee on a lobby table that looked it hadn’t been cleaned properly (see picture)Other than the location not much going on. Restaurant was either non existent or going through repairs - I got a leaflet for a local deli who delivered to the room (minimum of $10)Not sure I would stay here again

I enjoyed my stay at W hotel downtown. I have been upgraded to a corner room with spectacular city view. Staff were friendly. The hotel provides coffee and tea during specific hours. The bed was extremely comfortable.
user_name:
Clare W
New York City, New York

review_body: I have to start off with the fact that I have always been a fan of the W hotels and have stayed at many of them in different states and countries so this visit was a major disappointment. We chose this location so we were away from time square to enjoy the New Years. We asked about the New Year’s Eve party and we were told as guests we could use the bar. This was in fact a lie the only way we could stay at the one and only bar in the hotel was paying a hefty $100+ per person charge through event brite (it blows my mind that you couldn’t pay at the hotel for this point). So when it was below zero temperatures outside and we didn’t want to leave we had to because we were misinformed. In addition the service was subpar as well as the room. We had beautiful sweeping views of construction going on, which I know is not their fault but when asked if we could get another room it was a resounding no. For a place that advertises “Whatever Whenever “ I was astoundingly shocked at how many “I’m sorry” and “No” that we received during this long weekend trip to the city! As an avid W return customer I was astonished at the service and the countless don’t care attitudes that we received. It was an utter disappointment for us. We would not recommend this particular location ever based on this experience.

Really really small room with a view that overlooked construction debris on one side and looked directly into another hotel guest's room looking the other direction. The bathroom and closet doors are like frosted shower doors, so if one person is sleeping and you need to use the bathroom, all the light comes into the room from the bathroom and wakes up the other person. The hotel concierge was uninformed giving us subway directions to a store that was a 10 minute walk from the hotel, and recommended going to TKTS Time Square to stand in line in the rain to buy same day theatre tickets when there was another location that was indoors and tickets went on sale hours earlier. Noisy heating ventilation.

The property is massive and has a lot going on but the decor is very dated compared to other hotels of this size. The W has a very specific brand that relies heavily on the color white which gets very dirty easily and makes the rooms look low quality. I had an amazing view of world trade and the room was a good size for an NYC hotel room but the older appliances and furniture irritated me. I’d skip this place and stay closer to Tribeca where there are newer boutique options.
user_name:
tristans34
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel really has a great location. Bedroom clean and quite spacious, restaurant food was fine. We had stayed here five or so years ago and were not disappointed with our stay last week. Good value: friendly staff.

Hotel rooms seemed dated and small. Not impressed. The area for drinks was not on rooftop, but still offered a nice view of One World Trade Center. Location is good, near subways, etc. However, the small rooms and dated interior made my trip unpleasant.

Staff were helpful, had some good recommendations. Room was clean with a great view. The fragrance they used in the room was lovely, my wife wanted a bottle of it to take home. The hotel is right next to the WTC and has good links to everywhere. I would stay here again for sure if I ever go back to New York.

The room was such a pleasant surprise when we arrived and our view was beautiful. Ourconcierge Teela was exceptional she was very kind, answered all of our questions, gave recommendations for restaurants and she was so helpful with our ride on the subway. Can not say enough kind words about her. Sabrina checked us in was so kind and when asked if we could get a late check she was very willing to accommodate us. We highly recommend the W Hotel. Randy and Jennifer

Great location...as many hotels within the hood offer...but this W is just poor in man6 respects. 1. NO food whatsoever...meaning, not even coffee provided...no in room coffee/ tea pot, no room service, no coffee in lobby, 2, Poor SPG recognition... platinum may get you a corner regular room if you push. 3. Rude rooms manager when we spoke. 4. Room decor ol$ and outdated5 it’s a aloft feel without the benefit of the litl3libby gift/ food store..where u can at least get a coffee/ juice 6. Did not replace free water dailyOk for 120/ nite...but that’s all its worth.

Sleek hotel, testament to the W style. Good location, a stone's throw away from the Rector subway station. And Cafe nuovo nearby serves good pastrami. A few steps away from the 911 memorial, and a couple of bars. Nice room, good service. Bed and pillows were good. Housekeeping was alright.Wifi was a pain. Could have informed us and signed us up earlier as an SPG member - thought it got sorted out after a call from my room. Check in staff could have done this for us while checking in. And informed us of the complimentary coffee and tea in the mornings. If i had to point out the room design, it lacked lighting. bathroom door should have opened inwards, not outwards cos it gets the floor wet. Also, am pretty shocked basic stuff such as toothbrush set and electric kettle were not provided.

We had a standard room. The room was nice and of a decent size with W flourishes. Check in and the lounge are on the 5th floor. The hotel location was good. The lounge was nice and the staff were friendly and efficient. There was an outside terrace in the lounge with heating, but it was freezing outside so nobody tried it out.The only issue was that the restaurant was being renovated, so there wasn't a place to eat at the hotel. You had to use room service or wander outside to find a restaurant (plenty around, but a bit of an issue since it was freezing in New York City at the time :)).

Stayed here for a week over Xmas. Overall was pretty pleased with the stay. It’s in a really nice part of Lower Manhattan. Bit more quieter but has easy access to subways all around to get you where you need to go and has plenty of options for food and drinks around this area. Hotel lobby is really cool. Our room was quite small but had a decent size bathroom with a decent view. Staff were helpful and I would stay here again when we return one day.

I travel to NYC often on business, and the W downtown was just added to our booking system, so I thought I'd give it a try as it's close to my office. I was booked for 5 nights and came in on a Saturday. The first thing I noticed was that setup of the hotel is a little awkward. You arrive to an elevator bank and take it up 5 floors to check in. It's a bit tight at the front desk and if you need luggage held they take it on the main floor.Upon arrival we had a room ready immediately which was great, however after getting into the room I realized it was an interconnecting room. I've had noise concerns at other hotels with this type and asked if it was possible to move. I was told nothing was available as it was only 2pm and check in was at 3pm but they could hold our bags. So we took the two elevator ride back down with our bags to hold them and left for a late lunch. We arrived back at the hotel after 5pm and was told our room wasn't ready. When questioning the time I was told my room was ready - however they gave me the exact same room. After about 5 minutes + of searching, they had another room for me - on a lower floor facing the west side highway, even louder than the first room. So I gave up and took the original room - it then took over an hour and 2 phone calls to get our luggage sent up. Not a great start.While getting ready to head out for dinner, the hot water in the building went out mid shower. We called down to the front desk to check on the issue and they said it would be back momentarily. 2 hours later, still no hot water. I understand emergency maintenance happens, but communication wasn't great here as they earlier told us it was back on when it wasn't.The first morning we were awoken at 7am by yelling and laughing in the room next to us. At first I assumed it was the hallway but discovered it was noise from the interconnecting room, just as I assumed would happen. This went on for over an hour. There was also a great deal of street noise. I've stayed in other hotels in the area facing the same streets and it hasn't been a problem, being on a higher floor I assumed we would be alright, but maybe the windows aren't as thick.We were woken up again after midnight the second night by yelling and pounding on the wall. I was here for business and up at 5am the next day so I called down to the front desk to ask for help - they said they would take care of it. 30 minutes later and nothing. I actually went down to the front desk and angrily asked for something to be done. Eventually security came up.The first two nights were definitely a struggle. Things quieted down for the next few nights. There was a Christmas party on the lobby/bar floor the last night and you could hear the bass from the music even 10 floors up, but it stopped before 10pm.Upon check in I asked for the bill to be split on my personal and corporate card. When I checked out they put it all on one card. I asked for the quick change and they were able to accomodate quickly - however when I checked my online banking I could see they flipped the two cards despite clear instructions - this required another call to the hotel. All in all, a frustrating trip.I will say this though, the beds were very comfortable and the rooms were a good size. I also had a nice view of the WTC site. I feel like this could have been a nice trip but sometimes things don't work out nicely. I'm not sure if I'll give the W another chance on my next trip.

We recently stayed here and it is a great hotel in a great location. We faced the freedom tower, so the view was memorable! It was also a lot more calm than midtown, with a toddler I appreciated, yet still easy to get to all the areas we wanted to visit. Expensive: On arrival we were tired so I ordered some toast. For 3 slices of toast, jam and butter, and delivered, plus tax this cost $15 we ate out after this.......... though they did offer free apples in reception could have bought a toaster for this!Cot:I emailed them before we visited, to ask for a cot. They said they would organise. On arrival there was no cot in the room. When I asked for it they said it would be $35 dollars per night!!! Again and for not mentioning to me prior?! Not good. Our little boy slept with us. WindowOn the 15th floor our window opened dangerously too much so we put our suitcase in that area. Very scary when you have a toddler running around!Amazing bar/reception The bar/reception is stunning! A pleasure to go back to each day!Friendly and helpful service was given all the time.Places we visited close by: Freedom tower/grown zeroBrooklyn bridgeCity clerks office (where we got married) Staton island ferryWall StreetThe bullBattery parkThe Dead Rabbit for cocktailsEataly: visit this place for lovely food produce, nice momentos and you can eat there in the evening. They do amazing breads and wine!!!The Beekman Hotel:An absolute must for a bit of luxury! Again amazing service, great food and drinks!We love New York and this is a good hotel that I’d recommend.

W - is just being W - nothing personal just a W:) but it’s clean and the bedding is nice - as well as in room food. Nothing much changed from some years ago - as a Manhattan resident - would like more personalized service. It is not a Macdonald’s afterwords - and no one is doing us a favor - we are paying for stay and have all the right for questions - stuff has to be trained. ❄️
user_name:
NB_NYC2013
New York City, New York

review_body: I stayed here on a Friday night after my company holiday party with my boyfriend. We were looking to splurge a bit, and this place did not disappoint. The room was spacious, clean, and had a great view of the Freedom Tower. The only downside is we were really looking to stay somewhere that we could have room service breakfast delivered, and their restaurant is currently closed (undergoing reservations I believe?). That was the only downside to our stay. Other than that, great for a night.

Well this is a pre review. I am arriving there next Saturday night, for only 1 night. It's a suprise xmas present, on the way to Montreal. Looking forward to exploring all the great features of the hotel, and hopefully a nice quiet room which is a good size for the 4 of us. Photo's to follow.
user_name:
Jezm0nd
Santa Maria di Leuca, Italy

review_body: We called the front desk to say that when we checked for bed bugs (none) we noticed the sheets were covered in hair. The floor wasn’t vacuumed either. The front desk said that although they always change the sheets on all beds (and “duvet covers on the king beds”) they don’t always change the mattress covers. The bottom sheet is not fitted, by the way. I said that was unacceptable and they said they had no clean king size mattress covers. The gentleman that came from housekeeping was able to find a clean mattress cover...it doesn’t fit but will do. This for $400....

Me and my sister stayed here for 2 nights. Room on 14 floor at rear of hotel so didn’t have much of a view.Room was very nice, comfy bed, no noise from other guestsOnly down point was WiFi in room very intermittent and there was no tea/coffee facilities in the roomBeing downtown it was a lot quieter however we wasn’t far from subway. Plenty of restaurants and few shops nearbyWould definitely stay again

The hotel is very modern and feels alittle dark.The room was fine & again modern feel. Bathroom had a walk-in showery which was good.The in room facilities: Had a mini fridge which was well stocked but prices for these drinks and snacks were mental.Was disappointed there was no tea or coffee facilities in the room.Hotel had a bar area, balcony and good area of seating.In the mornings the hotel puts on free coffee and fruit flavoured water.I would say the hotel ok but would maybe think about a hotel midtown so I didn’t have travel as much. out of 5

My first impression is the location is amazing of course right around the corner from the World Trade Center and the financial district is a very good choice , now being a PLAT75 I would have thought I would have gotten a better room upgrade then 7th floor over looking all night construction in a very small room , when did NY become Europe ? Front desk staff were great and check in was painless..... more to come

Having stayed at the W in Union Square we thought we'd try this one on this occasion and it was a massive mistake. The hotel feels tired and the furniture is almost a battered afterthought. There is no room service, no restaurant, no breakfast and the entrance is just weird. Upon arrival we found our shower had not been cleaned properly and there is some mould on the ceiling.

We had such a nice weekend at this W. The staff are friendly and professional.The location is so convenient to the Sept. 11 Memorials and Museum and Battery Park and a host of other sites. The traffic is not horrific as compared to mid town or up town.Perhaps not as much to offer in terms of restaurants and certainly not as to plays (for those take a taxi about 3 miles north). But we will return.

Hotel - noun -" an establishment providing accommodation, meals, and other services for travellers and tourists" OHH SO YOU THOUGHT! Not this one I'm afraid. No breakfast, no restaurant, no room service and the night we arrived not even a bar. Barely a mention of this long term kitchen/restaurant closure on the booking website and nothing on their own one. Clueless front desk / management. 3 rooms 2 nights, $2700! haha you must be laughing...but I'm crying. Wrote an email of complaint 6 days ago which remains unanswered. Disgraceful.

The staff at the hotel is very helpful and friendly...from check-in staff to the housekeeping staff. The rooms are nice size and very nicely decorated with contemporary decor. There was no shower cap/Qtips/cotton swabs in the room....you have to ask Housekeeping for these items. However, they do supply nice shampoo/conditioner/body wash/lotion. I really do not like the lighting in the bathroom....there was plenty of it, but not in the right areas for putting on makeup. There was a large makeup mirror on the vanity which was way too large for such a small vanity (it should be put on the wall...not on the vanity)...but the bulb on the makeup mirror was too dim. The beds were great. The room could also use better lighting.My biggest complaint about this hotel is the dark mirrored floor in the lobby. It shines in your eyes and makes you dizzy which was the complaint among many we were with. Our room was on the 14th floor facing the 911 Memorial and the view was spectacular.....one of the best I've had in NYC. Complimentary coffee and tea is offered in the lobby each morning.

This hotel is right downtown and a stones throw from Wall Street and Brookfield Place. Very convenient. Good "W" hotel. What is missing is a restaurant, they serve no food in the hotel. Also, their hotel wifi is REALLY atrocious. So for holiday is fine but not for business.

I stayed here for two nights while on business. This hotel is fair. It is overpriced and not deserving of 5 or even 4 stars. The lobby is so dark it is difficult to see. My room was comfortable but not overwhelming. The bed and sheets were nice. Beautiful view overlooking the Freedom Tower which is a huge plus. There was no kitchen and no room service at the time I stayed here so I had to order from seamless web. Not great choices for healthy food.

I always think of the W as a special experience. This time wasn't as good as I expected. I haven't stayed at a W in a while. It was a bit bare bones. There were very few outlets and more modern usb charging locations. The bliss amenitiies are always nice. The sheets and bedding were high quality. I don't know if it's worth the money.

This is a nice stay when traveling downtown for work. The hotel was comfortable however I had a room right above the rooftop bar, it was quite noisy come around 11pm when I was heading to bed having to wake up early for work the next morning. The staff were very accomodating and brought some ear plugs. Overall the stay was nice and easy for me to get to my office which is close by. I would stay here again.

My experience with other W hotels has always been amazing; unfortunately my stay at W Hotel Downtown in New York was disappointing.The outside of the building looks like a building site, as if it was still developing and unfinished. The entrance was dark and dirty. Taking the lift to the concierge, we were greeted by a grumpy reception staff, who was unfriendly, inattentive and didn’t seem to care. It was not very busy, but I had to ask her to contact concierge to bring our bags up. The lobby seemed very dark and had no lights and very quiet, unlike other W hotels which are usually welcoming, funky and fun. We stayed on the 6th floor, facing the WTC. The room was a good size.The interior seemed overused, with white and brown, which did not go well together. The wall and desk seemed dirty with brown marks. There was an odd red pillow and cover on the bed. The Bathroom was a good size. There were limited toiletries, but no tooth brush, other toiletries or slippers available in the bathroom. There was only one dressing gown for two people. We had to ask the maid to give us some more toiletries. The most annoying thing was the bathroom sliding door. Each time it is opened, it slides into the gap in between the walls. This made it difficult to close again, as you had to use your small fingers to encourage it out again, which was unsafe. There was a mini fridge and snacks, which looked dusty. The room was very noisy, especially during the daytime when you can hear the building works outside. The gym was ok, quite small, but has dumbbells and machines. The check out process was quick, but very swift and abrupt. I remember he said, “You are done now, thank you.” The reception didn’t seem to want to help you. I am not sure if he said goodbye or offered to get concierge to bring our bags or offer taxi, I had to ask him. It is in a good location, close to the subway and attractions. Overall a disappointing stay, as all the other W hotels I have stayed in, including Barcelona, London, Taipei, HK and Bangkok had been a Wonderful experience. Unfortunately this was not Wonderful. My experience with other W hotels has always been amazing; unfortunately my stay at W Hotel Downtown in New York was disappointing.The outside of the building looks like a building site, as if it was still developing and unfinished. The entrance was dark and dirty. Taking the lift to the concierge, we were greeted by a grumpy reception staff, who was unfriendly, inattentive and didn’t seem to care. It was not very busy, but I had to ask her to contact concierge to bring our bags up. The lobby seemed very dark and had no lights and very quiet, unlike other W hotels which are usually welcoming, funky and fun. We stayed on the 6th floor, facing the WTC. The room was a good size.The interior seemed overused, with white and brown, which did not go well together. The wall and desk seemed dirty with brown marks. There was an odd red pillow and cover on the bed. The Bathroom was a good size. There were limited toiletries, but no tooth brush, other toiletries or slippers available in the bathroom. There was only one dressing gown for two people. We had to ask the maid to give us some more toiletries. The most annoying thing was the bathroom sliding door. Each time it is opened, it slides into the gap in between the walls. This made it difficult to close again, as you had to use your small fingers to encourage it out again, which was unsafe. There was a mini fridge and snacks, which looked dusty. The room was very noisy, especially during the daytime when you can hear the building works outside. The gym was ok, quite small, but has dumbbells and machines. The check out process was quick, but very swift and abrupt. I remember he said, “You are done now, thank you.” The reception didn’t seem to want to help you. I am not sure if he said goodbye or offered to get concierge to bring our bags or offer taxi, I had to ask him. It is in a good location, close to the subway and attractions. Overall a disappointing stay, as all the other W hotels I have stayed in, including Barcelona, London, Taipei, HK and Bangkok had been a Wonderful experience. Unfortunately this was not Wonderful.

I visited the W Downtown for a few days and had just checked out of Park Lane Hotel (near Central Park ) to be on the downtown part of Manhattan. The W was a breath of fresh air compared to the older hotels by CP. From the doormen, to the check-in process the experience was great. Everyone was super nice and not to mention the lobby on the 5th floor, it’s very chic and so pretty! What an upgrade from the hotel I came from. They have a bar on the 5th floor with the best view of the One World Trade Center. You can walk to Eataly which is a must stop if you’re in the area. Tons of shops nearby and the BK bridge is walking distance. Amazing experience and I am glad I picked this hotel.

We stayed here for just one night while in town for a wedding. It has great views of the 9/11 Memorial and the Freedom Tower. There is a cool bar on the 5th floor with outdoor seating. The room was small but It clean and efficient. The staff was wonderful. We would stay here again.

I stayed here for two nights in late September with my dad. We had two separate rooms. The good: both rooms were very clean, the showers had great water pressure and the beds were comfortable. The staff were friendly and the location is brilliant if you want to be downtown close to the world trade centre and Wall Street. The frustrating: The booking process was difficult as the hotel website kept transferring me to the SPG website which showed different prices from the hotel website. When checking in the man at reception didn't recognise we had booked two rooms and required prompting. He also forgot to allocate our free wifi to our rooms. The bad: the hotel restaurant was under renovations which meant no in room dining or breakfast etc. Not a big deal but we were not told about it at all until arriving at the hotel - it would have been nice to know prior to booking. The room was very small with no where to put one bag, let alone two! The hallways were dark and a bit dingy. Would I stay here again? Yes - only if I needed to be downtown and if it was a good rate. Otherwise I'd probably look for something nearby. It's certainly not in keeping with the W standard I am used to!

Extremely average hotel with dated decor. The room felt plastic-y, although bed was nice and water pressure good in the shower. Tough/ long taxi ride from other areas in NYC and the subway stations nearby are under construction. Close to Eataly which is a perk.Will likely not stay here again except for Starwood points.

Drinks at the Living Room bar are well made.My room was a corner room and spacious, but the lighting seemed off. It was very fluorescent. The room overall felt very four, possibly even three, star. Some tiles and caulking in the bathroom were messed up. Fixtures felt plastic-y. Bed was good. Water pressure in shower was good.Will likely not stay again except for SPG points.W is not what it used to be...

Booked this hotel based on the name alone. Once I started reading reviews I was worried!The location is amazing, the room was spacious. The staff was friendly and so very helpful. Tracey Thomas went above and beyond for us!Only negatives: no onsite restaurant and valet parking super pricey

I stayed here for one night. Check-in was quick and efficient. Room was quite quiet for both NYC and for a W-hotel. Great wifi and AC. Gym could use a spin bike or too.I would recommend and stay here again.

The good: great location, awesome view of the Freedom Tower, friendly service, and good rooftop bar. The bad: Bar's hours, pricey, lack of on site dining option (They are working on it) and small, worn rooms. I bet these rooms were really cool when the hotel was new. However, currently there are lots of scuffs and scratches, and they do not seem clean. With a little tlc, this could be an excellent stay.

This hotel is located at a strategic location which is directly opposite 1 WTC! Hence the good views! However service from the front office is not as friendly, they're quite cold and don't speak much. Renovations of the interior of the hotel is just normal and not impressive. Don't get much W brand of awesomeness feel of it The other W Union Square at 14th St/Park avenue south Manhattan has a better and impressive interior which carries the W energy and image!

The hotel was very clean, bed, bathroom etc. And while the room was small, it was perfectly large enough for one person there for work. The location is my favorite of all the hotels I have stayed at in Manhattan. The view from the lobby is really something unique and special. There is a peaceful yet young vibe to the hotel. You are close to battery park and the marina. Overall couldn't have really been happier. The only downside is proximity to midtown if you have business there but the hotel can't be two places at once. I will definitely try to stay here again if I go for work. Staff was very kind and helpful. Well done W!

This is a typical W Hotel experience. There is a lively bar area and the rooms are clean, relatively small, but has all the necessary amenities. The entrance was a bit confusing since the check in desk is not located on the ground floor and the signage to enter was not very clear.
user_name:
Carlos R
New York City, New York

review_body: Font desk overall is helpful & we requested twin bed and finally we got it. No breakfast during my visit as restaurant is under renovation, luckily has starbucks and the burger restaurant nearby . I bumped into housekeeping. She put toilet brush onto wahing basin. & i am shocked, it is very dirty as it is where i put my face towel. Mattress is easily moved away from bed. One night I bumped into bed corner. I had a big bruised. Bad design. Not safe.

We were so surprised that it was quiet at night in this area of New York. A real plus. The room was great, very comfortable. They are making some renovations so no restaurant on site, but plenty in the area. We recommend Bill's across the way. A great bar on the 5th floor overlooks downtown. Not cheap but great service and it is New York. Staff was very friendly.

Very quiet and perfect location to walk around and go anywhere you like around NYC. It is close to the subway, you are literally right across the 9/11 Memorial and also close to the Tribeca Film Festival. The Rooms are super clean, the views are magnificent, the staff are super friendly and they have a very young and hip atmosphere. I would stay here again when i go back into NYC.

I have come to expect the consistent W experience and this place is no different.Great modern look and feel, excellent views in a good location downtown walking distance from the world trade center.Something to look out for:* The valet parking is $70 which is pretty steep even for NYC standards. Would recommend self parking down the street for $40

We stayed at this hotel during July and air conditioning was great although the weather was very hot. The bed was very comfortable. The room was clean and it was taken care every day during our stay. Service was great and we had everything we needed in the room. Its location is very convenient considering how big the city is. It is close to the attractions but far from the crowd of the city.

Hip, edgy, fun, yet accommodating, W Hotels may have their occasional faults, but the W Downtown did not exhibit any on my trip this week. Typical for some, if not may NYC hotels, check in is not ground floor but on an upper floor, in this case the 5th. The lobby is black, very black. With an undulating, ceiling of custom LED light fixture that is simply amazing. Being in the real estate industry and having stayed at hundreds of hotels, this lobby design got it right. Really, really right. The room was bright, cheery and well maintained. No "I am too cool for school" unsupervised design here, Once again they got it really really right. Night design that serves its purpose and function. The W was able to immediately accommodate steaming my travel worn jacket free of its wrinkles - just in the nick of time for my dinner. WELL DONEA pleasant balcony at the lobby bar provided excellent views of the Freedom Tower. Walking distance to Wall Street and the World Financial Center. Don't miss Bob's Burgers next door to the W !

My husband and I enjoy The W hotels and he has been a long time Starwood member we saw a few bad reviews but trusted the name. This is always our first choice and sadly we regret this one. The W New York-Downtown is not contributing to the good name that has been built. Cooperate should review the condition and policies of this specific location. I suppose I should just start from the beginning...At check in we were informed that there is no food on site due to construction. They did provide a long list of alternatives which was much appreciated. However, in reading past reviews apparently this has been a major complaint of being an ongoing construction project which I must admit, I hear the jackhammers across the street but there is nothing going on in this hotel.Once we got in our room about 10:30pm after a long flight the first thing we noticed was how damaged and dirty the room was but too tired to deal with it we waited until morning with the intention of moving to another hotel. Unfortunately the daylight made it worse. There were black marks all over the wall, mold rings in the sink, and the shower was unacceptably dirty. We booked our room through MasterCards BLACK CARD/LUXURY CARD and after calling the front desk to complain about the uncleanliness they said they would send a housekeeping manager to inspect it. No one ever showed up so we told them to forget it that we would call MasterCard to handle it. As soon as we said that, they agreed to move us but told us that they did not want to move us to a low floor(I'm assuming because the low floors are the reject rooms).Now we moved from the 8th floor to the 20th floor and we still have some cosmetic issues but it is actually a lot better. There's still mold in the sink and marks on the walls, not to mention the broken furniture, but the nicer view and shower floor that I'm not afraid to stand on sort of makes up for it. But all that considered not much of a change in cleanliness. And it's not just in the rooms that this is a problem. The lobby and hallways are all poorly maintained.Since we can't eat on property I decided I wanted to at least enjoy the bar. According to the website as of August 21, 2017 at 10:49pm the bar closes at 11pm. We strolled into the hotel after dinner around 10:30pm and was told that last call is 10:25pm so the bar is closed. This was obviously the last excuse I wanted to hear. So I called the front desk and the woman confirmed that it closes at 11pm so I inquired why the bartender told me there was a last call at 10:25pm but no mention of it when we checked in, on any of the hotel room information books, or on their website. Her response, "I guess it closes at 10:30pm then." It sounded like a fake reason not to serve us. I understand the W-Downtown appreciates us choosing them, business is business. And since this is a public forum that hotel staff replies to, I think any solution should be taken care of publicly. It might help some to know that the issues are getting fixed not covered over by an apology and no action. Again I just want to make clear that we love the W brand but this hotel does not do it justice.

Room was very nice Clean, working wifi, and nice view. Service was very good as well with very nice and courteous staff all around. Location close to subways, 9/11 museum, and Wall street. Would definitely stay again.
user_name:
Christopher K
New York City, New York

review_body: I have just returned from visiting the W hotel about 1 month and a half ago and someone from the hotel has been using my credit card details last night. I am in shock and appalled by this!! How could they let something like this happen....

Is the small details that count. In this instance, this is so true. Every morning , I look forward to waking up and have a fresh cuppa at the lobby area where they serve free coffee. The wake-me-up is even better as you lounge in the open area absorbing the morning views of the freedom towerRoom wise, I was given an accessible room which was a little awkward but overall pleasant. Staff were also very friendly giving great recommendations to nearby eateries and the necessary directions

Close to One World Trade Centre and other downtown areas. Easy access to the subway. The room was comfortable and staff very helpful. The only issue for a nice hotel that was a letdown was not having free Wifi except in the lounge. Other issue was the bathroom door did not have a lock and the shower door did not close properly. Free coffee every morning is a bonus.

The W is a great option if you have business downtown. It is located across from the World Trade Center Memorial and if you get a room facing that way it will have great views. During my visit, the restaurant was closed but there are many good dining options near by.

I used to be a heavy user of the w hotel brand, so when I found 3 mice in my apartment bathroom and needed a place to stay until the landlord can get it sorted out, I booked a last minute room at the w downtown. like most w's, the w downtown is oozing modern style. it seems slightly out of place in the middle of the financial district and most of the other guests I saw looked like they came more for the low price than the design.as an spg member I was given a rate so low, I actually thought about pinching myself. it is July in Manhattan after all. usually last minute rooms would be hard to find and not anything close to a bargain. sadly, the new political climate has clearly affected tourist business and I got my room for way south of $200. no complaints there.it took a moment to figure out I had to go to the fifth floor to check in, then take another set of elevators to my room. strangely, despite a clearly not full hotel, I was given a room not exactly next to the elevator, rather the room was set back behind it. I took one look at the l shaped wall and realized my room was backing up to and sharing two walls with the elevator shaft and hightailed it down to the front desk to ask for a move to a quieter location a little aside: many years ago, another Manhattan w hotel "upgraded" me to a room that was similarly sharing two walls with the elevator. since the hotel is clearly not full, it seemed kinda petty and cheap of them to put me in such a crappy location.my new room was 6 floors up with a sweeping view of downtown Manhattan and, wait for it, a sliver of a water view. a super functional desk spanned nearly floor to ceiling windows. bonus points for that. everything looked brand spanking new, clean and sparkling white. and yay for the bliss toiletries including a real bar of soap that actually smelled delicious. my only complaint were design choices: instead of bathroom tile, they used a vinyl substitute complete with faux grout lines. yuck. and the tv was mounted so high it was practically touching the ceiling. the restaurant is currently being remodeled, but this is Manhattan and who'd bother with eating in the hotel restaurant anyway? (unless you are staying at the ace where the restaurants are amazing.). be warned, wifi is NOT free unless you are an spg member and even though I am, I had to call down and ask for them to enter a special code into my reservation. not a big deal, but something that should have been taken care of when checking in.I absolutely loved the almost next door to century 21 location and as soon as I finished checking in, I hightailed it over there for some shopping. if you've never been to century 21, do not walk, run on over. the selection is high end, the prices not so much. and July/august is clearance time, so don't hold back.all in all, the w saved the day. it was amazingly clean. new enough that baseboards and carpets were still in good condition. and the staff, while not terribly proactive, was more than willing to change my room and give me a wifi code when asked. can't really ask for more than that this far south of two hundred bucks.

There's no hotel that could ever get you a better view on ground zero than the W Downtown NYC. The location is awesome to explore this part of manhattan. Public transport is right in front of the hotel and there are a couple of bars and restaurants as well in the area. The rooms are quite small, so don't book the smallest category of you're traveling together. We had an amazing view and felt very welcome! A bit weird is that you have to enter an elevator before you reach the lobby- but that's about it. The rest is just a great modern and clean hotel - typical W style. I'd recommend a breakfast in bed - slightly expensive but if you have a room with a view it's an amazing experience.

I stayed at the hotel for one night. The hotel is very close to westside highway and on a quiet downtown street. The main lobby is on the 5th floor where you need to change elevators. I got a good rate of $180 for the night. They upgraded me to a high floor corner room due to my status. The views from this room were unbelievable. I could see a good part of NYC from my windows which went around 2 sides of the room. The room itself was of decent size. I found the bathroom to be tiny. My biggest issue with W hotels is that they are very dark! I know they want to be cool, but I do like to see things in the corridor while walking :)...The service was sterile so cant say much. Overall this hotel did provide a good mix of price & value so I would repeat it.

In our second time to visit new york. We love the winter season We have wonderful time We book this hotel because we found a great value in this seasonThe location probably is far from time square but you take the metro and. It was easy and fastThis hotel the standards are incredible we book a room with great view , great size. Clean fluffy beds a lot amenities and they send us a chocolates m&m for my daughter birthday, great detailThe lobby is mix of lounge and restaurant great option to have a drinksWe forget a portrait of our daughter and we call to the hotel and the send. Us to my home Thanks w hotel for the detailWe recommend this hotel

I stayed at the W Downtown for many weeks in 2017, as I worked with a client in the Financial District. This hotel is right in front of the One World Trade Center, and is within walking distance to the Fulton Center subway as well as the Rector St, 1 Line. Loved the service levels at this hotel, everyone from the doorman to the receptionists and bartenders knew me by name and always tried to make my stay as comfortable as possible. The rooms were quite large, and I did get upgraded a few times to corner suites facing the WTC Memorial. The hotel does not currently (July 2017) have a restaurant as it is undergoing upgradation, hence there is no Platinum lounge / breakfast buffet. However the last time i visited they did provide gift cards to use at the Starbucks around the corner, which I appreciated! Additionally because this hotel is situated downtown, it does get a bit quiet after 7 pm or so, and there aren't too many restaurant choices. The modern room design is also something that not everyone might like (black carpets, white walls and ceilings) and could possibly be improved with more light in the room. Overall though I would greatly recommend this hotel, and would come back if I needed to work out of NYC going forward.

This hotel faces One World Trade Center. But be aware that you may get stuck like I did facing a run down, abandoned parking lot. When I asked for my room to face the tower, they told me there were no king rooms that faced the tower. Yet, one of my co-workers had a room as such. Just be careful. Room 613 faces the parking lot. I have to admit, it was quite, though.

This W definitely lives up to the chic vibe that W hotels around the world possess. The staff are helpful and friendly. You enter through sliding glass doors at street level off a non-busy side street (Albany). Bellmen greet you warmly and handle your luggage. An elevator with the always cool W mood music and aroma whisks you up to the 5th-floor lobby and lounge which has a wonderfully inviting patio and bar with views across to the Freedom Tower and the World Trade Center Memorial Park. Make sure you enjoy drinks or just hanging out on the patio - especially after dark. It's a great experience and the view is spectacular. The location is great for Battery Park, Financial District, Statue of Liberty. It is a long ride up to mid-town for theatre or sites there. SoHo is a twenty-minute walk but it is through fun, interesting neighborhoods. The area right around the hotel has plenty of inviting shops, restaurants and coffee hangouts. The now iconic Oculus mall and train station is only a couple of minutes away and absolutely worth visiting. As an SPG liftime Platinum we were upgraded to a corner room which had views on two sides to the Freedom Tower and Financial District. The room had all the hip whistles and bells we love about W hotels - latest tech gadgets, sleek design, floor to ceiling glass. The bed was wonderfully comfortable. The bathroom spacious, well designed with a big shower with excellent water pressure. On the down side, this W does NOT do Platinum upgrades to their suites. They wanted more money for that. Most other W hotels do offer such upgrades -- for example, the W in NYC on Lexington Avenue does it. The manager told me the suite was available but since it's so distinctive they need more money. That's unusual and disappointing. Also, the restaurant is currently being renovated so only some coffee was being served but this should be fixed soon.All in all, this is a solid W hotel with better than average views, helpful staff and I do recommend it for Lower Manhattan though they should reconsider their upgrade policy.

This hotel is well located, we enjoyed our stay it was our friend's birthday. Friendly staff, spacious room it was quiet in the morning just the traffic noise not bad at all. Highly recommended. Visit the bar you will have a great time!

Celebrated my 50th birthday! Excellent hotel, trendy vibes, everyone was friendly. Enjoyed the cocktails. We've been to a few W Hotels and never one of them disappoint. We love the lounge - great for chilling. Highly recommended.

We decided to stay here for a couple of nights when passing through NYC! We had drinks at the bar on a previous stay and really enjoyed it.We were upgraded to a corner room due to SPG Platinum status. They are not the biggest rooms around but for NYC standards it was reasonable. The bed was the usual W bed which I find really good and overall the views from the room were good also.The bar was as good as last time, friendly service and good drinks. The outside area was a bit cold this time of year but is still nice to have the options.Breakfast was the only thing that let it down, the restaurant was closed so it was being served in a makeshift breakfast area. The omelettes were pretty good but the service was terrible. Was as if they didn't know what they were doing and a cold wind kept blowing in as well. It was certainly below what you would expect but I assume a temporary situation so not the end of the world.Overall I would stay again if in NYC, it all depends where you wish to be, but it is very handy for the various transport links!

W has the usual high tech rooms and decor. Highlight is the patio bar overlooking the World Trade Center memorial. A restaurant, especially for breakfast, would be nice. Not cheap but hey it's New York. Convenient to business downtown and to the occulus shopping.

The stay here at the W NY-Downtown was an excellent one. The lobby area is definitely one of the most unique I have ever come across at any hotel and has a definite trendy vibe to it. The room I stayed in was a tad small, but it's to be expected in NYC. Other than the size, the room was great and had no issues. I would definitely recommend staying here and will aim to stay here again the next time I need to stay downtown.

This W is a great location for working in Wall Street but it seems to be more expensive every time I book it. The gym has recently been upgraded to newer equipment which is nice but still very small and can be over crowded early mornings as it can only accommodate a dozen or less people. The restaurant at the lobby level has been closed and under construction for over a year! Also construction around world trade continues and can be noisy if you are on a lower floor. Amenities are great and staff are friendly.

The staff at the W Downtown are just amazing. When I checked in a little over a week ago, there was a mix-up with my reservation, with most of the blame on me, and I had been having a bad day. The front desk staff, and then in particular the Welcome Desk Talent Coach Prith Shah really went out of their way to manage the situation. They were patient, accommodating, professional and kind. They also upgraded me to a great room, with complimentary drink tickets as well. I am a platinum lifetime member, and was certainly treated as one here. I will be extending my stay while I house hunt with a new job, its the perfect balance of NYC cool with comfort, and a view of the 9/11 memorial site. I would never think of staying anywhere else in downtown NYC!

My friends and I stayed here for a few nights. If you're looking to be close to a bunch of touristy stuff in midtown, this will be about a 30 minute ride by subway. But in itself, this is still a good location in the financial district. Our room faced the One World Trade Center which is a block away and it was spectacular, day or night (see photo). It's a several minute walk to the west side of Manhattan on the Hudson River, where you can walk along the river and get a distant view of the Statue of Liberty. Another 10-15 minute walk to the east side of Manhattan where you can walk the Brooklyn Bridge across the East River to Brooklyn. The hotel itself is modern and streamlined and reminds me of European hotels. The lobby on the 5th floor has a generous seating area, bar, and balcony overlooking the One World Trade Center (you get discounted drinks as a guest). You can get rooms in different sizes. We booked the "Spectacular" room with two double beds for four people and it was a little tight, but I believe a lot of mid-range hotel rooms in New York are like this. It was worth the money considering the location. The beds were comfy, the staff was friendly, and I appreciated the wardrobe and cabinet space.

What a cool, hip hotel. Located on lexington ave, just a few blocks from Grand Central Station. It's close to radio city music hall, the tonight show with jimmy fallon, rockafeller plaza and so much more. We mentioned we were on our 10th anniversary trip and were given complimentary drinks in the bar. Our room, a "wonderful room", was the smallest we've ever stayed in, however is considered large for NYC. Bed was comfy, bathroom nice and a decent sized closet. There was a balcony, however, it was unusable by the hotel based on size (not sure what that meant). Would stay here again

Stayed here for a couple of nights while on business trip to NYC for meetings in the area. The location is a plus for travelers who are primarily hanging around downtown - the hotel is slightly off the hustle and bustle but within short walking distance of everything. It has the classic look and feel of the W but is subdued compared to the other W's in NYC. The reception staff are incredibly helpful even though the reason I had to interact with them was because the air conditioning/heater in my room was broken...other than that the noise level is tolerable and I would consider staying here again.

Seriously cool hotel, so dark that you kept bumping into things in the lobby. If you are achingly trendy, stay here. As someone who is beyond hip to be square, mostly I was irritated. Finally, I lost it with having to take two elevators to my room and the fact that the on-site restaurant had been closed since March. Seriously, dude? I haven't got the time to go to a diner for breakfast, I'm Gordon Gekko of a morning! So I checked out after one night, and went round the corner to the Holiday Inn (a new fresh hell of pain, but of my own choosing). No 'Let me print your invoice', instead, 'We'll email it you'. Next day, had to go and ask for a print out. Then, without having reconfirmed my email address, I received several from the hotel. Hmm ...

I travel to New York frequently but this was my first stay at this location. The front desk is located on the fifth floor so feels very safe. The actual room was a nice size with a comfortable bed. Unfortunately, the thermostat was not working so the room was warm. To be fair, I never mentioned this issue to the staff and instead cracked the window open. The nights were hot and then I had some visiting mosquitoes. I should have alerted maintenance and these issues could have been avoided. Overall the stay was fine and I would consider staying here again.
user_name:
Kathy M
La Crescent, Minnesota, United States

review_body: Enjoyed this hotel. We actually showed up at hotel around 930 am and check-in was @ 3pm. The hostess graciously checked us in!The hotel is clean and quiet. Walking distance to train and other sites. Perfect location for us! Would definitely stay again!

The W Downtown is an old hotel, needs to be refurbished. The hallways and rooms are older and you can see the wear and tear. The hotel itself is down a side street and it and there are a few things around however if you are in NY for vacation, this is not a great location.Ok if you are in town for business and you need a place to sleep.There is a gym however it is small, only 3 treadmills and on 2 mornings at 6am they were in use.Difficult to get taxis from the hotel, best bet, walk over to the Marriott, much easier to get on from there.Rooms are small which you expect for NYC however they are loud, first stay was on the 9th floor facing the world trade center and the outside W patio was having a party and the noise carried right up to my room.Next visit across the hall from the ice machine which was creaking all night.Bed is comfortable however with the noise, tough to get a good nights sleep.Overall I would definitely give this place a miss

The W Hotel Downtown is a great hotel in a fantastic location- both for business and tourism. The views from the room (Ultra Cool I believe) are truly breathtaking, overlooking the 9/11 memorial and WTC. The rooms are a bit dated and the corridors seem to be from a 70’s Sheraton, but hey, the views make up for that. In terms of amenities, the Hotel has everything you need. A fairly well quipped gym, business center and free coffee and water in reception is a nice touch. Will stay again!

I had a great stay at the W Hotel Downtown recently. I was there the weekend of May 5 to 8. Our room overlooked the 911 Memorial and was close to the Staten Island Ferry, Battery Park and Wall Street. The hotel appeared to be fairly new. The room was very clean and well appointed. My only complaint at night is the lighting isn't very bright. But the view from our room was spectacular. I highly recommend this hotel and this area of the city.You can easily take subway or Uber/Lyfte to get to other areas of the city. I highly recommend the W New York Downton.

I went for a single night work stay. The hotel is convenient to all of the downtown offices. As a person who travels a lot for work, I try to stay fit and hotel gyms are important. The gym is solid - it has punching bags, good mats. Small-ish, but most people at the W go for the fun. This place is also 3 blocks away from the running path that goes up along the West Side Highway. Free coffee in the lobby at breakfast. Hopping bar in the evening.There's a nice view from the lobby (about 5 floors up) that overlooks the WTC memorial. Could be a nice place for a cocktail or coffee if I had the time.The check in process was a bit brusque, but the morning shift were quite pleasant and helpful.The rooms are small. And dark, but that's the style that W goes for. It's new, clean, well equipped and well located. For its class (W) of hotel, it's one of the best I've stayed in. If it were a different class of hotel, I'd rate it higher.It's no marble, historic place. That would make it a 5 star.

The W downtown was a fabulous hotel to stay at for the BikeNYC 5 Boro Ride. Amazing staff, all the way from the bellman to the managers. Very accommodating and helpful and truly seemed to enjoy what they were doing! Rooms were clean and comfy. Great views of the Freedom Tower. They had a coffee bar and breakfast/treat station for fueling up for the ride ahead and offered a late checkout for riders that day. Highly recommend this hotel and look forward to staying here on our next trip to the city! Kudos to the management and staff for making our stay and event a great experience!

We stayed here for the 5 Boro Bike Tour and were really happy here. We stayed here a few years back and it wasn't as good as it is now. The staff is simply incredible. The check in was perfect. The valet staff and bell staff were incredibly accommodating and nice. We have stayed at other hotels for the Tour and it was not nearly as smooth as at the W Hotel. The location is perfect. Our room is overlooking the World Trade Center site and the Memorial. It's an easy walk to Tribecca, Greenwich Village, The West Village, and SoHo. Also nearby Battery Park City which is fun to walk the river. The rooms were excellent. The housekeeping staff was excellent. We are not big fans of the lobby set up but hey. That's all. The beds were great. Nice!

We've just spent two weeks travelling along the east coast and the, W Downtown was definitely the best hotel we stayed at. We were in 2208, a corner room with stunning views of the freedom tower and surrounding areas.The hotel was great, view's were amazing, yet it was the staff, particularly JaVonn that made this hotel stand out. Nothing is too much, a really relatable, genuine guy that obviously loves his job, which is a really rare find. Outstanding customer service. This was our first trip to NYC and we will definitely be back later this year. Please pass on our thanks to JaVonn!!!

My second time returning to the W Downtown after a year, and it's was like visiting family. My stay began with a warm welcome from Tracey at the front desk, who is just a fantastic lady, and who even remembered me from my last visit. Combined with an overall expert staff, and warm morning greetings from Erik at the front entrance, made it for a great stay.The hotel has an edgy vibe and is popular on the weekends with a trendy, younger crowd. I prefer this as you will never have to deal with the midtown crush of tour groups and the Number 1, 4 and 5 trains are all within walking distance. Security is excellent, both inside and outside the hotel, as it faces the 911 Memorial, and rooms are immaculate and modern. Presently, they are refurbishing their dining facility, but as it's NYC, finding great food nearby is never a problem. If you want an upscale, laid back, and peaceful hotel stay in NYC, this is the hotel for you.
user_name:
NOIDK
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel is in a great location if you are primarily interested in checking out the WTC area or are working in the Financial District. The rooms are very small, which I guess should be expected in NYC. The entrance to the hotel is awkward with no street level lobby and an elevator that takes you up to a very small/awkward check in area. At the time I visited, the hotel had no restaurant and the rooms had no coffee makers. When I travel for business, I consider both of these as "must haves" due to long hours at the office. The design of the rooms is very modern and clean. I stayed in a corner room which had. Nice open feel to it despite being small.

I was so happy to be upgraded to my two bed queen room because I would hate to know how small my room would have been without he upgrade. This room actually had a great view of the 9/11 Memorial. No coffee maker in the room but I am sure you can ask for one - Starwood Hotels never fail in that area.Where this hotel scores major points is with their bar and the view from the balcony of the bar. It truly is magnificent. The service is wonderful from check-in to the concierge. The only reason I am giving 4 instead of 5 stars is the room is really really small. It was fine for me, by myself, but if I was to bring my family there - chaos.

The W Downtown is a nice hotel in Wall Street area, across from the 9/11 memorial. There are many subway lines close by and we found the location easy to navigate from. You can also walk to Battery Park and the Staten Island ferry quite easily. The rooms are very small (our room had one bed, one small desk and a small bathroom w/o a bathtub (only a shower). Closets and drawers are tucked into every spare inch. The design is very modern and nice, and the views were amazing (we stayed in a room with a "spectacular view" per the listing and it did not lie.) There were signs of age in our room (for example, bathroom pocket door did not stay closed and the lock had been sealed over so there was no way to close the door, alarm did not work, paneling was peeling off some drawers). There was also a ridiculously overcharged minibar (buy your snacks at a convenience store on the walk over from the subway and save $30). The bed was nice and the linens were clean (no bed bugs!). This room was about $300/night not including the taxes which are substantial in NYC. There is no restaurant (starting in March 2017). No ETA provided as to when they would be done.
