The conceirge that we worked with did give us a list of restaurants to try that were close by. The lighting in the 5th floor (main lobby) was dark and hard to see in after the sun went down. The hotel claims to be green, but I didn't see much of an effort. For example, no recycling, linens and towels changed everyday whether you want it or not, shampoo/conditioner swapped out every day w/o request, aircon runs continuously when room is set at 74F.

The hotel is nice cozy good vibe and good service.Quiet in evenings after hours.Suggested for singles and young couples.I enjoyed the lounge and the bar was great.Don't get lost in the elevator as the 5th floor is the concierge and it is a bit confusing.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel at the beginning of April. We spent 4 nights here along with my 7 year son and although we didn't spend much time in the hotel (other than to relax late evening and then sleep) we found the staff all extremely friendly and the room very clean and comfortable. Despite my initial doubts about staying Downtown and how accessible that would be to all the tourist attractions, we found it really easy to get around with the subway right around the corner. If I had a couple of bits of feedback however, it would be that the 'double' beds are smaller than expected, so my son and I slept in one and my husband in the other, so it would have been nice to have a small 'roll-out' bed for my son to sleep on. The second thing would be the lack of tea/coffee making facilities. That said, we would definitely stay here again and would certainly recommend to others.

It has been a long flight when I arrived at lobby of W Downtown NYC.Unfortunately I got a room on a low floor even though my Platinum profile indicated a high floor preference - receptionist refused to look for another room as she argued the hotel was fully booked. I was in a hurry to check in and asked for my luggage to be delivered to my room. When I cam back around midnight I asked again for a different room and voila of course no problem - unfortunately the check in person was super unfriendly and kept me waiting and also refused to get me a new key as she was not sure where my luggage was - situation escalated and we needed the manager on duty to resolve - all in all the W Downtown is not as cool as many others of the chain but has a specific issue with client centricity. Will clearly not book this hotel again - one person can mess it up all.

I usually think every hotel can be good but usually it excels it unforeseen circumstances. This time, I arrived without reservation as I had mixed up arrival dates. The staff was outstanding without fussing about my fault. I got a room at the same rate (which was a pretty good rate for a wonderful room). I got dedicated a very generous – and I got it for the whole stay. Thanks a lot for everybody in charge.As to the rooms, the hotel only has three suites, which it usually keeps open and does not grant a platinum upgrade but if you have a chance to get a cool corner or an ultra cool corner, they truly make a rewarding stay. As to the rooms, the hotel only has three suites, which it usually keeps open and does not grant a platinum upgrade but if you have a chance to get a cool corner or an ultra cool corner, they truly make a rewarding stay.
user_location: La Caleta, Adeje, Tenerife, Canary Islands
user_name:
adelyne2016
La Caleta, Adeje, Tenerife, Canary Islands

review_body: loved this hotel. stayed here a few years ago and came back again. was not disappointed. of course New York is great and it helps to stay in such a nice room. great view and nearby a lot of nice restaurants

One of the least exciting W Hotels I've visited -- not helped by the isolated and dull FiDi location. The rooms were cheap imitations of something more interesting. You're better off at the W Union Sq or even the Sheraton on Canal-- better location.
user_name:
aworldaway1983
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: A visit to the World Trade Center Memorial and Museum, along with shows in Times Square for a getaway overnight and we chose to stay downtown. Amazing views of the surrounding area out of the windows of a room on the 20th floor. The design of the rooms is a little on the science-fiction side, but perfectly comfortable and even utilitarian with plenty of space to stow your belongings.The design of the lobby area is wild with an undulating black and silver ceiling. The ground floor area is under construction, so check-in is on the 5th floor which was a little disorienting on arrival. Staff was super-friendly and helpful putting those New York stereotypes to rest. All in all, a very, very good stay.

This place wants to be cool. It's enthusiastically read the text book it got for Christmas and even took a few classes but it's missing the vibe. So the fifth floor reception is pretty interesting (and disorientatingly dark) and the bedrooms have some fun touches. But that's it. Right now there is zip food on offer. And no coffee making in the room either. There are no public areas beyond reception and it's sewn on bar area. Luckily you're in New York so food & coffee etc is just a step away but that's not quite what you paid for, is it?

This location was absolutely exquisite! I checked into a Corner room with a spectacular view over the World Trade Center. It was perfectly located close to Battery Park where I had a tour scheduled. Without knowing how close it was, the valet attendant told us it was only a 10 min walk! Thanks for the heads up before we asked for a taxi.Associates, Pete Villarreal and Andrew Brown stood out to us. Pete was so accommodating in making this NYC trip amazing, anticipating my needs, and Andrew Brown gave us an amazing Sushi restaurant recommendation and exclusive entrance to PHD nightclub.This hotel also have an excellent Livingroom bar. It's gorgeous and aesthetically perfect for a few drinks before you hit town.I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and family.

I think this confirms I shall not book with W again. Again, all very hip but the room is small; no coffee makers, insufficient bathroom shelf space and expensive wifi (who else still charges for this now basic commodity?) make this a disappointing experience. Compounded this time by no cafe or restaurant or room service. Seems they knew this since early March but don't warn you. No apology on check in and no reaction to my complaint on check out that no breakfast available was a problem The provision of coffee urns and polystyrene cups in the bar early morning turned this otherwise trendy hotel into a low grade motel. And charging full price for the wine well after happy time had started was cheap behaviour.

A fun, different hotel. Be prepared to experience a different kind of hotel! W Hotel is fun and very modern. When you walk into the lobby it is takes a minute to get accumulated to the sensory experience. May not be the right fit for everyone.

The best thing about this property has to be the location. Near the Subway and some room as views of the World Trade Center. Rooms are generally clean and comfortable. I had a corner room which has windows on 2 sides of the wall. Was quite nice to have more views of NYC. The TV was placed in a fairly awkward place - close to the celling. It doesn't matter to me anyway since I don't use it. Overall, a standard good city hotel.

This is a great hotel! The staff was incredible they went above and beyond!It's clean, the rooms are very nice and what you see is what you get, no trick photography! The location is great - what else can I say? Just stay here you won't regret it!

If I had a choice between this W and the one on time square I would definitely go wth time square. This hotel needs some more updating that is for sure, the people are nice there and SPG recognition seems pretty good, overall it is a good place

I received a complimentary room upgrade to a corner room with skyline view. Corner room is spacious enough for one person and comfortable. Platinum member of SPG has a choice either breakfast or 500 points. I recommend 500 points because the platinum member free breakfast was just a coffee and some bread. Location was great. 9/11 memorial park and wall street and a lot of metro stops are within 10 minutes by walking .

We picked this hotel for the view of the Freedom Tower and it was worth it. We were on the 20th floor and had a full unobstructed view of the tower. Lobby and bar area is small, was cold so no outside area, but in the summer when the plastic is rolled up it must be great to sit outside and enjoy the view. No real amenities, but if your a tourist, who wants to spend all day at the hotel. Only complaint about room is bathroom had no counter space, so if you both have toiletries, good luck! Also has a see thru shower, so if you are afraid to be naked in front of your roommate, not the right room for you! Oh yea, LOVE it that the window opens a little for some fresh air, and instant AC when cold outside!

The hotel is very nice with very helpful staff, rooms are a little bit small but at a good cost. The thing that bothered me the most is that the lobby is in the 5th floor, so you have to take 2 elevators to get into the room.

The hotel was extremely clean and very nice contemporary room with lots of room. Navigating up to check-in then through another bank of elevators to your room through a very noisy and busy lounge/lobby is awkward at best but manageable.

Great hotel typical of NY with small rooms and odd layout. Everything was clean and well maintained. The decorations are typical of W hotels with a bohemian funky atmosphere. Be advised that they have "water closets" WC off the bar area which means the men's and woman's bathroom is one room with stalls. Not an ideal situation for a work trip and I'm not comfortable with this setup at all. The odd layout for this hotel consists of check in on the 5th floor and transferring elevators to get out of the hotel.

Nice hotel. Convenient downtown location. Staff is very friendly and the bar and lobby are nice. The rooms are nothing special, but the price is right and we enjoyed our stay. The restaurant is under renovation, but they still have room service.
user_name:
Bratts202
New York City, New York

review_body: 5 1/2 years ago, a guy from Phoenix who I had been speaking to for a few months came to NYC for a birthday party. After hanging out twice, it was clear we had an amazing spark and as a "treat"- I rented a 2 night stay at the W Hotel.Not to be completely cheesy, but we definitely fell for each other in this hotel, and my favorite moment was after a wonderful dinner date and walking around NYC for hours talking, we went back to the room and sat on the bench overlooking the window together and looked out on the city in total silence. 3 months later we were in love and 6 months later we formally got "together"It was a magical moment that I will take with me for the rest of my life. Over the last year, due to distance and life events, we've grown apart and decided to take a break from each other. I was in NYC on business for a few days and wanted to surprise him by recapturing that moment.I reached out to the W Hotel Manager with I was sure was an impossible request- was there anyway to find out the room I had stayed in 5 1/2 years ago? Or if not, if I could describe the room and the angle, could we get a reasonable similarity? The Director of Welcome Office, Mickey Steenberghe, was immediately helpful and was able to find the room number. He helped me book the room 2 weeks in advance and was amazing in communication - offering other treats and events to make the visit more magical. When I checked into the room, I was overcome first with nostalgia, but then with a huge smile as I saw the W Staff had strewn rose petals all about the room, including a large heart on the bed and a trail leading to the bench which now had decorative lights over it. A bottle of chilled champagne and chocolate covered strawberries were on the desk waiting for us. My guy arrived a few hours later- he was extremely touched and we had an amazing time reminiscing and reliving those first beautiful moments where we connected. It's a bit too early to tell, but I think we may decide to give things a second shot when I move back to NYC in a few months. It was truly an amazing magical experience the first time around and Mickey's help to recreate the moment gave us both such a wonderful experience- I can't thank him or the W enough. Definitely my favorite place to stay in NYC!
user_name:
AllAboutSports79
New York City, New York

review_body: Checked in for a wedding...Amazing location. Starwood Gold member...no upgrade, told we were given a prime room...I guess prime means next to elevator, no view. Heard the elevator as well as the people in the next room..loudly! Never offered our choice of wifi or free drink. Went to desk to ask for the free drink coupons and given attitude but we did get one coupon. Usually one per person. Very interesting rooms, great bar overlooking the freedom tower, Need a serious Starwood training session.

I recently visited this hotel as I wanted a change from the Time Square vibe and I AM SO GLAD I did. My awesome experience started even before I checked into the hotel when I contact Concierge and spoke to Andrew who was able to secure me a reservation at one of the hottest restaurants in NYC (one that was showing complete booked online and when calling over the phone). Upon check-in I was greeted by Candice who helped my wife and I get our stay underway. Candice was EXTREMELY professional, friendly and sweet. While checking us in Candice noticed our room wasn't ready and started to make some calls to speed things along. During this proceed we had some small talk and Candice learned that my wife and I were celebrating our wedding anniversary so she went to the back and got us some passes to use at the bar which we did while we waited for our room. 15 minutes (or less as we were busy drinking) our room was ready which was AMAZING! Due to our original room not being ready Candice appear to have upgraded us to a better room which had amazing views of the Freedom Tower and surrounding area. The room itself was super trendy and had some cool gadgets. The bathroom was also great. Later that night we stopped by Andrew's desk again to thank him for hooking us up with the reservations and shared with him how happy we were with the restaurant and before no time we felt like "old friends". I truly enjoyed my stay and the entire staff did everything they could to make us feel welcomed.

Loved this hotel. Loads of places to eat and drink. Right by the wtc site and it's transport. Really helpful staff and cool feelWifi free and nice bar tooLarge rooms for NYC and good views fromrooms that face north.

As a New Yorker, I never imagine that I would stay at hotels in New York City. However, I decided to do something for a change.I chose W New York Downtown because it has a nice view of the One World Tower. We got the room with the amazing view overlooking the New Tower and the New Lower Manhattan. The room was small but from my experience, it was a reasonable size for hotel room in big cities worldwide. The reception and the concierge were very nice and helpful. At the beginning, I decided to spend only one night and at the end we spent four nights because we enjoyed the view so much. How to get there - Take R train and get off at Rector StreetWanna go shopping - Take R train and get off at Cortlandt Street to visit Century 21 (it's faster to walk there than taking the train though)Wanna go sightseeing - Take R train and get off at Whitehall Street to explore South Ferry and take the free shuttle to Staten IslandThis was my second times that W Hotels tried to rip me off for something that I didn't take. They added something to my bill (folio) and I told them to remove it. They did remove it. I'd have given this hotel five stars if there was no error to my bill.I would recommend this hotel to others. However, watch you bills.

I hardly ever rate low. We had three rooms altogether spread amongst the hotel. Before dinner one night, we gathered in one room so we can leave together. Each room has a radio. We had it on low volume, and got three complaints, almost to the point of asking us to leave. It was seven in the evening - on a Friday? Nobody was being loud. I found it extremely misleading the way the hotel advertises for fun. Nothing special about the rooms either.

Bar/Lounge was nice and trendy while upper floor reception helpful to recommend restaurants and print maps. Walking distance from SoHo and Greenwich Village where we find nice food (Japanase) and Jazz, Next to 9/11 Memorial & Museum which we visited the next day, I had business meetings in the restaurant in the first floor and good American food. Parking is ridiculously expensive like NYC in general.

Stayed here for the final leg of a trip to the states. The hotel is in an excellent location, opposite the new World Trade Centre, in the heart of the financial district.The hotel is a bit of a distance to the metro. As we arrived at Penn Station from Philly, we called an Uber to take us to the hotel. It was a short ride of 15 mins max.The check in, you go into the main reception and up a couple of floors in the elevator. The reception is quite small compared to other hotels, but was nonetheless quick and the staff were friendly. Our room was located on a mid floor, opposite the elevator doors. I was slightly concerned at this and the expected noise, but we found that this was not an issue at all.Our room was large for NYC standards - very large (and very comfy!) bed, with a padded seating area to look out across the city and to the World Trade Centre. The room, and indeed hotel, is very modern, going for chick, modern lines as opposed to some of the dated features in US hotels.A couple of things that did surprise me about the room:1. No coffee machine! This is a 4 star hotel, so I would have thought it would come with a coffee machine. You have to ask reception for one;2. Lack of sockets! There were hardly any sockets in the room, so I ended up charging my phone in the bathroom, which isn't ideal. I did open a bedside cabinet draw, and found a jungle of cables with a 3 way adaptor, but I have to say, it didn't look safe to use! 3. The minibar was only half stocked. No problem as we didn't use it, but this did give me a slight concern incase we were billed for anything. I mentioned it to the front desk staff, who didn't seem too concerned! We headed out for NYE and came back around 1am, where a party was in full swing in the bar. We were slightly worried that this may make our night noisy, but we didn't have a problem at all.This will be our choice of hotel for any stay in NYC.

i checked into the w and was very pleased with the hotel its very hip ,i have stayed at the hotel many times before with no probs ,apart from one time last year,which the hotel put right by upgrading me to a suite (1409) which was lovly and large,exsept it was a little worn in parts damaged wall papper and table, but nothing to much to complain about. The room service menu was exspensive but i new that but the food was good. i will be returning to the hotel in june 17 and again in dec17 all in all fab hotel in the right part of town, 1 point no resterant it was closed for re-furb

I had an issue with my reservation - the W Downtown was inflexible, demeaning, uncooperative and lacked professionalism. I would never recommend staying at this hotel because if you have an issue, the current team at the hotel will not assist you in resolving it.

Starwood/Marriott platinum member so got a nice corner king room on the 15th floor for a two night stay. Hotel is hip, modern, geared towards young professionals. Pros: Very quiet - didn't hear any other guests during our stay. Really nice shower. Really comfortable bed. Ability to control the HVAC to make sure it stays on and doesn't cycle noisily or use a motion sensor. Convenient location right across from the 9/11 memorial and lots of metro lines. Nice check in staff. Cons: The blinds aren't very effective - they are on a pulley system that lets lots of light from the corner of the windows seep into the room. Without curtains, the blinds themselves just can't make the room dark. Bring an eye shade or throw a shirt over your eyes and you're good. I'd absolutely stay again.

This hotel is an experience! I know the W brand is sophisticated and irreverent at the same time, but are all W's like this? The lobby is on the 5th floor and resembles a night club. Check-in was a breeze and was strictly transactional - no emotion from the front desk attendant. "Welcome. You're on the 10th floor. Here are your keys. Your wifi login is your name and room number. Enjoy your stay." Hahaha. Adjacent to the lobby is the bar, where a DJ spins tunes every night. It converts to a self-serve coffee and tea bar in the morning. Lobby restrooms are gender-neutral (one row of toilet stalls and sinks for everyone) so don't use the lobby restroom if this weirds you out. The rooms are small but very well laid out and organized. Every inch serves a purpose and every piece of furniture has a function. The only problem was that the mattress rests on a plastic platform without any kind of rubber mat between them. So, if you sit up in bed to work, read, or watch TV, the mattress slides down, leaving a gap between the mattress and the headboard. Location is excellent. The entire downtown area is easily accessible by foot. Subway access is nearby as well.

A beautiful hotel to stay in ...but my wonder room was to small for my 17 year old son and myself ...there Queen sides beds ..r just a standard Double in uk ...The head of housekeeping is an amazing Man....Mr RONNIE EPPS ...my son as ADHD and as AUTISM with out Ron's help his trip would have been boring ...Thank you Ron ...A big thanks to ALBERTO LOZADA whom was really friendly and helped me alot his Security and good at his job ...Brilliant stay apart from small room.....

So basically you think you pay for the W brand and expect for a nice place to stay right ?W downtown is just the worst .Its very old and dirty the room are the size of a closet and on top of all that I had BED BUGGS !!!Yes bed buggs ,,, I had to spend 250$ to the doctor and he confirmed it was bed buggs .I couldn't t sleep at nite for 2 days I was scratching my skin all nite so I called the manager and I finelly left the hotel at 5 am .They never refund me my 2 nites this place and the manager are the worst ,,,,

We checked-in Wednesday for one night and the experience was very disappointing. When I called in the morning to ask for a room ready before 3pm. the Guest operator, Jesse, was very accommodating and profesional, but once at the Front Desk at 11:30am, the agent was rude and not welcoming at all. The room was not ready, yet he was not smiling, not empathetic at all, simply asking for the payment for incidentals. Coming back at 5pm one room is availabe, but on a low floor. I asked twice this day to have a high floor (on the phone and at the first check-in), but nothing was taking into consideration ! Later on we ask for a toohbrush and a bathrobe, it never came....I work myself in a luxury hotel and this is NOT the service they are suppose to give to their guests.The view of the One World Trade center is amazing. Unfortunately this is the only positive aspect I found to this hotel. You can find better for the same rate !

Unfriendly staff and dirty linen! Charged twice for drinks in the lounge! Location is difficult if you plan on seeing shows! On the upside lovely view of the 911 memorial! Not great unless you are interested in seeing that or Wall Street!

This hotel was a very modern and in a great location to visit ground zero... literally out the front door! The rooms were nice, but in need of a little TLC, thus the 4 stars and not 5. The Concierge and front desk were extremely friendly and helpful during our visit. I would return again.

This was a very typical W experience - modern finishings, small rooms, lively bar scene. I was very happy with my room and the amenities, no complaints at all. This was just a brief overnight stay, and I picked this hotel primarily based upon location and proximity to my NY office. I wouldn't call the W a luxury hotel, but they do offer some nice amenities like the bath products and high-end bar scene, as well as comfortable bedding, so it's a little higher than mid-range. A little pricey for what is offered, but not unreasonable.

The hotel has a great location overlooking the World Trade memorial. It is very close to shop in new Westfield and Century 21. There are breakfast places all close by. The trip to the top of the new tower is well worth it. We prefer to be in a less crowded area so that part was perfect. The rooms are biggish for NYC standards. It is just a bit trendy with the frosted glass bathroom wall as I was traveling with my husband and teenage sons sharing a room made showering a bit awkward! Also the lobby is very dark and the lighting gave me vertigo every time we had to pass through. It is a great locations for families so maybe they should rethink the target market which seems to be 20 year olds on a crazy NYC weekend. The staff were friendly and helpful. We had a terrific time in NYC.

I am a Starwood preferred member...about 40 nights a year, more than half of those in NYC. This was my first and last stay at the W Downtown. The service is poor and this hotel isn't anywhere up to the standard set by W properties elsewhere. The room is fine and the view of the Trade Center is nice. However it doesn't make up for the substandard issues elsewhere. Also, at least for the time being, you won't be able to get a decent meal as the restaurant is closed. I'll go back to the Four Points Soho. The rooms are smaller and the venue not as nice..but the service is better and the staff is friendlier
user_name:
Chris M
San Francisco, California, United States

review_body: At the time of 9/11, the site where this hotel stands was merely a parking lot. Therefore it is modern, roomy and nicely appointed. Our room featured a view of the 9/11 Memorial and Museum and we were walking distance from Battery Park, awesome shopping and restaurants and made a little longer hike up to Little Italy. We were taken care of by an exceptional member of the W Hotel staff named Caroline. She made sure we had clean towels, a comfy room and anything else we needed. A big shout out to her. This hotel is right at ground zero, and very close to the ferries that go to Ellis Island and the Statue of Liberty. The hop-on hop-off bus is also in the vicinity. A walk over the Brooklyn Bridge is a nice activity to plan from here as well.

I was supposed to stay for 3 nights. I ordered room service. The dish wasn't served with the same sides as listed on the menu. I broke out into hives and anaphylactic shock with my throat closing. I called guest services asking for someone in the restaurant to tell me what was actually in the dish. The employee said they'd call paramedics and have the restaurant call me. I was waiting up in my room and there was knock on the door. Instead of help, there were 2 managers and security there screaming at me to leave. I tried to show them the dish and explain that it wasn't what was listed. One of the men kicked the tray over and said that now it didn't matter. One of them grabbed my arm to physically throw me out. I said I'd wait for the paramedics and closed the door. I called 911 for help. The police arrived and I said leave happily if the hotel would refund my money. I was on the phone with the company I booked through. The manager refused to speak with them until the cop forced him to. The hotel kept one of my pieces of luggage that had my work files in it and refuses to return it, saying that they threw it out instead of putting it in the cab. These people are dangerous! Don't stay there. I've spoken with the corporate office. They couldn't care less about how their employees dealt with the situation or how they broke the law. It's insane.

After reading reviews for this particular hotel after booking I was a little apprehensive about what to expect. Upon arrival we were greeted by a lovely porter who sorted our bags whilst we checked in.Hotel was lovely, clean and tidy and staff were very friendly.Room was larger than I was expecting which was an added bonus as we travelled with our 2 year old daughter.I would definitely stay here again should we return to New York.Just a slight negative of that although our taxes were paid through our booking with BAWe had to pre authorise our debit card with a $100 incidental fee should we use the mini bar or cause damage. Whilst this wasn't a problem it wasn't confirmed when I emailed them regarding any additional charges upon arrival.

I often take negative reviews with a grain of salt, but this is my first. I'd avoid this hotel like the plague. I'm an extremely loyal long time Starwood Platinum member, normally staying more than 75 nights a year, sometimes much more. My office in NY recently moved near this hotel, so this is my third stay, the last being the worst. I used to stay at the Chatwal midtown or the W on Lex, far superior hotels in every way, particularly the Chatwal.First, small thing but on all 3 of my arrival times, no one was there to help with luggage, and they are under perpetual construction it seems.Bigger problem- I can accept that there might not be an upgrade for Platinum members, but the front desk staff should at least appear to be trying to get you one, instead of downgrading your room because they gave it away. I had a prepaid King Bed room, they stuck me in a double bed room with a handicap bathroom which I don't like generally, and told me they would try to move me the next day, if they could. But the attitude was simply like they couldn't care less. I then made the mistake of ordering room service, because I was tired, and so for my $75, I got a very late steak sandwich that was stone cold, half raw inside on mushy bread that was soaked with whatever juices there were with a slice of squished terrible tomato and old lettuce, along with lukewarm soup and somehow a side dish of very hot vegetables. Next morning, I awoke to a leak of water coming down through the ceiling in the bathroom, and the seemingly somewhat helpful but ultimately incompetent front desk staff said they would make sure I was moved to a new room, and to just leave my bag in the room.On my return, late that night after a business dinner, of course, they had not moved me and there was only a tiny room available supposedly, now no view but at least no bathroom leak. I went and got my bag and moved myself figuring it would take too long for them to find someone to do it. The new room was small and terrible even for a W, but vven though I was staying for 4 nights, I didn't want to hassle moving again. This time, the front desk person was at least nice about giving me the crummy room and somewhat apologetic.Final two straws, I made the mistake of getting breakfast in their pathetic tiny temporary restaurant for the second time in 3 trips, to get a most incompetent waiter. He forgot the order twice, and checked and still it arrived wrong, he only brought coffee after 2 requests, then took a long time to bring milk, never brought water, never offered a refill or brought the requested one, and seemed way too overloaded to take care of the 3 tables that were there- and so I had mediocre overpriced food poorly presented.Final insult- when I got emailed my bill, they had jacked the rate up $200 a night from my already overpriced prepaid rate, even though the room was a clear downgrade that they moved me into, no view of the World Trade Center, and it was tiny and cramped.My first two visits were not as bad, but the level of service was still poor, no upgrades, and no attitude as if anyone cared that you're a Platinum guest. I'm going to mail this to the President of Starwood and tell him or her that they need to fire the manager and retrain the staff, this is the worst service I've ever consistently received.

Purchased through Hotwire and pleased with the value we got for the rate paid. Asked for a high floor and received it (thank you!). Also requested the reservation be put on my SPG account even though we couldn't get points, but wanted to use mobile room key. Didn't happen despite making arrangements for it in advance. Also requested a tower view (One World Trade) and didn't get that either.Good location for walking to attractions and the subway. Lobby is always dark and more of a club than sitting area. Example of this were a group of men interviewing for positions with the hotel and they couldn't read the documents at 9 am because it was so dark in the space.Overall the room was what we needed - clean and well appointed. Plenty of outlets to plug things in. Having said that, the advertising and 'trendy' nature was annoying at times. For example, the desk was filled with papers of information and their minibar offerings. Ended up moving all of this for the majority of our stay. Bathroom was fine but counter space is almost non-existent. Only one nightstand in the room which made it tough for someone else I was with to put their glasses or water down for the night. Did love the window bench though and used it to scan e-mail while looking at the city. One more quirk was the wind noise - the Saturday night we were there was really windy in NYC and every inch of the room made noise (creaking) the entire night. Not a big deal - just strange.Front desk staff was always friendly when we asked for basic directions or info on getting around.Gym was bigger than most hotel offerings and served its purpose the three days I used it.Overal a great experience for the four nights we were there.Check out the burger bar at the competing hotel just across the street - great food and atmosphere.

Nice typical smallish NYC room with modern amenities. best feature was the Bar that overlooks WTC 1 Building off the fifth floor. Very cool. Happy Hour specials. Nice view from the 20 something floor we were on on skyline.

stayed here for 1 night and did enjoy the stay. as we were here during the weekend, the area was quite calm. the hotel itself was nothing special, not according to other W properties that i know. what does make it worthwhile is the staff, Tracy at the Welcome Desk handled our check in very smoothly and gave us all the necessary info while having a nice conversation. secondly, Andrew Brown at the Concierge recommended us great restaurants that were all amazing, and gave us some good tips for us, as we were first time visitors to NY. All in all, nice hotel in a calm neighborhood with amazing staff.

Hotel entrance is a black hole...literally painted all black. There is no indication when you arrive that you have to go to 5th floor to check in. Fifth floor lobby just makes you dizzy with black floors and walls and lighting. Rooms are all white and cold. Bathroom only had shower which was poor. Bed was ok but that was only redeeming quality. Location not great for tourists.

okay - my big three safe, quiet & clean - great marks on all 3 - extremely helpful, friendly staff !!! - the only complaints are the rooms - they are roomy enough especially for nyc - but not user friendly for guests - the rooms are dark - i know they are supposed to be hip spaceship styled rooms - but come on even hip, spaceship women need good light to put on their makeup - the glass shower window/partition to the bedroom was a bit weird - and the sliding door on the bathroom never really stayed shut - i would stay here again if the price was right - the location near ground zero and trains was superb - but i know some of these things can't be changed but if they could they should be

We had travelled here in May of 2014 and just wanted to put in my two cents about the amazing experience. First and foremost New York is an experience everyone in my opinion needs to have. Specifically about the W in the downtown area, we loved that on the tiny tourist filled area of Manhattan it was the perfect place to get away. If you want the experience of luxury hotel with all the amenities this is definitely the place to be especially when with your significant other. One piece of advice for anyone staying in this hotel is make sure to take advantage of all the great spots across the street and in walking distance. New York's public transportation is already world class in my opinion but walking around in this area is just great. Definitely will stay here again.

Trendy hotel conveniently located in the wall street. If you like to stay in the downtown, this hotel can be a good option for 9/11 museum and discovering downtown by foot. Most of the staff was helpful. However, when I arrived early in the morning at the hotel and asked if it was possible to checkin, I got the very cold "of course no" response. While I was not expecting a warm yes, I was not expecting a cold and a little rude no either. To be fair it is New York so a little rudeness is just normal. So adjust your expectation.

DO NOT STAY HERE! They have very shady business practices. Booked a hotel room there as part of a wedding block over a year ago. Apparently, at that time, they incorrectly over-quoted me a price. I did not realize until speaking with other wedding party members that they over quoted me by $120. Called to get this rectified and they will not honor their mistake, however, DID honor it for one of the other guests. Very bad policy. Very shady. Will not EVER stay here again and will certainly spread the word about the sneaky policies!!!

Checked in this morning 10/31 for 3 nights Paid over 550$+ tax/night for a tiny corner room (the regular room started at 500+ tax).Not worth half of it ;They also don't clearly advise that Hotel doesn't have a restaurant on site (yes for room service ....and food is tasty ...a bright note on this somber hotel ....and I believe they have a place for bkfast only )The manager on duty was very accommodating for my request of early check in (not the case for the staff that did my check in )Wouldn't stay again here if I was paid ...Very different mood than W midtown Manhattan (no lively bar no party no nothing ...) or W montreal or W San Francisco Pretty disappointed

This hotel was conveniently located in lower Manhattan. It's moments from the subway, WTC, mall, restaurants, the pier, water and much more. The room is not big like other hotels but it's not small either. It's actually what you'd expect in NY. Love the bathroom sliding door and the fact I could crack the window. The shower is very spacious. Lovely view from the 22nd floor. It was nice to be able to dock my iPhone and listen to music. I bring my own toiletries but had to try theirs and loved it. The lobby area is amazing. It's great they will hold your bags if you check out and still want to browse the city.

This is a great location for 9/11 museum. Our King room had an awesome view. The room was clean and relatively spacious. The bed was comfortable, and the window seat provided a nice lounging area. However, like other reviewers, we had an issue with the poor lighting. There is no overall room lighting, only a desk lamp, the two bedside lights and some "cool" ambient lighting. In fact, the one bedside light didn't work properly. We reported it, and asked for a fix or replacement, and the concierge sort of argued with us that it was probably working the way it was supposed to. Ah, no. And it was not fixed or replaced. So, that definitely was a failure. The bathroom was nice and bright. Storage was under the sink, but a larger vanity would have been possible and appreciated. The lighting in the common areas is also very "cool", but dim and a bit disorienting. front desk personnel was not very friendly or welcoming, frankly. We did have an expensive breakfast, that was tasty and quickly served.

i booked this hotel because there was a good online deal. it follows the same trendy w interior design. the service was excellent, everyone i talked to was very helpful with answering my questions and they were very friendly. I'm giving it 4 stars because it's located downtown and wasn't the most convenient location for some of the activities I wanted to do. However, transportation was very convenient (a few minutes walk from the subway). It is very close to the 9/11 memorial and the one world observatory though. It all just depends on what you're looking to do.

Wonderful Hotel perfectly located in the downtown financial district with panoramic views over the World Trade Center Memorial park and One World Trade Center. I loved this area! It's so much less hectic and chaotic than midtown plus with multiple subway stations nearby, it's very easy to get anywhere in the city quickly. We were upgraded to the "cool corner" room and it lived up to its name. We loved the room, it was spacious for NY standards, very comfortable bed, perfectly clean and new, with a great bathroom and shower. The best part was the long window seats that wrapped the corner. The views from the 15th floor were incredible. The lobby is a bit unusual, it's more of a club atmosphere, but we enjoyed the vibe. It was certainly a popular place on the weekends. In all, I would highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a great NY experience away from the tourist hustle and bustle of Midtown.

A mixed bag in my opinion.....The Good:Rooms are lovely and some have a great view over the 9/11 memorial siteExcellent location for downtown attractions The Not-So-Good:No information provided at check-in re hotel facilities etc. None in the room either.....a map of the local area at least would be nice!No coffee making facilities in the room - not fun to have to go to the lobby to get coffee in the morning, especially if you are jet-lagged and awake at 4:30am.The decor in the lobby is irritating. Very dark and the reflection of the ceiling on the glossy floor makes you feel seasick every time you get out of the lift!

I stayed first in the W Downtown some years ago when I heard it had the same interior designers as the Q in Berlin - and I have been a returning customer ever since.The hotel hardly offers upgrades to suites (actually, I never had one), but the cool corner rooms are a true treat and so is the support of the guest relationship staff (thanks Casey for several wonderful stays). Do not get deterred by the location as downtown seems distant from midtown. Actually, it is easy to get to Jersey City and Hoboken (with very nice spots as well to spend time) and Newark Airport (as the Holland tunnel is near), and the subway brings you easily to other places in the city. Soho is even worth a walk. Of course, there have been requests, which have not been fulfilled, but the hotel has always made good on any slip on its side – which is not the average experience in NYC. Therefore, design and staff are my reason to make the W Downtown my favourite in NYC.
user_location: La Caleta, Adeje, Tenerife, Canary Islands
user_name:
adelyne2016
La Caleta, Adeje, Tenerife, Canary Islands

review_body: The W NY - Downtown gets two thumbs up and one big smile from this reviewer. It feels much like other W hotels, but the staff made our experience even better. They were so friendly and helpful. We were able to get a room overlooking the 9/11 Memorial which was beautiful. The location of this hotel is fantastic for events in downtown...walking distance to everything. We needed cab or subway for things like shows on Broadway. Rooms were clean and bed was very comfy! Would love to come back here when in NY again.

I recently stayed there for a bday trip. I walked in and it was just beautiful, made me PROUD to be a starwood associate. Went to the room PERFECT. I had a little issue where the bed frame stuck out futhermore than the mattress itself. I scrapped my leg so bad I was just bleeding. So I did go to front desk where I was speaking to the Night auditor. I just kindly told her what happen and gave her the resolution of just sending maintenance up tomorrow. She was rather mean and cut me off and said " Theres no one here to fix that " So I disregarded it. THAN I asked for a band aid. She ignored my bleeding leg and said to wait 10 minutes for it. I work front desk as well and I would never treat my guest in a manner. She than had a confrontation with my personal guest where she denied them access to the room. They had ID and the card that was on file. She said that because their name wasn't on the RSVP she was not going to help them with a key. AGAIN - I work FD and I understand Breach of security is something that none of us want. But if there is valid proof of my guest being there she could of handled the situation better. Most night auditors don't have much customer service but I do expect more. She did not compensate nor did she apologize for the mistake.

Stayed here for a week on business. The hotel was comfortable, the bed was fantastic, and the staff were genuinely nice. My disappointments with the hotel are:-very small gym, which seemed like an afterthought-breakfast area and food was average-not enough lighting in the rooms, esp at night (I understand that the idea is to have mood lighting, but this was not very conducive to working)I would stay here again, as I am a Platinum SPG, but it was probably near the bottom of the list of Ws that I have stayed at around the world.

The W downtown NY is conveniently located. Rooms are clean and well appointed. Service is polite and prompt. This is my preferred hotel downtown NY. Starwood hotels in NY are hit or miss. Best ones: St Regis, Le Meridian, gremercy, w downtown; ok options: Westin GC and Times Square; avoid - w NY on lex, w times sq, Sheraton NY.

I was really excited about going to this hotel. Unfortunately I was quite disappointed by their customer service. When we checked in we did not get any information - e.i. wifi connection, breakfast, gym, spa - there was no spa facilities although it was in the description!. Then we found out we had to pay for wifi in the room, which is for 4* hotel really poor service. Breakfast was not included , which we knew about, but again, for 4* hotel disappointing. When we checked out, no questions whether we were happy whatsoever. We were only informed we would not be charged for anything, since we did not use anything. What a surprise when we just for information checked our bank account and found out they charged us £17. No acknowledgement, no receipt, just charge! So I contacted them and after few emails they confirmed it was a mistake and gave us refund. Did not care, we were charged more for international payment, they just gave us exactly what they charged although we had additional cost due to their mistake. I was just wondering , whether they try this with every customer and just wait whether people find out or not... Really disappointing.

Lovely hotel! Friendly staff! Easy access to subway and local restaurants! Comfortable bed and room! Highly recommend. They have an outdoor bar that is lovely to sit and have a cocktail! They have drink specials in the afternoon. Only think is odd getting in as the lobby is on 5th floor - it's no big deal just the main entrance is just an elevator!

This hotel was very clean with a friendly staff. Convenient location close to many subway lines. Best part of the hotel was the unobstructed view of the World Trade Center and memorial from our room. The frosted glass wall in the shower was a little strange. It looks out into the sleeping area so if you are in the shower people in the bedroom will be able to see your silhouette while taking a shower. I would definitely stay here again if I was going to be in the lower Manhattan area.

The room is nicely furnished, modern, clean, and functional. Efficient use of space as is with most NYC hotels. We found a great deal so we can not be too picky. Multiple extras, infused spa water, gourmet coffee are nice touches. The lobby has a night club vibe, is probably a night club with bar at night except we were too busy or tired to check out. Well within walking distance to many download tourist locations including the rebuilt from ground WTC, Wall Street, and Trinity Church, the burial ground of none other than "his name is Alexander Hamilton". And since we are in NYC, everything else is just a skip and a hop away with the convenience of the subway and buses. Just get the weekly pass and you are all set.

We travel to New York City about three times a year and this time decided to stay at the W on Albany Street. It is basically across the street from the World Trade Center site and its outdoor bar provides great views of the memorial site. Our room with our king size bed was clean and comfortable but small -standard for New York standards. Cabs were scarce in front of the hotel due to the Albany Street being a small side street. Uber drivers had challenges finding the hotel due to the one way street and no left turn onto the road in front of the W.

Located directly across from the WTC memorial, the w hotel provides an accessible location to investigate downtown manhattan. I stayed here while attending a work event. Only a 10 minute walk from Wall Street. Lots nearby to investigate and subway entrance just a block or so away.The facilities were modern reflecting the w brand. The room aesthetic didn't do much for me in this location. The beds were comfy and the bathrooms clean. Very cozy room, maybe 325 swift. I did wish the air conditioning was able to lower the room temperature for my preference. Public space was much minimal. The bar area opens to a fifth floor terrace where you can enjoy a night cap or start you're evening. Tons of hotel options in the city. Fair value, I would stay again, but would be inclined to continue investigating other options which the city offers in huge numbers.

When in NYC we typically stay in the Meatpacking District but recent;y found the prices for our spots like Standard Highline were really creeping up, so we decided to check out come alternative hotels in alternative neighborhoods. And we found a great deal at W Downtown, about 1/2 what The Standard Highline charges! And with W, you always know what you are going to get - a modern, clean and pretty styling experience, usually with a pretty good bar too. And W Downtown definitely fills the bill. The rooms are pretty spacious, well laid out with nice bathrooms. Some have views, some not so much but all have good natural light. They are very dog friendly, and even had a huge doggie bed and treats waiting for our pup, Dwight. And the bar has a nice outdoor area which looks directly out to the WTC/Freedom Tower and the 9/11 memorials, very beautiful. We've now returned here on our trips to & through NYC several times.

I have stayed at this hotel many times and it never disappoints. This visit I had a corner room with an amazing view of the World Trade Center. Room and service was nice as always and the bar/lobby area is funky with a cool outdoor porch.

Stayed here on business recently. Great location within easy walking distance of main downtown areas. Staff were friendly and pretty attentive - had a minor letdown with one staff member but the rest made up for it. The rooms are of average (for NYC) size but pretty well laid out. Overall I enjoyed the stay and would happily return

Great hotel,and views are amazing. Staff were very helpful and polite. Location is fantastic, as there are many sites in this area to visit, Battery Park, National September 11 Memorial & Museum, Oculus, the transportation hub, Wall Street etc.We would stay here again.

Exceeded our expectations. Well appointed room, with great design and the most incredible views over the 911 memorial and Liberty Tower. Ideal location for visiting Manhattan, walking distance to many attractions and a short tube ride to the rest.

Nice hotel in a good location but unfortunately the staff of the reception and concierge is not polite at all, very rude, never smile and some time also arrogant. We stained 5 nights and never and the pleasure to speak with a genuine smiley people of the staff.

This is a modern and trendy hotel right in front of the new world trade center. The location is the reason of the high cost: close to several subway stations n the path to new jersey. The price is very expensive though and this does not include anything but the toom. Sign up to spg to get free wifi. Bathroom is great and especially the shower. Minibar prices shocking ! 90 dollars for a bottle of wine ...

Small rooms for the price. Supposed to be hip - not sure why. Not really a comfortable place. Would have given three stars if it wasn't for extremely helpful and friendly staff everywhere. Location is good but loud if you are on lower floors. Going up you have to pay more. Wouldn't really go back.

Hotel is in a very convenient location, close to subway station with some shopping/eating options not far away. We enjoyed exploring this area a lot more than we anticipated! Staff were friendly and helpful.Our room was about 20 floors up with a view we loved - looking over the World Trade Centre site. Always something going on below for the kids to watch.The bedroom and bathroom were both small but adequate, comfortable beds and everything kept clean. Also quiet at night for sleeping.The hotel lobby is extremely dark, they are possibly going for a bit of a nightclub atmosphere in the evenings with loud music etc. So not an enjoyable place for us to sit as we were travelling with small children.

In front of the Freedom tower , very well located and decent overnight valet price for the area. The terrace bar is also great and cost effective for happy hours along with great view of the city . Book that hotel through a good broker site for less than 300$ otherwise, you can consider it too expensive.

First time back in the area in many years and The W - Downtown provided an excellent stay in a fantastic location. The room was clean and had a great view. Staff was very nice and helpful when I needed to change my reservation. Highly recommend

This hotel over exceeded my expectations. The customer service was spot on. Andrew the concierge provided excellent recommendations and answered my many questions. The room was very clean and bigger than any NY room I've stayed in. Our view of the World Trade Center was spectacular! The only cons were that this isn't a very family friendly hotel. The lobby is very dark and with the bar connected to the lobby it was more of a nightclub at night. And I didn't like the fact that the shower has a frosted wall into the bedroom, not appropriate when showering and my teenage son is in the room. Other than that the hotel is great with easy access to the subway. I plan to stay here again and would refer family and friends to stay here.

My second stay at this hotel and it was just as great as the first time. The staff is always so pleasant and always greet you with a smile. I chose this hotel for my niece's first trip to New York and she loved every minute of it. Avah is particularly picky with the foods she will eat but the kids menu had a variety of options to choose from. The room was so spacious so Avah had plenty of room to run around. The view we had front the room was breathtaking. I left some items from my first stay and all I had to do was ask and in just 5 minutes I had my items back. Makiyia has checked me in both times and has always been so helpful. She is always so nice. Definitely a shining star. The staff seems to be well trained and professional. The rooms are very clean, and stocked with just about anything you may need. I would definitely come back. Thank you for making our stay one to remember!
user_name:
ashleyrojas27
New York City, New York

review_body: For those who know the W hotels, this one is average. But the location and the view is amazing. Our room was in front of ground zero and the One World Trade Center.The room are perfects with great design and an excellent bed. The only bad points are the room service (few items and average quality) and the restaurant was close without any other option. But at the end we had a great stay!

The lobby of the hotel was very modern and had a interesting feel. Seem like a Vegas hotel with the neon black lights and dark atmosphere. The woman at concierge was rude and not helpful when we asked questions. She simply gave us one word answers and dismissed us. We got up to our "Spectacular Non-smoking: 2 Double Beds Superior Room" and were less impressed. The room was dirty and dated. The beds were comfortable but there wasn't a safe and the fridge was pre filled so we couldn't even store our own water in it. The closet wasn't tall enough to hang a dress. There was a ton of construction noise almost all night and early morning. We did have a great view of the WTC but that was really the only nice feature of the room.

In the heart of downtown, we were welcomed with a smiling face, an upgrade, and was able to check in before 3. Upon entering the room, we had a great view of the World Trade Center that I don't see how it can be any better. Place is impressive.Bed was comfortable, clean with great amenities. If I had one issue, it would be after showering, the water was kind of all over in the bathroom. Nothing a towel can't fix.

I had 2 rooms for 6 nights August 24 - August 30. Patrick the GM could not have been more helpful and welcoming with my reservation an d request. Jean-Marie was wonderful at check in. Makiyia at the front desk was the best with all my questions and request. Andrew the concierge was full of great information and very helpful with recommendations. When you are traveling with two older family members it felt great that I had the support of a great Hotel.I don't think I will ever stay anywhere else while visiting NYC. I have been visiting NYC for 30 yrs and have never been treated with a more accommodating staff that truly expresses what staying at a W Hotel is all about. If you are looking for a great upscale energetic hotel that offers everything, don't hesitate in staying at the W Downtown.

The rooms were nice, clean, and uniquely laid out. They were a bit small though, though I knew that going in. My only semi-issue was that, like other W hotels, it tries a little too hard to be cool, and at times it can come off as a bit tacky, which, as one can imagine, sometimes attracts a douchey crowd (can I say that?). Of course, being next to Wall St, they're spot on! Ha. But for example, the particular brand of ambient lighting, the lobby/check-in being right next to the bar, the fact that you can peer into the shower from the glass if you stand on your bed. I get it, trying to be edgy, but meh. Still, that's a very minor gripe, hence the 4 stars! Overall a really solid place.

Deffinately would return , great location , Living room bar & lounge with the rooftop view of the trade center was awesome ! Staff was really friendly and hotel was clean & not to mention the rooms were great size especially for in New York ! Would recommend

I was in NYC for work near the World Trade, so the location we perfect. Within walking distance: amazing coffee shop (George's), Dunkin Donuts, Starbucks and lots of near by markets for necessities. The hotel was nicely decorated with a great bar and lounge area. I saw DJ equipment setup but I wasn't able to partake at all. However, it was a stunning area with views of the World Trade at night. There is also free coffee available in the morning. The service was great. I had the most wonderful Concierge (Andrew) that provided the BEST recommendations. The guys out front were always available to grab me a taxi or help with my bags. The rooms were cleaned each day. I used the free WiFi in the room and it worked great. I even streamed movies on Netflix and it worked fine. I didn't have any food there but there is room service and a special menu for pets. One small critique, is the shower has this wood looking finish so the walls are dark and it's hard to see if they are really clean but the rest of the bathroom and room were immaculate so I am assuming it was clean, just hard to tell.

Four of us stayed at the W downtown NYC for a weekend and it was great. The rooms are not big but they are very clean, modern and comfortable. What else could you ask for since you really don't spend any time in the room except to shower and sleep. The bed was very comfortable and I loved the pillows. Location was perfect; we had easy access to everything without the traffic chaos of Times Square. We would not hesitate staying at this hotel on our next visit.

The lounge on 5 was nice and the balcony bar was nice. Retro chic style..over priced drinks and food and it was not good. The service not to great. All the money you pay to stay there and the sink was clogged. I called, the plumber came up and didn't knock just came in the room, I yelled at him, I was so turned off. I thought these things are to be checked when you do an inspection, overall I didn't like the stay I was impressed you pay for location. Small rooms too
user_name:
Shanese W
Rego Park, New York

review_body: When I arrived late at night with my family traveling from overseas I ask for double bed but they didn't have availability. Michelle at the front office was very sweet and accommodate us with a rollaway bed. this was my wedding weekend and the stress level was very high. the next day we meet with Caroline the room attendant and she took some time for me to wish me a Happy and blessed Marriage, she helped me with my stress and took some time to calm me down. this had a such powerful impact because right before I walked down the aisle she calm my nerves, and I'm grateful for the time.Great service great staff and I will definite recommend the hotel.

Love the hotel. It's funky, modern, and upbeat. Location and view from my room was spot on. Andrew (concierge) was exceptional. Food surpassed my expectations. Breakfast- UGH due to SLOW service. This is due to restaurant construction I'm sure. I'll be back. Cheers!

The W downtown is in an amazing location! What a view of the world one tower. Could almost reach out and touch it! Battery park is a great very place to visit - boat, bars and shops and is just over the road. The interior of the hotel is really funky and modern and the rooms are spotlessly clean. Great shower! The terrace bar serves food and great cocktails whilst overlooking the world one tower - what more could you ask for. Staff very friendly and helpful. Great stay and would go again.

I love this Hotel. It's located minutes from soho and across the street from the world trade center memorial. There is also NY transit right around the corner from the hotel. I got from time square to the hotel in about 10 minutes on the train. There are also some great street vendors right outside of the hotel. The patio is amazing and the food is really good. I will stay at this location again without question.

I like the location of this hotel because it's really close to the NY attractions like 9-11 memorial, Battery Park, Wall St. and other places of interest. It's not too busy and close to subway. The staff I met with was very friendly and accommodating.

The W New York Downtown is our favorite place to stay when we come to the city! My husband and I lived in the city for 15 years before moving out to the 'burbs. We are very familiar with the city and all it has to offer. That said, we keep coming back to the W Downtown for it's clean and beautiful rooms and exceptional service! I also come back with my girlfriends every year for our annual girls night out. We all enjoy this hotel and will continue to come back for years to come!

I stayed at this property and it was just amazing my front desk person Javonne was exceptional not was he only nice but his knowledge of the area and amen this of the property were on point. The lobby is this chic moderne atmosphere my only hang up was I wish their was a Dj who could really play the tunes and if smoking a cigar could be allowed on the balcony. The view was impeccable and after a few drinks we danced the night away even if it wasn't David Bowie mixed in with a little Beyonce. I'm staying back at the property just because I loved it that much I hope in the future they get a solid DJ because the lobby of this hotel,beats any club in Manhattan it could really be the IT spot
user_name:
tomcat1011
New York City, New York

review_body: The room is nice and has a great view.. But there is only one outlet in the room. Also the refrigerator is $35 a day.. $35 for a refrigerator I wouldn't stay here again just off the strength of that..

This is my third time staying at the W New York Downtown and every time, it's a great stay.It's location is perfect for meetings on Wall Street or a visit to the 911 Memorial. It's on a relatively quiet street and close to the 1 train on Rector Street for easy access to the west side. The hotel has an edgy, funky vibe, which I love and as always, it's the staff that keeps me coming back. A big shout out to Tracy at the front desk, who is a perfect ambassador for the SPG brand. She was efficient, professional, and just a sweet heart. I was upgraded to a nice corner room and enjoyed a relaxing sleep every night. I'm looking forward to my next stay.
user_name:
NOIDK
New York City, New York

review_body: I stayed at a wonderful room on a business trip. It had a very good value compared to any hotel located near Times Square. W vibe, cool views from the bar, nice gym, very nice staff. If you are traveling as a tourist, the 9/11 museum is right in front and I highly recommend it.

Loved the location, quieter than midtown but still a good place to stay. We were here for 5 days and saw everything we wanted to. WiFi is free in the reception, so not a problem if you didn't want to pay for it in your room. I would stay here again if I came back to New York

-ve: Room is small, but maybe it is New York s norm.-ve: Construction site around, so surrounding environment is just so so (it may also be norm for new york)-ve: wall is thin (my "neighbour" always come home at 2 to 4 a.m. and wake me up. I heard all their women's talks) (i ve good promotion rate for my room, possible that those higher priced room have better condition)+ve: Close to 911 Museum, 21 century department store+ve: Cross a few roads can reach the Hudson greenway, possible, if not convenient, to do morning jogging along hudson river (and it is one of the most enjoyable moments for me in nyc)+ve: reception lady is nice and patient We have a very good W Hotel in HK, so, i m quite disappointed with this one. I guess this one is just a 4 star hotel.

I stay at this W often while on business in the financial district. It is conveniently located and rooms are nice. My issues are that they don't offer free internet for SPG members and the design of having to go to the fifth floor for checking and then transfer to a different bank of elevators is inconvenient.

You need to take an elevator to the 5th floor reception before taking another elevator o your room which is okay if the lounge wasn't exposed to the room elevators and you didn't need to pass through a crowd if you have a late check in. Other than that it is nice hotel with typical W style rooms. Nothing special here. Cool ceiling in the reception area but they also had construction going on in the reception which we were unaware of when we booked it.

I was expecting a high standard hotel like the W hotel in Doha, Qatar. In fact the W Downtown is really really poor. Rooms are very small. Staff is just OK.Very boring to use 2 separate lifts to get to your room. Bar closes at 10.30pm.... Outrageous for NYC.The worst comes to the breakfast... They call a continental breakfast a bagel and a fine slice of cream cheese... That's it!!! this is terrible.Definitely not a place I would go again neither recommend to anyone.

We decided to stay downtown for our trip in New York because of how quiet and accessible the area is. Unfortunately the lounge was right beneath us and was noisy all night. On going construction right across the street did not make the early morning into afternoon very pleasant either, especially after a night out on the town.

I enjoyed my quick trip in W Downtownand I would like to thank the staff who gave me a great view of the Freedom Tower. The rooms are very new, clean and well apointed. The bar had a view of the Freedom Tower too and the lobby is very modern. I will definitely come back! Thank you for the wonderful stay.
user_name:
hotelierinnyc
New York City, New York

review_body: I been more than one time in Starwood properties but this was one of the most satifisting for me and my team. Room was great with a nice view to the one World Trade Center. We had an amazing time at the bar, after a day full of meetings we went to the living room bar in the lobby of the hotel. Aurelio a very young and professional bartender treat us very well, we was a big group and he help us very charming individually, we had some bites, the menu is small but tasty. W Downtowm gonna be definitely a place to come back for me and my team.

This is a pretty standard W but it does not have the wear and tear of its midtown counterpart. Highly recommended, easy access to the subway as well. Very close to the 9/11 memorial, Wall Street, and Brookfield place for shopping and dining. The bar downstairs is pretty funky and draws a crowd but the noise does not carry up to the rooms.

The W Downtown is a beautiful hotel; the lobby lounge is great to hang out and the restaurant has excellent service, although under construction. We enjoyed our stay very much. However, it is very difficult to find anything in the neighborhood. The Concierge is a must-stop if you are staying here. I would even appreciate an information kiosk in the lobby to get quick directions or something. It's just so much construction in the neighborhood that you walk in circles trying to find anything.
user_name:
annahinnyc
New York City, New York

review_body: Best part. My room wasn't ready so they gave me a $100 credit I wasn't expecting which was nice. And the supplement room was fine. Great staff. Beautiful hotel. Nice views. I wish the room service menu at night was better but its NYC so I get it. I was being lazy.

It was my first time staying at a W hotel and I was very impressed with the property. The rooms were clean and fairly spacious for the NYC hotel. The hotel is right next One world trade and they have a bar on the fifth floor which guests can access with a great view of One World trade. The check in and check out process was easy and the staff was helpful. I appreciated the water that was put out my the staff while we were waiting to check in. The only reason I did not give the hotel a five star is because my bathroom door would not lock.

I travel for business and stay in many different types of hotels. This was by far the worst for customer service. Both the check-in and check-out were punctuated by rude people who appeared to want to be anywhere but there. We felt as if our business was an interruption and an inconvenience. (The heavy sigh at check-out when I nicely asked for a paper copy of my bill was the icing on the cake.)Room was clean and comfortable with a great view of Ground Zero. Too bad the staff left such a disgusting taste in our mouth for this otherwise well located and maintained property.

We arrived early, around 10:30-11am and surprisingly were able to check into our room which was great! We were given a room on the 7th floor facing the Freedom Tower which was amazing! Our room was cozy, it had a nice bench along the window, and we were able to open the window and listen to the city below us :) oh and free Wi-Fi was an excellent bonus! The Bliss products are the best! The shower was wonderful and the bed was so comfortable. The staff was very friendly and on a rainy evening they had umbrellas for us to borrow as we stepped out to explore the city. It was an overall pleasant stay and we would definitely come back!

The hotel is pretty clean and modern. I got the corner room which has alot of window which makes it nice. The staff is pretty nice and accommodating. The fifth floor terrace is nice place to relax with a glass of wine . I would say this is a good w . Not a lot of attraction other than the phenomenal views of the freedom tower all around the hotel. It is nice for a quite place to stay.It was VERY well priced.

I was blown away how well this hotel worked. I have never stayed in the financial district and this is the center of everything. I was able to see opening bell at The New York Stock Exchange and was able to walk everywhere. The view from the deck on the 5th floor bar was incredible and the view from my room was amazing. Looking right over at the new World Trade Center. Andrew the concierge was amazing and Nzhingha welcomed me by name each time I entered and exited the hotel

I have to preface with the fact that I am picky (or selective you can say). I absolutely loved this hotel. I stayed for business for 2 days and then transferred to another hotel for four days of fun in NYC. I was so disappointed with the second hotel after staying at this W that I had to return to the W for the remainder of my vacation. I have absolutely nothing but great things to say about the W downtown. Great beds, great pillows, nice size rooms, great soundproofing, and nice views. For anyone who criticized the room size, they have no idea how small NYC hotel rooms are. These are by far the biggest size hotel rooms I have stayed at in NYC. Can't wait to come back. Downtown is a bit far from the action but this also makes it nice because it is quieter at night. Take my advice, this is a great place to stay if you like a nice sleep in a decent size room. Nothing beat it!

Hello I last stayed at this hotel on 22nd December 15 the receptonist who checked me in was a little sharp with me,but we all have off days,im a spg member but booked through a 3rd party but didnt no i wouldnt get my points but a nice lady called miss wood sorted that for mei was disapointed there was no bath (tub) as being british do like a bath but i was told no rooms have a tub but she offered me a free room upgrade to a corner room, as a conselation for this in conveniance to me on my next stay which iv just booked for the 31 December 16 they have contacted me to tel me they have upgraded my room but to what type i dont no corner or no corner room?All in all a good hotel and i would recomend it very polite porters

I am a "Starwood guy." I love the W brand and my office actually moved all the way downtown so this is an ideal location. Some of the amenities at the Hotel were under construction but there are bars, pubs etc in the hood to check out.The rate was a bit high, but I wont fault the W, I will fault NYC. I will stay here again

Lovely place to book and visit after work for drinks and food, we did it for a friends birthday & was a lovely evening and amazing view of New York. Well worth a visit, also say book a table as well for your party on the out side terrace bar. Service and people were wonderful nothing to complain about at all.

Check in staff was very un friendly. The room doesn't even have black out curtains! Seems more like a good four-point Sheraton rather than a W Hotel. Disappointing! I have never been at a worse W hotel.

W Downtown is one of the "authorized" hotels approved by my firm; since it's a 5 minute walk to the office on Wall Street, this location is convenient. However, the hotel itself is dark, rooms are small and the bathrooms are the worst. Understand that most NYC hotel rooms are small, but the W rooms are SO small and SO dark... why the mystery?

I travel 9 months of the year and room cleanliness is my #1 criteria for assessing how well a hotel does in reviews! This property has good sized rooms with clean and updated bathrooms and sheets and has the signature dream bed of all Starwood hotels. Lacks bathroom amenities but they will bring you what you need if you call. The lighting is very poor for females who need to do their make up so I had to open the blinds and sit by the window to do it which was annoying. Location is great if you need to be located downtown - a quick walk to everything you need. Also the free coffee and tea you can grab on your way out is a great way to start the day. Not many staff at reception, but they are helpful once you get them. And the wi-fi actually works and is fast!
user_name:
princessandthepea888
New York City, New York

review_body: In typical W fashion, this hotel does not disappoint. The staff was outstanding, our corner suite on the 22nd floor was killer and the outdoor bar on the 5th floor is fabulous. This W Hotel is in a great location and close to Tribecca/Soho which is where we spent most our time. I had an outstanding experience and loved my stay.

Our view from the 22nd floor overlooked the ground zero memorial. Spectacular.My wife and I checked in for a long weekend anniversary celebration. The hotel upgraded us to a more luxurious suite and brought up complimentary sparkling wine and a big slice of chocolate cake.From the outside the hotel is nothing to look at. Inside, the lobby is on the 5th floor. The desk staff at all times was polite, friendly, efficient and helpful. The lobby was ultra modern with a curved lighting and ceiling that left you feeling like you were exploring a cave in which a rave might break out at any moment. There is also an outdoor patio that gives you a closer look at the ground zero activities. The elevators a swift and cool. The rubber mats in them are changed three times a day to say "good morning", "good afternoon" and "good evening".The bar at the end of the lobby is also cool. A nice selection of spirits and wines is to be had and the bartenders are sports nuts who can and will discuss all manner of sports minutiae ad nauseam while mixing and shaking. My brother-in-law, the sports freak, was in heaven. The ladies at the bar were a bit piqued at being ignored by the buffed bar boy toys. Drinks run on the typical hotel high side. On this Saturday late afternoon, a wedding was getting ready to begin so professional photogs herded wedding party members into various groups. In all, the bar and balcony were festive and enjoyable on a beautiful day.Our room was large by NY hotel standards. Like the rest of the hotel, the decor was funky and there were few right angles anywhere. The room was clean and well appointed. It was a corner room, thanks to the upgrade, and, from the west side, we could see the Hudson River. The lighting fixtures were cool and sometimes difficult to figure out how to operate. There was a shortage of electrical outlets, particularly on one side of the bed but a power strip was provided inside of a drawer on the other side of the bed. We were able to plug in a CPAP machine and charge two phones. The flat screen TV was mounted on the wall and there was a blue tooth enabled speaker to listen to your iPhone music. The sheets and towels were clean and the maids did a good job cleaning the place.The visit was a great experience. Unfortunately, when I got home, I found $170.00 charged on my credit card. A check with the W found that I was charged $120.00 for parking (I had no car) and $50.00 for a bar tab.
