The W immediately credited the $120.00 parking charge and "investigated" the bar charges for a few hours before informing my wife via email that the bar charge was an "error" and credited that too.Honest mistake or rip off? Not sure. Check your statements after staying here.

I've stayed at all the W's in NYC and I think this is the best on many levels. The rooms are decent size, the service and all staff I interacted with are awesome and very professional, the view was incredible (14th floor right towards the Freedom Tower), the bar and the bar keeper were very cool and the outside patio is a great place for a drink with a view. The 2 nights I spent were very quite - maybe I was lucky and didn't have any partying tourists on my floor - and the bed was very comfortable. I'll be back!

The room was clean, which is most important, and ALL of the staff was AWESOME. Other than that we hated this hotel (the building itself). Didn't think it was fair to give a bad review because it was honestly just personal preference or lack there of. You walk in to an all black room with nothing but an elevator.The least welcoming space I have been in (the lobby is on the 5th floor, which is fine, but the entrance was totally depressing). The "modern" décor was uncomfortable and not our taste, and in some spaces was done poorly, and looked cheap. We will not be going back, but as I said, not fair to the staff to base the rating on the fact that it is not our taste, but there was nothing REALLY wrong with it as far as accommodations. Tiny room, but its NYC so that is expected. Hope this sounds like a reasonable assessment. Just not for us, thinking the younger guests probably appreciate the modern design.

Pros: Excellent service, Minimalist Rooms, Bliss bath products, Chic bar/terrace areaCons: Dry cleaningI stayed again at the W Downtown for 3 nights. I sent my dress to the dry cleaning associated with the hotel, and they shrunk/damaged my dress, so I suggest perhaps avoiding this service. On the bright side, Helen from Housekeeping went above and beyond in terms of service and trying to resolve this issue, and I appreciated her time and help. Despite this issue, it was overall a pleasant stay.

We enjoyed wonderful days in this centrally located stylish hotel. The staff was awesome and very helpful. The rooms are not very large, but comfortable, fully equipped and quiet. The price is adequate for this modern downtown hotel.

Our experience with the W Hotel was very good. I would recommend it especially to someone wanting or needing to be near the financial district. For reference, it is located just across the street from ground zero and One World Trade, and within easy walking distance to several sites including China Town, Little Italy, South Street Seaport, and others. The housekeeping staff and bellman were extremely cordial and helpful. The updated room was very comfortable and cleanliness was about a 9 on a 10 point scale? It seems the walls are dirty? Though it is mildly inconvenient, I like the fact that you must enter, go to the 5th floor for check-in, and then take another (card coded) bank of elevators to your room. There was an almost overwhelming cloud of air freshener when we entered our room, but it either dissipated during our stay of we just became accustomed to it. Several newspapers are provided. By the way, we found Georges Restaurant, around the corner at 89 Greenwich, to be a perfect breakfast venue (serves lunch and dinner as well) both mornings of our stay. Not ostentatious, yet offers efficient and unobtrusive meal service at a fair price.

We enjoyed a lovely stay over the holiday period. Eventhough the hotel is downtown, it was easy to commute all over the city and we appreciated the fact it wasn't as busy and hectic as midtown. The hotel was stylish and looked stunning. The staff were friendly and the room was clean. We were disappointed that the WiFi wasn't free in our room, but it's free in the communal bar area so we were able to get free internet access. We would 100% stay here again, and recommend bills bar and burger around the corner (they sell the best burger we tried in NY!)

My family and I went to a wedding and the couple had reserved a block at this hotel, so we went into it relying on a few reviews and the standard info provided on the hotel's website. It turned out to be a trendy establishment that incidentally was impossible to reach via car (the surrounding roads were either one-ways or closed for construction) and that housed a nightclub on its outdoor terrace/lobby bar space. All of their double bedrooms have connecting doors, and we made an unfortunate switch to a lower level after our neighbors turned out to be a group of rowdy men - only to be kept up until 2 AM because of the pulsating music and roaring crowd on the terrace two flights below us. They had no complimentary Wi-Fi or even coffee, the "modern" light fixtures in the room took the three of us a good ten minutes to figure out, and the shower had a fairly transparent wall into the bedroom (!!!!). It seemed like with this hotel, not only did you pay a lot for the room itself (even with the wedding discount) but you had to keep paying more if you wanted to be comfortable. I will definitely be sticking to the tried and true Hilton Garden during future visits!

Most times we visit New York, we spend our time in Midtown, but for this trip we wanted to explore other parts of the city. We enjoyed being able to explore Downtown and the Financial District and the W was a great home base for that. We stayed in a "Spectacular" room with unobstructed views of Freedom Tower and the 9/11 memorial. Check in was very straightforward. Other reviewers had mentioned that the process was not satisfying for them or not on par with other hotels, but we did not find that to be the case. While not over friendly (this is New York), our check in was very straightforward and professional. Our room was very clean and comfortable with great views. We did not interact much with staff during this visit, so we can't really comment on that, but we would definitely stay again if in the area. It was a very enjoyable stay with a very good night's sleep.
user_name:
RYYS
New York City, New York

review_body: Myself my sister and my dad had a great stay here celebrating. The hotel was clean and staff were very friendly and helpful. Amazing view of the 9/11 memorial from our room. We didn't eat in hotel there was too much to do and see in New York for that. Would recommend hotel to any one.

Stayed W Downtown one night.This hotel is very close to ground zero, Wall St and ferry terminal so good for sightseeing.Also there are some restaurant near hotel.They provide continental breakfast as a amenity for SPG member coffee, juice and choice of breads. Bread tastes nice.Yogurt is not included it will charged around 5$/ per.

I usually stay in mid-town, but wanted to see more of the city (WTC, Battery, east river/hudson & DUMBO) and so went wit this starwood property as my option. The Four Points is also not that far away and would be another good option, but in the end we were happy to have stayed here.Currently, the restaurant is undergoing renovations and so there is no local food services. Not to fear there are lots of options in the area (not exactlyright outside the door) but food can be had. We ate at Hudson East frequently.The room (spectacular king) was small though adequate for two people and looked out on the 9-11 memorial from a higher floor. Beautiful view, you could spend all day and night sitting on the window sill pillow looking out there. The washroom had no tub but that was fine as the updated shower was quite good (does anyone take a bath anymore). Despite our room being right in front of the elevator all was quiet and we were able to sleep just fine.Would I come back? This is probably the best for the price in the neighbourhood, but with such a big city and so much to explore we will probably find another spot to go.

Nice size rooms in the hotel and generally helpful staff. Food options would rate in the OK category - would be nice to see more options. Rooms were always well taken care of by great housekeeping team.

I have been a loyal SPG customer for more than 15 years. first, it was just Sheraton in Asia pacific, then Westin around the US and in continental EU; then only W in the US. all my friends and a lot of my former colleagues (I am retired) were introduced to W by me (as their free go-to travel agent due to my extensive intl travels.) so when my husband told me he had a conf to go to in NYC this week, I told him to book @ a W hotel (not marriott, not one of those very attractive nicely appointed boutique hotels in Manhattan) this W is just like any other W, modern euro chic design which I always prefer strongly ..(why anyone not use a pocket door in limited space like bathroom is simply beyond me....) great location if you want to stay downtown, just next to the 9/11 site, you can see it through your room window. but what is a bit bizarre is that mobile phone coverage is very poor, and room wifi is spotty .. I think I got better reception in the middle of Masai Mara than in the middle of financial district. so I could not get any work done properly. also, I could find only 2 outlets in the entire room thanks to the minimalist design. I am a minimalist myself, but there should be an outlet strip on the desk like many other hotels do (e.g. Le Meridien) again, doesn't make sense to me that it is so anti-work in the middle of Manhattan ... no, this is NOT a resort, honey! one side note and this may strike as personal: this is will be the last time either I or my husband ever stays at a SPG property. reason? as I was lying in my bed at this W, I decided to book the Sheraton in Chengdu using my hard earned points and saved over the years. that is when, only then, I discovered that Starwood "expired" all my points ... on 5/2, a week ago! called customer service, even the manager refused to reinstate my points, not even after I offered to buy some points just to get my points back. nope. nada! nope, they did not send me a reminder email that my points were about to expire ... nope, I was told it was totally on me. that is ok. it is an irony that I told my husband to spend money again with Starwood. but no more. so, would I ever recommend W to anyone? f' no! but to be objective, this hotel is fine if you are looking for a place to sleep in lower Manhattan and you don't mind not having much to do at night.

I have stayed at multiple W brand hotels at this point. This particular one was just alright. The staff was great, very friendly and hospitable! The room needed attention, maintenance, and basic upkeep. The lighting strip behind the bed-frame was loose and you could see it hanging. The bathroom shower grout was coming off. The walls were painted white; which I have no problem with..... But they were dirty and obviously hadn't been wiped down or cleaned. The room had minimal lighting which was very dim at night. The room overall needed a face-lift when it comes to being maintained. Would I stay there again? yes. But I would definitely keep in mind other options.

When we arrived they were able to accommodate us in for early check-in, which was great. The person checking us in was not very friendly and felt kind of blahh. Moving on to the room. Our view was amazing, we were right in front of the freedom tower and at night it was so beautiful. My daughter would just sit in front of the window and just stare outside, it was super cute. Our room attendant was very nice to us, she offered my daughter complimentary chocolates and juice. The only thing that did bother me was that when we would come back to the room after exploring the attendant never left complimentary water that they refill each day, so we had to call pretty much every night of our stay. Weird. Now to the reason I'm leaving 3 stars only. My boyfriend on our last day, went to take care of the payment, I had put my credit card down for the holding and he was going to pay everything at the end with his card. So the same guy with the blahh attitude at check-in assisted him and swiped his card for the amount of our stay. The next day once we were back home, my boyfriend tells me that not only did they charge his card for our original invoice, they also charged him an extra $800 dollars!!! We called the resort and asked what was going on and could not give us an appropriate answer simply we have nothing showing that we charged you that amount. Well someone charged $800 extra to that card since the name of the hotel was next to the transaction. After almost 2 maybe 3 weeks they returned the amount back on the card with a simple "sorry for the inconvenience." So I would just tell anyone who stays there check your bank account statements so that this does not happen to you. Something seemed fishy to me. Other than that the hotel was nice. Great location!

While the location is amazing with great views of ground zero, and the design of the rooms is great, we couldn't help but notice how dirty the room was. There was dirt built up all around the base of the tiled shower, writing on the walls, and chipped paint everywhere. It was our first stay at a "W" and we were looking forward to it, but this hotel was very much form over function.

Booked this hotel as part of a friend's birthday weekend celebration. My wife and I stayed here, and neither one of us had ever stayed at a W Hotel before. The decor was thoroughly modern and check-in was easy. All of the staff that we encountered was extremely friendly and helpful, the doorman, front desk staff, bartender and waitress.We even learned what their "whatever, whenever" policy really means. I forgot to get a suit bag from the back of our car when we valet parked. The staff offered to get the bag for me and bring it to the room. Saved me from spending time finding my car when I needed to get ready for our friend's birthday dinner. Amazing!My wife forgot to pack hairspray. Called again and was told that the hotel could bring complimentary hairspray to the room. Score!Then I realized that I forgot my cell phone charger. The hotel staff didn't have a loaner charger but did offer to charge my phone using their personal phone charger. Wow!On top of the great service, we ordered a tuna poke from their bar and sat on their outdoor lounge area. The food and atmosphere were great!The location was one block from One World Trade Center as well, so our room had an amazing view of Freedom Tower (see attached photo).I highly recommend this hotel. My wife and I are now going to learn to pack or suitcases better.

This place is fantastic!! The employees were extremely friendly and accommodating and the hotel is just beautiful. But the most impressive thing is the view! Wow! Our room looked directly at the Freedom Tower and the reflection pools...stunning. Anyone that has traveled to NYC knows that the view at most hotels in the city is the wall or window of the building next to them. This hotel does not have a building in front of it so most of rooms have a great view of the WTC and skyline. Also, being in the financial district, the noise level at night was considerably quieter than other areas of NYC. This has definitely become my favorite NYC hotel.

I arrived in the morning after a long flight. Hoping to check in early to the hotel, I went to the front desk asking if they could honor my request. The woman that checked me in when above and beyond to check me in during the morning hours. She got me in and helped set my expectation for my stay. Overall a very good location and place to stay

Our stay at the W New York Downtown was great! It's everything you'd expect at the W. The room was great and comfortable. Shower was leaking everywhere but not a big deal. Great evening events at the bar/lobby. Location is great as well, close to WTC and the subway.

A modern and well taken care of place. Has an awesome location in the business district, which is very quite in the evening. NYC is overwhelming, but this hotel gives a rest you need to keep on exploring NY's madness. Staff is polite and professional. If you get a room at higher floors, you get a view you see in all NYC movies. Additional advantage the hotel is facing 9/11 memorial - it can't be closer than that.

This hotel really left me divided. I really love the location, the room and the cleanliness. The staff is super friendly too.Then again, there's a night club right below your room if you're staying on the lower floors. The windows are not super well isolated and you can hear the music blaring.Most people will walk around NYC a lot tho so you'll sleep anyway due to how tired you are. Then again, this might be an inconvenience to some people. :)

great location, easy access to the statue of liberty and world trade center museum, friendly staff, Tracy at the front desk had a great costumer service, friendly and make me and friends feel really welcome. the restaurant server (from cuba) was really good with us too, he was really busy but always smiling. I did not go to the bar but my friend made great comments about the bartender. Nice way to go, I look forward to return soon

We will be back!!!! We stayed in room 1407 and had a beautiful view of the World Trade Center. Our room was very clean and comfortable. And when we came to our room to get dressed for a romantic dinner at Delmonico's, a bottle of champagne was delivered to our room as a gift from the staff for our Anniversary!! We've been to amazing hotels all over the world and the W hotels always treat us special when we celebrate each year. Some cool places nearby are the liberty helicopter tours(good deals on travelzoo) Clinton Hall (outdoor ale house with great atmosphere, games) and south street seaport's Industry Kitchen (outdoor bar with great music and amazing views of Columbia heights, Brooklyn)..and another good incentive is the Starbucks on the next corner from our hotel. Our morning was perfect with a coffee and a walk to the memorial pools and the freedom tower. We highly recommend this hotel and their wonderful staff!! Thanks so much for a special weekend!!

Stayed here for 3 nights with my family. We really enjoyed the unique atmosphere and excellent location which was safe and nearby many attractions we planned to visit. Several subway and bus lines were within an easy walk. The rooms, while a slightly small, we're well appointed and quiet. We booked this via an online travel site and got a pretty good deal for the quality.

It's a nice hotel. Not too terribly much to complain about. I kind of screwed myself over with this one by booking an Ultra Cool Corner Room and then checking in after 8pm, meaning I was left with the least desirable one out of however many of these they have. Our view was mainly the back of another building, and I could only see the WTC by craning my head around uncomfortably. I did call down to see if they could switch us, but as I suspected, no others of our room type were available at that point. It was kind of a disappointing factor seeing as I deliberately booked this hotel and that heightened room rate to get the best possible view. But again, my fault. I was in hospitality, so I get it. Just a warning for others - if you plan on checking in late, you'll get the "picked last for the team" version of whatever room type you probably paid extra for hoping it would be amazing.Everything else was fine; the famous optical illusion bar design is even more impressive in person, and drinks were delicious. The unisex bathrooms were weird. I guess it makes sense though because millenials are super progressive, right...? And as others have said, I completely didn't get why the "rooftop bar" was on the 4th floor. Hungover Blooody Mary's and brunch the next day in the restaurant downstairs were wonderful.Bed was comfy, room was clean. Service was typical New York; they did their jobs and that's it. If you want sugary sweet front desk people and bartenders, you're in the wrong city.Overall, I wouldn't object to staying here again. There are a ton of other great hotels in NYC though that I would probably try first.

Directly overlooking the 9/11 Memorial, the W Downtown was surprisingly well-priced for a NYC hotel and offered us a good base for a very short stay when we needed to be proximate to both Manhattan and Brooklyn. A friendly doorman and pleasant check-in staff made for a nice introduction. The room was typical of a W--once chic, but now looking spare and a little predictable; bed very comfortable; bath well-stocked; shower spacious. I wish there was a more comfortable chair in the room than the desk chair and the window seat, but this is a minor complaint. Skip the mini-bar options--they're greatly over-priced and there are plenty of nearby sandwich shops that can satisfy you. I'm in agreement with another reviewer about the lobby lighting: when the brightly lit elevators from the rooms open to the reflective dark marble floor of the lobby, there's an illusion of depth that makes you feel as if you're stepping into open space. Rather startling! The room rate was a happy surprise--I know Wall St clears out on weekends, but the room was priced significantly lower than comparable hotels midtown.

Lobby areas completely black and dark. Both restaurants in the hotel were under renovation. Room was not much bigger than a large closet. Only lights in the room were two LED task lights. On the upside the bathroom was a good size and the room didn't suffer from loud street noise.

I stay here often for business trips. Hotel has the standard W feel with dim lights, modern rooms, and great service. Rooms are spacious enough and are mostly quiet. The only downfall I have seen is the gym, which lacks equipment and space. There are only two treadmills for a hotel with 30 floors, doesn't quite make sense. Other than that, I would highly recommend this hotel if you're in the FiDi area for work.

I have stayed in many W Hotels throughout the world and despite the amazing view and location of this W, it is not at the standard of its other properties in NYC or elsewhere.Checking in late at night was a bit disconcerting and deserted as no one was on the entrance level to provide directions to check in. Although very clean, the room was in need of TLC: the window shade was cracked; tiles were missing in the shower; knobs were missing from the lamp; and a power strip was the alternative for additional plugs to recharge devices. This is not usual excellence and impeccable finished of W hotelsBe advised if it is windy you will hear the building sway - even on the 12th floor. If you are not use to the sounds of high rise buildings, you could be startled.
user_name:
Decade4LivingLife
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I stayed here for three nights. My room was good in size and had a great view of the memorial. The room is starting to look worn. The biggest negative about the room = the mattress is on a slick plastic platform and the bed kept sliding off. I stayed here alone and kept thinking how annoying this was and how bad it would be with a second person. No music with bright lights in the elevators make it feel like a Hampton Inn. The lobby bar was great 1 of 3 nights. To go down and either see a ball game on or debate in the Living Room bar and have no music on the entire lobby level was just odd for me. I contacted a few people on this and I was told another guest requested this and to turn the music off and to have the debate on. That is great you are willing to accommodate a guests request, but don't change your image for one person. The adds placed in the rooms and around the hotel say to drop your power suit but to have the debate on goes against your adds. I go to NYC often for work and I will find my way to other W hotels or even other hotels over staying here again.

Decent stay at the W New York - Downtown. Thomas Sturniolo, the Director of Operations, was great in organizing an early check-in. Thomas also checked-in post-stay, to ensure my visit was satisfactory. Room was a little on the small side, granted it was in NYC. Also, room service menu was printed on printer paper :/ Had little interaction with front desk, although whatever experience I did have was relatively non-descript. However, Thomas was excellent in ensuring everything went smoothly.

The location was perfect for us, with a teenage daughter it was easy to get to everywhere with subways and taxis, but also wasn't in the chaos like times square hotels. The room was cosy, but all hotels in New York are! Room service provided great service and were always super friendly, however the front desk staff were less than accommodating. Our understanding is W Hotel's slogan is 'whatever, whenever' however basic requests were treated like a huge deal (ie. where to recommend to get food late at night).

I stayed in this hotel a few months ago but am just getting around to writing a review! The hotel was super clean and had very friendly staff. I also like its modern decor, which you will find at most W - hotels. It has a great location with many restaurants within walking distance. If you don't see something you like, you are only a short subway ride away. (I would say cab ride, but cab rides never seem to be short in NYC) The only reason I am giving this resort a 4/5 stars is for its room size. I know it is NYC, and that MANY hotels have small rooms, but this definitely was one of the smallest. However, I do think they are more reasonable with pricing because of this.I would definitely recommend staying here!

Stayed here as I was attending the Hope Gala at Capitale and this was a perfect location for us as we live in Jersey City. Quick drive to the hotel from the Holland Tunnel along with the ease of valeting your car right in front! Our check-in process was flawless and we were greeted with a friendly front desk agent. She even had our rooms ready prior to the check-in time which was wonderful so as to allow us more time to prepare for our dinner event. We dined at the restaurant on location - the burger and flatbreads were excellent! However, if you did not want to dine on property, there are plenty of restaurants within a few blocks from the hotel itself to choose from. We ended up at O'Hara's across the street for a very late night cocktail. But, the hotel also had a DJ and bar option on the 5th floor lounge if you wanted to stay in. The hotel was also gracious enough to extend our check out time as it was Daylight Savings and we had a late night! I certainly look forward to returning soon and hopefully staying longer!

Ok so it's cheaper than some of the other options but it looks seriously tired now. I suspect it was only a refacing job when it was done 15 years ago anyway. The rooms are tiny. The shower is pokey. It has a bar that is pretty popular. Check in and out was easy. I would go elsewhere

Had a room overlooking the memorial - very inspiring! Well cared for by an attentive and highly professional staff. Room was spacious and comfortable compared to some other NYC hotels. Highly recommend checking out this W.

I definitely recommend staying downtown to anyone visiting NYC. Lots of subway lines within walking distance of the hotel. The W Downtown has very cool design, room is small of course but the space is very well used so it doesn't matter. The staff were fine, the Wifi is not particularly worth what you pay for it though, and you don't get good cell signal in the guest rooms.

So, I don't write reviews often, and when I do I generally tend to write ones that are favorable. I travel constantly for work, so I understand the general ups and downs of the service industry. Not everything can be perfect all the time and this is never my expectation. However, when I put in effort to get things right and to make a special weekend happen, it is disappointing when I have an experience like this one. I booked this hotel through my chase rewards program. I specifically called the hotel, confirmed the rate I was booking and talked to someone there to ensure I would have a WTC view. This was an anniversary weekend and I wanted it to go well. There were multiple room booking options from the Chase site, with rates from $220 - $280+ for the single king room. I booked the more expensive rate (as it was told to me by the W staff I talked to) to ensure I would get the view and room I wanted. I also asked for a room on a high floor. This was "noted" on my reservation as I was told. I arrived that weekend. The staff member greeted me curtly to say the least. When I asked about the room, she said she saw "no notes" and that she would see what they have available. When I told her about the view, she said "no, I wasn't involved in any other conversations about this and have no idea what you were told. The rate increase would be $50 or higher for the WTC view and that's pretty much final". Considering my partner was standing there, I was not in the mood to start a debate or call a manager. It was late and we wanted to sleep. It was also apparently completely unimportant that the rate I paid for the room was already at least $70 higher than the listed rate on the W website itself for the same exact room. So, my anniversary was spent in a tiny, clean, and modern room facing another skyscraper. (The entire room also shook whenever there was wind and was rather creaky) It wasn't a poor room, just poor when I tried to make this a special weekend, planned ahead, tried to engage the hotel and was still left disappointed. I've stayed in starwood member hotels for a long time, and it is rare that I have as disappointing experience as this. Just as a case and point, we were supposed to spend 3 nights there. Instead, we changed our flight and left a night early. While I brought it up to the staff, the W refused to offer any kind of refund or recognize the issue. Even something small would have been nice. For the staff I talked to, It was an issue with who I booked with --- not sure, given that the W was providing the service, but again, I didn't press the issue. There is only so much time in the day.Regardless, I will likely continue to be a patron of Starwood hotels in the future. But this was by far the most disappointing experience to date. (I'm giving this hotel a second star, because at least the rooms were clean!) Finally, they billed me for a snackbox I never consumed. $8.45, after that weekend, didn't seem like it was worth the trouble either.

This was our second stay at the W Downtown and again the staff was awesome. The views were great we had a Ultra Cool Corner Room that looked out upon One World Trade Center with panoramic windows in the corner what a treat. Beds that allow you to rest comfortably are addictive and hard to get out of in the morning. BLISS products are a wife's best friend... but the staff here is what make this hotel special. Guys in valet parking are the best. Thank you to Christopher in the Living Room Bar for the great service and for treating us like regulars (cocktails were excellent). Tracy for the smooth check in. Anique for the wonderful service in the Washington Bar and Grill. We will be back !!

From the check in process to the room, I felt special. Host at check in desk was polite, offered points vs. drink to SPG member, offered late check out. Reservation was king-sized bed but was able to switch us to the needed two double beds.Then we get to the room and this view was absolutely spectacular! The room was large sized for a NYC room (smallish by otherwise US standards). Quite modern in style but very functional. Bathroom was the new standard modern with mostly frosted glass shower. Personally not my favorite. Had a drink at the bar. Pricey, but strong. If I had a need to stay downtown, I would not hesitate to stay at the W Downtown again.
user_name:
PenguinLoveFisch
New York City, New York

review_body: The hotel is a bit out of the way from most of the NYC tourist attractions and popular neighborhoods but the room was nice and the view of the Freedom Tower and 9-11 Memorial is incredible. For Manhattan, the room was a good size and if i had business in lower Manhattan, I would definitely stay here again.
user_name:
Allison R
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I just spent Valentines weekend in New York with my boyfriend and we stayed at this location. Let me start off by saying I'm a HUGE W fan. I travel a lot. If there is a W in a city I'm visiting it's my first choice. The hotel is great. Convenient location. Wonderful views. Very cool bar in the lobby. The staff at this hotel have to be some of the most uninterested, lazy and worst staff at almost any hotel I have ever stayed at and ruined part of the experience staying here. On Valentine's morning we decided to order breakfast and champagne in bed. I ordered the Healthy Start omelette which was supposed to come with all sorts of veggies inside and my boyfriend ordered and all American style breakfast which was supposed to have sausages eggs etc. Our total bill for the breakfast was $179 USD. When the breakfast arrived it looked like the staff had literally just thrown what they could messily on a few plates and sent it up. My omelette was just egg whites on a plate with NOTHING else no veggies nothing just egg whites (not what the menu said). A whole bunch of stuff was also missing from my boyfriends. We called down and they said they would re-make mine and send some sausages up for my boyfriend. He asked if they could re-make both of them since we were trying to have a romantic valentines breakfast in bed together and the woman told him mine would take 15 mins so he could just wait with what he had. He said no his food would be cold by then - so she informed us she would have to check with the manager if that would be ok. They called us back 15 mins later and said they would send us both a new meal. Not only did the whole ordeal take over an hour it was also at the end of the day a $200 meal for a s*&^ experience. I have NEVER been to ANY restaurant or hotel that has completely screwed up the entire meal and not comped at least the dishes they screwed up! #FAILThis wasn't our only issue. The entire staff seems just completely disinterested in their jobs. They aren't rude but it's just like they couldn't give a damn about their jobs or their hotel guests. The check-in was unpleasant. When we went for a drink at the lobby bar two of the bartenders were busy openly flirting with each other the entire time and just 1 of 3 bartenders was serving the entire bar. The staff at the bar Bill's down the street inside the Marriot are 10 times better and friendlier than any of the staff at the W.If you want any kind of customer service while on vacation or travelling for business SKIP this hotel you won't find it here.

W Down Town - super surprised about the hospitality in that part of the city. Had the feeling a office building was turned into a tasteless hotel, not! to be compared to any other W hotel in Asia or Europe (for those I saw!). From the beginning: Elevator is shabby (no music, experience Etx). No special lighting in the lobby ground floor - just the said office entrance where j had to squeeze luggage myself thru a small entrance beside the hotel - of course no staff to bother for assistance. Reception didn't even wanted to stand up during talks and had a "can not do" attitude, be aware of bed requests need to be confirmed black on white prior arrival - we ended up in a handicap room as we needed a king bed. When we stood at the Concierge counter we heard some sort of racist comment towards a Chinese couple who dared to ask for an adaptor from the clerk to fit their plug for US standard; he said: "who told you it's with me, go to your room and call someone"! When I tried the same next day he was still rude in his manner but send it up right away (I'm white!). In the room: No mattress protector on beds gave us a bad feeling - specially when we saw what was under the thin sheet - stains over stains (red and orange color). Bathroom was ok, but cold and really super small. Hairdryer a joke as super weak and electrical plug right beside water faucet...... Not the W hotel we were used to and not recommended except u r blind and don't care about personal experiences. Oh - and no free wifi - except u are a member - but don't expect the staff to help u looking up ur membership for u!
user_name:
Worldwanderer83
New York City, New York

review_body: Small rooms, small bar, small lobby, substandard uninterested staff. Nothing like W Times Sq. My gut tells me the developer/investors did this project to sell condos on the residence side because they didnt seem to care about hotel.

I was very disappointed with my experience at this hotel. I had to check in on the 5 th floor at a tiny counter next to the bar where very loud music was being played. The check in clerk was rude when I questioned why I was getting a twin room when I paid for a king. He further told me "it was first come first served". As the music was very loud and I was very tired after a long international flight I asked for a room well above the bar. Instead I was put directly above the bar, and could hear the boom of the music until the early hours. To make matters worse I also told him I was a SPG elite member, to which he said"why are you telling me that? ".Anyway, I visit New York every week, and stay downtown, but will never stay at this hotel again. Perhaps this is because I am too old for this"hip" hotel, and perhaps the clerk took an instant dislike to me. I would suggest you only go if you are young enough to appreciate the atmosphere here.

My fiancee and i very much enjoyed our stay at the W this weekend. Our room (a king single) was very well-appointed. The concierge and front-desk staff were friendly and helpful, and the 5th floor lounge was a great place to hang out during the cold snap in New York. This hotel is a great choice if you plan to visit Freedom Tower or attractions near the financial district. However, this hotel is not your best choice location-wise if your visit centers on Times Square, Broadway, or the usual tourist places in uptown New York. Aside from that, my only criticism is that the W New York, like other hotels that cater to an upscale clientele, charges customers extra for Internet access. I hope that the W will consider offering this to customers free of charge in the future.

W hotels, definitely had their hey-day. Unfortunately, having stayed at a number of NY hotels this one is now dated. Good location, I stayed for a number nights for work, I would not recommend this for someone on a leisure trip (rather than a business trip). The rooms are OK, nearly floor to ceiling windows on the corner rooms. Great for the view but in reality, there is no privacy, so you have to keep the blinds closed the whole time, making the room dull. Minimalist decor, white and clinical - it does not leave you with a cosy or romantic feel. Small bathroom, only one basin, and no shelving space.The entrance/lobby to the hotel, is black gloss marble decor - what I would describe as walking to some sort of 80s/90s nightclub. On most nights loud music played, and the bar was busy, rather incongruous for the hotel. (However some may like this!) No room service available - complimentary coffee in the mornings in the lobby but that is all. And a small gym with a couple of treadmills/weight machines. Overall, fine if you're staying on a quick business trip but for the same cost, I've stayed in more comfortable and amenable hotels in NYC

The sleeping rooms are normal W sleeping rooms. Nice, clean, comfortable, and roomy. The room service options are limited. Thank goodness I was in NY so I just ran out and had tons of options to eat at.The meeting rooms are small with low ceilings. There was a bit of noise from the outside but overall it worked.

From check in to check out I had a completely wonderful experience. The hotel is clean and beautiful. The room was large for a NYC room, with all the details there, including a window seat to look out over the city. I am familiar with the area but loved being 20 stories up to observe the city from that view. Front desk and concierge helpful and there when needed. Great retreat.

I was at my night out with my wife and we have a nice room with a better customer service. Nice location....and wonderful view from the 12 floor. The edge decoration of the lobby give it to you th essence of the hotel.

My wife and I stayed here on Sat Feb 5 and again had a wonderful WOW experience. We were greeted us at the front desk and again quickly gave us an outstanding corner room overlooking and the Hudson. We had dinner downstairs and enjoyed my NY strip steak (prepared just perfectly) and caught the subway up to BROADWAY (about 15 minutes). Great location, great people and outstanding service.

We stayed 2 nights at this hotel. The staff at the reception was not welcoming. However, the room was huge (compared to others rooms in NYC) and really clean. We also had an amazing view on the Freedom Tower. The hotel is located near a Subway Station. At night, the area is quiet but there are some good restaurants around.We left the hotel the day of the snowstorm. The doorman was really nice and took the time to explain us how to go to our next hotel.

Hotel has a good and quite location in front of ground zero. Hotel has a modern style and staff is friendly. Breakfast at the restaurant (close to entrance - doesn't belong to hotel) was good. Wallet parking guys where not very friendly.

The uniqueness of this hotel in NY is how modern and quiet it is. I had a room on the 11th floor (not so high) and it's completely quiet, although it's very close to busy areas around the ground zero site.The room was clean, well equipped, modern. The A/C was functional and not too noisy (and no unwanted noises when you switch it off). Comfortable bed.Bathroom small but functional, with hairdryer. Very nice shower. Small details, like tower hanger, need fixing, but no big deal.There is a nice bar on the 5th floor, nice atmosphere.Check-in and -out very quick and efficient.Free coffee at the bar in the morning (though did not personally test this).The room was smaller than I've had in other NY hotels, so not so sure about long stays there but for a week or so, it is fine. Quality of room and silence matters more to me than room size and this is definitely the best I've had in NYC. If you're the same, you can book there.

I booked this hotel for an overnight getaway with my boyfriend. I had an amazing experience between the rooms and the staff. The rooms were very clean and quiet. We were given a free drink ticket once I checked into the hotel for the main floor bar which has amazing lights and beautiful views of the Freedom Tower. I would definitely stay here again if given the opportunity.
user_location: New York, New York, United States
user_name:
Amanda R
New York, New York, United States

review_body: We loved this hotel! Happy staff, nice room with a fabulous view, and location. It's in a quiet neighbourhood close to everything you'll need. And for these newbies to NYC, lots of helpful tips from the concierge and the doorman. I've read other reviews about room size, etc, but this is New York, people! We found the room to be perfectly adequate for what we needed it to be. Great bed, very quiet. We will definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel. Two negatives-a coffee maker in the room would be nice, and we had a handicap room with an interesting shower, but it was totally doable.

I am an SPG Platinum member, and I was upgraded to a suite. It was small, but of course all accommodations in NYC are,... but it was very nice. I liked the location in Midtown, was a quick & easy cab or sub to either the northern or southern ends of Manhattan. The lobby is really cool and interesting. The only thing I was bummed about was we had a little balcony off our room, but the door was sealed shut and I couldnt go out on the balcony :(

The lobby design is cool. It's very reminiscent of W's from overseas which is welcome for domestic properties. The room was good. Very white washed with some cool design elements, but the ruffled throw pillows need to go. It's WAY too 2000 suburban housewife. Not cool anymore. The sleep was comfy. The room could use a little refresh since the walls were a little nicked and marked. I LOVED the view over the 9/11 memorial fountains...very touching and moving.

Spent a weekend at the W New York Downtown during the holidays. Been to NYC numerous times, were excited to see it over the holidays for the first time.Enjoyed our stay immensely, the room was a decent sized compared to the other rooms we were seeing in the same price range at other hotels. Great view of the Freedom Tower and memorial, walking distance to the subway and Century 21.Cool vibrant scene in the 5th floor lobby Friday and Saturday, was interested to see and am happy to report the noise was a non factor up on the 11th floor which had been a concern. Two inconveniences we had during our stay - the gym was poorly stocked - one day there were no cups for the cooler and the next day there was no water in the cooler. Also, a minor nuisance was having to stop at the 5th floor to change elevators - tiny bother, but unfortunately the 5th was pretty cold and sometimes there was a wait.Aside from that, great property and found it to be good value for the money.

This hotel was not at all as I expected. The room needed a makeover. Maybe some paint, light bulb were out in the bathroom, rug needed to be cleaned, hotel robs needed to be washed or replaced. The towels were not changed or replaced. Housekeeping barely cleaned room and saw the towels I discarded were picked up off the floor and rehung. The restaurant food was average...the staff need to work on hospitality. The "New York" attitude shows...no Good mornings or Good evenings ...no greetings or acknowledgement when I occupied public areas. The keyless entry did not work for me and when I asked the front desk agent about the room...didn't get a "the customer service empathy" I travel to New York every week for business and decided to use this hotel because it was closer to the client site. I don't think I will return to this hotel. I would like to but the price doesn't meet the quality or hospitality.

We stayed here for a wedding. The location was fantastic. Our room size was miniature. Not a lot of floor space...with my carry on suitcase open it took up all the floor space available. But the bed were comfortable and the amenities were great!

Beautiful room, the views of the World Trade Center Memorial and Freedom Tower are right in front of you. Loved the bar and decor. Great staff (especially Tracy at the front desk). Will definitely stay here again.

This was our first trip to the US and we asked for a quiet room. Having read some reviews on trip advisor we were already aware of the layout of the hotel. Upon arrival we went to the 5 floor, then to the check in desk and we were sorted very quickly. Our room was on the 18th floor right next to the elevator and another electrical room. It was sometimes noisy but it never affected out sleep. Our view was on the opposite side not facing the infinity pools and it wasn't the greatest.Our friends who arrived previously managed to get a free upgrade to a room with a decent view of the pools. When we enquired about this they said it was unavailable or at a premium. So that wasn't a good start. But we weren't too concerned about this as we planned to be out and about as much as possible. The room was small but adequate, furnishing were good but the lighting was not the best. The bedside lights also flickered slightly. The bathroom and shower room was fine. The floor was cleaned adequately throughout the week and no problems were experienced. We also had a free safe and access to an iron and board. The hotel is very dark as mentioned by others which can sometimes make you feel strange. The hotel is pretty well maintained and clean. In the mornings there was free coffee and tea - although getting English tea was sometimes a challenge. During the day there was water available. The people at the front desk were helpful when needed. We didn't eat at the hotel and used the bar once or twice. I felt the bar was expensive - $9 a bottle of bud but $11 after the tax. So we never really used it. I used the gym 4 times - it is small with limited weights but adequate for a holiday. We signed up (for free) for a service that gave us internet access and this was very useful. I would advise you do this. All in all a very enjoyable trip. I would stay in this hotel again.

but bad enough. We went to the W on Lex years ago and swore we’d never go to another W, but. . . Worst of this place is the lobby: polished black onyx-like floor with tricky indirect lighting, makes you think you are going to fall off of it. Tiny lobby crowded by a bar, with only one check-in desk, and everywhere. . . darkness. The policy-makers for the W chain think that darkness is cool—and it is if you are having or intending illicit sex, but probably not otherwise. The room, though small, is well designed, comfortable bed and bedding and nice toiletries, but of course, no one can read in the room because of the poor lighting. Unlike other TripAdvisor commentators, we had a terrible view. On a sampling of two in the W chain, my advice is: Nobody over 30 should go to a W hotel.

This hotel is gorgeous. The view of the freedom tower is amazing. The room was beautiful, bed was so so so comfortable. Stayed here with a friend for a weekend of fun, normally stay at the w on Lexington but due to budget restrictions, this w was more economical. This hotel is great for business as it is by the FiDi, not so much for youngsters like us, it was quite far from midtown where most of the attractions are. But all in all, it was a great stay. Love the W

We enjoyed staying at the W Hotel Union Square on two separate occasions. This December, we stayed three nights at the W NY-Downtown and we were just as pleased. The location is quite convenient for walking or taking the Metro. We chose to do a lot of walking during our stay because we had gorgeous fall weather this December! The staff was friendly, the lobby is funky and disco-like but a bit on the dark side. The reception is on the fifth floor but this is off set by the number of available elevators. We really appreciated the complimentary tea and coffee in the lobby in the early morning and ice cold water in the afternoon when we returned from exploring the city. The two double beds were very comfy, the room was spacious, neat and clean. I loved the full length mirror on the inside door of the closet. Not a fan of the opaque wall of the shower wall that is part of the bedroom wall. Not much privacy. We were on a higher floor and had a spectacular view of Ground Zero, Freedom Tower, 911 Memorial, sleek skyscrapers and other new buildings that are under construction. As a bonus in the room we had a window settee that stretched the length of the wide window! During relaxation time, we sat there to read, color in my coloring book or just admire the various activity going on outside at street level. This W Hotel would be our first choice if we stay again in Lower Manhattan.

Great Location. We stayed on the 21st floor with direct views of the 911 memorial as well as The new Freedom Tower. Temara the manager on duty when we checked in was great. They couldn't grant all my request but she gave me options that we acceptable. Jean Marie at check out was also exceptional. Andrew and John, the concierge truly lived up to WHATEVER/WHENEVER. We were in NYC visiting our daughter for Christmas and the W Hotel really made us feel at home. Cant wait to come back and I have already recommended this hotel to several of my friends.

I will visit this W. Hotel because they covered my mistake. I booked at the Albany location when I meant to select another address. I had time to peruse the website. I was excited about the accommodations. Of course I read the check in/out and cancellation policies $0.00. I called the next morning explained my situation. They were reasonable as I had expected. They were polite and understanding. Susan from the front desk and Jackie from Accounting.

Clean, friendly, very quiet and centrally located. The 911 memorial, the One world observatory and the brooklyn bridge at walking distance. I can very much suggest this city hotel. One slight tear drop is, that when we returned at 1100 pm, very thirsty after a basketball game at madison square garden, the bar was closed already.

The W Downtown New York was a very enjoyable and impeccable experience. The room sparkled with cleanliness as well as the bathroom which made me smile. The Staff showed quality customer service which is so important from the front desk to the bartenders and restaurant staff. If you are looking for a clean and friendly place to stay in the city I strongly recommend the W Hotel.

I just recently stayed at the W Downtown New York and it was fantastic! The room was very nice, super clean and modern with a very comfortable bed. The lobby was very cool, and had an awesome bar with an even happy hour. The hotel was in a great spot, close to the subway station which was then easy to get all over the city. Overall, very pleased with the stay and would highly recommend.

Best kept secret. Close to battery park city, excellent views of New Jersey and Statue of Liberty nearby, nice walk, quiet, great access to transportation, near tower of freedom.Close to Wall Street. Great deal in Manhattan.

Stayed here for a few nights with my wife, and overall it was very good.The decor of the hotel is very contempory and funky (see photos of the ceiling in the bar - very trippy), and check in was quick and easy with very friendly staff.Our room suffered the same issues as many other inner city hotels, with the room being very small with barely enough room for luggage and few plug sockets (although we did bring a plug bank with us). Additionally, the lighting in the main bedroom was quite poor, aside from the desk lamps, for the mostpart the lighting had to come through the large frosted pane from the bathroom.The hotel is located a block or so away from the 911 memorial and is a few stops away from the main areas (Times Square etc) and a short walk from the Brooklyn Bridge.I would recommend this hotel to the younger and funky crowd however those with a more subtle / quieter taste would probably not appreciate it.

Nice-modern-clean room....didn't care for being given the corner room as it was smaller than other rooms. No free wifi- :(Overall, not bad..for the price though..don't feel it is worth it. Staff was nice though...

This hotel has fantastic views and the floor to ceiling window has great emphasis on this. We oversaw the world trade centre memorial which is a very moving sight. The staff were excellent only issue was no coffee in the room so had to ask every day which was an inconvenience to us but they soon brought it up. Travel to the hotel is easy on the subway so all in all had a great time.

Very modern but mainly for the young as has a very trendy bar - not our sort of hotel but very clean, and in a very good position for all of New YorkA bit frightening on the first day as bar/reception area when you come out of the lift, it is very dim lighting and the floor is black big tiles, seems like you are falling into a hole, not a good feeling

In Manhattan your room window often faces a wall, an alley, or another building a few feet away, not at the W New York. If you get a room high up, you have a beautiful Manhattan skyline, which is just perfect at sunrise. The rooms are spotless, modern and large for Manhattan. The lobby is a little too dark and funky for my taste, but we spent very little time there. The service was friendly...and there is parking. We found the hotel to be perfect for getting a feel for the Financial District, going to 9-11 Memorial Museum, and to take the ferry to Ellis Island and the Statue of Liberty.

pros: typical W minimalist and sleek decor, bliss bath products, location right next to one world observatory, easy check-in and check-outcons: no real cons, but I might pick a different hotel in the same price range on my next trip to New York...it's a great hotel, but not necessarily wow-worthy

We recently stayed at the W Hotel for 4 nights over Thanksgiving. For the most part it was a decent stay. The room was modern and clean and I really liked the Bliss toiletries. I was a bit worried at first because we were beside an elevator but to be honest, we never heard a sound. There was a small hallway that lead to our room and the one beside it, and the hallway had a door - would be great if you had rented both rooms.Overall the bed was comfortable and the shower was good. The room was on the smaller side for sure but we made the best of it by putting our luggage on the window seat. We had been hoping to have a view of the memorial but as we booked through Hotwire we weren't shocked to not have one.My only real complaints were 1) kind of a pain to take two elevators but on the plus side there generally wasn't much wait. I think we were just so exhausted we just wanted to get to the room. 2) There is one mirror in the bathroom and then another full length in the main part of the room. However its on the inside of a cabinet door which is sort of in a nook. It was really dark there and way too awkward to be able to use it. Extra frustrating that it meant only one person could be getting ready at a time.

I am still a guest here and will be staying for almost 20 more days. I got a room on the 16th floor facing the WTC and the view is amazing. They arranged a microwave for me my stay so far has been extremely comfortable. It is a beautiful hotel, extremely trendy and vibrant. I have to give brownie points to the cleaning staff, they do a wonderful job. Everyday i come back from office and find my room cleaned to perfection. Cant comment on the bar as i dont drink, but if you are in NY, W is the place to be, unmatched view of the WTC.

On holiday for my 21st so wanted a cool hotel and this is what we got. Floor 18 double bedded room with a view which I found amazing. Free tea and coffee in the lobby every morning which was great. Staff were nice and kind especially the doormen. Sorry to the guy who got his fingers trapped in our car as we were leaving;( you were so nice to us. We would return as staying Downtown makes you see more of New York and its people. We will return ;) thank you!

Great view of the 911 Memorial. Rooms are a tad small, but ok for NYC. Strange set up once inside. The check in desk is on the 5th floor, and guest rooms are above that. It takes two elevator rides to get to your room. Be sure to specify a room with a view of the 911 Memorial, or you will be facing the brick wall of another hotel.

I stayed at The W Hotel in Downtown because it was recommended to me by a relative. I have to say that the hotel is beautiful! It has a modern, hip style which I really liked. Jayvon at the front desk checked me in and he was very friendly, warm and charming. Actually the entire staff was very friendly, everyone said hello even the cleaning crew went out of their way to greet me. When I stay at a hotel I always look for cleanliness, I check the room as soon as I get in, along with the beds. This hotel was very clean, and it passed my cleanliness check with flying colors. The hotel has a bar "lounge" on the 5th floor which was very lively with a large array of drink options. I know most people are not looking to hear noise when they are staying at a hotel, but rest assure that the noise from the bar was not carried up to the rooms. The hotel has a perfect location! It is across from Ground Zero, so the views are out of this world. Overall this was a great stay and I will be back.
user_name:
Jamie S
Staten Island, New York

review_body: The hotel is located right by the 911 memorial and the new World Trade Center building. There's plenty of subway lines connecting you to midtown and Brooklyn and the PATH train to New Jersey. It's a trendy hotel with cool curvy lighting in the ceiling of the lobby but it kinda resembles a disco more than a hotel. It's isn't cheap. I paid $600 for a 'spectacular' room midweek in November. Now for that you'd expect something spectacular but the room was a bit of a let down. The furniture was trendy but flimsy. There was no coffee machine or kettle. The bed frame was cheap though the bed itself pretty comfy. And the bathroom was rather utilitarian and due to poor ventilation there was mold on the ceiling above the shower. Also there's no bath tub.The good points; the view if you're on the north side. Also there's a nice 5th floor outside terrace.

Perfectly located in the heart of downtown Manahattan, great views of the World Trade Center Area, 9/11 Memorial, etc. Nice, clean and spacious rooms, very friendly and helpful staff, modern style bar and frontdesk area

After having this hotel chain recommended to us we decided to try it - a big mistake. Incredibly rude staff at the service desk, unclean (dirty!) rooms, lack of maintenance and a horrible smell. We spoke to the hotel manager - they were fantastic. Unfortunately we still felt the need to provide a poor review of the hotel as we were very disappointed. This has nothing to do with management as they were great to us - lovely people and very understanding and accommodating of their guests. Something does need to be done about the staff though and the quality of the rooms.

This hotel is awesome, from arrival to departure we had a great time. In town for Halloween weekend and the hotel was BUZZIN with action. Guys in valet were on point never waited for our car once..called down and it was there in 20min. For N.Y that's quick. Views from our Spectacular room were great, high floors are always best we were on 17. Room service was also very efficient, food was hot and our order correct. Now for the cool part, the hotel is very modern and hip. The hotel bar was unbelievable and Halloween night we had a blast. GREAT DJ. Shower was hot and the Bliss bath product made my wife go crazy.. Thank you to GM. Patrick Horstman and staff for a great stay.

Perfect located just across from Ground Zero. The hotel is very hip and the rooms are cool! The view from the rooms is verys nice, it deosn't matter which floor you are on! No breakfast, but this is no problem, since you have deli's in walking distance! The Coffee station in the morning offeres a really good coffee!!! I will be back!

Beautiful property with an amazing receptive staff. Have never had any issues here and there are great views of the city, including facing directly toward the World Trade Center if you are on the south side of the hotel.
user_name:
onthebackstreets
New York City, New York

review_body: This is a beautiful chic property in a prime location. The room was immaculate and service was exceptional. We arrived very early not expecting our room to be ready but it was! Very central to the 9/11 Memorial, waterfront, financial district and more. On-site restaurant provided a great meal and service.

I stayed here while on a brief business trip and thoroughly enjoyed it.The room was clean, the bed comfortable, the view phenomenal, and the staff friendly. What more could you want?The decor is pretty modern/trendy and they cater to a young crowd including live music in the lobby in the evening. Apparently there is also an amazing roof-top bar. Though I wanted to check it out, I never made it up there. Room service was fantastic!! I highly recommend the French Toast.I can't complain, I enjoyed the quiet time in the room's window seat just looking at the WTC memorial.If I have to return to NYC again for work, I'll gladly stay here!

The staff was very friendly and funny . Very well informed about places to go in the area . Rooms were very comfortable . The lobby is dark and cool and confusing for dogs and parents over 65ish but I loved it . The view of the 911 memorial was fantastic from my room . The evening vibe in the lobby was typical W hotel with a bit of a club feel but it was not overwhelming. Happy hour until 8.

The W New York Down Town Whatever Whenever desk is top notch! I had to arrange a nice suprise for my brother, who was running the New York Marathon. Within 1 phonecall everything was arranged thanks to Mr. jean! Including a card in DUTCH! :) Great service with direct action! Thank You!

The hotel has great views of the WTC site and it is well decorated. However, it feels quite small and cramped in the common areas. Some of the employees were very friendly and engaging and a few were unapproachable and icy. We did have a great room and view but I was also disappointed by not having complimentary drinking water and WiFi in the rooms.

This is one of the worst hotel I have ever stayed and definately never again! I stayed at W bali for a week and that was really lovely and was looking for my stay this time in NY. However...Loud music on the 5th floor, they gave me 6th floor room despite email sent in advance to request for higher floor.food was awaful- saltyand low quality$509 per night with no wifi or breakfast includedrude and unhelpful staffno basic stuff like toothbrush, slippers and when requested, i waited more than 30 minutes after chasinglamps were not workingvery small roomhotnosiy ventilationthe list goes on....so gald that i only stayed for 2 nights!

In NY for a quick night. Decided to se the 9/11 Museum and Memorial. W is great proximity to the site. Easy check-in and out. Nice bar on first floor. Employees very personable and attentive. Great dinner across the stet at Morton's! Would stay at this W again.

As much as I travel I am use to a few mistakes from hotels. We are all human! But the W NY-Downtown was perfect. Staff great, guest room amazing, view of the Freedom Tower unforgettable. Love this hotel!

My wife and I frequent NY and have stayed in time square mostly but downtown was awesome. The W was fancy and didn't have the crazy crowds you see in time square yet you get the NY lifestyle. Loved the hotel and staff. Close proximity to Statue of Liberty and new freedom tower.

Nice location. Views of the Freedom Tower. Great ambiance. The Living Room Bar & Terrace served great cocktails and nice views of the city.Only downside on my stay was that I booked the Cool Corner Room and at 7pm it wasn't ready. Due to a late guest. We had 8pm reservation so couldn't wait. We took the next one below. They credited the difference, and sent us a bottle. Through a nice gesture and truly a Wonderful Welcome Team, rather stayed in the room I booked. Definitely will stay here again!
user_name:
Julian P
New York City, New York

review_body: As noted in previous reviews, this hotel is located overlooking the World Trade site (memorial pools, museum, observatory and construction site), and has a subway station nearby. The reception and lounge on Level 5 are typical W styling. The room itself was nice and spacious but the bathroom needed attention with mould and plastering issues.

We chose W downtown because it looked like a high end boutique hotel and expected similar service to other places we have stayed around the world. The views of freedom tower and 911 memorial were fantastic and the bed was very comfortable! The toiletries provided were suitably luxurious but the bathroom was getting a little tired with mould on ceiling and in grouting. We also got a complementary bottle of bubbly (presumably because we were on honeymoon). There is a huge 24hour construction site next to the hotel. We managed to sleep ok with ear plugs.Unfortunately the staff were very rude and impersponable (especially the night staff). Having travelled all day/night and arrived at 1am, the man at the welcome desk was rather rude and appeared irritated that we had actually arrived. He wouldnt even make eye contact when speaking to us. The only member of staff that was courteous was the cleaner lady!For the prices we were paying we would have expected abit more than help yourself lukewarm coffee in paper cups for breakfast. There was always no milk by the time we got down at 9:30am. For the prices we paid, we wold have expected internet in the rooms. Also having retrospectively read from another review that SPG guest get complimentary internet in the rooms, it is rather disappointing that our "welcoming" staff didnt advise us of this (despite being SPG guests). So after a long day in the city, we had to contend with the music/party revellers at the bar while accessing internet (the balcony area was closed for construction work).This was our first time in NY so unsure whether this is typical of the hotels in the city. Although the hotel looked funky, I will not return to this hotel in the future because staff were rather impersonal and I never once felt welcome.

Stayed at the W Downtown New York for a conference because the neighboring Marriott was full. Did I luck out! Staff was very helpful and friendly, and room was beautiful. Impeccable decor in the room and throughout the hotel. Good location right by Ground Zero. Starbucks and good casual restaurants close by.
user_name:
Sandra L
Harahan, Louisiana, United States

review_body: Hotel is totally fine. I just cannot get over how rude the front desk just was to me. I am in town with a company for a convention and have booked myself and about 12 other rooms for staff here. I just ordered food to be delivered to the hotel for one of the staff. The delivery address had my name, but I wanted the food delivered to the room of a person staying in a different room. I had left instructions with the correct room number in the notes of the order, but they didn't read it. Front desk calls my room."Food's here.""Can you ask them to deliver to room 809?""I'll have them bring it up to your room.""No, I don't want it to my room. I want it to room 809.""I SAID I'll have them bring it up to your room.""My room is 812. I want this taken to 809. Can you ask them to take it to 809?""What did I just say? I SAID I'll have them bring it up to your room.""But.."HEAVY SIGH "THEY ARE BRINGING IT UP TO YOUR ROOM!" Then she hangs up. They brought it to my room. Sorry to be such a trouble to you, W Hotel. You'd think bringing something to a different room in the hotel wouldn't be such a difficult thing. After spending thousands of dollars on booking a huge group here, I don't deserve to be talked to with such a disgusting attitude. Don't worry, we'll stay somewhere else next time.

Located conveniently 2 very short blocks from Rector St subway and not much further from Wall St and Cortland St, this hotel is the A-typical W. Fairly non-descript entrance but take the elevator up to the check-in on Level 5 and you know you're at a W. Reception is virtually combined with the bar and dance floor area with lots of cozy corners to chill in. My room was surprisingly large for NYC, with a nice work area and a bench in the floor to ceiling window that looked out over the Freedom Tower site. I only have 2 small things that stops me from giving this place 5 stars. 1) The split elevator system (you need to take 1 set from ground to 5, then walk thru the dance floor to another set to go up to your room and 2) the work desk in my room, in stead of being positioned looking at the city view, it was positioned looking straight into the windows of the apartment building next door.... all little things, but they made me fall short of giving this place a perfect score. I will be back next time I'm working downtown.

A very nice hotel in a great location next to the 911 Museum and subways. Good gym for a hotel and very quiet room. Staff was nice but failed to call me when my room was ready. They were very apologetic about it. I'd stay there again and recommend it.

Close to perfect for a business traveler visiting the Financial District (stayed here on 6 separate occasions). Always upgraded as SPG Platinum. The bar and live music every night spice things up. Right across the street from WTC, decent restaurant at street-level for late bite to eat. Great views from the room. Typical W styling and guests. Not a good choice for someone looking for nearby nightlife.If SPG traveler and downtown this is a great option if you like walking to the client, cheaper alternatives such as the Aloft and Sheraton Tribeca are one notch down but often much cheaper. No Green Choice at this hotel but available at Aloft and Sheraton.Wifi is okay. Desk chairs in the rooms were terrible but it seems these have been slowly getting replaced - thank you! There are no outlets next to the bed, you'll have to charge your phone on the other side of the room unless you use the clock radio to plug-in.

Stayed here recently for businuss. Location was fine for my work. But pls note don't take a room facing WTC there is massiv construction going on. Also during the night. Very noisy. Had to move room which was a hassle. Rooms are not really comfortable. Max 4 star, service throughout the hotel not good.

We'd never stayed in a "W" before & were excited to experience one in NYC but I have to say it was disappointing. It was a Saturday night, so it was expensive. The rooms were bright (we had booked a corner room) which had great views but overall the whole place felt very dated - the corridors especially. It was very noisey in our room from 2 floors down. The reception area which transforms into a "club" on a Saturday night. We won't be staying in this W again.

Well appointed hotel in a great Battery Park location right next to the new World Trade Center! Busy weekend bar scene adds to the vibe. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Room was stylish and had all the amenities. Bath products from Bliss Spa...nice!Get a room facing the WTC tower....amazing view!

This is an upscale trendy hotel. The staff were extremely friendly. There is a bar next to the lobby that has a balcony and it has great vibe on the weekends. The rooms were spotless and extremely comfortable, especially the bedding. My room had a great view of the World Trade Center and 9/11 memorial. The location was great.

We stayed here during my sister's bachelorette weekend and it was awesome! The hotel lobby on the 2nd floor(or 5th? don't remember.. but it's where you check in) lobby area is ultra modern and hip with a nice bar and photo booth. Staff was friendly and pretty thorough with room service and cleanliness. This place could probably appease to all types of crowds, although it does have an especially fun and trendy ambiance. It's also steps away from some the World Trade Center and a walk away from Bryant Park and other interesting NYC land marks, coffee shops, etc. I'd definitely recommend this hotel for your NYC stay.
user_name:
Angela N
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The staff were all very kind and professional. The hotel was so much fun and beautiful!I didn't even have to leave the hotel the first 2 days because the food was great and the entertainment was awesome!

We stayed at the Downtown W 4 nights and experienced excellent service across the board. We were a block from Ground Zero and close to several subway lines. We were also within walking distance of great restaurants, tkts for same day plays at 40-50% off, and the harbor for a cruise to the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island. We were told that all rooms offered the same view, one that only reinforced that "We will never forget". A few extras that could've been offered include coffee and tea in the room and more than complimentary coffee, tea, and newspapers at the 5th floor bar. The bar area was spacious and decorated with comfy furniture inside and on its outdoor terrace. Be sure to make time for the daily Happy Hour. What a find!

I arrived earlier than expected and the hotel had no problem getting me a room. The staff were very friendly, knowledgeable and personable. The bed was amazing and I had a great view. The room is well equipped and bathroom www well stocked and clean. The lobby is a lot of fun with good energy and vibe

Not great. Hotel check-in right next to the lounge. Had a question, concierge on phone entire time, no eye contact to indicate he knew I was right in front of him. One fairly friendly bartender. Nearly impossible to get a cocktail waitress who was flustered and overwhelmed. The place was clearly understaffed. Also, it was very expensive and **gratuity is included in bill** even for small checks (1-2 drinks). Also, the bathrooms were European in style. I.e., combined men and women's bathrooms with two flushing side-by-side square panels. Seemed a bit pretentious for the U.S. Trying to be something you're not.With better management, increased staffing, customer service training, less deceptive billing, and separate men and women's' bathrooms, this place would be great. The shortcomings were made up for by the quality of the drinks, comfortable seating and nice views from the lounge.

nice hotel, nice lobby, nice bars, they serve complimentary coffe in the morning.facing the New WTO and the 9/11 Memorial, amazing view from the rooms, we where on the 14th floor, a great spectacular room, quite big well furnished, kingsize bed, nice and big bathroom with big shower and nice amenities overall. as all the W worldwide a little bit expensive things such as breakfast, water and other sweets in the room. but nice service, nice staff, rooms clean from floor to ceiling and i really liked this property because it is stylish and simple at the same time, it looks a little less pretentious than other Ws i slept into.Quite far from midtown as u can imagine, but of course NY is not only Times Square, and if u don't mind walking or taking cabs everytime u have to go in and out, it's a wonderful location.

The location wasn't nice.It's downtown but it's very very down downtown.The room was small but with nice view. It's very modern but i like it alot.The concierge was nice and The rest regular.I'm a tourist so location is important that's Why only 4 ovals.

Sadly we´ll not consider this SPG managed property in our next trip to NY. Yes, the rooms are cleaner and bigger than the W at Lexington Ave, but the staff is not so kind, just as an example: at check-in they barely had eye contact. No room upgrade was given as part of the benefit of the loyalty program and its seemed that our room didn´t have windows for all the noise that came thru.Our “ultra corner room” on the 10th floor was facing towards the air conditioned machinery of the adjacent building so all day long noise was coming thru; also on the mornings, all the noise from the construction of the park towards 9/11 memorial, was terrible. No complains about the cleanness of the room, washroom, carpet, towels and a comfortable bed, but staying at a pricy hotel, at least you expect isolate windows. Consider this hotel if you are planning to move around downtown otherwise expect a 25 min taxi ride to Mid Manhattan; several metro stations are also close, but expect more time travel.

Great location for Wall Street and big spacious rooms which are nicely designed.Breakfast was disappointing as á la carte and not a buffet but was decent enough. The bar views were pretty impressive. Also very helpful and accommodating reception staff. Only one other thing I didn't like was a lack of a pool, otherwise nice if not super pricey.
