I was there for a few days celebrating my sisters birthday. the room was not ready but was able to store our luggage start the day. the hotel design was very chic with a great living room vibe at night . walked in the room to a surprise gift. The room was vey spacious. the staff was very friendly and helpful especially Katherine Woods. awesome stay!

I was in town for a conference and this was the selected hotel. I had an amazing view overlooking the 9/11 memorial. The rooms are expensive but it's in such an amazing location. The staff was very friendly.

The room was very spacious...especially for NYC! The bed was extremely comfortable and the room was bright. The only downside was that being on the 7th floor, we could hear the music from the bar on the 5th until early in the morning. It would also have been nice to get free WiFi.

The W hotel in downtown, was great. The gym is clean and a decent size for a hotel gym. The room was your typical small trendy W room, but not as small as the one on Lexington. On the weekend the area is pretty quite, but there's some very good bars in walking distance. The outdoor terrace from the W bar is really great. I complained about the coffee in the living room (black water) and I received a very nice note from the manager hoping to make it right on my next trip to NYC. Its probably one of the best W's I've stayed in. I've stayed in 3 others.

We stayed a week at the W Hotel downtown. As often, we had chosen this hotel due to its location (our friends live around the corner). The atmosphere in the hotel felt very impersonal, the staff at the check-in barely looked at us while checking-in / having questions / checking-out. Nobody was greeting / smiling when leaving or coming back to the hotel. The interior design of the lobby is very fancy but also reinforced this cold atmosphere. The hotel room, which we got for a good deal (if we had to pay the regular price, it would have clearly been overpriced!) was clean, the design was ok. The room was small (in my opinion the room size was ok, my partner found it too small) and I especially liked the W-bed (very comfy). The safe did not work as well as the lamp in the closet; both got fixed / replaced within very short time. The isolation of the room was also very good, or we had very calm neighbors. We missed a good restaurant for breakfast. I tried the one on the ground floor once but was neither convinced by its quality, price or service. Next time visiting our friends, we will probably stay not right around the corner and chose another hotel unless we get a very good price offer.

Staff was fantastic. Katherine Woods @ the Welcome desk was super helpful getting me checked in and taking care of my special needs. The Bar Manager and cocktail server working on 8.21 in the evening were awesome as well! Beautiful space and excellent service!

I'm not a huge W fan -- I just prefer a lobby that's doesn't double as a techno music bar -- but this is a very good hotel. It is in an old building a block from the WTC site, and it is either new or newly renovated. My room was very small, but really comfortable and the space was used exceptionally well. Beautiful bathroom, comfortable bed and good work space with lots of outlets. Across the street there was construction going on but it was not a problem. Generally, the staff was helpful and responsive, but you're on your own if you want to get a cab and the hotel is on a side street, so use Uber or a car service. Room service food was excellent but expensive. Will stay there again if I'm in downtown Manhattan.

Stopped in this week for a drink at the Living Room Bar. I cannot say enough how much I enjoyed Tony's hospitality. He was such a pleasure to talk to and gave some excellent recommendations on nightlife attractions. He should be recognized for his amazing service!

Stayed at hotel for two nights. Great hotel with amazing views of the freedom tower. W hotel at its best. Great staff friendly and helpful. Great location for exploring downtown Manhattan and short subway trip to other great sights. Great rooms with comfortable beds. Highly recommended.

I was a recent guest at the W New York Downtown. I’m a fairly regular visitor to that part of town—I have a close friend in Battery Park City and a nearby hotel is the best guest room ever. I usually stay at the Marriott, right across the street from the W. On this trip I thought I’d try something a little different. I have to admit, my arrival experience was a bit disconcerting. I walked into the hotel, suitcase in hand, and then it took a half a second for me to realize that the lobby wasn’t on the ground floor. Call me a slow learner. And once I stepped into the elevator and couldn’t quite figure out which button to push, since none of are labeled anything quite as boring as “Lobby”. I think they might call the Lobby the “Living Room”.But once I made it to the front desk, the hotel hit its stride. The desk staff couldn’t have been more friendly and helpful and soon enough I was on my way to my room on the 18th floor. My room was compact but well appointed. It was done up in the modern chic style that the Ws are known for, but it wasn’t so modern and chic that I couldn’t figure out how to work the lights and to flush the toilet and all that stuff. The bathroom was just the right size—I never quite have seen the point of a bathroom the size of the Pentagon. The shower was so nice that I wanted to pack it up and take it home with me—spotless, great water pressure, and toiletries that didn’t come from the Dollar Store. The room was quiet at night, and what can I say about the mattress other than that I slept like a log? I loved waking up and looking out the window from my bed to the Hudson River—whoever designed the window knew how tall the bed was going be. Simple, but very nice. On my second day at the hotel, I made the egregious mistake of bringing a soft pretzel back to my room with me. Soon enough I had big bits of white salt all over the black carpet. Shortly thereafter I left the room and on my way out asked the housekeeper if she could give my room-which she’d already made up—a once over with the vacuum to take care of the pretzel detritus. She couldn’t have been nicer, viola, when I returned no one would have known that I was stupid enough to try to eat a salty pretzel while standing on black carpeting. Later in my stay, I had to ask someone at the front desk to help me with my bow tie—they never come close to presentable when I tie one. Presentable was no problem for the young man who helped me with mine...picture perfect was all in a day's work. It was the kind of personal and professional service that made me say to myself, “I’m so glad that I stayed at here.” I’d stay at this W again in a heartbeat—especially now that I know that the Lobby, er, Living Room, is on 5.

Very good hotel loved the cookies The only thing I didn't like was the shower NO PRIVACY!! My daughters LOVED the photo booth very organized, clean, not noisy, Front desk was very nice. Beautiful view from the hotel! Very accessible towards the subway :)!

Nice hotel with the expected level of additions. Very central to downtown & main finance districts. My room view looked across a building site - which would not be the best, but seeing that it is a world trade centre, I guess it can be seen as an attraction in itself

We booked two rooms in June for ourselves and family to experience downtown NYC and see how transformed the area has become! Although it was a little difficult to find the entrance to the hotel, once we figured out which way to go we really enjoyed our stay! The view was tremendous and we had a spot on view of freedom tower and the 9/11 memorial. Very touching and emotional to see right before your eyes!

Stayed 2 nights July 31 & Aug. 1. Strange that check-in was on the 5th floor, but I had reviewed previous, so I knew this upon arrival, so it wasn't a big deal! Very trendy, modern feel in the lobby, which had an outside balcony/bar with a view of One World Trade Center/911 memorial!! We stayed on the 21 floor, which I had requested after reading about the loud music on previous reviews. Upon arrival we had a broken glass in our room, called front desk, they came up within 10 seconds, cleaned it up! Later in the day a hand written note was left, along with a Bottle of Wine!! Room was spacious for NYC. It had a wonderful view of One Trade Center!! Bathroom was very small and there was no shelf space whatsoever!! Shower shared a wall with bed, and it was not solid, it was smokey glass, but my husband said it saw me...lol!!!! Had to request a coffee maker, strange, but when it arrived, at NO charge, it had Starbucks coffee!!!! So happy!! Bed was comfy! Staff was pleasant!! Outside bar on the balcony on 5th floor was closed!! Strange, because I think it would have attracted more people had it been opened, instead of inside bar!! We had a few drinks, waitresses were ok, not too friendly!! Free WiFi if you were a SPG, which we are. Otherwise it was a charge. Loved the location! So close to the Hudson River Walkway!! Loved walking along! Enjoyed Battery Park!! Close to Subway... Ate at George's Restaurant for breakfast, totally recommend!! Food was great!!

I was so impressed with the look of the hotel. The lobby was super chic and loved the view from the rooftop bar!The room was surprisingly more spacious than I expected which was a huge plus! felt so at home because of the comfortable beds. THE VIEW FROM THE ROOM WAS AH-MAZING! thanks to the huge window with a little sitting area so you can enjoy the view comfortably. All the staff of the hotel were super sweet and accommodating too. It was a great stay overall! Thank you W Hotel

On my previous stay at the W New York - Downtown, my entire night's sleep was disturbed because the room next to mine had music blasting till 4.30am in the morning. I really doubt that the staff care at all about the quality of sleep that the guests receive. The walls of the hotel are not soundproofed and very thin. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a good night's rest.In addition, I was mischarged for items that I took from the min-bar which I didn't. The frontdesk thought that it might be a good gesture for my inconvenience of the noise to offset this mini-bar charge which was uncalled for when I hadn't consumed anything from the mini-bar. If you are a guest here, I advise you to double or triple check your bill.

Part of a chain yet every single W I stay in manages to have very professional and friendly staff. Welcome cocktail on arrival and .... Superb and impressive location. Great rooftop bar also with a view, take a second to pay tribute and remember how lucky we are to still enjoy this all. Top marks for SPG formula and team!!! Will be back!

Hotel is located across from the 9/11 memorial so you can request a room with a view of One World Trade Center. Thought the room was really comfortable with adequate storage and a contemporary vibe. Bathroom was small but had everything needed, including a good shower. Room was quiet (1401). Minor complaint was A/C aimed at the bed. Room service was quick and the food better than expected. Staff friendly and helpful. Would stay here again.

I like this hotel's proximity to everything (subway, Wall Street, 24 hr Cafe, Trinity Church, 911 Memorial, Broadway St and many more. The entrance is on Albany St. and to check in, you have to go to the 5th floor. There is also a club on the 5th floor where loud music is heard but I did not mind it at all. The place is lively. The front desk staff are courteous, pleasant and accommodating. We asked where the public places were for free wi-fi and she gave us a one time free sign up. So once we got to our room, we had free internet. After we checked in, we decided to go out for a late bite and we asked a gentleman, an employee at the hotel and he motioned us the direction to take towards Charly's. Our room was on the 15th floor overlooking the new World Trade Center. It is worth visiting the Memorial museum. If you enjoy walking, just head to Broadway St and head north, lots of places to check out.Overall, this hotel is clean, modern, with good staff and very centralized. I would come back to this hotel again. We did not try any of their restaurants/bar because we were out all day.

Nice location, spacious rooms, friendly staff, great views! We found the staff very nice and accommodating. Our room was on the 18th floor with a view of Freedom Tower. The rooms were spacious and not all what I was expecting for NYC. The park across the street was fun with tables, ping pong and connect four. Starbucks around the corner.

Wow talk about customer services.. These guys are amazing! We had 17 girls come in for a bachelorette weekend stay and the staff could not be more accommodating and helpful. Going as far as letting us check in 3 hrs early and getting us rooms on the same floor. The hotel was beautiful. Perfect weekend thanks to the W!

The Hotel faces the 9/11 Memorial. It is very well locates, especially for those who need to work in the area. It is also very convenient if you want to get to know Tribeca.The rooms in higher floors are really quiet, have a very decent size, especially considering you are in NY City. The staff is very welcoming and professional.The Hotel does provide room service. You can eat at the bar downstairs but it is francly below the W standards: very few options for breakfast and for dinner.All in all an acceptable choice if you are a W fan. if not, there are options in the neighborhood with a better value for your money. Also, they charge you over USD 15 for the WiFi.

We stayed there for 4 nights, family of 4 including a 3 year old. Had read some reviews that said wasn't child friendly, have to now disagree. On our first night we were left a complementary tray with cookies and milk, lovely touch. Views stunning of memorial pools , lovely to sit on terrace and enjoy a drink. I can't fault the rooms, luxurious. Staff very helpful and courteous. Agree lots of construction but didn't feel noise an issue. Would definitely stay here or this chain again ! Food was delicious as well, very trendy crowd in bar area and nightclub atmosphere in lobby.

Beautiful ambiance and decor with an awesome view. I attended a rooftop party-endless yummy food and delicious drinks. It was nice seeing the city from way up there!The staff was attentive and friendly. I would visit again.

The hotel does have an excellent view to the World Trade Center. When you enter the level 5 with the front desk you can go out pick a drink at the outside bar and just rest in one of many nice easy chairs. My room was 1405 also with perfect view to the 9 11 memorial park. The stuff was absolutely friendly and made me feel home...

Very trendy hotel as expected, room was very large for New York and everything felt modern. Very comfy bed and bedding. Fitness centre is superb and views from our room and the gym are fantastic, looking into 9/11 memorial pools and freedom tower. Great location if using Wall St or battery park or general downtown. We would probably stay somewhere more central next time as most areas and attractions are mid to uptown. Stone Street downtown (7 min walk from hotel is a hidden gem, outside drinking and dining and very cool area). Only downside is the obvious rebuilding taking place around the hotel means it's a noisy stay and construction starts about 7am. We ate at the restaurant below for breakfast twice, can't fault food but prices were very very high compared with diner and other breakfasts we had on our stay. Coffee $5! At least in the lobby area of the W they provide free filter coffee in the mornings. Overall, nice hotel but location perhaps not ideal for our stay.

It is a shame that we could only rate it 2 stars !! We stayed for 3 nights in this beautiful hotel !! Amazing room and stunning view !! The porters were very helpful !! So not bad at all until we checked out. The welcome desk said 'no' to every simple request we had, for example 'can you please print out the receipt for us' without a smile without any apologies. Not sure if he (his name is Rafeal Grayson) was just having a bad day but being treated like this was absurd. We have decided to let it go but our last straw was his reluctance to help us with the suitcases. We had 6 suitcases and he actually suggested us to carry to the 1st floor. I had to request "can you please send someone for help?" He did not even bother to look at us and gave us the face of impatience. Finally his colleague came to help us. Oh well what a lovely treat finally!! We are easy going people and normally will not make a fuzz over something like this. But this is an eye opener for us. How can someone like Rafeal be allowed to sit at the welcome desk!! He needs some serious training on how to treat customers. Help!!!Dear manager can you please read this !!
user_name:
Sssssssssssssssy
New York City, New York

review_body: We chose the W Downtown for our 24-hour stay in Manhattan, and could not have been more pleased. The bar is trendy, but small enough to feel cozy, and overlooks the Freedom Tower. The view at night, when both the tower and the bar are lit up, is particularly stunning. Our hotel room was clean and bright, the robes were luxurious, and the bed gave me the best night's sleep I've had in years. A request for extra towels and a razor was filled within five minutes. This is probably not a hotel for families with small children, but the young adults I was traveling with (ages 15 and 20) adored the lounge and the automated photo booth. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Standard W hotel feel - loud music in the lobby and people that don't eat enough - but bigger rooms than you'd expect and nicely set up. If you're staying downtown you could do much worse. And the view of the WTC site is remarkable from the higher floors.

Love the hotel. Just like every W I've been to the bed and mattress is just awesome! I have the best sleep in every W hotel.The room service is great, nice breakfast. Everything is very quick and hassle free. Location might be a bit busy ( didn't stay there for location since in a Nee Yorker) but for someone visiting it's actually great, close enough to everything
user_name:
NB_NYC2013
New York City, New York

review_body: The people at the "W" New York Downtown hotel were awesome. Very friendly, and accommodating. Beautiful hotel, spacious rooms. The best part of this hotel is the location. Easy access to everything you want in Manhattan and Brooklyn without the craziness and congestion. Highly recommend it.

My sister and I spent 3 nights at the W Downtown NYC in July 2015.We were upgraded at no additional cost and had a spectacular view World Trade Center, the reflecting pools at 9/11 memorial, and the museum. (Photo attached). The room was clean, the staff really helpful, and the location was PERFECT! Thanks to Andrew (the concierge) (for answering our many stupid questions and never making us feel stupid), Pete Villarreal (for help with special reservation requests) and Katherine Woods (for promptly responding to me about a concern). Already planning a return trip!!

It is a nice hotel located central downtown with walking distance to Wall Street, Tribeca, Soho, China Town, Brooklyn Bridge and the nice Battery Park area. The hotel is clean and trendy wih a nice rooftop terrace! It is a little bit noisy since it is on the side of the construction area of World Trade Center. Bar is trendy. Service is ok! Hotel is located very central with regards to using the subway system of NYC which takes you anywhere in the city in a fast and comfy way!

W New York downtown on Washington street was truly amazing, great view, great rooms and everything is up to date but the thing that stood out the most is the customer service i have received it was amazing, anytime i go to New York i will stay at the W. 11/10

I have traveled all over the world, usually with my husband. This time around i decided to do a Mother/Son vacation to new York city. This Hotel is so intimate and Stylish. The concierge "Andrew Brown" is the most wonderful and knowledgeable customer service rep i have ever come across during my travels. He goes out of his way to make your stay the most enjoyable. He deserves a big thank you. I promotion is in order.Sincerely,Jasmin El-HamadStayed July 16-19, 2015

Our room overlooked the 911 memorial and the beautiful One World Trade Center. Awesome view night and day. My wife and I never heard a sound from outside our room during nights. The room was modern and clean and the king bed was very comfortable. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. We were able to store our luggage without a problem. I was impressed with the help and directions that we were given by the concierges. Andrew greeted me by name and was as pleasant as can be.We were in New York to see the tourist sites and the hotel location was perfect for what we wanted to do and see. My son-in-law had recommended the downtown W and we were not disappointed.

Great hotel ! The only down fall is it's in the cut, therefore hard for taxis to know how to get to the hotel due to one way roads/construction. But the hotel room is really nice. The best one I ever been and room service nice. The food is expensive but worth it.

This hotel is a stone's throw from the 9-11 memorial and it's a fairly up and coming spot in New York. So no wonder there is a fashionable W hotel in the neighborhood. The hotel is trendy and swanky, and between the hours of 5-10pm the lobby seems to always have something going on. I would recommend this hotel to someone in their 20s-30s, but maybe not to my grandmother.

Staff not friendly, front desk agent sat on a stool, did not look up at all during check in. Had no idea what he was saying. Did not tell us about area, no maps, no interactions, worst experience at hotel ever. I picked hotel because my boyfriend had never stayed at a W before. Not impressed. Barking dog above us all day, nothing they could do because residence lived there. Bathroom door did not closed. Hotel worn down which confused me as I thought it was new? Room was noisy with random noises from other rooms, paper thin walls (other shower running and more). Someone dropped off a bottle of red wine with a note because of dark barking. No wine glasses on a trey and it was with a welcome note. Plus we don't drink that wine. If your going to make the effert to give a service recovery, do it right. We check out tomorrow to go to the Hyatt and look forward to not having to spend the money on a hotel that does not deliver. Bummer. The view was nice.

We had five traveling together to show our children NYC and the 9/11 Memorial. This is the best hotel to do both! Great location overlooking the Freedom Tower - big rooms for NYC standard - we had two queen beds and a baby crib and lots of suitcases and all fit fine. Great recommendations on where to eat. Must book early for Girginos at Wgner Park (Battery Park) only two blocks away but do it not to be missed if your at the W Downtown. Will recommend to others with families!

My husband and I stayed at the W Downtown last week for two nights. We loved our room and the view from the outside terrace at the bar is amazing -- it overlooks the 9/11 memorial and Freedom Tower. However, we were really disappointed with the service. We wanted to enjoy the view and grab a drink before dinner but the service was horrible. When we arrived, there were a few small groups at tables but it wasn't busy. We waited about 5-7 minutes then my husband tried to flag down a server. We waited another 5-7 minutes and no one had shown up so we left. Also, the following morning, I called the front desk to make sure I wouldn't have a problem catching a cab in front of the hotel. The receptionist told me that it shouldn't be a problem and the valet attendants could help me but when I got down there was no one there to help (this happened when we checked into the hotel as well). I waited a few minutes and then had to walk over to the Marriott and they had a cab stand there. Overall, I would go back to the hotel to grab a drink and enjoy the views but this isn't the level of service I'm used to at a W...
user_name:
Michelle L
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Good location, really over-the-top funky decor. I like modern and contemporary, but this goes well beyond that into weird.... Pink elevators, awkward elevator entrance and super funky decor make me want to choose elsewhere for future visits. Marriot is right next door and foregoes the weirdness that is W Downtown.... Still good location and comfortable brings me to an average rating for this property.

Starwood makes sure that all of its "W" properties are trendy from head to toe and this one is no exception. First, location. It is called the "W New York Downtown" and if you are not familiar with the various parts of Manhattan, it is in a great location in the Financial District, one block from the Freedom Tower and the 9/11 Memorial as well as within walking distance of many waterfront attractions, including the water taxi to the Statue of Liberty. Thus, it is away from the insanity of Times Square; there are no costumed super heroes trying to get paid for a picture. The only downside of this is that it is a bit of a haul up to Times Square or Broadway and the Theater District (we were in town for, inter alia, "Mama Mia!") The rooms are nicely appointed albeit a bit on the small side. Check-in is not a street level but on the 5th floor and, after a swift and friendly check in you have to go to a different bank of elevators to get to your room. This is a minor inconvenience at worst but is done for security. Rooms. We were on the 20th of 30 floors with a view mostly of construction and rooftop decks; there are some spectacular views but it was the Fourth of July weekend and none were available. Do ask about views, however. Some look right at the Freedom Tower. Worthy of special mention is the "Downtown Living Room Bar & Terrace." off the fifth floor which is an indoor year-round bar area but most notably has a wrap-around outdoor deck area, again with a spectacular view of the Freedom Tower and Monument. Ashley took great care of us on several visits. There is a restaurant on the first floor, the BLT Bar & Grill." The food there is good but not rave quality and the bar area has sports-bar-style televisions where we watched USA dismantle Japan in the World Cup final. All staffers we encountered were very friendly and helpful. We would come back here any time.

My husband and I stayed here along with 2 friends. Normally we opt for the Sheraton Times Square but that was booked. We were pleasantly surprised with how large the rooms were , the great view of the trade center, and the open windows.The beds were comfortable and the staff was extremely helpful. We enjoyed dining at BLT and the convenience of the nearby metro station. We are runners and were able to have our morning run to the Brooklyn Bridge and across in a short time.

We were excited to take our family on our first summer trip to NYC! Was even more excited to stay at the W! That is until we checked in. Apparently kids aren't the right cliental for this location. I get it, they want to be "cool", however, don't disrespect families in the process. We checked in early in the day and we were told that we had a king room and if we wanted two beds we would have to pay $30 a night. We opted to stay with the king and the rollaway( for a charge). Once we got back to the room(9 hours later) still no rollaway. We were told it would "be right up". While waiting, we noticed a HEAVY smell of Marijuana and loud music from the next room. We called about this and we were told security was "on the way". NEVER HAPPENED! We really weren't in the mood to give our kids a lesson in pot but had too. It was so bad that staff even made reference to it as our door was open in the hallway. OH and our rollaway never made it. The bellman who came to help us move rooms told me that they were sold out of rollways. We ordered it at 10am!. The "manager" (who I wont name out of respect) was less than empathetic throughout this whole process. How many calls about pot and my kids need to be made!? We made two and my wife had to go down to the front desk(in her robe) to get our rooms changed. Shame on you W hotel!!! I am sure you already know that your "cool" days are numbered. Time to step up your game and your customer service.

As a parent traveling with 2 18 yr olds, this was a fun hotel. It has a cool lobby with a bar, music, a free photobooth machine... Rooms are modern, with comfortable bedding. The hotel is in a quiet section of the financial district. It is blocks from 9/11 Memorial, Trinity Church, Wall Street, Battery Park, Brooklyn Bridge & the ferry service to the Statue of Liberty. Altho it is a very expensive cab ride to get uptown, it isn't as loud and busy as Times Square. The staff was terrific and very helpful. Bought tickets from the concierge for the hop on hop busses that run around NYC. I have been to NYC several times but this was my 1st experience w the hop on hop off bus. It was very informative, and an easy way to get around (& reasonable $79 for 3 days-including a ferry ride to the Statue of Liberty-compared to a cab ride to Times Square which was $45 + tip. Onlyminor complaint was the loud ice machines-with metal ice bins....

Decent high end Starwood property very conveniently located near most of the Downtown Financial firms. I was walking distance to the firm I was visiting. The rooms are a bit small but nicely furnished with interesting art and nice amenities. The staff at check in and check out went out of their way to make me feel appreciated. The concierge was helpful on multiple occasions in directing me to Starbucks and my meeting location. In addition he recommended Katz Deli and Sarge's Deli as well. I didn't have time to try Sarge's but Katz was a winner.Ask for an upper floor to help isolate you from the Street noise. I was on 16 and couldn't here the street.

I loved everything about this hotel from location to courteous their staff that contacted me before my arrival to make sure they could meet my needs. The lounge was closed due to a private NBA draft event but BLT bar and grill was delightful and open late enough for me to grab a bite. The rooms with views to the memorial and tower are spectacular! Cannot wait to return to the W downtown.

Amazing place to stay is very central to few of the attraction in New York City.. the W hotel staff is very attentive they give me very good tips to go around in in the city at it was my very first time at NYC.. room was clean and good space to be in NY

Me my husband and two children stayed Hereford Christmas.Such a lovely hotel very modern.Welcoming atmosphere with a little gift for the children and us when we arrived.Exceptional and breath taking view from our room. Loved every minute Thank you

Oh man, just stepping off of the elevator on the 5th floor lobby was a heavy taste of eye candy. The floor was immaculate black marble that reflected the incredible ceiling perfectly making you feel like you were walking on an uneven pace. The room was small but packed with everything one would need. The view from many rooms was outstanding of the Memory gardens of the Old World Trade Center and the new skyscraper taking its new stand in their place. The restaurant on the first floor was also excellent! IF YOU STAY there, don't miss out on the elevator rugs! :)

The W hotel is centrally located in downtown NYC, adjacent to the World Trade Center memorial pools and the new tower. It is a vibrant and busy area during the week, but gets calmer during the weekend when the financial area gets deserted. The lobby is located on the 5th floor, so guests must use two elevators to get from their floors to the entrance/exit. Check in was smooth. The lobby is very modern-looking, and the whole hotel has a very young atmosphere. Right next to reception is a bar/lounge that plays loud dance music at night on the weekend. The room is small but well-appointed. Like the rest of the hotel, it is very modern. The bathroom is also small but has everything a guest would need. The shower is incredible, though. Great water pressure!One complaint I had was the noise. There's always construction going on downtown, but I could hear noise from the outside quite clearly, and my room was on the 19th floor. It is easy to catch a taxi outside the hotel, although some streets in the area are blocked off for construction or on the weekends. There are several subway stops nearby serving most lines in Manhattan. Checkout took a little bit of time as there was only one person working the desk. All in all this is a very solid hotel, but it is definitely not a "classical" luxury hotel. The clientele is young and looking for good nightlife. I am not sure I would recommend this for guests who are looking for peace and quiet, or for families, but it is a very good hotel.

I am not used to staying in boutique hotels, so the W was a treat for me. The photos of the lobby you'll find online don't lie. You get to walk through this striped wonderland every time you go to your room, since there are two sets of elevators required for each ride up! (This is not as inconvenient as it sounds, once you figure it out.) The staff was super nice too, not always the case at one of these places. The room was cute (read: tiny but well furnished) with a window bench, retro-style fixtures, and a great bathroom. It was quiet. My only room-related complaint was that the AC vent blew directly onto the bed, making for an arctic sleeping experience. The bathroom makeup light also didn't work. But the location was excellent and like I said, the staff was very friendly. The one problem I had was that the cleaners threw away my custom-made posters because they were in a cardboard sleeve and must have looked like garbage. I was pretty upset about this but they were unrecoverable. The manager said they would add 5000 SPG points to my account. I don't know if this has happened yet.

This is a great hotel in lower Manhattan, which has come a long way in the past decade. We paid to upgrade our room to 2 beds (which was kind of disappointing to have to pay for) but we were also then given a view of the WTC memorial pools and WTC1 so that was worth it. The room was clean and modern. I do wish there was a lamp near the bed with an outlet, and not just a dollar store extension cord in a drawer. The Bliss bathroom products were great, as was the staff. The lobby is very loud until around midnight but that is kind of to be expected at the W, it was a fun atmosphere even when we were travelling with our 3 year old. Rooms were very quiet. All of the staff was super helpful and friendly, and we had a great stay.All in all this is a solid hotel and I would definitely stay again.

W standards dropping. Hotel room smaller than similar rooms at budget chains in Manhattan. Wall and floor coverings peeling. Shiny "chic" furnishings had decidedly worn feel to them. Someone took my iPod mini off the room desk while I was in a meeting, right before I checked out, to round out the experience.

The staff and manager went far beyond to ensure our stay was perfect. Everything went off without a hitch and they provide what they promise! As other reviewers have noted, it is starting to show signs of some wear, in particular the bathrooms, but is astronomically cleaner and better kept than most properties downtown. As others have noted, get a higher floor if you're not going to partake in the lobby bar area. Great location and easy access to subway. Skip the hotel restaurant and experience/support the local deli's and restaurants that are within walking distance. The price is likely higher than some other properties but well worth it. The ONLY drawback is that 2WT and other WT facilities next door are under construction, so the noise early in the morning may be bothersome. But you'll likely find that about anywhere in NYC...

I have been to this hotel many times to socialize in their bar, which on the weekends is packed and I would recommend their drink "the wall street bull" (I won't spoil it by describing it, but it should suffice to say that you must experience it) The lobby is extremely trendy and has a great feel. The staff was extremely friendly and appealing to a more youthful demographic. The views are incredible at almost any angle of this hotel and you really don't miss much when you look out the window. On the down side the hotel is showing signs of age with some ripped carpet, broken drawers, misplaced light-ropes. They're trying to take the trendiness of the lobby into the rooms, but it feels a bit overdone. They may have gone for the extremely unique at the expense of quality. Just didn't feel like the hype in the rooms. But let's be honest the view and the lobby make up for it and I would stay here again.

Beautiful, trendy hotel centrally located to downtown sights and activities (overlooks 9/11 memorial pools, close to Battery Park and State of Liberty Tour). Upon check-in (before 6pm), we learned that they had given away all of the 2 double bed rooms and only had single king rooms available, and no roll away beds. We had our two children (13 & 10) with us, so that was going to be a problem. The woman at reception was struggling with offering us a solution, when the manager, Katherine, came over and said she overheard our situation. She very graciously apologized and offered to select a corner, high floor room for us, and have featherbeds and extra comforters sent up if the kids did not mind sleeping on the floor. While not ideal, we agreed, and she discounted our rate, and offered free breakfast for us for being agreeable. The room was smallish, but clean, and nice, with a beautiful view!

Just got back from a quick 3 day stay at the W Downtown! This was my 3rd time visiting the city and 1st time staying downtown. The location of the hotel is perfect for those wanting to stay away from the craziness of midtown, but still close enough to other attractions like Battery Park, Wall Street, Little Italy and Chinatown and obviously the World Trade Center. I can not express enough how amazing the views of the Freedom Tower was. I happened to be there for my 26th birthday, and wanted to try things off the beaten path that only local New Yorkers would be familiar with. I could kick myself for not getting his name but the concierge on the night of May 30 was fantastic. He recommended a restaurant named Distilled in TriBeCa. He was nice enough to mention to the hostess that it was my birthday when he called to make our reservations. With that little mention, our waiter provided myself and my party with glasses of champagne and a birthday desert! The attention to detail at The W was above and beyond what I expected. I happen to work for this hotel company in New Orleans and I know that employees traveling often get overlooked because we are internal customers but that did not affect my service whatsoever. The concierge also took the time to book our Statue of Liberty passes and then have them delivered to our room while we were out and about in the city, making it so easy for us to get in everything we wanted in our short time. My friends and I had an amazing trip and I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in the downtown area.

As a Director of Housekeeping of a large hotel, I was quite impressed with the W. You could tell the hotel is well maintained and attended to. My room was very clean, and I had the good fortune of running into the housekeeper that cleaned it. She was very sweet and obviously was eager to help.The W bed was impressive, and I slept like a rock. Although it may have been from all the walking I was doing. Also, had a great view of WTC1, which was much appreciated. Keep up the good work W.

A bit expensive but we had a wonderful room and we overlooked the scene of ground zero. This may sound a bit ghoulish but it's really not. What has been done here is truly inspiring. There is a good restaurant, BLT Bar and Grill attached, and there are plenty of other choices within a short walk. Great location.

Stayed the weekend of 5/23, my fiancée has stayed at several other W locations and had given me glowing accounts of all of them, so I was very excited for my first experience! The room was small and cramped, but that's typical Manhattan, however I was thoroughly unimpressed with the shabbiness of the room, marks on the carpets and walls, floorboards chipped and scratched, some sort of bodily fluids/particulates caked onto the sink and a view of an empty dirt lot. Lovely. No wifi in the room, and no outlets near the bed. To top it off, I was charged $15 for some unexplained transgression, which is a small amount of money, but still rankles since I didn't use the minibar or any of the other nickel and dime 'amenities'. The W bed deserved the hype, but that was about it. I've stayed at nicer Holiday Inn Expresses and certainly won't be returning here.

In NY for business, location was perfect. Staff super friendly and obliging, really comfortable room. Free Wi-Fi a great asset. View on east side was not picturesque, but that's true for much of Manhattan as it rebuilds.

This is a typical W - pulsing music in the lobby, incredibly friendly yet casual staff, and great views of the World Trade Center. Ask if you can get a room with a view of WTC1 on a high floor, although even those facing the Hudson and the harbor are quite nice.

Stayed here for a week on business trip . Funky , modern - bit dark in reception at times - but can see the look they wanted. Rooms were of a good standard with everything you need and awesome views of twin tower memorial pools. Easy walks to subways, wall st Staten Island ferry etc etc. Still think London is the best city though !!

We had a wonderful experience at the W Downtown Memorial Day weekend. The front desk staff and housekeepers were friendly and efficient, the food and cocktails in the Living Room was on point and the BEDS - there is nothing on earth quite as comfortable as a W Bed. We had a solid stay and, being in the industry myself, I recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the city and looking for an all around amazing hotel.

Stunning views of One World Trade Center, typical impeccable W service, and a spacious room (by Manhattan standards), including the bathroom. The fitness center was above-average, and the breakfast at BLT Bar was top notch. The only downside -- spotty service at the lobby lounge (The Living Room), at which every table had a "Reserve" sign, despite being virtually empty.

Will highly recommend this hotel to all my friends, Excellent Guest Service, Nice people and Good location easy to reach using Public transportation. Fast check in and check out. Will definately come back Clean rooms. Keep it up.

Corner King fantastic view of One World Trade Center. Walk to Museum, Battery Park. Statue of Liberty ferry. Very clean, comfortable bed, silent, spacious for NYC room. Wrap around outdoor balcony bar. Nice complimentary coffee bar. Free WiFi. Parking listed at $60 but went on line and prepaid two blocks away $27 for 24 hours. Only minor complaint is water pressure in shower not wonderful.

We stayed a few weeks ago and had thought we were getting a W experience. What does that mean? Great service, stunning rooms, nice lobby and bar's, and that well W "scene" of exciting guests and an "it" place to be. Perhaps our expectations were too high, but they certainly charge you for that perception and we certainly didn't get that in return. The location is small, cramped, the service is uninspired to say the least, the bar is unremarkable and their lobby barely offered coffee or water, and then only in limited times. So what does this mean? Was it a bad experience, no. Would I recommended others here, no. For as many wonderful locations in NYC you can spend time to find a place that puts in the effort.

Our stay here at the W was very nice. Room facing ground zero was breathtaking. The hotel staff was so great. Room was very nice comfortable would stay there again for sure. Our first time in New York defiantly memorable experience.

A very modern luxury W in downtown NYC! Hotel is within walking distance to battery park, pier and wall street. 15 to 20 minutes drive to midtown/uptown Manhattan. Room was spacious and clean with stunning view of one world trade centre. Staffs at the front desk were friendly and helpful. Would love to stay here again next time!

Had a very lovely weekend with my girlfriend here on the heels of Wall Street. Balcony of the bar / lounge area overlooks the Freedom tower and the empty space where the WTC towers used to stand. To say the location is centric could easily be construed as an understatement. Design is modern and chic. Clientele is young, hip, and for the most part wealthy. Decor is forward thinking, classy, and of superior taste. Customer Service is friendly and attentive. Lives up to what you would expect from a swanky hotel in the heart of Manhattan.Would gladly return.

The hotel is very W, walking distance to pier for status of liberty and world trade memorial. good food selection nearby, convenient to subway station. Neighborhood is clean and quiet in the night. Also provided W service apartment which didn't get the chance to see.

I stayed in one of the fully furnished apartments. It was very luxurious. Almost a bit space age. The hotel is very new and faces the 9/11 memorial. It had an amazing view of the WTC complex. The bar has a very eclectic feel and serves up some great cocktails. One of few bars with a terrace. And a very nice gym and entertainment lounge upstairs
user_name:
asiagirl511
New York City, New York

review_body: Second time here for this event. Very close to starting points. Hotel is dark. We had an ungraded corner room with great view and decent size. Clean, well maintained. Appreciated free coffee in the morning in the lobby.

This is another 5 Star hotel in NY that charged exorbitantly but the word service is not in their dictionary. Staff are not that polite to start with even though I asked politely. Room is small & the regular toiletries are not found especially bedroom slipper. Paid close to usd500 a night to no avail. My suggestion if u want to stay around this location, try lower star hotels since 5 star hotels do not mean that you will get what you paid for. Nearby hotels within walking distance is Marriott Downtown & Club Quarters.

Location cannot be beat if you are visiting the 9/11 memorial. From the room, we can see the new WTC tower and the 2 memorial pools. The rooms are pretty standard and the service was top notch. The complimentary morning coffee and tea at the lobby are great! Just a short way to TriBeCa where all the great restaurant are. Walking along the Hudson River was so pleasant with view of Statue of Liberty!

Yes, this hotel is very contemporary. But if that's what you're going for, you've hit the mark. On certain nights, the lobby will be packed with people and loud music. But when there isn't an event, the lobby/bar area is much more relaxed. And either way, you have a great view from the bar lounge. The staff is very friendly, and the rooms are comfortable.
user_name:
Caroline W
New York City, New York

review_body: Very comfortable hotel. Many areas with view of WTC to relax. The rooms are small with small showers only but adequate. The coffee was good . The staff were all very helpful and friendly. 9/11 museum a must see

I have always had the nicest experiences staying at the W Downtown. The front desk staff is very friendly and give you a warm W welcome! In nice weather, one of my favorite things to do is to sit and have a cocktail on the outside terrace facing the WTC . The rooms are clean and the housekeeping staff is wonderful.

Trying to get to the lifts with a bunch of B and Ts blocking the way as reception area becomes a nightclub was bizarre if not annoying and then the rooms are very small and basic for the price and then sleep was hardly easy if you have room over the loud outside terrace bar

Business Traveler - was very convenient and available for my extended business travels, but was too contemporary for my taste. TV was mounted too high with sleek touch latch cabinets. Had washer / dryer and kitchenette (range & oven) in room - executive suites / extended stay. Great view into WTC Memorial and Statue of Liberty (from roof). Close to subway and Battery Park.

I was lucky enough to be offered a spot in Starwoods mobile key solution. I was weary if this technology would be helpful, but it really worked. What I really liked was the ability to go directly to my room. As for the hotel, frankly, given my age this brand does not really cater to me, and some of the experiences like the music are not exactly my cup of tea. Otherwise, clean room, kind staff, great location for me and I was tickled pink to be considered part of a high tech test

Was in town to visit a friend who was having an event in the Meat Packing District; was able to walk there - was a really nice day. At check in I received drink tickets as a special welcoming touch. The bar was happening, there is a nice outdoor space as well, the drinks were perfect and the service fantastic! I will be back!

What a treat to stay at the W for our quick trip to NYC for a college orientation. We had a fabulous view of One World Trade Center from our room. I loved the modern décor, and the hip public space in the lobby, where I enjoyed coffee and wifi and the NY Times on Sunday morning. The hotel staff sent a lovely note to my son congratulating him on college choice. It was a very nice touch. And Andrew, the concierge, was so helpful and patient. Thank you!

This hotel I must say blow my min, it was everything and more. The customer service was the best I've received in a long time. They catered to my needs and made me feel welcomed. If I were to ever plan another trip to NYC, I'd definitely stay here. They made my birthday getaway one to remember.

Fantastic hotel. Staff very nice, rooms very clean. Bed so comfy .Great place to stay . We found it a great location for all the sights, we walked everywhere from the hotel instead of getting taxis , Hoping to go book again for this year .Not a cheap hotel to drink at, ok for a night cap.

While working in NJ for a couple weeks, I wanted to stay in NYC for a weekend. Surprisingly, the W was one of the more reasonably priced hotels.Immediately after booking I saw an email come through from one of the welcome desk employees, Katherine, welcoming me and asking if I needed anything for the stay. The personal touch, even prior to the visit, was great.My room ended up being on a floor somewhere in the mid-teens on the northeast corner. The view of One World Trade Center and the 9/11 Memorial was simply incredible. Everything about the room was great - bed comfy, room quiet, and internet fast.A couple downsides - the internet was a bit pricey and parking was $50/night (though, I suppose this is to be expected in NYC).All in all, I had a great experience and wouldn't hesitate coming back.

My offices are in the World Trade Centre and this is such a convenient hotel for that. It's also pretty easy to walk or get a cab to great restaurants from here. Staff at the W are v friendly. Know that during the weekends the hotel does become a party hot bed. Bar is great, good selection of drinks and views over 'ground zero' are pretty epic from the balcony.

To W Hotel Downtown NY:BackgroundMy family and I were planning to celebrate my little sister´s sweet 15th. The plan was to take her to San Antonio, Texas. I jump in and suggested to go to NY, and while we where there stay at W downtown. I used to work at W Mexico City and since then I’m in love with the brand, and what a better way to show the brand to my family than taking them to the city where the brand was born.I never expected that my little sister would be sleeping the first night, and the night of her birthday in a rolling bed.We arrived to W Downtown around 2:00 hrs. of Friday. First I was surprised by the attitude of the welcome desk agent. No eye contact, no smile, and no warm welcome nothing that is part of W DNA. Then he went to back office and came out with Michelle Chang, who I assume was the manager on duty or night manager.The first thing she told me was that the hotel was sold out and there was a problem, there weren’t any double bed rooms. This was since my reservation was made under a Starfriend rate. (She really meant that cause I reserved under this rate, they could just take away my room?) And then suggested that she could look up for a room in other hotel. (Again suggesting to separate my family apart). She was rude, and not understanding my situation witch was: Reservation was made on the 12/2/14, 3 rooms with king size bed.Confirmation of the double bedroom was received on the 12/03/14 (witch I sent you when asked at the hotel)I was fully charged for the rooms + taxes of the 3 rooms 1 month before my arrival.Michelle told me that there were no rooms until Sunday, after several minutes she told me that the next day they would be able to change the room as the one payed. The difference between rate of rooms was supposed to be adjusted in the final bill, thing that didn’t happened, I was told that they would reimburse the credit card that was used to pay. (still waiting for that to happen).Then Michel told me that they wouldn´t charge me for the rolling bed, (this is offensive, It was the least thing she could do)So, we went up to our rooms, and my surprise was that my room, and my brother`s room with was supposed to be a king size bed, we got queen bed in the smallest room I’ve ever seen.Next morning I went down and finally met 1 of the 2 kind people in the entire hotel. Katherine Woods. But at first with the same answer that Michel gave me, “there is nothing we can do for you” and after telling that I had the confirmation for that room, she showed that she was in my side and helped me. Also helped me to move to a better room, (paying for it) and finally get a King size bedroom.On Sunday we ordered IRD service, first I can tell the WW talent was so busy she was making us a favor becoming one more rude talent that we interact with. Dinner arrived to the room and when we tried to turn on the light… didn’t work, we called WW for someone to come up and fix it. Finally a nice man came and helped us. But when we tried to start our dinner, we noticed that we didn’t have a corkscrew in the room, and the IRD talent didn’t opened, so again we called WW to have someone sent up to open the bottle.At my check out we met another WD talent who, as the first one, didn’t talked to us, no eye contact, no nothing. Just “want you bill printed or by email”. And like that I left the hotel. No inquires of my stay, nothing.When we arrived to the airport I noticed that I left my passport at the hotel’s safe. I called and a WW talent transferred me to Security, I can say he was nice but didn’t go any further than that. I needed to call an UBER tell him the situation, ask him to go to the hotel, and then give the information to the security talent. The passports arrived on time to the airport, what surprised me is that no one in the hotel was willing to help me, and better a driver that I have never met before helped me than the staff of a hotel where I stayed.Overall I left the property unsatisfied. Sad of the way the Hotel manages the brand identity; the real DNA and the reason W Hotels are what they are in the market. W hotel don’t just sell rooms, they sell experiences, and yes, maybe for me one of the worst hotel experiences I’ve had. You are the newest W Hotel in NY, but clearly you have lost your path. This was the 3th time I stayed @ W Downtown, and I’m sure the last one.

other than the view being beautiful and relaxing the atmosphere is amazing . the staff I have encountered every weekend I go there are very welcoming and helpful . they are always trying to make my stay better every time. Can't forget to mention how delicious the food is . I had such a great time the first two stays I make it my little weekend getaway from home every chance I get. I never have any complaints about noise or housekeeping constantly knocking . I tell my friends about my stay every chance I get. If you're looking for a little lounge area with music, drinks & finger food the 5th floor of this W hotel is where you need to be . Always a variety of music thanks to the different DJs they have.Thank you to the staff ! especially the young woman who works Friday evenings * I know her name starts with an M I want to say Makeya but I may be wrong :(* she is always to kind, attentive & informative .

I booked our 3day/2night stay-cation as a surprise for my boyfriends birthday and it was a great stay. I checked in with Tracy who was very helpful and accommodating, I informed her we were celebrating a special occasion and she helped me secure a room with a view! I inquired with the concierge, Henry?, regarding liquor stores and grocery stores nearby as I'm not familiar with the area; I am impressed with the follow up because not only did he give me directions but he sent a marked map up to my room. It's the small details that make an impression. Room- very clean, well appointed, wonderful huge windows with a lot of natural light, and the bed - SO comfortable. Location- very convenient. Within walking distance to a lot of sights and history that downtown has to offer. There are also many subway lines nearby so you are only minutes from anywhere in the city. Hotel: In general I think this is a great place to stay for younger groups/couples - ranging from 25-40. There is Happy Hour in the lobby bar and DJs, it's style and décor is definitely trendy and geared towards a crowd that is here to enjoy the nightlife the city has to offer. I wouldn't consider this a child friendly or family oriented hotel; not a bad thing- just informational for others doing their research. All in all I would definitely stay at the W downtown again.
user_name:
Jenn5225NYC
New York City, New York

review_body: Hip and trendy hotel as we expect from W! My room was big and nicely decorated with a spectacular view on Ground Zero. It actually reminds you all the time about what happened here some years ago :-(. Great concierge who gave us good restaurant suggestions.

NY is exensive we ALL know that but come on!!!!!!!!!!!!!! One night stay was $500+ for a rinky dink room that faced a construction sight and an empty lot. And the bathroom door didnt even have a lock that held. Service was good. But the room was very small. It was like being in a cruise cabin. Better off staying at the Marriott or Ritz Carlton at least there's a view. And to check in you have to go to the 5th floor then walk thru a lounge that's made for a Dead trip so psychodelic then to another bank of elevators that went to your floor. And there was the cleaning cart fromthe time we checked in and still there when we checked out. Not cool to watch dirty laundry

This hotel has an amazing view of the new World Trade Center building and is located between the financial district and battery park. It's a great location near a lot of subways so you can virtually get anywhere in the city. The bar area is really cool and there's a free photo booth in the lobby which is really fun. From the street you have to take an elevator up to the 5th floor where you check in. From there you have to take a different set of elevators to the your room. This is a bit annoying in the morning when you're trying to get directly down to the street but you have to go through two sets of elevators. In terms of the room, the beds are super comfortable and consistent to other W's I've stayed at. However, the showers aren't my favorite - they have a dark brown rubber tile throughout that makes it look small and dirty. Also, the light fixture in my bathroom was falling from the ceiling. Overall it's a really nice room though. The staff is amazing - they're very friendly and are there to accommodate any need you may have. The bartenders were also very nice and gave good food / drink recommendations.

Stayed here with last minute booking and was skeptical about it but when I got to the hotel I could already tell the view was going to be amazing - I chose not to valet my car as the garage is right behind the hotel and you gotta tell them you are staying at the W they will give you a ticket and make sure you get the ticket stamped at the front desk to get the hotel rate. We, my girlfriend and I ended up checking in at the front desk and the lady that helped us was Makaiya and WOW! I must tell you her customer service skills were outstanding, I am in the wireless industry and have to deal with people everyday, I pick up very well on good customer service! let alone excellent customer service! She treated us so well and made sure I would enjoy my stay. I requested a room with a view and she made it happen even though there werent many rooms left and I had to pay to upgrade which is fine but she did make it happen! Thanks to MAKAIYA for everything! All in all, i loved my stay and I think this is the hotel I am going to book in the future when I come spend the night in the city as it is very close to all subway lines and the view and comfortable views are fantastic!

I know this might seem strange but I always travel with my favorite brand of Pop-Tarts, kind of a morning ritual. I requested someone to toast for me, and Michelle the third shift manager went out of her way to take care of this strange request both days I was there.Thank you Michelle!As a suggestion, the morning coffee area should have some snacks for early morning risers, because there's nothing open besides walking 2-3 blocks in the wind and rain for whatever you need. Also, the coffee doesn't come out until 6 a.m. and us older people do get up early. Also, on the ground floor lobby entrance, maybe a few chairs if your waiting to be picked up. Everyone from housekeeping, door guys, front desk staff, and managers were extremely pilot and helpful for everything. We only had one cliché, and that was we waited 15 minutes to get a to go coffee in the restaurant, and couldn't even get because our taxis was waiting.

Visiting New York City during my spring break. I decided to book the W hotel because my girlfriend wanted to see the WTC memorial (Freedom Tower and Ground Zero) so why not right? I really love the design of the lobby; it has a really great and positive vibe. The staffs that were there was friendly and professional. I arrived in the hotel around 7am but the check-in time was at 3pm, lucky, the room I booked was available a little before noon. The room was really amazing; the view from the room was what you see in the lobby but much higher. The bed we had was really comfortable and the covers were the warmest covers I’ve ever slept on. The bathroom was interesting because one of the walls in the shower was a frosted glass wall; the other side is the bedside so you can really see the “outline” of the person. No complaint there. There is a fitness room and it was bigger than most hotels I’ve been in. There are around 3-4 treadmills and 2-3 stationary bikes. They do have dumbbells and it goes up to 50lbs, which is pretty good for a hotel. And they also have an incline/flat bench. One thing this hotel has that no other hotels really have is a cable machine that goes up to 100lbs. At nighttime, the lounge turns into a club. The lobby was dark, there was a live DJ and they have a bar. It’s a great opportunity to meet new people and have a few drinks after a tiring day. Overall, I really enjoyed my stay there. Even though it’s a bit pricey but you get what you paid for and it’s definitely a great experience. The staffs there were really professional and kind. The room was really modern. I would definitely recommend people to stay here if you want to stay in a luxurious hotel.

We stayed only one night at the W and found the hotel to be perfectly adequate. The rooms were small but well-designed and thoughtfully appointed. Some of the rooms have a fantastic view of the new World Trade Center Building. The Front desk and Lobby is on the fifth floor, with very modern and artistic decor. If you are interested in staying Downtown and you get a good price this hotel is definitely worth a try!

Chill atmosphere. Best complimentary coffee served in the lobby I've ever tasted. Excellent staff. Amazing views of freedom tower. Patio equipped with lounge chairs and scenic view. Will definitely stay again.

The view was incredible. The value was right on for the hotel and area. The outdoor terrace bar is a lot of fun. The suites are very W with beautiful bathrooms. This was a perfect getaway hotel to Manhattan for a great price for a weekend. The area around the WTC is thriving so there is quite a bit to do on that end of the island these days as well.

Quick getaway in Manhattan (lower Manhattan to be specific). The location is immediately south of the WTC site and memorial, and within walking distance of several subway lines. (My one and only complaint is that the very closest station, Rector Street on the 1 line was closed due to construction - certainly not the hotels problem, so it's always a good idea when relying on NYC transit to check on weekend maintenance closures....they are fairly common).The staff really bent over backwards to be gracious, hospitable, and accommodating. My particular room had a view of the WTC site....while I'd visited it before, it was quite a different vantage point and quite striking especially at night.The usual (amazing) W amenities apply here. Superb bed, bath, etc.The hotels' style and architecture are, jaw dropping, and exciting. I'm a "bit' beyond the age demographic (not that much!) , but still appreciative of the intent and execution.Kudos to everyone at this hotel - very well done all around.

Everything was great except for the fact that I had to pay 6 dollars to use the internet for 15 minutes. Charging for internet usage in this day and age at a hotel is antiquated and frustrating. 6 dollars? Seriously? Also...why is one bottle of water in the room free and the other one costs 7 dollars ? 2 eggs, bacon, toast- 28 dollars. Deluxe cheeseburger- 22 dollars. That one is a puzzler.

Traveling for a business meeting, I booked the W as it is wishing walking distance of Wall Street. Prior to my arrival, I received a warm email from Casey welcoming me to the hotel and asking if I had any special request. That set the tone for the rest of my stay. Check in/check out was efficient and professional and I was delighted to receive a room upgrade, which came with a complimentary bottle of wine, and my room had an amazing view of Freedom Tiwer and Ground Zero. The area around the hotel is very quiet in the evenings, with very few sirens or ambulances to disturb your sleep. It's also only a block away from the 911 memorial and the NYPD are present throughout the area at all times, making late night walks feel safer. The lobby is not directly accessible to the street, as you take an elevator from street level to the check in area. As a W, it has a funky decor, and vibe, which I like, and most nights there is music and people mingling and hanging out in the lobby. If you opt to skip the hotel breakfast, Cafe De Novo is only two blocks away and opens very early (6am) for a fast take away/sit upstairs NY breakfast. You can join the construction workers who are picking up their friend egg sandwiches and buttered roles. The food is good and quick. One of my favorite things about this hotel is that you can catch the subway, which is within walking distance, for traveling to either the East and West side of Manhattan. Normally, I stay in mid-town which requires a long walk, a cab or shuttle at Times Square if I am traveling cross town. Here, it's not an issue. All in all, excellent stay, great service. I will definetly return again.
user_name:
NOIDK
New York City, New York

review_body: My husband and I visited this location friday night . Was impressed by the decor and the vibe of the bar. The host at the check-in desk was very polite and accommodating. The view from the Spectacular room was amazing. Had a view of the Freedom Tower, it was awesome at night. The room itself very chic, all modern upgrades and comfortable. The bed was comfortable as well, not like some hotels we've stayed at, which is a must. When we left the hotel for a night out catching a cab was a breeze with the assistance of the hotel porter. When it come to breakfast, even thou we put in our request at 2am, breakfast was at our door promptly at 8:30 am. very impressive. And the food was great. All and all an excellent experience. Will definitely stay here again.

We stayed 1 night at the W Downtown and everything met or exceeded expectations. The hotel and room itself were beautiful and the view of the 911 memorial from our room was an unexpected treat.The staff who met us on arrival were the perfect combination of friendly and professional. They helped us with a few extra questions and needs and did so with a smile. As usual the W brand has done more than it needed to do to keep our business, can't wait to stay with them again.

Stayed here for a week in November. My room faced the Freedom tower which provides for amazing views at all times of the day. If you're working in the financial district, the location is great. If you're here for leisure, the area is not the most vibrant at night and few fun restaurants and bars in the neighbourhood. Subway is very conveniently located though, just round the corner from the hotel. Friendly staff and good size rooms. Free apples at the reception desk and complementary coffee in the morning, great vibe at night in the lobby/bar area. This along with the welcoming carpets in the elevators :) (changing a couple of times a day wishing you 'good morning' or whatever time of day it is) make for a good stay.

Excellent customer service from the front desk to the concierge; everyone is very friendly and has a guest first approach...little thank you's and hellos go a long way.The gym is fantastic, excellent amenities; the lobby is exciting and makes you want to just hang out and enjoy the vibe.The toiletries in the bathroom in each room are also great.Rooms overlooking the reflecting pool provide a great view of the area....

Have stayed at this property multiple times and always had top-notch experiences! Its location within the city is extremely convenient and we had a very easy time getting from the hotel to all other areas that we wanted to visit. The staff is great and very knowledgeable about the area. The property itself is very trendy and upscale.

The W Hotel is the place to stay when in downtown Manhattan. The location can not be any better. Walking distance to shops, restaurants and the Freedom Towers. The room are all upscale and top of the line. If you stay get a room with the view of the Towers and reflecting pools. Also enjoy the outdoor rooftop bar and restaurant.

Great location, walking distance to trade center and near subway lines.The room was okay. I expected more from the W. Overall the room looked warn, dinged up, small. Bed was comfy. Snacks in room are convenient, but pricey - one of which was a month past experation. Free breakfast drinks - always out of coffee, so I drank tea. Tea was yummy. Trash was full the one day and the area a general mess - needs more attention. Bar area was pumping during evening, fun - paid $14 a glass for so so wine!Bell hop is hidden on the first floor...When leaving, requested a copy of the room bill. No additional charges. Then 2 days later a$60 charge on my cc for an in room bottle of wine, which I didn't order or take from mini bar. Had to leave 2 messages and then call a 3 rd time requesting manager before getting someone on the phone to discuss. They were very understanding and promise to reverse the charge.

Great hotel in a surprising great spot, next to the Freedom Tower. In fact, my room had a direct view of the Tower and the park below. I was on the 9th floor. Lots of convenience stores near by, a few restaurants, an old style boxing gym with a Ring. Steps away from two subway lines. Ten minute walk to the Staten Island Ferry. Five minute walk to the multi million dollar food court inside the old financial center on the water by the Hudson. There's even an ice skating rink there. Spectacular views! The W is typical of a hip trendy younger 30's to 40's and some really fashion conscious 50 year olds. Modern everything is the theme...along with their slogan, "Whatever Whenever!" My room was huge by NYC standards. Bathroom was small but very efficient, equipped with a glass enclosed rain shower. Great bed, great view day or night. Incredible built in window seat that stretches two panel windows wide approximately 8 feet in total length. Loved it. Will definitely stay here at the W Downtown NYC again.

If you're near the 9-11 museum or anywhere in lower Manhattan, it's worth a trip to the 5th floor bar at the W Hotel. Amazing view of the city especially at night and the lighting inside the bar itself is mesmerizing. The atmosphere probably ranks a little above the drink selection but those weren't bad either- just fairly typical cocktail and wine list. Fun and reasonably priced with friends.

I have stayed at this hotel twice, and both experiences have been great. Pros: Friendly staff, quick check in, great location (right across the street from the 9/11 memorial, within walking distance to financial district, brooklyn bridge), great "living room" aka lobby/lounge area, great outdoor space with a bar and views of One World building. There was also a giant, 4 ft tall connect four game out on the deck. Compared to the other W Hotels in NYC, the rooms here are the nicest in my opinion. Tip: Since the hotel is right across from the memorial and one world building, try to get a room facing this area.

I had a great time staying there. Location is awesome, I'm a big fan of lower Manhattan and this W location is facing 9/11 memorial and museum. It's all beautiful! Rooms and bathrooms are big! Very modern and stylish. Great views! I will stay there again soon! If you are proud of USA as I'm, consider stay there and support lower Manhattan rebuild and the peaceful and beautiful 9/11 site.

Stayed at the W Downtown Manhattan with my family for a couple of days. Hotel was wonderful, clean, comfortable and great service. I will return. The hotel was well located and easy access to the subway system. We had a wonderful breakfast in the restaurant. We also injoyed the bar and dJay to much. The staff was outstanding

Comfortable modern rooms with enormous windows and incredible views of 9/11 Memorial. As SPG platinum, we are consistently upgraded and receive welcome gifts when visiting this hotel. All around service is consistent and attentive. W Aficionados should note that, although this is one of the more modern properties with a full service lobby "Living Room" with music, it is among one of the quieter W properties, so if its a thriving party scene you're after this may not be the place for you. It's much better suited for couples seeking romance and those who wish to escape the hoards within Times Square. On the flip side, the fact that it is a 'W' should not scare off families, as the rooms are among the most comfortable you'll find in Manhattan. Location is good to be within walking distance to the museum, Century 21 designer discount shopping and the Brooklyn Bridge downtown area.

Great location downtown. Right across from the Freedom Memorial. We had two rooms next to each other on the 19th floor and one of them was a corner room which was nice as it was larger and had two large windows with good views. The only thing I think it needs is better lighting in the room as the lighting was dim and the lights next to the bed were not adequate for reading. The bed was very comfortable. The front desk staff were very helpful andthe restaurant on site was quite good. Overall, a nice experience and we would go back.

The first thing that struck me was realizing that the hotel front desk isn't by the front entrance. You have to take the elevator to the fifth floor to check in. The hotel staff provided excellent service which compensated for the uneven room experience. The standard room is small and shaped like an Aloft room - bed taking up most of the floor space and a narrow bathroom. The bed linens were crisp and clean, and I slept well. The bathroom linens, however, were frayed, spotty, and worn. The water pressure in the shower is great, and I got a nice hot shower before going to bed. In terms of decor, the bathroom has brown tiles which is tricky because unless every single crevice is super clean, the dust and dirt in corners show and makes for a messy appearance. The room carpet is also a dark brown shade and very easily shows where the corners and edges hadn't been vacuumed thoroughly. My room service experience was extremely slow and they didn't accurately fulfill my order.If staying downtown, I'd prefer the Andaz again.

I live in Florida but commute to NYC on business almost weekly. I invited my 21 yr old son to come up for the weekend before xmas and just hang out and see some of the typical NYC sites. The hotel is well located near Downtown attractions and close to the subway. The service was good and helpful. the music in the lobby (5th floor by the elevators) was loud and not conducive to conversation. seems like the hotel does not know what to do there, is this a dance club or what? The only negative I can really say is the price of the restaurant meals. the first day we paid almost $50 for two eggs and toast. at a deli a few blocks away we had much better fare for a fraction fo that. Same for dinner. Overpriced and not that good quality.

I booked a room for my sister a few weekends ago, she loved it!She loved the view from her room, we needed 2 beds but they only had kings. They gave us a rollaway which we did not mind much.The staff is very friendly. Deffinetly going back.

I really enjoyed staying at this hotel! They were so welcoming and the rooms are so cozy. The location is great, we walked most of the time and there was a train that takes u straight to Timesquares in less than 10mn.

Doesn't get any better. Outstanding location, accommodations, and service. We had an incredible dinner, breakfast, and lunch. Quality, promptness, and service second to none. Robert and Scott, managers, couldn't do enough! Nakia easily checked us in and set the tone for a wonderful weekend! Planning our next visit next month! Drinks overlooking the World Trade Center was most memorable. One the best W's anywhere! Mike & Marie

After staying at nearly all starwood hotels in NYC, this is my new favorite. Though the location isn't prime, it's perfect for a weekend trip that requires just a short subway ride to excitement. I was surprised to see that when looking out the window of my guest room, we were located right next to Ground Zero.The room was great but what made this hotel amazing was the service. Every member of the talent staff greeted us warmly and every request was completed promptly- both of these traits are incredibly hard to find in NYC hotels.
