BLT is a great bar and restaurant and the room service was prompt and delicious as well.

My wife had been to NYC before but this was my first trip. We wanted to see everything we could but knew that staying in Times Square or Midtown would be too loud and busy for us. We picked the W-Downtown for it's proximity to the 911 Memorial and the Statue of Liberty. When we first decided to go to Times Square we asked the doorman at the W to call us a cab. It was around 5pm on a Thursday. He said that he would call us a cab but that traffic would be impossible so why don't we take the train? We were a little worried about taking the subway but since the train station was only a few hundred steps from the hotel and he told us how easy it was to ride it we decided to try it. Not only was it easy and cheap transportation, it avoided traffic and got us there in a few minutes. We used the subway every day all day from there on and made our trip awesome! We also loved the rooms, even though they are small, and the hotel bar and restaurant were great! The staff was more than accommodating and let us check out at 2pm instead of noon. We will come back to NYC soon and we are DEFINITELY staying at the W-Downtown every time!
user_name:
Doug C
Dallas, Texas, United States

review_body: This W is an awesome location, although very south in the downtown manhattan (financial district), it is next to the 1 subway which makes it very easy to go anywhere. Inside is very W, hip and cool. Staff is very happy to work there, smile, and ready to help in each corner and super service oriented! We had an awesome room with an awesome view and everyone was great to check-in to check-out! I would totally recommend this hotel to anyone!!!

I booked a room at the W New York Downtown for a night out with friends. It was the perfect place- trendy, spacious, and in a perfect location. Our hotel room looked out on One World Trade Center and the 9/11 Memorial, which was an incredible view.The hotel is also in a great location- close to several subway stops, including the 4 and 5 trains which makes it so convenient if you are coming from Grand Central. There were a few small things that made this hotel stand out. There is a photobooth in the lobby, which was fun to use before we went out. The Bliss products in the bathroom also added to the feeling of luxury.I highly recommend staying here for a trendy, luxurious New York experience.

A late booking, hotel is good , great bar, and a real buzz about the place, we just got a pretty poor room, up in a attic , small , with a good bed, did not quiet have the W feel, but the rest was very good, just pay a bit more than a standard room

We arrived late on a Friday, having flown in from the UK. We were greeted on the sidewalk by a great guy who took the car keys. By the time we checked in and arrived at the room, our bags were minutes behind us and the car safely parked. I have to say that arriving late into the lobby was disconcerting, with the dark lighting, people, dancing & music it felt like we'd wandered into a nightclub. Very strange when you have no expectations of it. Our room was well set out. Bathroom small but functional. Lovely products. The location is the biggest plus. This part of town is hot, and getting hotter by the month. I wouldn't want to be based anywhere else in NY.

I booked to stay at the W hotel Downtown NYC for a 4 night stay for my boyfriends bday. Upon arrival we were met by lovely staff who checked us into our hotel room and took some details. We were offered to join the Starwood's hotel membership for free (sends you emails about hotel offers & you get membership points etc) I agreed and in return we got free wifi for the duration of our stay as well as two free drinks cards at the hotel bar! Definitely worth doing as you have to pay for wifi in the room otherwise. I'd read reviews that the hotel rooms were small which didn't bother me as we were in New York to be constantly out doing things not sitting in the room. In fact, when we arrived the rooms were a perfect size, the bathroom was well designed and spacious. I'd also read reviews the rooms were noisy, but both my boyfriend and I slept perfectly without a problem at all (This could have been due to the fact we were so busy during the day nothing would have been able to wake us up at night!) The bed was like a cloud to sleep on! The rooms were cleaned to a high standard daily and the bed was changed.On my boyfriend's birthday we came back to the room to a bottle of champagne and a crate of beers! Such a lovely touch. The atmosphere of the hotel was perfect, we had a group of friends come to meet us at our hotel before going out for dinner one evening. They were all impressed with the bar and ceiling in the lobby area! The drinks were quite expensive, but only what we were used to as we both work in London.The only downside was the location. I presume perfect for business as its located next to the finical district but for all the touristy bits I would have wanted to be more uptown. As this was my first time in New York I wasn't sure where would be a good place to stay. Having said that - we had no problem getting around! During the day, to get Uptown it only took about 15 mins on the subway. During the evening we got a cab to restaurants as I didn't fancy getting on the subway in high heels and a dress! Personal preference - the subway runs late into the night so never a problem getting around. Cab uptown costs roughly $15. There were always cabs parked up outside so we never had to wait. We didn't eat in the hotel as we wanted to explore what New York had to offer. There's a lovely sports bar/diner next door! Also 100% recommend Keen's if you are looking for a special night out!Definitely would recommend this hotel 100 times over, so perfect for everything we were looking for. Thank you W hotel :)

Well designed, great cool atmosphere starting at the lobby welcoming through the corridors and room.The spectacular room is spectacular as it is relatively big, very comfort and have beautiful views to ground zero.Service by the staff was efficient when required, but not more than that.Public transportation to everywhere in Manhattan is great - all trains are available within up to three minutes walk. Restaurants and bars are close to hotel but not with large variety.

Returned to room after a long day only to find the weirdest scene in the lobby. A dj and drummer were set up in front of the elevator and the weird cast of characters from what looked like a Fatboy Slim video were dancing like highly choreographed dancers who have never danced before. The cast includes a 2 year old and a guy in an electric wheelchair-spinning the controls.I retreated to my room for sleep and found the music to be obscenely loud. Called and complained. Desk clerk said there's nothing he can do because they advertise music until 1:30 am. My reply was a reasonable one: "This is unacceptable. You don't advertise music in the guest rooms until 1:30 am." His response was there's nothing he can do, this includes no room change. This music was not set up in the bar on the 1st floor (far from rooms- the reasonable choice), nor in the lounge on the 5th floor. It was in the middle of the lobby, In front of the elevators. Bad idea. Easy decision to never come back. I'm here now and need to wait another hour before the music stops. This is insane! There are plenty of places to go if I want to stay up late. But where if I want sleep?

I am an SPG Gold Member who travels frequently for work.This hotel has a great location in the financial district and is close to subway lines. I found the front desk, concierge, room service, and bartenders to be extremely helpful and personable. Definite thumbs up on service.Downside is the following - none of my SPG room preferences were acknowledged or honored. I prefer quieter rooms (high floors, away from elevators, and no connecting door). I also prefer feather free rooms due to allergies. I was placed on floor 8 (the lobby is on floor 5) almost immediately outside of the elevator, in a connecting room, with feathers. I would expect the desk clerk to acknowledge my requests and acknowledge that they were unavailable (or whatever the reason is). To have those wholly ignored is unusual.The rooms are incredibly loud. Both the noise from the hallways and the street makes sleeping difficult. A higher room may help.The rooms are a bit small and there is zero bathroom counter space. But, the room was clean, minus some stains. Very happening happy hour scene at the bar and downstairs restaurant. Room service is tasty and prompt.The gym is a good size, clean, open 24-hours with decent equipment.I would stay here again- if I could get a my SPG preferences.

The lobby is very nice although check in took some time. Loud music all the time can give you a headache. We had no sleep the night we were there because the room next to us imported several "party girls" and were loud all night. Apparently the walls re thin because we heard everything. We called the front desk to no avail. This seems to be a hotel for those who want to party all night.

Sexy hotel. The lobby is gorgeous with a great outdoor patio. Staff was great and patient. But if you need a taxi do not depend on the staff outside. They just wave their hand up when I taxi drives by down the street. You are better off just walking to the corner if you are in a rush. So basically if you need to get anywhere try to leave early so you can get entertained by the outdoor staff for their antics.

This hotel takes the cake on trendy! From the elevators to the ceilings, it is all decked out in trendy decor. You have to take two different elevators to access the hotel rooms, which was a bit odd and frustrating if your hands were full. Location is amazing - right next to the subway and 9/11 memorials. Our room was very small and a bit too contemporary for my liking. I'd prefer a softer bed and a chair to sit in with a book versus the window bench. The shower was great and the products they provide in the bathroom were scrumptious. There is no coffee in the room, and these days, that is unheard of. It's such an easy thing for hotels to offer to make you feel more comfortable! We ate in the first floor restaurant for breakfast and enjoyed it. Fast service and I think we were the only ones there. The staff were very friendly and helpful - the concierge was fantastic and pointed us to a sushi restaurant we never would have found on our own. We were here for two nights for work and despite the odd interiors, I recommend this hotel for it's location at least.

For the business person who has meetings in lower Manhattan this is a perfect spot, if you're staying in Manhattan for the weekend, not such good spot. The hotel itself is a very typical W hotel. The staff are average, but really not that great. The rooms are tiny, the bathrooms are really small. The bed is comfortable, the room was pretty clean. Breakfast on a weekend was as complete disaster, as they had one waitress serving a very full restaurant, you waited forever for your food, drinks and the quality is well below what you having to pay. I have stayed here during the week, when breakfast service was fantastic fast and efficient, and perfect for meeting business people around the area. If you're willing to walk for a few minutes you can get to some nice restaurants just beyond Wall Street, the cabs up into Soho pretty cheap, and you have trains very close to the hotel. Unless I have a business meeting in lower Manhattan I will not stay here again especially on a weekend.

Stayed one night at this hotel for a conference at nearby City Hall. View of WTC site is amazing, room was nice and average size for NYC standards. Great customer service throughout. The lobby is fun and futuristic, although rather nightclubby, primarily designed to be a nighttime feature with LED lighting, etc. A great hotel if you need to be downtown.

We stayed here recently for a wedding and thought it was great. I can honestly say that this was the most comfortable bed that I've ever slept in. I got home and immediately Googled buying a bed from the W. Weeks later, my fiance and I still talk about how nice it would be to buy that bed. Given the comfort and other amenities, the price was reasonable for a hotel in NYC. We would definitely stay here again.
user_name:
RMinDC1
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Definitely the best W in NYC. Stayed there almost 2 years ago and it was already good. Came back this November. Management seems to have changed. Worked out perfectly! Everything improved there to a true 5 points performance. cool bar at the lobby with dj at nigtht. stayed at a cool corner room with perfect view to memorial and freedom tower! will be back as soon as possible. two thumbs up

The view from my room looking at the WTC Site was awesome. If you can get a north facing room. The Staff including Casey and Teela were responsive and helpful. FYI there is a Subway stop on Rector St about a block down around the corner. If you plan a stay downtown I would recommend staying here !!

We have stayed here many times as the location is near where our daughter lives. We use Starwood hotels everywhere we can as they have excellent benefits for frequent travelers. This hotel just added keyless entry for Starwood members. you can check in on your mobile phone, get your room number and use the app as your room key pretty cool. The rooms are not that big but request the rooms that face the Freedom Tower if possible. The view is amazing. Service is very good and we like to hang out at the bar off of the lobby (on the 5th floor) when the weather is nice. It is a "W" so it goes without saying that the decor is funky but interesting.

You feel a lot different in this hotel, full of energy with music playing everywhere, in the lobby,lift. Rooms are nice, but little compact, which gets compensated with its terrific location right in front of WTC.

Large room, modern and well-finished, large shower, high quality in room complimentary products, very nice view on the 9/11 Memorial (we received a high floor at check in time, as requested). Either public spaces and our room were clean and tidy. Nice people, only one guy on the 1st floor a little bit rude. Ladis at the concierge desk were kind and helpful. In general, a pleasant place to stay. Maybe the position is a little bit far from Soho and the 5th Ave, nevertheless there are many metro lines stopping in the nearby.

This hotel has a nice downtown location and if you are lucky you can get a great view of the new Freedom tower. It has free morning coffee. The rooms are small and the bathrooms are very poorly laid out. You get soaked by cold water when you into the shower to turn it on. We asked for subway information on a Friday evening around 6 PM. The sole employee at the front desk had zero understanding of the subway system (which seems improbable).

This hotel is very conveniently located in front of the former World Trade Center site, and is also close to the Brooklyn bridge and convenient to West Village and Chinatown.Room is minimalist - well, what're you expecting from this trendy and chic hotel chain? It is comfortable for two people, with a working table and an armchair plastered to the wall where the tv is, and a comfortable seating area by the glass window, allowing you to be taken in by the stunning newly built One World Trade Center. Bed was comfortable, and amenities are provided. The hotel uses a brand called 'Bliss' as part of its bath products. The bathroom was a little small though, with enough room for only one person at a time. Sticking to its minimalist design, the shower us gifted with a rain shower. Perhaps it could do with a shower faucet as well cos this come in handy for some people.And oh, the soundproofing is probably an issue here. With the higher ceilings, my voice echoes and oh, I can hear the people outside quite clearly. Are the walls a little thin?

I paid more than I usually pay for a hotel because of the 4 1/2 star but I found the rooms average they had modern updates but the rooms were small had a great view of the freedom tower and the foot print memorials not much to do in this area but subways are very close

I had the pleasure of staying at W Downtown this past weekend and had a great experience! From the moment of arrival you could tell that this was the place to be in the Financial District. The decor of the hotel was excellent, location for public transportation was great and beyond all the service was perfect. I was helped by the Concierge and purchased tickets to the 9/11 Museum which is only a block away and a humbling experience that is very worth it. The bartender at BLT Burger was excellent and rememberd me each time I went for a drink. The Style (Housekeeping) team was awesome as I called upon them twice for additional things in my room and they arrived very quickly.Lastly I was upgraded to a Cool Corner room and it was very worth it with such great views.If in NYC this is a great place to be!
user_name:
Dillon E
Chicago, Illinois, United States

review_body: We have gone to this hotel now three times. They always have great service. We love the downtown location. The view of the WTC and Freedom Tower from most rooms and from the really great bar at the check-in level is just awesome. Rooms are big on New York standards. It's worth getting the Cool Corner Room. All the great restaurants in Tribeca are a convenient one mile walk.

My bridesmaids picked the W Downtown as the spot for my bachelorette party. The hotel is chic and cool (we made good use out of the photo booth)! The rooms are stylish and we had the most incredible view of One World Trade Center. The lobby bar was really accommodating and a lot of fun. Quinn was our point person there and he really made sure that I had the most memorable night start to finish. The staff was very helpful and super friendly. It's definitely a great place if you're looking to go out in Manhattan and really have a fun time!
user_location: New York, New York, United States
user_name:
Caitlyn B
New York, New York, United States

review_body: I'm stayed at a number of NYC hotels, and this one is great! Larger than most hotel rooms in NYC (including other W's in the city), the amenities and linens were so nice, and the view looked down over the 9/11 memorial and over the skyline. The best part of the stay was the staff though-- Most accommodating team and so friendly. They organized a space at the 5th floor bar for a dozen friends at a moments notice (don't forget to take pictures on the photo booth by elevator too!). Especially if you plan to spend a good amount of time downtown for the sightseeing or meetings, this is a perfect home base. 5 stars!
user_name:
Yakmel
New York City, New York

review_body: My friends and I stayed here for a foodie field trip around NYC and it really was a great location. Every restaurant or food hub we went to was only a short train ride away. Not to mention, there were numerous train stops located around the hotel for easy access. Also, upon arrival they welcomed us with a bottle of Chandon and cake! It was a very wonderful surprise and made our stay their even more enjoyable. The hotel itself is beautiful and you really feel it come to life at night. The view of the freedom tower is a perfect way to close out the night before diving into one of the most comfortable beds you will ever sleep in.

Organized my best friend's bachelorette to have a "stay-cation" at the W downtown and it was the best decision I ever made. From the moment we got out of the taxi we were greeted by Jose who immediately helped us put everything on to the cart and safely unloaded it into our rooms. We then made our way to have a toast (a sweet courtesy from Quinn a W manager) prior to getting picked up. The bar server Ashley was so sweet and patient with us rowdy girls. The service was excellent and Ashley was more than attentive with us. Edwin, another manager at the hotel made sure we were always happy and well taken cared of. The attention to every detail was IMPECCABLE. I recommend anyone visiting NYC to stay here. Couldn't have had a better time. As someone who is in the service industry (I manage a bar uptown), I am accustomed to a certain type of attention and judge accordingly. I like the personal experience and thats exactly what the W Downtown provided.

Great downtown location overlooking World Trade Center site including the memorials. Easy access to subways, fantastic room service and friendly staff. Slightly quieter part of Manhattan which is nice too.

What an amazing Hotel. We had the most beautiful room, it over looked the world trade center and the 9/11 memorial. It was beautiful. The rooms are a little on the smaller size, however that can be expected at it is New York. It is conveniently located close to subway stops and great restaurants. I would stay here again for sure! A+

Met friends in NYC to do theatre, dinners, cocktails and some sight seeing...this hotel was super clean, modern, and our backdrop was the world trade center! The staff was very helpful with suggestions and the bar on the fifth floor was fun to finish up at after coming back "home". They made delicious martinis!!! So overall- we would highly recommend this hotel, it was WOW!!!

This W Hotel is walking distance from ground zero and the new World Trade Center being built. From the hotel, you can see the tower soaring up high! There's a subway just right behind the building so it was so easy to go uptown as well. When you walk in their lobby, the first thing you would notice is a display of probably a thousand LED lights on the ceiling that are put together and shaped like waves. Also, in this same lobby, there's a party every night with a DJ!!! I think this is the face of modern-day NYC!The rooms are very bright and the color theme is white which I love. We were sightseeing most of the time so we did not get to interact with the staff much. However, those we encountered were very pleasant. We came from a red-eye flight and arrived very early in the morning so we weren't expecting early check-in. The hotel was able to check us in before noon which we greatly appreciated.Food in the restaurant was good. Our only concern was that our breakfast took a long time before it was served. They were probably busy. When it came, it made it worth the wait, though.We will come back for sure!

From entering the property on the first day of the visit to departing on the last day, the W New York Downtown was great! The Welcome Desk staff was very kind and helpful while checking in and assisted in setting up the keyless phone entry. The property and rooms are very nice, and one of my favorite W set ups. The views off the LRB are great as well, looking directly at Freedom Tower and the Memorial. Style(Jason?) and In Room Dining were wonderful as well. No issues with anything we had ordered and the room was always prepped upon our request or when we had exited for the day without being disturbed. Tila at the concierge desk was quite helpful and had a very positive friendly attitude as well! Thanks for the Hospitality and I will definately be returning to this property when visiting NYC. Nice touch with added waters in the Mix bar. BLT was wonderful as well! The in house made Marinara is simply fantastic! Cheers!
user_name:
mcreynolds687
New York City, New York

review_body: The service was excellent and each experience with the staff warmed my overall impression of the property, which was, jarring to say the least. While I appreciate the clean designs in the bedroom/bathroom, and was fine with the small but well utilized space, the main lobby, elevator platforms and bar area was over stylized in my opinion. Nonetheless, the stay was over all nice.

Stayed for one night with my boyfriend. We joined Starwood's rewards group when we checked in, so we got an automatic upgrade and had a nice room on the 21st floor. Our room had views of the 9/11 Memorial, which was beautiful night and day. The room was clean, the bed was super comfortable, and it the whole set-up was spacious (for a New York hotel). Plush robes and Bliss toiletries were nice touches.We didn't have many interactions with the staff, but the ones we had were professional and friendly.The surrounding neighborhood is pretty business-oriented (though the Memorial is next door and the Statue of Liberty/Ellis Island ferry not too far away) so there's not much in terms of nightlife around. But it's close to several subway lines and easy to get to trendier neighborhoods like the LES. The hotel also has its own club, but we didn't check it out so I can't comment.I'd definitely recommend the W Downtown to anyone looking for a nice getaway!

I had a truly wonderful stay at this W, the front desk staff were so pleasant & accommodating. The room was spacious, comfortable & clean, the bathroom had a great oversized shower & lovely Bliss products. I would highly recommend this hotel & would certainly stay there again.

The hotel is exactly what I needed for my three night stay in New York. I felt at home the moment I walked in the door and the staff showed empathy for my concerns and questions. The location is perfect. The room was clean and so was the entire hotel. I enjoyed my coffee first thing in the morning and it was hot--just the way I like it. I will stay at this hotel again when I return to New York.

We went there on the last weekend of October, celebrating our anniversary and we were very wellcomed by fd agent which even suprised us by sending a bottle of champagne to our room! The view was just outstanding and the service from the concierge superb...always willing to help out with the best suggestions. Every staff member the we had the pleasure to speak was incredible friendly which made our trip even more special! We love it!

We really enjoyed our stay. There were no surprises as everyone was friendly, courteous and helpful. The room was large and comfortable and always very clean. We stayed 3 nights and found that the hotel is conveniently located so that it was very easy to find our way around. We had dinner at the hotel one evening and were pleased with the atmosphere and the food.

Stayed at W Downtown for 4 nights for a vacation in Summer/Fall 2014, booked via the Starwood Better Tomorrows rate. SPG Gold Member at the time. Mentioned in the reservation that we were celebrating a special occasion and was pleased to find a chilled bottle of champagne awaiting us in the room upon check-in. Staff = very accommodating and friendly. Room = clean, typical W-style chique, small but not unexpected for Manhattan.Location = excellent, if you desire being away from the busier parts of the city. Easy enough subway access, although sometimes cabs were lacking in this area of town. Was able to easily access the East River Promenade to go on a 10mi run one day, the next day we walked up the west side of the island, hit up a nearby Shake Shack and walked up to Tribeca and West Village. Beautiful views of the new WTC.Price = expensive, but again not unreasonable for Manhattan. Overall, would stay here again if looking for an quiet escape from the hustle/bustle of the City while still having convenient access to places in Manhattan.

We stayed here for three nights and we were impressed. The location is downtown, by the World Trade Centre site, so it's great for downtown (and fine for all of Manhatten really, because it's very close to the Subway stations for mid and uptown) and the hotel seems very modern. As is quite often the case in New York, the service is cool to the point of freezing cold - which is a shame. Other than that, and the fact that you have to pay for wifi other than in reception, there's nothing to fault. The hotel is really comfortable, with very nice beds and the rooms are reasonably big by NY standards. It's also quiet by NY standards. It all feels very clean, shiny and well looked after too. There's a nice bar, which gets busy (but not horribly so) and there is great free coffee at the bar til 10am, which is a nice touch. We didn't have the breakfast. Overall, if the staff could be a bit friendlier and wifi free, this hotel could be perfect.

The location was great for us attending a wedding reception. We were there only one night, but the staff was friendly and helpful. This was our first time in NY. and we needed some help getting around. We were directed to some great places to eat and drink thanks to the Front desk staff.

I've stayed at this hotel a couple of times for a few days with my Mom and we had a great time during both stays. The hotel is perfectly located downtown with easy access to buses and the subway. Rooms are very spacious compared to other NYC hotels. Service is good and the staff are helpful. Both times I was upgraded to rooms with a nice view of Freedom tower.
user_name:
corky_c
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed 3 nights at this property and really wasn't blown away by services. Upon arrival, doorman didn't assist with luggage out from the cab and simply just indicated to proceed to the 5th floor for check-in.Thankfully check-in was smooth and speedy, but again I was left to manage my luggage and hand-carry on my own to my room.During several attempts to have a large bank note changed to smaller notes, none of the attempts were made successful with the front desk staff responding with either "oh, I have no change" or "sorry, I'm not carrying a cash float". It seemed like that was the hardest request to get sorted.The room itself was nice and clean. Spacious enough for 2 and I was assigned one with the view of the 9/11 site.Service at BLT where breakfast is served was far better than service at the hotel and made for a positive start to the day.Overall, a decent stay but certainly a let down service-wise.

I recently stayed at the W Downtown for my Bachelor party. We had 3 rooms in total. I requested them to be all doubles, after booking single rooms by accident. The staff was very accommodating and helped us out. All three double rooms we had were very spacious and clean. Not one problem at all. The concierge, Nicole, made a great resturanat recommendation for our breakfast the following morning. We enjoyed drinks and small plates at BLT too which were very good. I would stay here again and recommend it to anyone.

W New York Downtown is a great place to stay if you want a top notch experience. Amazing view of the Freedom Tower and 9/11 memorial gardens from your own suite. The place is within walking distrance to China town, financial districts and the water. The friendliness of the staff is an added bonus.

We had a wonderful stay. The staff was very helpful. The view was absolutely magnificent. We were with family members in New York to celebrate my son's wedding. There was a short walk to the subway to take us uptown to the museums.

Love the W. The staff is friendly, the rooms are functional and stylish, and I always have a great experience there. Super modern, great views of the WTC Freedom Tower, and the restaurant downstairs is great.
user_name:
Mike B
Los Angeles, California, United States

review_body: Great staff and great location. Room was clean and spacious. Really enjoyed the outside seating area on the 5th floor with a great view of the freedom tower. Bartender was very attentive and knowledgeable.

I booked a group of 4 rooms to celebrate my 10th wedding anniversary (I was married in NYC in 2004) and our visit was better than perfect from the moment of our arrival. Our view of the 911 Reflecting Pools to the spectacular view of the Freedom Tower was breathtaking. Our room was immaculately prepared and well serviced throughout our visit. On the first day, a member of our party lost a diamond tennis bracelet at the BLT Bar. We noticed it within about 2 hours and immediately began retracing steps from the hotel room through the lobby and back to the Bar. Two Bar employees, using cell phone flashlights, dug around under the booth and found the bracelet where it had been kicked into a dark corner of the booth. We had breakfast each morning in the BLT bar and enjoyed happy hour each evening in the living room. This may well be my new favorite hot spot in NYC! Thank you for an amazing beginning to the next 10 years of my marriage! We'll be back!

Stayed at the W to celebrate my birthday in Manhattan. What a wonderful stay! The hotel provided me with a bottle of cliquot to celebrate the night (my fav!) wonderful views of lower Manhattan and 9/11 memorial. Overall wonderful stay. Highly recommended for celebrations in NYC!!

I really liked the room, nice bed and bathroom. Really nice view of the new world trade center from the window. When we had questions about NY the staff was really helpful and nice to us. Enjoyed my stay, would book this hotel again any time!

The room and amenities were great. Loved the location and the view of the freedom tower is unsurpassed. I will stay here again. Easy access to subways and Brooklyn.There was a dance party in the lobby on Saturday night. Unexpected but interesting. Wasn't noisy in the rooms.

We stayed as part of a large group attending a wedding at Trinity Church nearby. On the one hand, service in the lobby was excellent, and the hotel offers unhindered, sobering and thought provoking views of the 9/11 memorial. On the other, both the common parts and bedrooms are small, and some of the furniture looks tired (there were scuff marks on some of the fittings in our room). There was no bath - only a shower. The hotel felt somewhat cramped and not particularly comfortable. It is also expensive (due to its proximity to Wall Street) - we paid $555 per night midweek rate. There are better value hotels for leisure stays elsewhere in NYC. We would not choose to stay again.

I stayed at the W late in September for 4 days. I was in town on business and the accommodations had been arranged by my company. The room was very clean and modern, though on the small side. There was a window seat looking out at the city views as well. I loved that there was a Homedics sound machine in the room, just like the one I have at home--helps drown out the city noises. The bed was very comfortable and I slept well. I was really only in the room to sleep so it was perfect in that regard. The only cons were the location. If I were travelling for pleasure, I'd choose a hotel in a more lively location, with more restaurants and bars. The view, while beautiful and serene, might disturb some. We were across the street from Ground Zero. Lastly, I shared the room with a colleague I didn't know. Fortunately we became fast friends, laughing about the frosted glass window into the shower. Maybe not the best idea for a double room.
user_name:
Cheyenne H
Austin, Texas, United States

review_body: This hotel was in a great location, clean, and had comfortable beds. The hotel's design was very modern and chic. Within walking distance, here many restaurants, The 9/11 memorial is literally right across the street. We enjoyed the hotel bar/terrace for drinks. The rooms were small, but typical of NYC. I come here on business a lot, and will definitely stay here again. Overall, the hotel is good, but service levels seem applied inconsistently.

To start off, if you have ever stayed in a newer W, you know what to expect here; interesting and trippy light treatments, sculptural elements everywhere, fantastic air deodorant, darkness. It all combines for an effect that leaves you saying to yourself, "I shouldn't be enjoying this as much as I am because I realize how over the top it is, but who the hell cares. This is fantastic." First of all, the lobby is on the 5th floor (ground floor lobbies are SO old school. What are we, farmers?). As soon as you get out of the elevator to check in, you are a little blind because your eyes arent adjusted to the dark confines of the area. Luckily, the staff is super nice and is used to people getting off the elevator having no idea where they are going, so they call you over and get you all checked in. The staff was great. Checked in with keys in less than 5 min. We got a room on the 24th floor and it was fine. Not the most amazing view (we werent on the WTC side), but it certainly wasnt the worst. You had to pay a ridiculous amount for wi-fi (c'mon guys. Really?). The room was tiny, even by NYC standards. There was not enough room for us to have our luggage out on the floor and still be able walk around the bed. I am sure there are bigger rooms available (got this room the night before on a Priceline robbery), but this was humorous small. Honestly, I didnt care all that much because the bed was probably one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in. It ranks up there with some very high end properties. The look of the room is very Philippe Starck-esque. minimal and beautiful. The bathroom was also gorgeous and very edgy. Next to the insanely wonderful bed, the next best thing about this place is the location. Very easy to walk to the Brooklyn Bridge, Wall St, NYSE, Battery Park, Staten Island Ferry, WTC Memorial and all the other sites in the financial district. It also has a pretty easy escape route to LGA if you need to get to the airport. Not a ton of time fighting surface streets in Manhattan. It seems like half of all the subway lines funnel down around the bottom of the island and they are all 2-5 blocks around the hotel. Very easy to get around.Overall, this is a great property. Yeah, we all know its like staying in a hip nightclub full of 22 year olds, but this club is worth it.

Stayed at the W downtown for one night during a quick weekend jaunt to NYC. The pros: the hotel is very hip, very posh design with a cool bar area. Received fantastic service from front desk staff including some free drink coupons and a room upgrade (I am Platinum, though, so expected). The rooms are pretty roomy, and very funky but fun modern design. The corner rooms have really cool window seats, with the WTC view being pretty awesome. Also, the bed is spectacularly comfortable (not sure if it is a Westin Heavenly Bed, but it's as comfortable as HB or better). The "Cons" - the location is convenient if you are spending time in Lower Manhattan, but the exact location in Financial District isn't in the middle of much except for the WTC Memorial. It was a little tricky for cabs to get to the hotel due to construction and one-ways (though I didn't have a problem waiting for longer than 8-10 mins for an Uber). Ultimately, the hotel was about 30% more expensive than the Westin Times Square per night during the same weekend, and although I hate Times Square, the TSWQ Hotel is probably a better value for the price. Nonetheless, if you are OK with the Financial District location, then this hotel is a winner.

The location of this hotel is perfect for doing business in the financial district. The lobby turns into a full bar/ night-club on the weekends, and as I was trying to locate my colleagues for a dinner meeting in the lobby bar somewhere between a large bachlorette party and the after-work drinks crowd.The concierge service was very helpful in making arrangements in New York for me prior to my stay, and arranged very professional (albeit expensive) car service for me. However, the service levels during my stay varried widely - I never did receive a news paper, which other rooms on my floor did. I didn't have my room made up until very late (4pm) one day, and the housekeeping staff did not seem to expedite the request for cleaning. I also only received turn-down service one of the three nights of my stay. I'm not sure that newspapers or turn down service make or break the stay, but it seems odd that the services were applied very inconsistently.The room was well appointed, and the bed very comfortable.Overall, the hotel is good, but service levels seem applied inconsistently.

This hotel was a great location, very clean, and VERY comfortable beds. The hotel's design was very modern and chic. The subway was close for a zip uptown, and there were many restaurants, etc., within walking distance. The 9/11 memorial is literally right across the street. We enjoyed the hotel bar/terrace for drinks. The rooms were small, but typical of NYC. I come here on business a lot, and will definitely stay here again.

When you can't stand the crush of humanity in Times Square anymore, try the W Downtown. It's a comfortable, very hip hotel with fantastic views of the Freedom Tower and 9/11 Memorial. After buying theater tickets in Times Square we escaped to the W, where we could walk the sidewalks without being jostled and enjoy a quieter side of New York. The staff were very pleasant and accommodating, the room quiet and clean, the bed very comfortable. Also I love the Bliss products they offer in the bath. The design of the hotel is so cool, it always makes me smile. And it's an easy subway ride to anywhere in the city you want to go. The only negative was Sunday morning, when a band started playing loudly in the plaza outside the hotel. I think it was a road race event. It seems every weekend in good weather there are parades or races or demonstrations somewhere in the city, they're unavoidable. But otherwise we enjoyed our stay at the W, an oasis of hip comfort in an overcrowded, over-caffeinated city.

We stayed here for two nights and it is quite a nice hotel in the downtown area. The property is what you would expect of a W Hotel, but I think this place distinguishes itself because of its staff. From the concierge to the bartenders, everyone was friendly and supremely helpful. Next time I have a need to stay near downtown, I will definitely consider this property.

This hotel is uber chic-"wow" inside and out. The entrance to the hotel is a few steps away from ground zero in lower Manhattan, at the base of the new Freedom Tower. Inside and the hotel is gorgeous - If you have 20 something kids or young at heart friends, take them to the W balcony bar for trip they'll enjoy. Rooms are small-but cozy and well appointed.

Great alternative location to uptown and right next to the Freedom Tower and 9/11 memorial. Lobby is not on ground floor so anticipation builds while you take elevator up to check in. Very modern lobby with lobby bar. Once in our room, very very cool minimal room with nice corner view. I'd definitely recommend the W Downtown if your looking for something different and close proximity to SOHO & Tribeca. Friday night in the lobby bar was hopping with a live DJ and the outdoor space here is really great to enjoy a drink. Definitely recommend.

Stayed at this hotel during the winter last January. The room was very modern and chic. Not a huge room but it had a great view of the Freedom Tower. The hotel is nicely situated in the heart of the wall street area and the word trade memorial. This hotel is kind of pricey even for manhattan but does offer a great location. It was clean and the bed was comfortable. I did not eat in the hotel restaurant as there are so many places to choose from within walking distance or a short cab ride. I was a little disappointed that my waste baskets weren't emptied during our stay. Not sure why but we did mention it to the manager on our departure. They have a nice club/bar that you can visit after coming back from dinner. I would recommend this hotel mostly for the location.

Situated in the Financial District, this is a fantastic place to stay! We came to NYC with 10 friends in tow to get married. Temara, Nicole on Concierge and the rest of the team looked after us before we even arrived with prompt e-mail responses to questions I had. All the staff (especially Ray!!) were nothing but ultra friendly and helpful. The rooms were great - we had a Cool Corner Room overlooking the 9/11 site and this room was quite big by NYC standards. The windows open a little as well which is quite refreshing. The bed was one of the most comfy I've ever slept in and the room over all was very clean. The Bliss products were also fabulous! We had no probs with noise from other rooms or from any functions going on downstairs whatsoever. The very cool outside bar & balcony area was just beautiful to sit at and enjoy a drink as well as the amazing view of the Freedom Tower. My only negatives where that there were no tea or coffee facilities in the room (although it was no problem to get a mini coffee machine sent to the room which they kept well replenished). But you had to drink from paper cups which I didn't enjoy. But really - that's it. Other than that I wouldn't hesitate recommending this great, well valued hotel to any one. It's also really close to the Subway which made it super easy to go uptown and it took no time at all to walk into Soho, Tribeca, Chinatown, Little Italy and the Lower East Side. Thanks so much W Downtown for looking after me and all my friends so well. We'll definitely be back!

Relaxing and New York City are not something that go hand in hand. However, this was such a restful stay. Beds are comfy. Pillows fantastic, great water pressure and just a fun vibe with very attentive service. The lounge is a great space to hang out late evening for a night cap after a full evening. The thing I loved most is that the rooms are really sound proof. We had a family with a kid ( Odd for this hotel one would think) in the next room and never heard him or the TV or ANYTHING ever! I was honestly surprised. Tip - Ask for a room facing the World Trade Center - The view is inspiring! It was a little pricey taking cabs to midtown ( about $20) but once we were tucked into our room we forgot that little thing.

I stayed for two nights and I was impressed by the modern hip decoration in yhe rooms and the hotel in general. It is conveniently located a few steps from the subway. My only recommendation would be to avoid eating in the hotel. The prices of food are ridiculous and for a fraction of that you can find great places to eat close to the hotel.
user_name:
Eliana G
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel was a bit pricey however it was in a great location with the redline subway just a few minutes away and the yellow & green only a 5-10minute walk. Great location near the world trade memorial. It had an amazing view and was clean & tidy. It was annoying that there were no scales to check the weight of our bags upon checkout.

Deeply meaningful location overlooking the 9/11 Memorial Park and a laid-back, but attentive staff make this W a good experience. It's a bit off the beaten track so if you are needing to get to mid-town locations and W is your hotel of choice go for the one on Union Square - it's excellent.

One mistake we made was hoping prices would decrease as we got closer to the date. Such was not the case. On the labour day weekend the best we could do was $280 per night. The location was ideal for visiting all the sites we wanted. First impressions were good, the lobby was clean and stylish. On check-in I handed over my credit card and SPG gold card, hoping this would maybe get an upgrade. Nothing like that happened, so off to our first room. The room was on the seventh floor. The room was incredibly small. You walked in and two feet in the door you were beside the bed. There was enough room to walk around the bed and go to the bathroom. My wife was furious as the room quoted in the reservation was supposed to be 240 sq feet. That room was not even close. Back down to the lobby and my wife showed the paperwork for the reservation. The clerk said that we should have been put on the upper floors. Off we go again. This room was small as well but a little more space. I have attached photos of the view, if you are lucky ask for a north facing room. You would then have view of WTC memorial as well as the new world one tower. Facing west you don't have much to see. The room was clean and modern. You do hear noise from the hallways. I phoned down to confirm that Internet was included as I am SPG gold, alas since I had booked the hotel through Expedia I was not entitled to free internet. The price is$14.95 per day. However there about three free wifi signals you can get if you open the window. We had no problem accessing the internet. As well there is free internet on the fifth floor and as well a lot of the subway stations have free internet. There is no coffee maker in the room but between 6 am-8 am there was free coffee in the lobby. Or you could order coffee from room service for $20 plus delivery. The hotel is in a good location but not ideal to hang out in. The bed is comfortable with quality linens. Was it worth the price? Not really but the lesson learned is do try last minute, better to reserve in advance.

My daughter and I stayed at this hotel for one night before returning to California. We got a room with an amazing view of the 9/11 Memorial.... we could see the water towers perfectly. The staff were both professional and friendly. Bar area was gorgeous too! Not your typical New York sized room either - our room was really big and it had a large window seat!

Even though its located in the more conservative business district....it has Miami written all over it! Parties in the lobby and decor to send you into groove of club life. The rooms are very modern with a very comfortable feel! The amenities were plentiful and staff so helpful. The room also had an amazing shower! I suggest if you are going to stay here stay with someone you are involved with ...the shower is spacious! This hotel set the standard for me in what I expect in the future for travel.

Why? Well it is in a great location that's true.It is well presented - true.But it could be better with a few simple changes. Like moving the toilet roll holder. Who wants to sit on a toilet sideways to avoid the loo roll.The gym is a token. Needs some better kit in it.Tea/coffee in the room or available in reception all day/night would help.Bar open 'til late would also be good.The rooms are good, clean and well equipped but for what you pay I don't think you get value for money.

Our room was clean, spacious and had an unbelievable view of the memorial and waterfront. Comfy window seat to sit and enjoy the view. The subway is 5 blocks away on Rector Street - very convenient. There's tons to do in the neighborhood but definitely stop by their 5th floor Living Room Bar and Terrace for a cocktail!

The hotel was extremely nice although my room was very small, this is to be expected given the fact that the hotel is located the financial district. Within walking distance of the world trade site, Brooklyn bridge and battery park which was a huge plus. The staff was very friendly and the room was clean. I would recommend this hotel to others.

I love W hotels. My first experience was with the W Times Square three years ago and on this particular trip we stayed at the NY Downtown location. It was amazing. So glad that the 911 Memorial Garden and Freedom Tower are complete because three years ago they were not. Although there is still a lot of construction going on this location is very handy to the subway and taxis. I stayed on the 9th floor and had a great view of the Memorial and the Tower. My room was very clean and fresh. I love the vibe of the W hotels. Very young and chic. I feel like I am in a nightclub when I was in the lobby in the evening. The financial district does become a bit sleepy after 6 and on the weekends but that's okay. It's a quick subway ride to any other location in the city. Loved it's proximity to Centruy 21. I purchased two pair of shoes within an hour of arriving. I would stay again, but will probably try another W just to get a good feel for them all.

Really enjoyed staying here! I had to check-in early for an event and my room wasn't ready but since I had recently signed up for their rewards programs, they upgraded my room to a beautiful corner room overlooking the World Trade Memorial. The beds were the best I've ever slept on while away from home. Really did feel like sleeping on a cloud like they advertised. The restaurant downstairs was exceptional. Would definitely stay here again and absolutely consider staying at any of the "W" hotels because of my experience. Very clean and really really comfortable.

Great location next to Freedom Tower and a close walk to everything downtown. Tribeca is not too far as well. The classy lobby is on the fifth floor and most rooms have a good view of downtown and some of the waterfront. My fabulous corner room was adequate and big enough for NYC, my gripe would be the bathroom door... difficult to open and close. Overall, this is what I expect from a W property.

The W near Wall Street with its splendid terrace overlooking the WTC is a destination for business or pleasure. The room was cozy but huge windows opened it to skyscraper views. Amenities included down comforters, bathrobes, and wifi along with a spacious glassed shower. There were complementary copies of the Times and fresh coffee or herbal teas in the morning. There is both a fine restaurant and day spa in the building. The room rates were acceptable for NYC. I would definitely return.
user_name:
gerihanna
New York City, New York

review_body: Very nice hotel with an exclusive downtown atmosphere almost borders on pretentious but not quite. Lovely location across from World Trade Center memorial pools and museums. Easy walk to battery park city and attractions. My one gripe is the unisex bathrooms on concierge level-- needs more constant upkeep-- good bar location...would definitely recommend.

Used to quality of W hotel, this one is no exception. The quality of the service is truly good. The personnel were really nice and professional. I got Upgraded and as an SPG Member can’t thank the direction enough for that gesture. I really appreciated that and so did my girlfriend. There’s a spa, a pool, that was really relaxing after a day visiting the city. Speaking about visiting, make sure you go to….

I had business trip to New York city every year. There was my first time to stay in W Hotel - Downtown. My experience are:1) Location: near World Trade Certer. 2) Hotel: Hotel located in higher floor of the building. It provided you the good city view.3) Room: it was comfortable.4) Restaurant: foods are nice.

Hotel is clean, modern fixtures. Great decor for the young and middle-aged crowd.Located across the street from the World Trade Center site.A convenient taxi ride to the Brooklyn Cruise Terminal.Staff very friendly and helpful.

I stayed at the W Downtown a few weekends ago. I love the Warm Welcome from W staff- I love the Staff- I honestly love the location. It was great experience to stay here and be able to view the new Freedom Tower and 9/11 memorials. it took my breath away just seeing the view. It's close to sumbway and cabs.I will definitely be coming back and staying at the W Hotel Downtown- So Classy and trendy... Love it.
user_name:
Rashylove1
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I stayed at the W Hotel-Downtown one night on the July 4th, 2014. The location is great given that we were able to walk down to see the fireworks and also walk across the street to visit the 9/11 Memorial. It is also about $15-$20 cab ride to Times Squares. I have stayed at other W Hotels and they all exceed my expectations. The staff was friendly and helped me with a map of the city so I knew where I was going. On check out, I was able to leave my bags in storage while I went sightseeing one last time before we caught our flight home. We also had a great view of One World Trade Center (Tower One). I would definitely stay at this hotel or any W brand hotel and would recommend it to friends.

Loved staying here. Stayed at W on Lex last time in NY and I liked the Downtown one more, as the location put us squarely in areas we don't usually go to like WTC/GZ, walked to Chelsea and Skyline and thru West Village to get back, amazing neighborhoods. Close to subways and cabs everywhere. Our room felt bigger than most Ws and overlooked ground zero.

I stayed at the W Downtown over 4th of July weekend and we were lucky enough to get a room on a high floor overlooking the new Freedom Tower and 9/11 memorials. The view was incredible. This hotel was the perfect location for us as we were there to visit the new 9/11 museum, as well as the Statue of Liberty and Elis Island. Battery Park where the ferrys are located are within walking distance. The room was clean and well appointed, small, but that is to be expected in NYC. I've actually stayed at the W Lexington (further uptown) and had a much smaller room. All of the staff were friendly and accommodating, and one in particular was very helpful, unfortunately I do not remember his name, at the FD, the concierge was gone for the evening, he reccommended a restaurant for dinner which was lovely. After dinner we came back and enjoyed drinks on the outside deck, which was also very nice. The parking is outragously priced, but also that is to be expected in NYC.

The hotel is the newest of the W Hotels in Manhattan. The hip design is not too contrived and the place feels like a well building. The rooms have a great views of the downtown New York. I LOVED the outdoor patio lounge, which is a great place to relax and have a drink. The staff are friendly and accommodating. If you have business in lower Manhattan it is a good location. If you are visiting New York, the location is not ideal for sight seeing or shopping. While the hotel is near the 9/11 Memorial, NY Stock Exchange, historic buildings, etc, the subway service to the rest of NYC is limited particularly on the weekends when many trains do not stop or run to downtown stations. A huge new subway station is being built nearby and may improve access in the future.

we booked a last minute weekend getaway at this hotel (we live on long island). When we arrived there was a huge crowd of "hoodlums" standing in front of hotel for some event being hosted inside. When you walk into building you have to get into an elevator and take it to the 5th floor to check in. On the fifth floor is checkin, outdoor balcony with seating and the bar/lounge which happens to be brand new and really a beautiful hip design. After check in we went up to our room. Nice room with a view of the new world trade center buildings (especially beautiful at night with all the lights). Our king sized bed was AMAZING. so so so comfortable we didn't want to get out of bed. Bathroom is nice and clean as well. There is window seating which is awesome (cushions all around wall so you can sit and stare at the view). The next night there was another line outside the hotel of hoodlums waiting to get into the hotels bar lounge and the music with DJ was loud. its an open space so everyone can hear the music. Put that all aside it was a nice weekend but when I got the checkout invoice emailed to me (while I was still at hotel) I saw a bunch of charges for this tax and that tax which is ridiculous but also a charge called "Living room lounge tax $22). I went to the desk and asked what the heck that was and he said oh its for using the bar lounge. I said that's lovely except we didn't use it. He says to me "oh you didn't?" Ok ill remove it. And even if we HAD used it? How would the hotel know? We would've paid for our drinks and been on our merry way. In my opinion they add on this charge and I guarantee that many ppl who stay at this hotel do not even realize this BOGUS charge. SO beware and check your invoice before you leave the hotel! During the day we walked across to the water and it was beautiful. it was like a 5 minute walk from hotel.
user_name:
Nur R
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed at the w this weekend and was beyond disappointed. The hotel charges a super premium for normally free things like internet, and the room was literally the size of a closet. If service, accessibility, or price matter, I'd avoid the w.

I have stayed in this hotel 5 times since October, 2012 and have been more and more disappointed each time. There are better alternative options nearby: Marriott Downtown and Conrad by Hilton. Pros:1) Close proximity to 911 memorial/World Financial Center2) One of the few SPG properties in Downtown ManhattanCons:1) Housekeeping lacks attention to detail - my glasses were left in the room and they were not able to retrieve; shampoo was missing in the shower in the morning during one stay; hair dryer was missing during the current stay.2) Front desk service is poor - most front desk agents do not welcome you in a nice manner (certainly not to SPG standards); as a Platinum member, they didn't ask me to choose the Platinum gift option and I had to call later on to confirm that I was getting the points. 3) AC does not work well - You would expect air conditioners to work in a 4 star hotel. Not at all in this hotel as I experienced issues in 3 different "Spectacular" rooms. For example, if you set the AC on auto for 74 and the current temperature is 76, the fan would start as Low-Medium (which is normal). When the temperature gets closer to the target of 74, the fan suddenly jumps up to High (contrary to how a normal AC works) and continues for at least 20 minutes while you are freezing. Perhaps this issue only applies for the corner "Spectacular" rooms, but I would expect all rooms to have working ACs.

The room was small and there were lipstick markings on the glass behind the headboard. The location is less desirable for those wanting to walk the city. No fridge in the room. The rooms are pretty small. But overall, it was a decent place to stay for a night.

I stayed at the W Downtown last week for one night and it was absolutely amazing. The check-in desk is located on the 5th floor with spectacular views of One World Trade Center and the Memorial. The front desk staff was friendly and knowledgeable. My room had a breath taking view of the building as well. The room was clean and modern with all the amenities you need. I got a great nights sleep! After our meeting finished we met for cocktails on the outdoor bar on the 5th floor. Our server was professional and prompt even recommending drinks that were really tasty. She let us know we were in a reserved section but we were welcome to stay right up until the party arrived. Overall this hotel is a welcome addition to the downtown area and a place I may go back to for happy hour once in awhile.

Hotel was very clean and impressed with the friendly and helpful service. I am SPG platinum and was upgraded to a larger room with a great view of the freedom tower. Location is excellent and very close to One World Trade Center. W beds are extremely soft and I was able to get a good nights rest. I will definitely be returning.

I just stayed in this hotel and enjoyed it...but it has some issues. BTL (their resturant) is located on the bottom room so you need to take the lift up to the 5 th floor to check in....the lobby area, outside space and bar was fantastic. But then you must cross the lobby to get to the room lifts which is a pain in the neck....My room was decent size, bed comfortable and the bathroom was just OK. I think this hotel needs a bit of a face life (common areas and room) but I will stay their again because it is very close to my office. Only real complaint is the room rate is a bit steep $340.00 per night which is out of my clients budget.

Stayed here for business in room facing 1 world trade center. Great large room for a W in NYC, toiletries and shower solid. Decided to stay here vs the Conrad Hilton where meeting was & it was worth the cabs :)Pros -- Location (if you're doing the downtown stuff, or grab subway or cabs), Rooms, ViewsCons -- typical W lobby vibe that can get on my nerves when all you want is to check in and get to room late at night

If you are looking for a great hotel with great service and a fantastic view of the world trade site, look no further. Room was very clean and well stocked. The front desk was amazing. Loved it. Will recommend.
user_location: New York, New York, United States
user_name:
Gina S
New York, New York, United States

review_body: I was stay here for 2 days for business trip, the location of hotel is very convenience close to Battery park and WTC, the service wasn't good and bad at all. Free coffee in the morning at the lobby is great. As a SPG Member the Wi-fi should be free

I've stayed at W hotels before, but not this one. This hotel is very nice inside and the elevators are pretty quick. You end up having to take separate elevators to get to your room...one to get to the main lobby, then another to the rooms.The single bed room was fairly small, but I have had a lot smaller rooms at other hotels in New York. I was able to kind of get my bags out of the way in the corner. The lighting in the room is horrible. In fact, light in this room is almost nonexistent at night. Most of the lighting is cove lighting around the desk and the bed with a small desk lamp and table lamp by the bed. The bathroom is fairly small with no space to put any of your standard bathroom items. The shower was decent with pretty good water pressure and a nice shower head. The bed was comfortable and the air conditioner kept the room nice and cool. The desk was cluttered with the usual over-priced snacks and hotel books. The desk chair had to be one of the most uncomfortable chairs I have ever used. Definitely not good if you have work to do at the desk. The TV was nice with a good assortment of channels. The TV also had a media box connected to it so that you can connect your laptop or other type of media player to the TV. In fact, this media box actually works, unlike a lot of other hotels.Overall, nice rooms, but not the most comfortable or practical.

We stayed at the "W" Downtown for 3 days sightseeing and it was the perfect catch! Very close to the metro station, many sights and the hudson river to go for a walk. The room had a great view to ground zero. All the rooms seem to have a good view, because the hotel is in the higher floors. Housekeeping is doing a good job! Very clean everything. If you like to have breakfast, you can order this "a la carte" in the restaurant below - which is really good! Unfortunately we just had time to use it once, because in New York are so many different good places to have breakfast at. The bar interior and the public area is for me a little bit to dark, but modern - everybody has a different taste, for the "W" concept it fits perfect and looks great. The terrace with view to ground zero is perfect for an aperitif. The only thing that doesn't give the 5th point is that "the Welcoming" at the reception was very unfriendly and during the stay very unprofessional. The employees prefer to talk more with each other than with the guests, also a smile seems to be very hard for them to share.

One of the best located hotels, with great service. The W design is strong in general areas but slightly dated in standard rooms, that are quite small. The W minibar does not loose its attraction. All extras very expensive, $18 for a glass of average house chardonnay is really the limit!

My stay here was great. I upgraded the room to a higher floor, more space and a beautiful view of the 911 memorial park. Well worth doing. The room was large by NY standards and very well laid out. The bench seat by the window was a relaxing place to sit. The bars are expensive (expected in NYC!) but the included wifi and morning coffee were welcome touches. The location was great for work but it's probably not the place to stay if you're on vacation - quite a distance from uptown attractions. That said, it's near subway stops and taxis we're always easy to find.

I stayed for a night for business reasons. The front desk staff was not very welcoming or friendly. The room was on the west end of the hotel and oddly shaped because of the building shape, with a smallish bedroom and large bath. The hotel is trendy, but I agree that the rooms need better light and more counter space. Unfortunately, the bed is on a platform rather than a box spring, and so not as comfortable as most hotel beds. A bigger problem is that the platform juts out from the mattress, and my right shin is still sore from an encounter with the corner of the platform.

Great place to stay in the city and financial hub of the world . If your company is paying for the room then staying here is a no brainier as you can walk to your meetings and offices and then come back for a happy hour in the lobby bar. Free coffee for the morning and wifi is free in the lobby. Strange set up as 5th floor is reception . Only thing is I asked for a mini fridge and they did not provide it to me for some reason they claimed they did not have one . I was there for two weeks and placing ice in a bag. Besides that it's a good place.

Location: Great location if you want to be DowntownAtmosphere: Super clean, new and well laid out in every aspect from rooms to restaurant to lobby. Very beautiful.Customer service: Great. Everyone welcomes you and asks how they can help.Price: Over priced for the location. One night stay will run you well over $400. It's just not worth it. If the price were in the $300 I would give it 5 stars. This would allow more business travels to stay.Overall - If budget is not an issue and you want to be Downtown ~ it is a great option. If you want to be cost conscious there are many other great options for less. Probably won't be back.

This hotel was very modern in design, with style potentially exceeding practical substance in the room design (we needed more surfaces, trashcans, and power outlets). Our double room was immaculately clean, relatively spacious for NYC, and very quiet even though directly across from the elevators. The room had a stunning view of the 9/11 memorial park that really gave us a sense of pause and reflection. The hotel’s location is about a block from the Memorial Park and museum, and convenient to Battery Park, the marina, and the financial district. The hotel was close to at least two subway stations accessing upper Manhattan. The reception is actually on the 5th floor, which is a little disconcerting at first. The reception area is continuous with the bar and outdoor terrace. This level was transformed into a dee-jayed bar/nightclub for young, beautiful, and dispensibly incomed most nights we were there. This wasn't really our cuppa, and the drinks were NYC priced to be sure! We found a nice, more down-to-earth vibe at nearby O'Hara's Bar. The reception and concierge staff was clearly cosmopolitan, but nonetheless helpful and approachable when asked. But a doorman was not available to get our party a cab on 3 occasions during our stay. The free coffee in the morning was actually outstanding! The cucumber water was very nice too. It was very expensive to stay there, which is not unexpected given quality, location, and NYC. Even though the service was excellent, it was not on par with the quality of service that we have experienced at similarly priced venues in other major cities (Drake-Chicago, Intercontinental-Chicago, Blu-Sydney). We would likely choose to stay there again if we had an event in the Financial District, but would likely look elsewhere for a clean, quiet, more centrally located hotel with more old people when we return to this amazing city.

The W downtown is an exceptional location if you need a hotel in lower manhattan/financial/wall street and want to be close to world trade. And by close, ask for a room facing the freedom tower & memorial (it's across the street).The W downtown is a typically trendy as all W hotels. The bar is a scene, the restaurants are good, the decor is high gloss and the beds are extremely comfortable. Tiny room, but expected for any manhattan hotel. Overall, would totally stay there again.

My husband is a platinum Starwood member and frequently uses this W for stays when he meets at the financial center. It's a matter of convenience but he chooses this over the Marriott and other brand name hotels in the area so that's saying something positive. We are both former New Yorkers and I used to work on Nassau Street so I'm familiar with the area. It was nice to sit out on the terrace of the 5th floor lobby area, which has an amazing view of Liberty Tower (and the construction work going on below) and drink the complimentary coffee. Nice cocktail bar although BLT on the ground floor is also quite busy. The decor is beyond "Groovy" - it has a sort of black and white sea wave effect which I think, if I were tipsy, would totally confuse me! It's very "W" design, with a sort of New York modern edge and world music soundtrack 24/7. Most important -the beds are super comfy. Trains (R and 1) are right on Rector Street (same name for the stop on both lines). Hop on and in 3 minutes you're in Chinatown (Canal St stop) or keep going uptown - both are West side of Manhattan train lines but R trains are easily switched to East (4,5,6) at 14th street. Personally, I like visiting Trinity's Church's 300 year old graveyard to see where Founding Father Alexander Hamilton rests (good July 4th activity, sorry abetr didn't know about that) or the Night before Christmas see Clement Moore - or just check out the old tombstone artwork. But you couldn't get me to visit Ground Zero for anything because it was incredibly painful to live through and to me it's...morbid. And jam packed. That said...it wouldn't have been our choice of location for a regular visit to Manhattan. W yes, but really it's a working area, kind of dirty, doesn't show the best of NY at all, and there's not much to do around the hotel. Not the fault of the hotel - but I'd say this is good for a Wall Street need, not a visitor stay.
user_name:
Lisa C
North Kingstown, Rhode Island

review_body: I was looking forward to staying here - I love W hotels for some reason. This did not disappoint. We checked in early and were assigned room 1105 facing World Trade Memorial and Freedom Tower, when we got back to the hotel later in the day we asked if there was a room on a higher floor with the same view and we were given 2205 it was amazing, we even decided to get pizza in the room and enjoy the view at night instead of going out. Unfortunately I cannot remember the lady who changed our room - I think it Tomara (she's from Australia) and you was a pleasure to work with. The room was clean and had plenty of Bliss supplies I especially love that the windows opened even just a little bit. I do have a couple of things that would have made the stay better 1. the A/C wouldn't go below 77 degrees and 2. the bed was very uncomfortable and woke up both mornings with horrible back pains.I do have a couple of things that would have mafe the stay better 1. the A/C wouldn't go below 77 degrees and 2. the bed was very uncomfortable and woke up both mornings with horrible back pains.

We took a train from New Haven and stayed overnight at the W Hotel downtown Manhattan.We planned on seeing the Ground Zero Museum and Eliis Island and the Statue of Liberty, all were right there within walking distance, especially ground zero.The hotel was fun, modern and youthful. It catered to families and the younger crowd. The decor was different and the help were friendly, young, vibrant and beautiful.I recommend staying there if these are the sights that you want to see and feel.

I will start off that I am a SPG Platinum member and stay a W hotels all the time. This property can use a lot of help. Went to spend the night there for the July 4th weekend. Front desk was very unhelpful when asked about ideas for the weekend. Send me to the concierge who did not know to much either. In regards to the rooms the flooring was rubbed out and the room was not clean. Would not advise people to visit the property.

The radio/clock/music combo machine was complex and difficult to use. After miserably failing at the iPod/Auxiliary options even the radio failed to work. Eventually we ended up spending most of our evening in silence trying to figure out if we actually enjoyed each other's voices. In effort to break that silence we noticed that there was an ambiance machine located on the other side of the room. Our quick test promptly descended into a horror film when it started a human heartbeat 'ambiance' on full volume. But of course these are superficial points to the hotel's management. It must be noted that their staff is rather precise with their welcome mats. We noticed this upon checkout that we entered one elevator at 11:55 am and the elevator mat prominently displayed 'Good Morning.' Four minutes later we entered a separate elevator to find it saying 'Good Afternoon.' Now mind you... they were one minute early, but since we are relatively intelligent people, we figured that this was logistically understandable. Considering they have half a dozen elevator mats to change, and it simple doesn't make any sense to have the staff stop all their work and coordinate an immediate at noon changeover. But we certainly would have appreciated a bit more diligence.Nevertheless, the rooms are clean and pleasant, beds are soft, views are admiringly calm, location is excellent to get to either river (for fireworks) or the harbor, and most importantly the Brioche French Toast is simply delectably delicious.
user_name:
Kwan N
New York City, New York

review_body: The bed in my room was so comfortable it was hard to get up in the morning! The rooms were a little small. It was OK for me because I was traveling solo but if my husband had been with me it would have been tight. The bathroom was nice but it was rectangle shape so there was a lot of room for them to hang some shelves but there was very little shelf space for cosmetics. That's just a minor complaint but also an easy fix. The rooms were clean and nicely decorated. The gym was nice with the basics available. It was also clean. I wasn't high enough or on the right side to see the memorial but I am sure if you are in the right rooms it would be a beautiful view.Honestly, this hotel is a little swanky overall for my tastes but it was a very good property as are most W hotels.

The hotel was beyond my expectations. Amazing views from the room of the 9/11 memorial. Room was bigger than we thought, bathroom was great. The bar was a lot of fun as well! Parks in Battery Park City are a very short walk away and shouldn't be missed on a nice day.
user_name:
John M
New York City, New York

review_body: My wife and I did an overnight in early June at this property in early June and would do it again Check-in staff was wonderful and our room had a great view of the WTC and had a very contemporary design. The location is perfect--quick access to Brookfield place, the battery and the lower manhattan attractions but its also very quiet and restful. We ate outside the hotel but the coffee bar on Sunday morning was a welcome sight after a late night before. If I had to travel to NYC on business I would definitely select this hotel and it was perfect for our romantic weekend in the city.
user_name:
Jason H
New York City, New York

review_body: The staff was extremely helpful and the hotel was right across the street from the WTC.A must see for NYC! The staff was great about letting my friend and I know cool spots to check out and took their time when answering our questions - everyone was very professional and nice. The hotel has a cool modern vibe and the rooms were quite large by NYC standards. Awesome spot if you like swanky things (:
