I stayed at the W Downtown with my daughter - we asked for a quiet room and early check in and were accommodated. The only down side of the quiet room was a terrible view of a vacant building. We had a corner King - 814 I think. It was quiet and we needed sleep. It is also across the street from the new WTC Memorial. I highly recommend a visit to the site. There are many restaurants and things to do from this location. The only problem is the entrance is actually on Albany not Washington so your drivers or gps will have a hard time getting there.We had a great price - less than $300. Memorial Day weekend. The staff is very nice. The hotel cafe has good food but the service is excruciatingly slow. Do not eat there if you are pushed for time. The staff was nice - not sure why the delay - had a feeling the kitchen was very far from the restaurant??Overall - would absolutely stay here again. The room was very clean. The bed was comfortable. The bathrooms were clean and nice.

Great locatin - I was there to visit my daughter who lives in the city. This was my first stay at this location. Check-in was perfect and the room was very clean. I however was most impressed with the staff of this hotel. I work in the hotel business and am I am in tune to customer service. The staff was always always ready to assist myself and my friend and always with a smile on their face. The two most impressive employees were Michell Chang, The Welcome Talent Coach. Anne Engel

I went to the w for my b day and it was very good experience , the hotel is nice and clean, very good music in the lobby section . They gave me in a really nice room like I asked in the 20th floor and right in the corner w amazing view to the 9/11 memorial . The concierge (I don't now her name) es really nice since the first day she gave me a list w places to visit. I recommend to everybody go there .

Great location downtown N Y C. CLEAN MODERN HOTEL. Helpful doorman Chris.Within walking distance of Reflecting Memorial pools of Trade Center. Lots of food establishments and bars, great walking along Hudson. Recommend to tourists for ages 27-50. Bar with disco on 5th floor concierge.Safe area, reception Andrew efficient and friendly.Generally great staff ready to receive guests of property.Suggest that staff bring themselves up to date on subway system in area of property.

spent six nights at this property. loved the hotel facilities. great gym, lively bar and all the staff are always ready to help with a smile. location is within a stones throw of central park, times square and some of the world's best shopping...you can't really ask for a better place to be!rooms were clean and beds were very comfortable. great choice in tv channels. We had upgraded our room however it was barely bigger than a match box. bathrooms are also very tiny and need a refurb...everything works and is clean but they are quite outdated.If you are going to soak in the sights and sounds of new york all day and need a very comfortable bed and a good hotel then this is for you! However if you are looking for large hotel rooms etc this is not somewhere I'd recommend. All in all I can't fault anything on this property other than the room size (which is due to the fact it's an older building...)

we went to NY for a 30th birthday party. Never stayed at this particular W.I was moving to fast and reserved the wrong room but It was quickly resolved he was trying to charge me an additional 40$ a night but after an adamant No he quickly "upgraded" the room for us and it was great!!! They served wine at check in The Room was clean bed was supper comfortable house keeping was great she offered to come back we forgot to move some jeans off the bed and she was kind enough to move and fold them to make the bed she changed the sheets as well seeing how I spilled coffee and to my surprise she seen it and took care of it. No complainants.  the concierge was super helpful he gave us great directions so that I could get a nice birthday gifts. The world trade center attraction was not open to the public but Its great proximity to the hotel. the room was

Great location, impressive design and concept, But ...very little recognition is given to SPG Platinum members. Don't expect significant room up grade and the hotel do not participatpe in the SPG suite night award though they market on their web site two types of suits. Hotel is poorly managed. From my personal experience do not count too much on promises given by the hotel staff ( including the hotel manager himself!). We booked a room to celebrate our anniversary. I am heavy traveller and SPG Platinum member for 13 years. I dropped a line to the hotel asking to take into account that it is our anniversary and appreciate best service etc. Got nice replies but when checked in the room was served for one, was not cleaned properly and had smoke smell from previous guest. Was given room on a relatively low floor and no significant up grade was made. If you need to be in the area, do not have a better alternative or get yourself a room at a promotional rate you may consider staying here but otherwise go elsewhere and save yourself a lot of aggravation. For SPG elite members - there are better Starwood options around NYC which valued our loyalty and one may enjoy the full scale of benefit offered to SPG Members.

We stayed for three days and it was awesome. The rooms, the service and the atmosphere is completely out of this world, excellent. For my surprise the location was perfect, right across from 9/11 memorial, walking distance to the financial district. I can't wait to visit again.

The service was great, the hotel accommodated all of me and friends needs. Beautiful location, with great people working the front desk and style. The hotel is very fun and the bar is super cool on the 5th floor! It may not have the most the rooms, but they make up for it in there service!The bathrooms were nice and very accessible.

I stayed at this hotel about 2 weeks ago. It was my first time ever in the downtown area. The hotel is beautiful, alot of fun/modern design. Check out the outdoor terrace! I will be back for a thursday-saturday when they have their DJ playing on the terrace. I upgraded my room to an ultra cool corner and the views were stunning. The room has a wrap around window seat and I could have easily sat in that window for hours! I had both dinner and breakfast in the BLT resturant it was very good. I will be back again in the fall!!

Came on a girl's trip. Had a wonderful time and the view of the freedom tower and memorial was amazing. The room was clean but average. No fridge, microwave or coffee maker. And for the price a continental breakfast would have suffice. There was a charge for every treat placed in the room. Over all the location was great.

I love the W brand, but this hotel is lacking. I stayed for one night while moving out of my apartment, so I chose it out of convenience. As others have noted, the location might seem out of the way but it is close to the 1 and R trains. The check in experience was fine, I received a room on the 10th floor that faced the river as opposed to the WTC. I was surprised how small the room was though. The lighting in the bathroom was pretty bad, and the hanger that the robe was on kept breaking. The shower also had mold. And the most annoying thing was no free wifi unless you go to the lobby. The good things here were the standard W amenities such as the bliss products and their signature bed. Didn't get a chance to try BLT Grill, but it had good reviews.

Stayed here for pleasure and the hotel was clean and rooms were decent size for NYC. Great service from the concierge and front desk staff. Great proximity to transit and the 911 memorial. Always cabs available out front. Gym was well stocked and all equipment worked. One issue was the positioning of the AC vent in the room. It blew right to the head of the bed which didn't allow for a sound sleep.

I stayed here on a recent business trip ans was impressed. The hotel us clean, well looked after, and the rooms are pretty big. The staff could be more helpful, but nothing that was terrible. Overall good experience.

I stayed at the W New York Downtown for a 4 day period while on a business trip in New York. The experience was pretty mixed and the price tag for this experience was way too high.Let's start with the rooms - while they are a nice size, my room was not cleaned properly (I had hairs from the previous guest in the bathroom) and I could hear very clearly what was going on in the hallway and was woken up more than once by the noise coming from there.The location is right at the World Trade Center site, which is in the middle of the financial district. This is a good location, if you stay here close to an office, but most touristic sights are about a 20 minute subway ride away.Last but not least and something which I totally don't understand is the absence of free Wi-Fi. The rate for a day of Wi-Fi was something like USD 15 and for a hotel where one night costs well in excess of USD 200, I can't accept having to pay extra for Wi-Fi.

I checked in and was met by friendly staff. My room faced the world trade centre site and was very modern and well appointed. The Bliss products are great. A bit long to get a taxi and the two separate elevators are a but of a hassle. But other than that a fantastic stay.

Location is excellent for downtown: immediately south of the WTC reflecting pools/memorial. Very dramatic lobby - pure W.Good restaurant - particularly for a hotel, of any level.Typically excellent service for Ws.Rooms are reasonably large - for NYC. This is not a W or even Starwood issue, it's a NYC issue. You don't stay in NYC if you're looking for a huge room, unless you're willing to pay very large sums of money. This W's rooms are appropriately-sized for NYC, even on the generous side.One thing to note: you enter on the street level, take an elevator to the 5th floor, which is where the lobby is. Then switch to a different elevator bank to get to the rooms. That's sub-optimal and can be confusing at first. It's not a major grievance, though. Personal impression: I am Starwood gold, and I am in downtown NYC frequently for work. This is my go-to hotel for those instances. It has never let me down, and I have no plans to stop using it.

Stayed here for business. It has a cool vibe - a party atmosphere at night in the bar which I liked after a long tiring day. Upon arriving the staff were very helpful and courteous. You can see the difference the extra effort makes. When I finally returned around 9:30pm to check into my room on my way to the elevator someone stopped in his tracks to welcome me, offer assistance on anything and gave me his name (which I forgot unfortunately due to fatigue) and offered I could call for him and he will be able to help. The only slight bummer was the bar / restaurant closed a bit early that night. The place was a little slow so I don't blame them but again the staff was the difference but not so great in this situation. This time the hostess station was crowded with 2 or 3 people chatting and once I was finally greeted I was told they were kind of closing early. It wasn't a big deal and in the end I had a great meal at a Mexican restaurant a short walk from the hotel. It was Cinco de Mayo after all and service for one at 10pm on a Monday was not a problem. That place was SouthWest NY. I believe it was the chef or the late night cook (i.e. a chef but not by name or pay) who took such pride in delivering the meal to me and checking in to see if everything was ok. I was a table of 1 in a large restaurant and I immediately felt like I was in the corner of someone's house. Which is why I titled this review as I did.In the end I thoroughly enjoyed the W and the modern layout and design. Besides it has spectacular views of the 9/11 memorial.

I am in the US visiting my family for a month and their home is in Westchester New York. During my month home, I needed to find a wedding dress as I am getting married in five months and decided to make it a girls weekend with my Mom in NYC.I booked through my SPG account and chose the W Downtown as my wedding is actually being held in October 2014 at The W Bali! I requested a very early check-in as we had many appointments and they were able to get us right into a room and we were off on our wedding dress hunt!We were lucky enough to find the perfect dress and headed back in the late afternoon to The W Downtown to freshen up for drinks and dinner. We loved the Living Room bar and it was really wonderful for me to see the trade center re-built. We are a New York family and hadn't been downtown to that area and the views from the Living Room were really lovely. Overall, it was a fantastic experience, my only downside was I didn't realize there was no Bliss Spa! I live for their facials when I am home as in Singapore, where I am based now, there is no Bliss! My girlfriends are throwing me a Bachelorette Night this coming Friday and we will be staying once again overnight at your hotel and I'm looking forward to another fabulous W experience!
user_name:
JoannaN207
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed here for the 5 Boro Bike NY weekend and found the hotel to exceed all of our needs and expectations. It was modern and super clean with a very attentive staff. The rooms were fresh and clean and were a good size by NY standards. They had plenty of space for us to spread out during our stay with our 2 children. Yes, it sits DIRECTLY across from the 911 memorial which brings lots of tourists, but I didn't find it overwhelming as most are just queued up waiting to get in so its not like a mob scene. In fact, the extra tourists and bit of construction keep the car and taxi traffic away from the hotel which adds to the overall experience. The hotel is conveniently located to bike paths and can easily walk to a wide variety of restaurants.

We recently stayed at the W for a wedding and enjoyed our stay. One of the nice things about the W is you can count on their consistency- comfortable beds, great coffee in the morning and a beautiful hotel- all very true about the W in Downtown NYC. The only consideration of this hotel is the location- it sits right next to the beautiful and moving 911 memorial, however this also means there is a ton of tourists and a lot of construction going on. I really enjoyed looking out at the Freedom Tower and visiting the memorial and there's a great deck off the main floor where you can enjoy coffee or a cocktail and look out at the ongoing project and what's been built. It's also a great location to check out the Brooklyn Bridge. Overall, great hotel and stay!

W New York-Downtown delivers the typically strong W Hotel experience you would expect from a really great downtown location. Rooms are well done but like most in NYC are a bit smaller than you would see in other cities. The views of ground zero and the new Freedom Tower are excellent - especially on the upper floors. The hotel was totally sold out the nights I was there (which apparently occurs frequently), but it did not feel crowded, and the staff took the time to connect with you. It is very easy walking or jogging distance to Wall Street and to the tourist attractions in and around Battery Park. Although there are several good restaurants within walking distance, I ate breakfast at the hotel and found it to be very good. The food and service were both excellent although pricy for what you got (typical of most high end hotels). The atmosphere was a nice blend of adult social and business. While the downtown location is good, it is a pretty fair distance from the tourist machine of Times Square, and cab rides can take awhile if there is a lot of traffic. If Times Square and Midtown are your primary destination or if you are traveling with a group that is focusing on family activities, you might want to consider either a single night at this hotel or a more family focused hotel further north. The W Hotel staff is friendly and is genuinely interested in making sure things work well for you and that you want to come back. All in all - a good place to stay. I would come back if I was in the area.

A really excellent experience. The room is new, fresh and room 2208 is a corner room with an amazing view on the memorial site.The room has a carpet which was still new, also there is no Nespresso machine.The breakfast is lousy and the service extremely slow. The fitness is small but good.

This was the first time our family had stayed at any W property. I can't say we were disappointed. The 5th floor lounge and balcony was a nice retreat from the street noise. The rooms, while NY size (a bit smaller than usual) were modern and clean. The beds were very comfortable and I slept great, which is not always the case when I travel. Couple things though: at this price level, free room wi-fi would be nice. Also was surprised by the lack of a business centre. The location is fantastic. From the W, it is an easy walk to Battery Park, Wall Street, the Brooklyn Bridge and many other attractions. So, overall, not perfect, but I would stay there again if I wanted to stay in the Financial District.

We have stayed in this hotel for couple of nights while visiting NY and must say that this is one of the best hotels we`ve ever stayed in. The location is perfect - it`s right in the center of financial disctrict and just steps from the subway, finding a taxi in this area is also not a problem and yet you avoid hords of tourists that occupy Time Square and other touristic locations in NY. The views from the rooms and the terrace are just amazing. The drinks in the bar just perfect and the staff just excellent. I would like to mention especially Robert - Concierge. He is one of the best hotel associates that I`ve ever interacted with. The perfect manners, kindness, friendliness and a perfect knowledge of the city. He was just amazing when we were asking about things to do in the city and where to go. You can see that he enjoys his work and is really good at it - his knowledge was just incredible. His recomendations were perfect and even when we asked about other cities that we plan to visit in States he knew what to recomend. He is a real asset. It`s very rare to see that kind of attitude and it deserves a recognition.All in all the hotel and the staff makes your stay a perfect one. There`s no point in going anywhere else.

You could either find the most friendly and professional staff or the most careless and unfriendly people. Great check out service but the check in and in room dinning is not up to what you expect from a W hotel.Room ok, nice but small, amazing view of WTC. In room dining not that good on good quality, grilled chicken sandwich doesn't taste good, just ok. Won't come back

Good place to stay, but the rooms are really small. Also, honestly, I tough all hotels where furnishing the wifi for free these days. The W ask for 25$ per day!!?? Won't go back. Also, the breakfast is a rip off.

I loved the W Downtown. It's a fairly new hotel so the facilities and rooms are wonderful. I loved being close to the Hudson for lovely walks in the morning. It was also a hop skip and jump to tribeca and soho which is where I enjoy hanging out. This part of town is increasingly cool.

Amazing views of the 911 Memorial and the new Freedom Tower, One World Trade Center and excellent location in downtown. Staff greeted me with smiling faces the minute they opened my car door all the way to the 5th floor reception. And yes a chilled glass of champagne to boot. Robert, the concierge graciously informed me of the new developments right outside of the front door of the hotel. An upscale shopping development springing from the ground. Better yet, a skip away from the new National 911 Museum that just openend this morning. Excellent lunch at BLT Bar & Grill - wickedly fantatsic beet salad and lobster risotto - not to mention a crisp glass of New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc. Excellent room - ask for the view side of the 911 Memorial - amazing at night - very chic modern and the sleep machine was a nice perk too. Heard no taxi honking. I'll be back...again and again.

This hotel is amazing, very stylish and the staff is extremely friendly! I enjoyed the view that I had and I really enjoyed the food in the hotel. I'll make this my go to spot when I'm on business in NYC!

We stayed at this hotel for a week at the beginning of April and really loved it.The views of ground zero are incredible and extremely moving.The hotel is in a fantastic location if you want to enjoy a different part of New York than usual, namely the Upper East Side. Having been to New York before we enjoyed staying in this area and exploring somewhere more than in just a half day. The location was great and downtown has a lot to offer at Wall Street, Ground Zero and the shops down at pier 17 (particularly a large Abercrombie & Fitch that offers discounts the Fifth avenue flagship does not) However do bare in mind that if you plan to spend a lot of time going uptown to central park, Empire State, museums, broadway etc then taxis will be quite expensive. We found a cab up to fifth avenue was $20+ and to soho/TriBeCa $10. These aren't overly expensive per trip but across the whole visit dan amount to a couple of hundred dollars. I would recommend getting a week long subway pass/metro card for $30 (or less 3/5 day if your stay is shorter) This was great value we must have used it at least 5 times per day and considering we were told a return journey from downtown to the Met was $11, it does save you a lot, and you don't have to queue to reload your card each time.It saves you a lot of money and time on cabs as the subway is so quick and there are lots of stations near the hotel for the various different lines.We absolutely loved the hotel. It was gorgeously decorated and really modern and contemporary! The porters at the front of the hotel were super helpful with your bags, offering umbrellas and getting you cabs. They took our bags straight to our room and directed us to the front desk on the fifth floor.The reception area was lovely and combined with a lobby/bar area that also opened up to a gorgeous outdoor terrace bar area (which will be close due to inclement weather) the lobby was great and had free tea and coffee until ten am, a full bar with various bar snacks and appetisers. It also had free wifi which worked well.Our room was on the 20th floor and we had a corner room (which we paid for) it was very nice but looked out of the back of the hotel not on to ground zero which was a shame but the views were still fine.The room was a great size, lovely window seat, large comfortable bed and nice bathroom with shower.The room was cleaned perfectly each morning and we didn't have any issues with anything in the room apart from the WIFI.The wifi is not free (outside of the lobby) it is around $13 per day and we opted for a $70 package for 7days. The wifi was appalling, it rarely worked in our room and when it did it was slow and intermittent. The front desk were great they refunded the charge immediately and allowed us to keep the wifi on incase it worked.Overall we had a great stay, the location was fantastic, the hotel was gorgeous and we really enjoyed it.The hotel arranged us a car to Newark airport which was $100 (only $10 more than the cab we got on the way). If you are coming from Newark the cab ride is quite expensive so do account for that.

We had a reservation for a spectacular room months in advance for a biking event. I sent them a few emails regarding parking accommodations and bicycle storage, and they replied promptly with useful information. When we arrived around 1pm, there were many people all checking in at the same time. They kept everything organized and even already had a room ready for us. To our surprise, when we went to our room, we saw that we were upgraded to a cool corner room! The room itself was spacious (for NYC standards), clean as can be, and the bed is one of the most comfortable hotel beds I have ever slept in. The hotel staff was always cheerful with us, even though it was sold out and there were guests and bicycles everywhere. They arranged for changing and washing facilities for us after the bike tour (even though we were already checked out), and also did not charge us for another day of parking. We did not even have to wait long at all for our vehicle to be retrieved from valet parking. Also, providing coffee, fruit, and healthy snacks for the guests the morning of the bike tour was a very nice touch. Overall, a most pleasant stay, but the service that we received left an excellent impression. That being said, I would not even hesitate to stay here again, and would recommend it to anyone looking for a great (but not too pricey) hotel in the financial district.

Chose to stay here for proximity for 5 Boro Bike Event start. Not a great location for anything other than the WTC memorial. No trendy restaurants, lots of construction and tourists due to the memorial. Staff was friendly and helpful. Very dark decor in the lobby and family room/bar area. Great 5th floor terrace with lots of seating area offering direct view of the WTC site. Great cocktails. Free coffee every am in the lobby and the signature green apples. Public parking around the corner for half the fee charged by the W.

I've stayed in a few W hotels in NYC. I would have to say I preferred this location over the others. Because it's a newer building, the rooms provide plenty of space. You can't beat the views either. Because it's right next to the World Trade Center construction, it's a fairly quiet area (for now). Great option for friends, couples, or those traveling for business if you need to be in the Wall Street area.I always have a weird feeling about staying at a W, because it's the dance club version of a hotel, but if you can deal with that vibe it's a great option. This stay I didn't use any facilities or eat at their restaurants, so I can only comment on the room. It was spacious, clean, with a great view, and provided the amenities I needed for a quick one night trip to NYC. I would gladly stay here again.

Interesting place. You enter on the street [where the big bar is located] then take the elevator up a few floors to the lobby, [which is not that uncommon in NYC].The lobby decor is 'way out there', very European in design, a very specific taste is almost required to enjoy the ambiance. A lot of European travelers stay there and their cell phone use is non stop. Sidewalk-bar-elevators-concierge line-free coffee line; there is no escape, even if you come down for your coffee at 7:02 am, they are calling home and shouting due to poor connections.A young US crowd stays there as well.A strange thing is that they have a rear set of elevators in the lobby for the 10 or 15 floors of private residences that occupy half the tower. The 'residents' have a definite 'owners attitude' toward the hotel 'riff-raff' and you have to share the lobby with them---not too pleasant.I am a Starwood Preferred and I love starwood but this hotel was just odd. The rooms were new eclectic and fancy, way back when, but now they are rather tired and dated. While you have a full view of the World Trade Center re-construction [25' across the street] it becomes a little depressing after a while. While I applaud the crowds that come to see the memorial, [as I have done myself, and it is worth it]; those crowds are just that, large crowds you have to deal with right out the front door on the hotel sidewalk, trying to walk around and competing for cabs.Sorry, but you should avoid this place, it was quite expensive $300+ per night and simply not worth it. If you 'need' to stay at a fancy WTC hotel; go a diagonal block over to the Millenium Hilton-a great place, fancy and updated with a cool bar, restaurant and a pool.

I was working in TriBeCa this past weekend and so decided I would rather stay down that way rather than in midtown where I usually stay. I decided to use Priceline as it wasn't a crazy expensive time in NY and there seemed to be good options, this hotel came up in downtown, on Express deals, as 4.5 stars and at $164 that seemed great! After choosing that option I was informed it was the W downtown which I was really happy about. Flat rate to the city from JFK, so the Uber wasn't anymore or less expensive (taxi $45 plus tolls) uberX ($65 plus tolls) I got a driver with a Chysler 300.The great thing about this hotel is the Rector St subway stop is right around the corner, so getting uptown is very easy and only $2.50.My room on the 11th floor was not facing Freedom Tower, I would think those rooms would have been great. My room was exceptionally clean, the bed comfortable and the bathroom was a really good size, I loved it. And, there was something really nice about being away from the pulse of midtown.I would have rated it 5 stars but I ordered coffee to my room in the morning, the menu said $8 with the service charge it was $16, and, the first pot - it was a French press had really large chunks of coffee floating in it once I poured it, when I called the whatever/whenever the person said, that's just how a French press comes (I have one at home, mine certainly doesn't) anyway they said they would send another pot up, and that came quickly - great, but still chunks of coffee, the man who brought it up said he would try again, and he agreed, it shouldn't be like that, he would go and try again.... Which he did - mind you, I'm running out of time now, but he came back up, this time with a pot of drip coffee - on the plus side the service was great, the coffee in all cases was piping hot and the milk was cold, but I just didn't have a decent relaxing cup of coffee in the end as I had a meeting to get to. I haven't checked my bill yet, I really hope after all that they didn't charge me for it.I really would stay here again, I thought overall there were a lot of good things and that was a great price.

As a hotel, I can't complain. It's clean, it's modern, and the staff are mostly cheerful. The lobby and bars are a beautiful representation of culture--fashion, art, music, and nightlife. The rooms have custom furniture and artistic value, but aren't particularly upscale or comfortable. The problem is, that pretty much sums it up. If this were a run-of-the-mill hotel in a suburb of any typical city, I would be content; however, this is neither. This is a W, in downtown New York City. The W line, at least to me, carries a certain weight; my expectations are automatically several levels above "typical." The first time in a W, generally, should be unique. And while there was certainly a good representation of New York inside, I didn't experience anything that I haven't found in lesser/cheaper hotels. Having said that, I am rating this hotel "average" because that is exactly what it was. It met or even exceeded my expectations for a 2-3 star chain hotel. However, as a hotel of its caliber, it's nothing special. It's simply not worth the extra money over a lesser hotel, which may also have free in-room WiFi.

This hotel has a great location if you plan to stay around downtown most of your trip, which was our case. It can get a little tiresome to keep going daily to midtown and uptown, I imagine. Access to subways are easy, but taxis can be hard to find during rush hour. There are plenty of restaurants, stores and tourist attractions around.This has the vibe of other W properties, which means modern decor, loud lobby music at night and an upscale feel. You won't be disappointed if you enjoyed other W properties, but don't expect anything too different.The room was small, but very decent sized for NY standards. Our room had no maintenance issues, the bed was comfortable, the shower was great and the view from 9/11 memorial was fantastic. We used the connections panel provided for the TV and it worked perfectly, easy to set up and it was a welcome addition. One issue was that the walls were on the thin side, so we could sometimes hear the room next door.There is no free wi-fi in the room (which is always a drag), but at least there is access in the lobby (5th floor), which is more than I can say about some other properties. It's also nice to have water and coffee at the lobby as well.This would have been a clean review, but poor service cost the hotel one star. The staff was nice and efficient for routine tasks (check-in/out, housekeeping), but we had 2 issues during our 3-night stay of employees making no effort to be helpful (concierge and bell man), on simple requests that took 5 minutes for me to solve after I decided to do it myself. It seemed that if something deviated slightly from their routine duties, it was greeted with an unwelcome attitude.If I plan to go back downtown I will probably consider the W again, but I do believe the concierge service can be more accommodating.

Very funky hotel - situated right next to the 9/11 memorial - so you get views of the queues all day. Situated in the heart of the financial district, its OK, but we seemed to spend our time in taxis going back and forth to mid town, Soho and Greenwich.Very small rooms but well appointed - although there is barely space in the showeroom for toiletries. The only mirror is in the bathroom, which makes getting ready a challenge for two people (showering, make up, hair drying etc).We had a coffee maker in our room (complimentary) but the promised refills weren't there every day and we were constantly asking for these to be brought up.Drinks generally expensive as you would imagine.Can't help thinking we might have benn better off in another hotel with a larger room.

Date of visit: Sunday, 20 AprilLocation: Literally across the street from the World Trade Center site, walkable to Battery ParkLooks: A little "weird" that check-in is actually on the 5th floor, so there isn't a welcoming lobby in the traditional sense. The interior is dark and sexy like other W's.Amenities: You walk right into the Living Room bar, which has a very inviting terrace with ample seating to enjoy the outdoor air. One couch in the corner is set against the high-rise brick exterior, which provides a great photo opportunity. I did not get a chance to sample a cocktail, but the bartender kindly greeted me as I walked by.Room: Whereas the W in Union Square had a more serious look with their reptilian-skin textures, the W in Downtown reminded me a bit of South Beach, or the newly designed Tropicana in Vegas -- a glossy, white canvas with splashes of red. It gave a very cooling effect (which was probably more due to the a/c that had been turned up), and I liked it a lot on that very warm day. I enjoyed the view of the 1 WTC from my room.Verdict: A true "W Hotel" in terms of minimalist decor, but less of a see-and-be-seen vibe (there were plenty of families with kids in the lobby for a Sunday). I'd recommend it as a great place to stay, esp if you want to do the ferry to Ellis Island. Can't imagine an extended stay here though (for a tourist) as there is not much in the way of attractions.

It was my and my husband's first stay in W Downtown in March and it was awesome. The location was great - just steps away from great restaurants and a quick drive to midtown. We also got to the hotel within a 25-min drive from the airport, even tho we landed at midnight so there was less traffic. The service was good. What made our stay was actually the super comfortable bed. The washroom was a bit small, but the most important was that it was clean and up to standard. We would definitely come back.

Great experience. Stayed with friends for one night. Beautiful, immaculate room overlooking Freedom Tower. Considerate and helpful staff. With the DJ playing techno, the bar was chic and had the atmosphere of a club. Will certainly look forward to staying again.

We went to nyc for a friend's wedding. My girls friend and I got lucky and had a chance to see nyc with a great weather, very sunny. The view of the room was facing the freedom tower, never construction still but we a few visit spots open for visit. We had a chance to see it from above at all different times and if u like ppl watching on the streets it's definitely very cool. Besides that, u r surrounded by architecture from all different times of nyc. Very impressive. The service was good and the bathrooms and bedroom were great. Nyc rooms are never too big, specially the bathrooms. This bathroom was very spacious and the shower was pretty nice. The staff was very helpful and we were treated as guest! We really enjoyed our time there
user_name:
Joao D
New York City, New York

review_body: I have stayed in New York several times, but moving forward the W Downtown will be my only destination of choice. I went to New York for a 4 day getaway and could not have picked a better location. We stayed on the 22nd or 21st floor in a corner room with a view of the Freedom Tower and it was AWESOME! The rooms were spacey (for New York) and the design was great. The staff was very personable and accommodating to all of our needs (Rafael and Erica are the best). I was bummed to leave, but next time I go back it will totally be here! Highly recommend!!!

Sleek and modern new hotel with great rooms and a streamlined aesthetic. Very comfortable bed and linens. Lovely view of the former World Trade Center or New York skyline. Very short walk to four different subway stations, so the location is extremely convenient. Super friendly staff.

Distinctly underwhelmed by my stay at the W Downtown. My room was very tired, bumps and scrapes all over the walls. The towel rail fell off the wall, and other 'facilities' in the room were unfit for purpose.On the plus side - the bed was comfortable.Given the vast array of competing hotels in the city I have no compelling reason to return here, nor could I recommend the hotel.

Good location down by battery park and the freedom tower. Stayed for a long weekend with friends. Didn't try BLT on site but used the concierge to find good local places to eat nearby. It's a typical example of the W chain, urban/corporate/hip.

I recently stayed for one weekend night while traveling in the area. The hotel is right up next to the WTC site and does have a lot of tourists milling about. I thought the rooms were a reasonable size for NYC, had nice bathrooms (similar to other W's) and the room was surprisingly filled with light because it looks out onto the WTC reflecting pools. The only downside was there were no valets or doorman present when we got there? (I'm guessing it was because it was a Saturday night?) No big deal because we each had only 1 small bag each but you do expect that in NYC hotels or any city for that matter. The hotel was conveniently located near where our friends live in Battery Park City, close to the water with walkways and bike paths (Citi bikes are for rent nearby). Also surprisingly quiet for a NYC hotel. We'd definitely stay here again.

I was hesitant to stay downtown on a recent trip to NYC but prices are good downtown on the weekends and we love the W properties so we decided to go with the W downtown. (In fact the price was less than a Holiday Inn on the Lower East Side!) It was my first time at this particular hotel and it was a wonderful experience. We arrived very early on a red eye and they let us check in - THANK YOU - AND upgraded us! The room was super comfortable. The lobby and bar area are comfy and chic. The staff was very nice. And while this has nothing to do with the hotel, I realized how EASY it is to stay downtown! This property is close to almost every subway making it easy to access all of the places we needed to go. Downtown is pretty quiet at night, which was fine with us, but bustling with tourists during the day which was nice. We recently moved away from NYC and our room overlooked the 9/11 memorial which is gorgeous and it was nice to be able to see it. It was a little strange that the bar - which gets busy with a DJ at night, thumping music, etc - also overlooks the memorial. All W's have an night time scene. I think people expect that from the brand. And there wasn't a noise issue because of it. It was just a bit peculiar as former New Yorkers to be in a disco atmosphere above the memorial. My only complaint is almost too small to mention but is enormously important to me - there was no coffee maker in the room. I am a caffeine addict and I NEED a cup of coffee in the morning. I appreciate that they have free coffee in the lobby but I don't want to get dressed to go down and get my morning coffee. Many boutique hotels don't supply a coffee maker. However, the equally chic W in downtown San Francisco had one so I was disappointed not to have one. But all in all a terrific stay & I would stay there again.
user_name:
Alix S
New York City, New York

review_body: Very odd misses on my visit. The room service menu was out of date and both items I tried to order were no longer available. The TV remote was missing from the room. After reporting the incorrect menu, returned the next night to find the compendium was missing totally from the room. The room temperature remained very cold and the thermostat did not appear to adjust correctly the first night. To be fair, each time an issue was reported, the front desk was apologetic and engineering was quick to arrive with the missing items. The desk was empowered to offer credit against in room dining charges and the hotel manager was able to offer Starwood points in exchange for the inconvenience. But with that said, when you're looking at nearly $1,000 for two night's stay these kinds of misses in succession can't happen. This stay was for business. I'm not sure on my next trip whether I will stay at the W again, or simply move a half a block over to Club Quarters where the rate would have been substantially lower and these types of gaps would have been less annoying.

Consistent with all other W properties, that the hotel faces the 9/11 memorial is a definite differential. The rooms are standArd W property, bar area was nice and outdoor area was good to look out at memorial. Odd elevator set up but overall worth it for a weekend.
user_name:
HaphazardGourmet
New York City, New York

review_body: My wife and I stayed in a cool corner room with fantastic view. Super friendly staff and great service made this stay perfect. We appreciated the extra attention we received from Mr Metrell on our anniversary. We will definitely come back next year. Veronica and Jan Erik

The hotel seems like it has been renovated. Very clean and modern hotel. It is nice if you are going for shopping in 5th Avenue. There are quite a lot of places to eat around the area. I would recommend this hotel if you are into shopping in 5th Avenue!!

This hotel is located across the street from the new Liberty Tower. Rooms are small but nicely decorated and have all the things you need - great shower and bath amenities. Beautiful large windows overlooking the neighborhood. Very friendly staff!

Modern decor, comfortable room, conveniently located, and that's it. Service is not particularly commendable - you need to call them and remind them in order to be provided a toothbrush or a pair of slippers. No complimentary bottled water. No free WiFi in the room. Aren't all these pretty standard nowadays? Also, the front entrance is not sheltered - it would really be inconvenient on a rainy day.

I was fairly underwhelmed with this hotel it was all rather trendy but just felt fairly superficial . I guess everyone is different but the hotel really did not do much for me. The room was fine and the bed comfortable. The decor was not to my liking and for the money they charge the whole experience was fairly disappointing.Location wise the hotel is in a good location and can't be faulted from that respect. Just not the hotel for me.

This was my first stay at the W Downtown, and really hadn't thought much about the location relative to the 9/11 Memoral or the Freedom Tower. I am a platinum Starwood member, so I always try to stay at Starwood, and this time was no exception. I found the reception to be warm when I arrived, it seemed to be hopping around the bar and restaurant, and was an active place. My room was perfectly located with an amazing view of the whole 9/11 Memorial, and at nite it was beautiful. My room was clean, the bed was comfortable, and I have no complaints, except that the little mini diet coke took "mini" to a whole new level. I had to go to the bar to get a "real" diet coke, which the bartender graciously gave to me. There's a Starbucks right around the corner, what else could you need? I wouldn't necessarily stay here for a leisure trip, as the location is more business oriented, but for business travelers, I think it's very nice. I would definitely stay here again. Besides, they have the best Tuna Tartare at the bar, and the bartenders were great!

Have stayed at the W downtime a number of times, hotel is in a prime position either for Wall Street or for offices in Jeresey. The hotel itself is very modern and has great views of WTC. Main draw back is that the WIFI is not free

My family happened to be walking back to the Wall Street subway stop, when we came across this hotel and I wanted to hit the bathroom because there aren't any facilities at the memorial. I am so glad I did because it was very clean and hip. There is a nice lounge nearby too. I will say that the bathroom is unisex, so be prepared.

I liked the comfortable bed in the "spectacular" class room (their name, not a rating on my part) and was pleased with the service. the staff is helpful, polite and quick. the rooms are rather small - in fact too small for me to get any work done. bring two suitcases and a laptop and you will have trouble moving around. I find this not adequately expressed on the hotels website. also note their internet is expensive and ridiculously slow. the location is excellent if you wish to be in the wall street area. the room I stayed in lacked sufficient opportunities to charge my electronic devices. international phone calls made from my room were dramatically overpriced.

After a positive first impression with the lobby which we were looking forward to returning to for a nightcap later that evening, we were disappointed with the room which was small and exhibited shoddy workmanship all over with poor drywall work, bad paint trim work, and botched caulking. Plus the shower had a strong mildew smell. Definitely not up to W standards.When we returned to the hotel later that evening, we were again disappointed to find out that the hotel lobby had been turned into a night club with very loud dance music playing from a cheap portable sound system right next to the elevators. Not our idea of a quiet nightcap so we decided to give up on that idea and ended the evening on a sour note.

I have stayed at this hotel a number of times. I think it is a tad overpriced but if you can get it on a good deal, it is standard for the chains in Manhattan. It is the only Starwood property in lower Manhattan which is why I try to stay here when I'm in town if the price is good. Otherwise I stay a little further away and take the subway in. This was my first stay at this hotel as a SPG Platinum Preferred member and I think I was "upgraded" to a corner room. It was on a low floor and looked into apartment buildings and over a random street. I would much rather have the WTC view, which I will be requesting from now on. Also, one of the shades wouldn't come down so I had to awkwardly try to stay out of the view of the guy across the way I noticed peeking out his window at me while I waited for maintenance. The maintenance guy was great though! Commiserated with me while I told him about my horrible cab ride from LGA. Later in the evening I tried calling down to get a wakeup call and the phones in my room didn't work (which wasn't the case earlier when I called for maintenance and room service).Also there was no heat in the elevator going down to the gym which was strange. Other than that, the location is decent, the gym is decent, I like the complimentary coffee/tea bar in the mornings.

Stylish and friendly enough, this downtown hotel is poor value for money on weekends; the area is dead! Overlooking the building site that is the former World Trade Centre, the area is utterly ugly and charmless. Bathrooms are finished badly; already there was mildew beneath the silicone sealant in the shower. Not so much of a complimentary glass of water is offered; water seems to start at $7 a bottle. Outrageous.Wi-fi is an absolute rip off; it is Wi-Fi, not a luxury and absolutely necessary for any traveler in this day and age - when does hotel internet in a Downtown Financial district, constitute an additional luxury?? Ridiculous.Rooms were good but the heating was below par. Comforters / Duvets were of a high quality as were the sheets and towels.Bar scene is well before par and is overpriced; service was also poor enough (I had to go find a server).A blah breakfast for three (room service) cost over $120.

We had an awesome time at this W location. The staff was friendly, helpful, and went of their way to make sure at we had a great experience. We're planning another trip to NYC this spring, and have already decided that this will be our hotel. Thanks for giving this southern girl, such great hospitality!

The W hotel downtown is what you would expect from the W chain. When you arrive, the lobby is on the 5th floor and it's dim lighting and chic design makes you feel like you are in a swanky lounge. The service at the front desk was great and fast. It took a couple of minutes to check in and then I was on my way up the elevator to my room. The rooms are a decent size for a NY hotel. They aren't well appointed but more simple and sleek in design. My room had a large bathroom and the shower was really nice, with beautiful tiles and a rain shower head. I had a great view of the WTC memorial and the new tower. The bed was very comfortable with the typical heavenly dressings. Overall I liked this property. The 5th floor lobby also has a bar and a good sized seating area to relax. It is a bit dark and cavelike though. There is also a restaurant on the first level that I didn't try but it looked packed with people.

Friendliest of welcomes from everyone at the hotel. Nicole at concierge is the best. Room was very clean and comfortable. Moving view of Ground Zero. Tribeca or Fulton Market is a short cab away. Very handy for my work in Jersey City.

Just stayed at this hotel on business trip. Rooms are small and nothing is FREE. You pay for internet service in your room and it's not very close to the convention center without taxi service. I have stayed at W in Dallas and was more impressed for the money with that W than the one in NY. Great pub across the street :Ohara's.

This was a business trip where I had to stay down by the Wall Street area. The W Hotel was a great pick by my assistant. I got a great rate and was very happy with everything. The staff was very attentive, the property was modern and up to date and my room, though a tad small for anyone traveling with a family, was perfect for me on a business trip. The only very minor complaint I had, and I asked them to address this, is that there isn't free wifi for guest, which I was a little surprised by. But other than that, I give this property a strong recommendation!

My stay was first rate from checkin to check out. The lobby was very contemporary and the front desk staff were great. My room was very modern, well appointed and had an incredible view overlooking Ground Zero, the Reflecting Pool and the new Peace Tower under construction. The restaurant served a great dinner and very creative breakfasts. The hotel was a very short walk to the Wall Street area and there were several good restaurants and pubs nearby. And to top it off, my room rate was a good value. There is no doubt that I will be back.

W hotel NYC Downtown is conveniently located next to ground zero. Rooms are quite compact, typical of New York hotels. The service is also less personal than those in smaller cities. The reception looks more like the entrance to a night club, dark and a little mysterious, which is quite interesting. The rooms have everything a business traveler needs, one big complain though, is that the blinds are not opaque nor do they fully cover the window, making it pretty difficult to shut out the lights on the street, not to mention the sun during the day, making it a little difficult for a business traveler to get over the jet lag.

I was in the city for a business but I started my trip with a Saturday night hereThe Good:If you're looking to be downtown then this is as good a place as any, its close to Wall St, Century 21 and the metro to get you to other places. The concierge was very helpful when I needed to locate somewhere open early on a Sunday morning to re-heel shoes.The bed was very comfortable and the products (Bliss range) were fabulousThe restaurant downstairs was good with circular booths and a great selection of food.The badI felt I was too old (at 35!) for this hotel. I arrived around 9pm following a flight from London and to get to the lobby you need to get through swarms of people as the area doubles as a bar/nightclub. The tunes were pumping, people are dancing and I needed to weave through the crowd with a suitcase to stand next to the DJ box to get a lift to the bedrooms.There is a lot of white leather in the rooms, a promotional CD and large bottle of wine, but no tea or coffee making facilities. It all looked very 'cool' but not very practical. Its a small thing but plug sockets by the bed are more useful than plugs by the bathroom (I like to charge my phone at night and have it there to use it as a clock).I also wouldn't feel comfortable walking the area at night, I moved to the W Union Sq the next day and I felt much more comfortable in this area. For the same price I would chose that hotel over this one anytime.

It was cold. Enjoyed the warmth of the hotel. Friendly arrival experience. Efficient Concierge. Tasty Hot Chocolate with Marshmallows available comp for all guests. Room comfortable with great views of the freedom tower and memorial. Stayed in for dinner...enjoyed food and service. Nice variety. Good fitness center. Enjoyed all, would return.
user_name:
OmniSAColonnade
New York City, New York

review_body: My girlfriend and I stayed here for two nights just after new years for a birthday celebration and had a great experience. As a Platinum SPG member, I've seen quite a few Starwood and W hotels and from my experience the service here maintained the high quality one would expect at a W hotel. The manager and staff were wonderful in helping me make this a special weekend to remember. The guy who checked us in was especially friendly and inviting which helped set the tone for the rest of our stay. As many other people mentioned, the location is great if you're looking to stay downtown and within reasonable walking distance of different subway stops. The views of the Freedom Tower/WTC Memorial were also unbeatable. My only tiny nitpick would be that I couldn't find a way to attach my iPhone to the stereo system, however this is incredibly minor given that everything else was quite wonderful. I would definitely recommend this property to others looking at staying in the downtown area.
user_name:
Chris K
Houston, Texas, United States

review_body: I've stayed in other W hotels around the world and unfortunately this one fell far below the usual standard.Location is great and the decor etc is stylish as would be expected however the staff and service leave a lot to be desired. Our check in and welcome was poor..There was no mention of any hotel facilities and no offer for our bags to be taken to our room.The rooms are ok (if you pay extra for an upgrade). The view over world trade is impressive. The corridors are shabby with dirty carpet and shabby doors. The gym is great..excellent facilities and a good size. The bar area is nice and vibey in the evening especially with the in house DJ.All in all I was disappointed with this hotel and would look elsewhere next time I visit the city.

I stayed here for business, but was joined by my wife for a little "weekend in the city."The location is convenient to all downtown activities and sites, and there are plenty of subways nearby if you need to go further uptown (or to Brooklyn). The weekend vibe at the W is "volume up to 11" - the lobby seemed to double as the bar, so the DJ was pumping high volume tunes.The lobby is very attractive high tech Euro-styled, and fairly small, unlike some of the larger uptown properties (this ain't the Marriott Marquis!). During summer months, there is a outdoor balcony that overlooks the Freedom Tower/World Trade Center site. The balcony was closed now due to winter, but the windows look out at the expanse of the Freedom Tower construction site which is directly north of the hotel property.It's nice to see lower Manhattan come back to life in the aftermath of 9/11, and the W is one of the properties that have opened since 2001. There are still not a ton of restaurants in the area, but, hey, this is New York... you are within a short subway ride (or walk) of EVERYTHING!The room itself was small, but it was fine for a couple of days. If I were to be living out of a suitcase for more than a couple of days, I might get claustrophobic. I read a couple of other reviews that mentioned the staff... I have no complaints about the service at all. In fact, my wife arrived before I did to check in (I was at work); and I had called ahead to make sure that she would not have a problem, since the room was not in her name. I guess it pays to have status...

I booked online, and upgraded to the "cool corner room". When I checked in I was informed this room did not include a view of anything,I than asked for a high up floor and was informed nothing was available. When I got to the room I had a view of ugly halfway done under construction buildings. Their online website should inform what different views are included with the rooms, considering I upgraded and payed more for nothing. Also, in the room they charge $8.00 dollars for a single bottle of water.

My girlfriend and I recently stayed at The W for four nights. Let me start off by saying that the front doormen are AWESOME. So polite, helpful..and easy on the eyes. ;) Unfortunately, the friendliness stopped at the front door. The desk concierge could not have been more rude while checking in..and DO NOT GET ME STARTED ABOUT THE DOWNSTAIRS RESTAURANT. We literally saw three separate groups leave over the course of our four days due to the rudeness of the restaurant staff. Horrible service! The bartenders could not even make eye contact..and we visited the bar frequently. Now, onto the more positive..room service was perfect and beyond expectations. Even brought my friend a complimentary piece of birthday cake . THE VIEW OF GROUND ZERO IS AMAZING. Rooms were great size, clean and spacious. Overall, we enjoyed our time at The W due to the cool front door men and the view. Only thing holding me back from staying again would be the restaurant. We enjoy cocktails & the convenience. The bar on the 5th floor was always dead the entire time we stayed at the hotel.

This has a great business location downtown if your meetings are there, but it really succeeds as a weekend party hotel, with a very good hip bar. Unfortunately I arrived on a weekend for negotiations on Monday and Tuesday, the papers that were couriered for me to read on the Sunday were lost but subsequently found on the Tuesday. The rooms are small but ok apart from lack of power points and aircon/heating that needs an instruction manual. The staff were very friendly and breakfast and gym quite good. Buy your coffee at Starbucks across the road as hotel coffee was very poor (which says something as I do not normally recommend Starbucks!)Hotel trading as a hip place but not really up to normal Starwood standard.

Stayed here for 4 days in early January. The "W" is all about about hip and cool and this hotel doesn't disappoint. Rooms are funky, a bit on the small side, but everything is in its place our bathroom was actually quite large. Room service was very good. Staff is always attentive and on the ball, ready to please. The lounge on the 5th floor was ok. Room suggestion, ask for a room on Washington Street so you can overlook the 9/11 Memorial. I would definitely stay here again pet friendly too!

The place is weird when you get to check in, but room service is great. They kept sending me drinks to me room after bars closed across the street at the Police and Firemans bar. Staff was nice. room service drinks could have been cheaper.

I'm a platinum member at Starwood properties, so I stay at a lot of them each year. This was my first time at this particular property and I found it to be a very mediocre experience. The appearance of the lobby was very trendy and modern, and the rooms themselves are the same. But I also found the rooms to have fewer amenities than any of the other Starwood hotels I've stayed at. I was "upgraded" to a corner room at the back of the hotel that had some of the ugliest rooftop "views" I've ever seen. The problem with being in a corner room is that you get two walls of windows, and the blackout shades don't cover the gaps, so there's sun pouring into your room as soon as the sun starts to rise, and no way to make it darker. Additionally, as a platinum member, I'm used to amenities such as free water in the room (there was none) and being offered small courtesies upon checkin, but none of this happened. Small things like having zero plugs for phone chargers, etc beside the beds (either side, not even along the walls) puzzled me. Why have such a modern hotel but leave out such a crucial detail? The heating system was also not intuitive to use (and I'm not exactly lacking in brains, it just wasn't easy to use) and even just leaving the heat at one setting, first it would be very hot in the room and then it would be very cool. No consistent heating at all. Also, while I was very happy with having Bliss products in the bathroom, I had grabbed the lotion to take with me to the office and then left it there. Not a big deal, I presumed that housekeeping would have simply replaced it upon cleaning. They did not. None of the products, whether missing or having been significantly used, were replaced. Last, I was very disappointed to find that this hotel does not participate in the green program, allowing us to decline housekeeping for Starwood points. I generally prefer to do this at hotels, as I'm not messy and don't need someone in my room every day cleaning. Overall, I thought the hotel was fine, but for a price of almost $500/night, I certainly expected more amenities as a platinum member, and if they aren't given to their most frequent travelers, I can only imagine what the experience might be like for those who aren't frequent travelers. In the end, I don't see that there's any reason to actively avoid this hotel, but I also wouldn't recommend it. I think there are many better in the city, especially at that room price.

This hotel is very nice - but you need to ask for what you want. They will stick you in a small room - ask for a better room with a view. There are coffee makers available, but you have to ask for one, they won't automatically leave it in your room. There is complimentary water in the room, if they remembered to stock it. If not - be sure to ask for some. Great location, close to subway and very nice hotel!

this is probably one of the best of the brand hotels downtown. the location is hard to find but once your there you are close to the whole downtown scene, financial district, tribeca and So Ho. The staff is very friendly, the rooms are modern and comfortable so I highly recommend.
user_name:
drew b
New York City, New York

review_body: This is in regards to the service I received at the W New York Downtown Hotel. I came into town to propose to my now fiance. I wasn't completely sure of where/how I was to propose, but after speaking with Chelsea Lamberti, I was sure that I wanted to make it a private occasion in the confines of our W hotel room. Chelsea was immediately attentive to my needs and understood the seriousness of the occasion while at the same time making me feel extremely excited about what we were planning. Not only did she have numerous recommendations for how to propose, she was more than available for questions, concerns, or anything at all. She even provided me with her personal number in order to make the proposal a true surprise, which it was! She even set up the room, and did it beautifully! I was so impressed, as was my fiance! I find myself staying at hotels all over the country and after a while, everything becomes routine. W hotels have usually been good to me, but this stay was really an exception. I have to say, in this day, it is extremely rare to find the personal touch that was given to our special weekend by Chelsea and the W Downtown staff. Also, not to mention, Robert Rozko, the concierge, was extremely helpful to our needs all weekend. He surely deserves a lot of credit. I would like to give Chelsea Lamberti the highest compliment in exceeding my expectation. Thank you.

I just love this hotel. From the doorman, then to the welcome desk agent, staff at the lift, style assistan, all are amazing nice warm people. We've got a room in the corner, we enter the room, and in addition to al the design of the room we had a first row view of Ground Zero. Bed is wonderfull, space, bathrrom and shower is just heaven.Love this place, walking distance is Wall street, Soho, Tribbeca, almos very place. If you are tired, Subway is just few steps away.

I stayed here twice. Once for a girls night and another time with my boyfriend. Both times the staff was friendly, check in/out was quick, price was as expected/adequate. The rooms were clean and up to date. Stay away from room service... WAY overpriced and not that good at all. I can't really complain about the hotel itself and would have given the extra "star" but during the stay with my bf we visited the "Living Room Bar" and were attempted to be ripped off by the waitress after being served the most iced up, lacking alcohol, drink I've ever had. If you stay here and decide to hang out at the bar, watch your bill.

We stayed here as a Family of 4 on the 28th November for 3 nights.We go to NY once/twice a year & have done for over a decade, so we know about NY hotels!We got to the hotel 8pm on Thanksgiving, so very quite.... but, still took 10 minutes waiting at the desk with only 1 person there ( then they got someone else) after waiting a lovely guy called Andrew Brown served us, only for him to tell me that the W didn't have our reservation!!! which we booked with expedia...this then took over 40 minutes to get someone from expedia to say yes the room was booked and paid for.. not what you want when you want to get out for dinner in NYC.so, we go upstairs, our room was a spectacular room.. trust me it wasn't! it was much smaller than ALL other rooms we have stayed in in NY. ..and needed a good clean! then we walk in the bathroom to find the shower cubicle dirty! We go back downstairs & try and find somewhere to eat, as the bar had now closed as it took us so long to check in!! ( thanksgiving holidays, everywhere is closed downtown)Then back to the hotel, I had to say something.. Andrew then found us a suite for the night.... which was lovely, views amazing!!! A true New York experience. We thought we had that for a night, but thanks to the manager Tamara we ended up staying there the whole time.Really wonderful suite- would definitely stay in that suite again 1409.Would I stay in a basic room here? No, I don't think so. Would I stay downtown again? Yes, its a very short walk to Southport shops.. & about a 20/25 minute walk to Soho. I don't think I would recommend downtown for 1st timers to New York... but if you know the city, then its perfect! PS.. the DJ in the bar was good & not over noisy like other people have said.

Excellent location just south of Freedom Tower in Battery Park. Smallish but comfortable rooms. Very attentive staff. BLT Steak was great for lunch. Walk to Wall Street, Battery Park (for Statue of Liberty). Great area convenient to many restaurants.

This was the first stay in W hotel and it was an mixed experience. The rooms size were small and basic amminites were not provided in the room such as (team of coffee) making machine- everyone wants a bed team i guess. However, the hotel location and the staff were great. After requesting to move from 9th to upper floor while the check-0in staff didn't helped - next day after the request it was done and i was moved to 20th floor - the view is best from there and a great experience. Overall a good experience

Was here for work... But really had a great time when it was time to relax!! Room was all in all very good! It was starting to get run down a lil! Bed was comfy and a bathroom very clean. Many restaurants/delis to eat at no matter what time very close by! My biggest complaint is there are no outlets (plugs) near the nightstand. I would no doubt come back to this hotel!!

There is nothing wrong with the W in downtown New York. However, it didn't grab me at all. Bordering on the 9/11 World Trade Centre Memorial it is a sobering location. They even have a funky balcony so you can look into the memorial. Not really my thing.The entry at street level is uninspiring, a lift lobby with no adornment that takes you to reception on level 5. Then it really goes pear shaped for me, you step out of the lifts into a black world, walls, floor, furniture. I found it challenging especially at night and disorienting during daylight hours. Trendy and funky - maybe I am too old.Apart from that the room was fine, reasonable size and well kitted out. Comfortable bed and very quiet.

I was booked here by my company so I have no idea what kind of rate we received, overall things were lovely with a few exceptions. My room on the 11th floor had two full beds and was fairly spacious for NYC, great toiletries and I love the room darkening shades and window seat. The safe was large, as was the bathroom. Plenty of hot water with a great strong water flow. I never understand that the nicer the hotel, the more they charge you for WiFi - I'm sorry it should be free, $14.95/day is crazy. If you wanted free WiFi, you had to go the public spaces on the 4th & 5th floor. The gym was small but adequate, only two treadmills, but bikes and ellipticals as well as weights were available.The staff were uniformly pleasant and helpful. There was nowhere to really store your luggage - if you had a small bag you could stash it under the desk, but I was there for the week with a big bag and ended up leaving it in the open next to the "adjoining room" door. My biggest pet peeve was the lighting - there was some mood lighting behind the closet/desk fixtures and the bed headboards and then there were desk lamps on the desk and bedside table, neither of which illuminated the room in general. I was constantly swiveling the desk lamps trying to gain some light in the room. Same problem in the bathroom, the overhead lights were near the door so you really couldn't see well in the mirror - I was always in shadow. Great lobby and bar area that included an outdoor terrace. Overall - very nice!

nice hotel, good staff. you walk into the lobby its dark and so when you walk in from outside on a cold winter night going from the dark and into the dark is weird. This hotel is great if you need to stay downtown. Food in BLT is ok. Ordered lint brush online that never came.

Of course, the hotel can't be faulted for its location, but I struggle to find a reason as to why anyone would want to be down here unless you have a meeting in lower Manhattan early in the morning (as I did). The hotel is located directly across from the WTC memorial, and that adds to the unsettling sense. Generally speaking, W hotels are attractive for those seeking a hip, trendy, loungy, party kind of experience...but if you are seeking this, why are you downtown? It's a vacant no man's land. I have stayed at the W on Times Square, and that makes a bit more sense. As for the facilities themselves, the rooms are small, as expected, but chic, and the lounge area is upscale (but empty). The staff was OK...didn't seem to know that much about what was going on. This is not a convenient place to get find a taxi, so unless you are comfortable riding the subways, it will not be easy to the other attractions in Manhattan. So again, unless you need to be downtown, stay else where. If you do need to be down town, then this is worth considering but there are less expensive options than to pay for the "W experience."
user_name:
JNelsonRedSoxFan
New York City, New York

review_body: I stayed at the W New York Downtown for 3 days when I was in NYC on business late October. The room was spectacular, with a view overlooking the 911 memorial, which is across the street. It had complementary coffee or tea in the morning, and the huge King bed was super comfortable. The lobby was hip, and the outdoor terrace was fun for drinks before dinner. I'd stay there again, as long as my business appointments are in the area, otherwise it's a bit of a hike to midtown or even Soho.
user_name:
acdcusa
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: W hotels are a known quantity but often can be a little too trendy and not functional with rooms so dark I have often used the emergency torch for some extra light. The location is great if you need to be this far downtown, on arrival the staff were very friendly and helpful, the double lift format where you get one lift to reception and another to the rooms is a little tiresome when popping out but it does mean you get a second quieter bar with a nice if small balcony. The more classic W Hotel bar is on the ground floor away from reception. Rooms were very functional, WIFI was good, zircon wasn't as loud as it sometimes can be but still needed to be turned off. In short one of the better hotels I have stayed in New York but check out the location works for you.
Amazing Lobby, very Stylish , had a gorgeous view onto 9/11.Bathrooms are Star Trek style.The Staff is extremely arrogant, not matching the High Level of Spg as it is used to be.Not again for me :(

Let's start at the beginning. The bell / valet servicemen who greeted us were exceptionally friendly and helpful throughout our stay. The reception team were welcoming and efficient. The lobby design is a bit spacey and, since we arrived late at night, was lit more like a club than a hotel, complete with dj and loud thumping music. The kids (teens) were very impressed.The rooms, with a view of ground zero, were small but sufficient. I wasn't a huge fan of the spacey design concept, but again, the teens loved it. I did, however, like the window seat. More hotels should have them.

We stayed here for a belated anniversary trip, and from start to finish, the service was terrific. We arrived first thing in the morning, and they had our room ready for us. They also upgraded us and left a bottle of sparkling wine in our room to celebrate our anniversary. Such a thoughtful touch!The room wasn't massive, and not a lot of counter space in the bathroom, but there were some clever uses of space in the room and it had a great view of the new Freedom Tower and 9/11 memorial.Lots of great places to lounge in the lobby to check email (free wifi), and the gym was well-equipped, although had to take two elevators to get to it from our room.While it is in the financial district, it's easily accessible to the subway, and a nice walk up to Soho or over to Seaport/Brooklyn bridge. I would definitely recommend this hotel and stay again!

Always overly trendy this brand, but here desk, doorman and concierge service warm and friendly. Bar understaffed. Except for the view, I wouldn't drink here. Get the Freedom Tower room view; wonderful to wake up in the morning to this symbol. If it is vacation, still a good location; getting around is what the subway is for. If W was not so full of itself and clean lines, it would put a shelf under the bathroom basin for ones toiletries for guest convenience.

Choosing this hotel was relatively simple since we are familiar with the W Brand. We first experienced W in Washington with its very cool vibe, and very friendly experience. Using priceline, we purchased our stay for the Canadian Thanksgiving/Columbus Day weekend. This W is easy to get to from LGA Airport (as any other destination in Manhattan) using the subway (via taxi to get to the subway - but I digress). Check in was longer than expected. This was not the hotel's fault since the gentleman in front of me had just under 1000 questions feeding our wait time. Thinking back, perhaps another associate could have been called to front desk check us in. Our room was a pleasant surprise of high level, spacious corner room. The corner room was a known, but the spaciousness of the "cool corner room" in Manhattan is a treat. This is a 3 year old hotel overlooking the 9-11 memorial. Probably the best view of the memorial in the immediate area (see pics below). All the furnishings are in perfect working condition and shape. The bathroom fixtures are also noticeably "different" which reminds you are at a the W. Soaps, shampoos, creams are excellent quality and worth "grabbing a couple extra". The bed was a comfortable queen with a duvet on top which added to it being comfortable. Pillow's a little too soft... different strokes, I guess.One pain in design - the reception and check in are located on the fifth floor. In order to get to your room, you had to take the elevator off street level, proceed to the fifth floor, navigate yourself through the lobby traffic and THEN get into another elevator to your suite. If you were in a bit of a rush, it would be frustrating. Thankfully the elevators are relatively quick. If you thought this review was helpful, click on "helpful"... thanks

This was a special trip for my partners 40th birthday, the hotel delivered in making this a very special stay, providing a room upgrade, bubbly, birthday cake & complimentary drinks. The hotel makes personal and quirky touches that makes you feel valued, the service was exceptional and the staff were helpful & polite. The room was great, good views, excellent location for exploring New York. I would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay again.

Great Location overlooking the 9/11 memorial. At night if you are high enough you can see the Memorial Lit up, which you can't see from the ground. The outside bar looking over the memorial is also nice but the price of the drinks are high, even for NYC. The beds are very comfortable and like the sitting area on the window sill. Do not like the sliding door for the bathroom, feels like it never really closed. The BLT restaurant is a plus, had a great breakfast there and have been to other BLTs for dinner.

The website and other reviews made my boyfriend and I excited about choosing this hotel. I used a lot of credit card points and was highly disappointed. The hotel was slightly confusing to get into, as there are also residents who live there. The pictures of the lounges and bar area were a bit deceiving in appearance.
