We sat down at the bar during a slower time of the day, and were not helped for quite some time, in fact others who sat down after us were waited on first. We left our room before 9 one morning and had to ask them to clean it at 6 that night, as it had not been done. I realize this is New York and the hotel rooms are smaller than others, but I have stayed at a very nice hotel in the same area with much more bathroom space. Positives are that the view of the Trade Center Tower is amazing and due to the location there is not a lot of noise from the streets.
user_name:
Amanda V
North Richland Hills, Texas

review_body: We booked this trip very last minute with 4 teenagers (which is an adventure in and of itself). For two of the teens it was their first trip to NYC. One commented as she walked into the lobby, "This is the nicest place I've ever stayed". Again, coming from a 16-year old girl who is finicky about everything, I took this as quite a compliment. There is a very upbeat, contemporary flair to this place that made our stay here very comfortable. The rooms were nice sized, very clean, very updated and with all the comforts of home (and then some). The attached pic is a view from our room that was on the north side of the hotel giving us a view of the Freedom tower that was straight out of a NYC postcard - SPECTACULAR. The staff were all very accommodating, professional, sharp and fun. Close access to breakfast spots & subway system. You can park for Free on the Street a couple blocks away (on weekends) ~ major bonus since parking in NYC with a Large SUV would normally cost me $45 a day. The neighborhood was very safe (cops everywhere due to the fact that you are in very close proximity to the Freedom Tower/911 Memorial). I wouldn't hesitate staying here again and would highly recommend this spot to anyone used to staying at 4+ star hotels.

Location lacks unless u r doing business downtown or you wish to be extremely close to Ground Zero . Overall a very good experience , a bit pricey and the room is a bit tight for the price. I would also make sure you get a discount- location lacks on the weekend- there is nothing going on down here worth paying these prices for.

This was our first time staying @ W and forgot we how clubby their hotels feel. Walking into the lobby area by the elevators (the Living Room) was quite disorienting even in the afternoon, but we did get used to the lighting etc over time. DJ sets up shop right by the elevators in the evening, and music booms up the elevator shaft.Aside from that, we found that our room met Starwood's stringent standards. Room size was surprisingly large for NYC, very similar to standard Starwood rooms elsewhere. Bed was as comfortable as expected. Bathroom was spacious. BLISS products were fabulous. Window seat was a nice touch. View overlooking Freedom Tower was amazing.I had only 2 complaints for the room itself:(1) Lack of useful storage: close space would be fine for someone traveling solo; no dresser drawers or adequate place for toiletries etc in bathroom.(2) AC offers an automatic fan that typically cuts out at night. I always need a fan kept on low for white noise. So unfortunately we did hear our neighbouring guests.About the hotel itself, I do have to say that Reception is either poorly staffed or poorly managed. Often no one was at the desk and we typically had to wait a good 5 minutes for staff to appear. Equally bad @ check-out; ie one person @ Reception with a line of at least 5 guests. I'm glad we used express check-out! Concierge service was good.Exercise room was well equipped.Complimentary coffee/tea (very nice selection) available until 1000 AM in the Living Room.Terrace was amazing.WiFi and nice reading material available in the Living Room.We did not eat in the hotel, so cannot comment.Car service was accessible, and offered decent rates to the airport.Our housekeeper was amazing!! I think her name was Caroline.

The people at reception are clueless. The techno musik which blasts continuously in nauseating. The facilities are well below average and the food is only average. The room has lights that don't work fully. I don't know why I'm. Here except I'm at an event here and have no choice tonight. BTW if you want a drink at the bar ... Get it yourself ... I did after no one served me for 15 minutes. Also the wifi keeps dropping out .... This is not one of Starwoods better propositions.

It's a good hotel and I really liked it, but what's up with those mysterious Munchie Boxes? I've read about them in the earlier reviews, so was not particularly surprised that it happened to me too. I didn't take anything from the minibar and yet, there they are on the final receipt! It's done in a really sneaky way - I didn't get the invoice while checking out, just heard that everything was fine and it would be emailed to me. Really surprising and has never happened to me in any other hotel.Other than that, it's a really nice hotel, with the "W" vibe, and I also liked the area (despite what some reviewers say) - it's a quick trip uptown by one of the express subway lines or a cab if you take the West End Hwy. Also walking distance to the Brooklyn Bridge and then you're just minutes away from the lovely cafes/restaurants in DUMBO. All in all - a different perspective, especially if you're familiar with NY and want to try something new. The Acura service is hard to book (no luck in four days), but the staff was lovely and very helpful in getting cabs us.

Stayed at the residences for 2 month - it was a pleasant stay. The staff were friendly and they really tried to know you personally. The bar at the 5th floor was amazingly designed, and the gym was awesome. You could see the freedom tower, ground zero and the empire state in the north-facing rooms and in the gym! It's also really close to wall street as well, only a few minutes walk away. Really glad to have stayed here. Fantastic

New York wedding party booked at the W. Great corner room, comfy beds and nice size bathroom (sink was tiny - no counter space). Staff was courteous, friendly. Lobby on 5 overlooks Ground Zero. Outdoor couches and seating - on a beautiful night - very nice. Overall recommend the W as trendy, comfortable place. Our price for one night for the wedding party $220+ tax etc.. This is my 2nd experience with W hotel - also stayed in Chicago.Both were very lovely!

I should first mention that I was able to get this hotel for $151 (before taxes) through the Hotwire "Secret Deals" (which means you don't know what hotel you are getting until you book). But it was in the right area and I had pretty well been able to discern that it would be the W...so I was happy with the results.We flew in to LaGuardia on a Saturday morning at 9:30am and grabbed the $27 dollar shuttle to downtown (more on that later). We got to the hotel before 11 a.m. and I had called ahead and they do have a place you can leave your bags if rooms aren't ready, but ours was. It was adorable...if not chic! Very small (as I understand is typical for downtown NYC hotels) but spacious enough. I mean, if you are going to NYC to stay in your hotel all day...um, why go? The bed is comfortable and there is a large desk/table that takes up the entire wall in front of the window...which allows for nice space to set things up. The bathroom is actually quite spacious and modern, with a glass shower. The door to the bathroom is a "pocket door" (that slides into the wall) and ours wanted to slide all the way open if opened slightly...and I got my fingers caught in it once...OUCH! Just be careful. The BLISS brand items in the bathroom were a wonderful highlight! There was bodywash, shampoo & conditioner, body butter, soap and even face wash! I kept these and took them with us on the cruise (which is what we were doing in NYC...leaving for a cruise the next day). Funny thing is on the cruise, the Celebrity spa also uses BLISS products and you could purchase a bag with almost the same things I had gotten from the W, same sizes and all, for $16. Ha! Thanks W! Our room was on what I would assume is the west side of the building, we were overlooking the WTC Memorial site line & gift shop, but not the memorial itself. My understanding from other reviews is it is a little quieter on the sides not facing construction but we had no issues with that where we were. This location is perfect for anyone looking to walk around NYC. We took in a lot, including the WTC Memorial, walked to Little Italy/Chinatown, SoHo and Greenwich, then hopped the subway to Central Park and took in a free outdoor concert at Lincoln Center. Hopped the subway back to downtown/financial district and it's just a few blocks walk to the W from the subway stops there (which was after midnight for us, so beware the trains that stop running that direction after certain hours). Apparently the W has a car service for free around downtown, but we didn't use it.Shuttle vs. Car Service: The W offers a car service, but when I called ahead and spoke to the concierge, he told me that it would be around $120 (he did try to sell me on the convenience...not having to be driven all around NY dropping people off at other hotels) it still didn't seem worth it to me. So the van/shuttle was just fine. 1) For $27 we got an easy ride around various parts of NYC (I took out my phone and followed along on my map so I could see some of what was around me) and 2) It didn't take but about an hour from the time we left the airport. We were the last on the shuttle van, but it was a nice/air conditioned ride and I was able to do some "scoping" of the city.

I stayed here for several months after Hurricane Sandy. Overall excellent experience. Super swanky 5th floor lobby/bar, solid 24 hour gym, comfortable bed. You cannot beat the location if you're working at one of the financial firms in the area - you literally have to walk outside for 5 minutes and you're in the World Financial Center. The staff is friendly and housekeeping is thorough yet observes' your privacy. One thing to mention is the walls are a bit thin so you can hear people's conversations in adjacent rooms; however, I wasn't really bothered. Overall a great experience.
user_name:
MarkNYC4
New York City, New York

review_body: We had very good experience. Good for business...Confortable.Althought the rooms are small...the bathroom is perfect.Good amenities.Service is very good also. The bar is very nice to see Ground Cero.

Super cool hotel with a sleek and modern vibe. Guest services were superb and delightful who offered great dining recommendations. Just loved the corner king room with a perfect view of the 9/11 memorial. I am a super fan if this W!

My husband & I were coming to NY for a wedding of a dear friend who was getting married in Battery Gardens. From the second we arrived until the second we left, we had an awesome experience with this hotel! The room was clean, & staff was VERY friendly & accommodating. There was a terrace on the 5th floor with chairs and a view of the 9-11 Memorial (right across street). I had 1 of the BEST Cosmo Martini's!! The hotel also has the "Acura" experience---an Acura car/Suv will take you to your destination. We used this on the 2nd day of our stay. The car took us to Times Sq & then the W Hotel on 47th St took us back to our W Hotel (Downtown) after our Broadway show!! Service was exceptional & this is what we like when we travel--whether it's business or pleasure. There are some places that forget that they are in the customer service industry---NOT this place!!! They went above & beyond to make sure our needs were met!! Our boys are getting older (1 in college--1 a senior in HS) & they don't want to hang out with us that much anymore---so my husband & I are reacquainting ourselves with each other again!!! How many parents out there can relate to us!!!!!???? We went to ALL of our kids football games, parent teacher conferences, various activities, etc---NOW it's time for US!!! We LOVE our boys dearly but now we want to explore various cities & we will DEFINITELY be staying at a W Hotel. We are planning a trip to Miami after football season & will be staying at the W in Miami beach!! Can't wait!!

I was celebrating my first anniversary, and the guys were totally helpful with this!!! We had a great time, the stuff was friendly, the room was perfect for NY hotel, I got everything I needed anytime I asked them, they even press a couple of shirts for me in less than 2 hours, thanks again, looking forward to stay here again!

What a fabulous place. I had a room on the 16th floor with a wonderful view of the Trade Centre Site. The room was on the small side, but beautiful apportioned. The salient fact however is that the beds are ridiculous comfortable - I almost missed a meeting as a result! The décor is definitely up-to-the minute fashionable as opposed to a period, grand hotel feel but it is completely consistent with the buzz and energy of the location. In terms of location, you're less than five minutes away from Fulton Street subway (4 and 5 trains to get to the Upper East Side), as well as a couple of others. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. I know that at this sort of level, things like offering umbrellas to the guest going out is when it was raining are expected, but I didn't even have to ask. The concierge was knowledgeable and helpful.The only substantive criticism that I might have is that the gym is a bit lacking, but that's nit-picking. All in all, a great hotel.

On this trip to New York, I stayed at both the W-downtown and the W-Hoboken. Night and day. While both had gorgeous views, the staff has clearly been properly trained at the New York location. The front desk was friendly and helpful, great dinner suggestion from the concierge, and above and beyond from the doorman. I had a great view of the memorial fountains, the room was clean, and the W slogan, whenever, whatever was in full effect.

Before my stay, I have done research and was aware of many "Munchie Box" incident, where patrons were charged for snacks they did not consume. I was surprise I was charged US$0.01 & US$11.98 in my credit card statement on the day I discharged. I did specifically asked whether I had any outstanding charges when I checked out, and was relieved to be told there was none, but when my credit card statement arrive, there exist the two mystery charges.My guess is, it could be two incoming call I received a day earlier, since it's mere US$11.99, I'm too busy to pursue. But I hope the hotel can be more transparent over such matter. Afterall, these are charges incurred to my credit card without my acknowledgement, and it's not ethically correct.Other than that, I have a wonderful stay, the room was spacious and nicely decored, with very comfortable bed. Services was generally great. A pity no free wifi nor free LAN in room, but can access on their lobby on level 5. The hotel is conveniently located, with lots of eateries nearby, close walk to Century 21, and several subway stations nearby. Remarkably, the staffs are nice and helpful!

Overall the hotel was very good. The room was clean and the staff was nice. There is a courtesy car available that's kind of not advertised but if you look you'll find it. It's a nice service that I used twice. My room was small. They called it a cozy corner. (I think) I liked the corner and big windows. The room was really too small though. Almost no furniture, a bed and one chair for the small desk. There was a bench to sit at the window. We laid on the bed to watch TV. The room was either cold or hot. I couldn't regulate the temperature. The thermostat seemed to be Ok, I don't know why it wouldn't work. It wasn't the end of the world. The bath needed more light. Even the makeup mirror was dim.Even with the negative things I wrote, the visit was good. I wouldn't stay away next time.

This hotel was in a great location and gave you a great view of the Freedom tower. I stayed for 4 nights. Beds are comfy and room is clean. The cleaning people did a decent job. They would come at odd times. I had my room cleaned one day at 5:30pm. There was even a day where they left the cleaning solution on my bathroom counter. There is no coffee machine. Rooms are dimly lit. Another thing I was disappointed in was the fact that the balcony on the lobby floor (fifth) was never open. Very disappointed in that. The people at the front desk were very nice. The restaurant downstairs is delicious.
user_name:
Allen J
Seattle, Washington, United States

review_body: Although our check-in process was less than desirable, we did have a great stay at the hotel. We stayed in a Spectacular Room over looking the 911 Memorial with adjoining room for the kids. The Spectacular rooms are quite large by NY standard and very comfortable. We did enjoy a drink in the BLT restaurant one evening at the bar, and it was nice. Another evening we sat on the terrace bar and had a bottle of wine. Our only real complaint is that the bar staff on the terrace are not very well trained and seem rather 'green'. Our wine was brought out with any type of chilling bucket - and we waited quite a while with a courtesy reminder to the waitress to bring one. No service was given as far as upsell for appetizers or anything like that - basically here is your bottle of wine - see ya. Doormen are 'ok' as well - again, a little green. Saw them many times hanging out in their little office/room. Cabs are VERY difficult at this property - and we were told by the doorman (who did help us get one) that you have to wait until another party drops off and that could be 25 minutes. This could be handled better for sure. who wants to wait - and hope - that a cab MAY come by. Other hotels have techniques that assure cabs - seemingly this one could too.We took advantage of the complimentary ride in the Acura, and it was very nice. They drove us to Chelsea Market, which was a nice treat not taking the subway or a cab - and it was free!My only 'warning' is watch out for internet usage. When we checked in - the desk person simple said that our password was our last name and room number. Great. No mention of charges or that the public area is free. SO - you can ONLY imagine our dismay as our son signed on with his PS Vita, our daughter with her iphone,and my husband with his ipad!! Each device - a separate daily rate of approx $15 plus tax. Luckily we caught it in time and the front desk assisted us on that matter.Our only 'issue' was Saturday night they had the DJ playing - music was QUITE loud. We were on the 11th floor - and could hear people yelling on the bar terrace and tons of music. This went on until about 2am - and we had a flight the next morning. NOT pleased. When we brought it up at check out the gal said they have 'never' had a complaint. I call "[--]" on that. There is NO WAY - especially if you were on floors below 11th (bar is on 5th) that you WOULDNT hear it! If you stay on a weekend - BE SURE to ask for a higher floor if you intend on being in bed before 2am.The hotel is REALLY close to alot of subway lines - and we found that really great. I would definitely stay at this property again but request a higher floor.

I only stayed one night and didn't stay in the room much, but its a really nice hotel and room. I got a room at the 20th floor with view over 9/11 memorial. The room is simple designed and clean, just the way we scandinavians like it! Love the Bliss bath products too.And for the people who think it's too far downtown, don't be afraid! It's the best part of manhattan. Quiet and close to much parks.

Staying at the hotel for the weekend and looked for the Acura service. After being quoted earlier in the day by an employee policy over early arrival after just getting off a plane and looking for a noon/1pm check in and again just now experiencing being talked over and when asking not to be talked over hearing the employee at the front desk saying to a college and I quote "you gotta be kidding me"... I ask myself why I frequent this chain and are called and awarded an ambassador level when it feels like every request today is a policy answer, calls get disconnected and no apology for me having to call back etc.....NOT people service!!! And it's NOT a question of what guest frequent stay level I am it is simply a question of hospitality basics and basic courtesy. A shiny front and an attitude even in NYC doesn't serve well!!I don't believe that nor for business or personal travel I will ever again stay at this W Hotel in NYC as there are many other Starwood options and also other brands!Having been a regular guest at Starwood for 10 years plus and a so called "Ambassador level guest", the service response is not even mediocre and the employees seem rude! Maybe it's time like in an airline program to challenge another guest program and reconsider the wrongly placed loyalty....

I just spent a night at the W Downtown- I made a reservation about a week beforehand and got an excellent package deal: 2 free drinks, parking gratis and a large room. Drinks were great, room very comfortable and modern/hip- but the location, location, location. My room faced the new Freedom Tower building, which is still under construction. I was woken up by an incredible racket at 5am, a racket which went on a long time. (I wound up checking out early). I called the front desk and was offered a breakfast credit, which I accepted. Four hours later I went down to see the manager, who was very sympathetic. (And reduced the price of the room.) So, staff is helpful, rooms very comfortable and well-kept. Many streets are still closed because of the terrible storm (Sandy) so the area is difficult to navigate and there were many tourists.There's a lack of reasonably-priced restaurants. On the other hand, it's a great hotel. Get a room away from the construction and it should be a good experience, with some limitations until the area has been restored completely and construction is over.

I stayed in the W Downtown New York for one night on a business trip. It is located adjacent to the World Trade Center site where the Freedom Tower is now being built. This represents quite a dramatic backdrop to the hotel. The drama continues as you step out of the elevator to the 5th floor lobby. I arrived at night and the reflection of the neon, undulating ceiling on the black marble floor was impressive. It was a Monday night so the lobby bar was not too full, but it did look inviting. Check-in was quick and I headed off to my 20th floor room. Two things struck me as I entered. The AC was on full blast so it was freezing in the room. The second, was the size. The room was $300 / night (on my company's discount, no less) and it was tiny. There was barely enough space for me to open my rollerbag. However, the bed was extremely comfortable and the shower (with the Bliss amenities) was great in the morning. Most importantly, it was very quiet and the din of the city did not disrupt my sleep. Overall, I would happily try the W Downtown again for a business trip, but probably upgrade to a larger room. The design aspect of the hotel is much sharper and creative than other W hotels I have been to and the bar options seem attractive.

We travel to NYC frequently on work. This was the first time I stayed at the W. The service was outstanding. We got upgraded when we arrived, which I was not expecting. The staff was amazingly friendly. And the hotel is located right in the heart of the city. Drinks were a bit expensive but creative and great. The only problem I have is that now I will have trouble staying anywhere else in NYC

The W Hotel was a great place to stay for us. We were close enough to a subway station and right across the street from the World Trade Center Memorial. We were able to use this as our base to explore NYC all weekend. The hotel is very clean and trendy. The even have a DJ in the lobby bar at night. One nice feature of the hotel is the free Acura ride to any destination in Manhatten.

Whenever I'm in NYC for work, I always opt to stay at the W in downtown. The style, service, and amenities are excellent and true to the W brand. This W is located in the heart of the financial district. It is directly across from the world trade center memorial and the room I stayed in had a direct view of the twin fountains. It is also walking distance from century 21, brooklyn bridge, and battery park. One thing that always stands out about the W downtown is the exceptional service. Everyone I encountered; the bell hop, front desk, concierge, bartenders, and cleaning ladies were all friendly and helpful! The staff really go out of their way to answer any questions I have and ensure that my stay is pleasant!
user_name:
Sue S
New York City, New York

review_body: Great location!! It's a quite side of downtown and after you get over being within arms distance of the 911 memorial (it's a little creepy) it's awesome. The staff was unbelievable, restaurant downstairs was delish, the drinks at the bar were great even tho they were $14, (but that's how it is in Manhattan). It's easy to get to the subway and head up town. My girlfriend and I loved it!!

Stayed at the W New York for a conference. I'm not an SPG, and don't normally stay at W's, so I can't comment on how it compared. Our room was clean, cool, and had a great view of the 9/11 memorial. Only negative - the construction outside was very loud.And while all of that is important, the 2 women running the concierge desk were the best reason to return to this property in future. They went out of their way to make sure my visit went smoothly. One of them found me a phone charger since I'd left mine at home. They both gave great directions. These 2 ladies took the W from a good experience to a great experience!

We've had a wonderfull stay there as we discovered downtown NY. The experience of being in front of the WTC site in absolutely amazing. Very trendy atmosphere, excellent service, great location, ... A place we'll be returning to for sure...

Don't go. Overcharged. Took 4 times to get the bill right. They lied about the 'house margarita' and charged $17 plus $2 for 'rocks' that they could not explain. Then charged the tip. I'm fine with the tip but had already gave cash tip to the server. Beautiful space. And tremendous view of the WTC site. Nice servers. But horrible policy and worse managers.

Just stayed at the W downtown for a work function of about 80 people. They did an excellent job all around including handling my allergy to onions with a pre-fixed menu. Stay at W's all over including others in NY but my only one negative is that I understand the area isn't that busy for nightlife but they closed the bar down at 11ish quite rudely and called 'last call' and then didn't even really come over to ask what we wanted for last call. We had a large group there wanting to patronize both bars instead of going outside the hotel and not sure why they didn't accomodate. Suggestion to reconsider.
user_name:
NicJean
New York City, New York

review_body: I stayed here for a business trip. The view was awesome, but the room was small very spartan and looked a lot like an upscale aloft. I know that ultra-modern style is very popular with a lot of people, but not me. that said, the staff was awesome, worked to make me confortable, and it was centrally located to where i needed to be

Staying at the w residences with the most amazing view of the manhattan skyline. Our window view encompasses the empire state building dominating the background and the new world trade centre in foreground. Seeing the 9/11 reflective pools below cannot but move you to tears. Lot of construction activity going on around.Very well equipped residence with all appliances and two huge TVs. There is a good gym and sauna, no pool however. The terrace is an amazing place to see nyc with sweeping views of the Hudson River, Statue of Liberty and the skyline .... A must see at night when the city lights up. Good selection of restaurants around the W and shopping at century 21 is the best. Enjoying our stay here in the big apple at W

I booked a Spectacular Room and was assigned a Accessible Room because I requested a room without a frosted bathroom glass in the room. We were originally given a room on 10/F at check in as the check in lady said there aren't any rooms higher up. When we went up to the room with the very friendly and helpful bell boy (Tray?), he offered to find us a room on a higher floor because he knew the hotel wasn't fully occupied - and he did, so we changed to a room on 22/F.The room was quintessentially W and quite big for NYC, but I must say there were lots of wear and tear in the room, ie chipped corners, cracked bathroom tiles, stained desk, etc. At that time, I thought the use of space was terrible, with lots of empty spaces in the room and bathroom, but thinking back, it might be because it is an Accessible room. Despite there being lots of space in the bathroom, the shower and sink area were tiny! There aren't much space for you to put anything.What really shined at this hotel was the service and attitude of the concierge, particularly Nicole (?). She was very friendly and helpful, and she helped us arrange and research into lots of stuff. She was also the only one who recognized me and greeted me by name every single time. The Acura car service was also very useful and there was always at least one available to me, even with a 15 minutes notice. All of the drivers were very friendly and knowledgable about the area.There is no free wifi in the room, but there is free wifi in the lobby, which doubles as a chic bar with loud music and crowds at night.

Great location for business but quite far from anything else. Staff is great but for what tgey charge a night I would expect at least complimentary WiFi in the room. Breakfast is also not included and lacking substance. Overall good design, good room size, very comfy bed but more style than substance.

Great downtown location right next to the World Trade Center site. Eclectic and stylish design, including a great modern window seat in the room. Large bed and bedroom and bathroom (by New York standards). Nice breakfast restaurant in a bistro style with really good food at reasonable prices.

Just spent the weekend in NYC and stayed at the W downtown. Staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. I arrived before the stated check in time, but was given a room straight away. Room size was good for NYC, and and a pretty decent sized bathroom also. I have stayed at a number of W hotels before, and as always the bed was very comfortable.To mirror some of the previous reviews, the downside for me, was the noise level from the room. Walls seemed to have been made from paper, hearing full blown conversations on the corridor outside at 3am. My room also seemed to suffer from being right beside the elevators. So there was a constant "ping" everytime one stopped on the floor. Also the lack of a plug socket beside the bed is annoying, with only being able to use the ones under the TV to charge devices.I didnt eat or have any drinks at the hotel so cannot comment on those, and was unable to use the Accura car service during my stay as it was fully booked.

I was there for only 3 nights but I had the best service. Nicole and Robert (concierges) were very helpful. The Accura experience was outstanding. My room was clean and very comfortable. I am sure it is family oriented though...The lobby and terrace have open Wi-Fi.

Jason, Marlonn, and Mateo went above beyond the call of duty and showed a level of customer service and hospitality to us (non-guests of the W) that will ensure our guaranteed future patronage, and our whole-hearted recommendation. Please commend your staff for an EXCELLENT experience.

The W Downtown, like other hotels in the area (Andaz Wall St., Millenium Hilton, Conrad, Ritz Carlton Battery Park etc.), should really only be considered if you need to be downtown. If you are coming to New York to visit the sites, downton is not where you want to be. Subway access is fine, but restaurant/bar options are limited and the area becomes a ghost town, by New York standards, after 9:00 PM.Assuming you need to be in the area, the W is a decent choice. Better than the Millenium Hilton. Not nearly as nice as the Ritz Carlton or Conrad, but better access to transportation, etc. On par with the Andaz. Like most Ws, the rooms are on the small side and dark, but laid out fairly efficiently. Plenty of desk space, although you may need to order a light to actually see. Stay on the north side of the hotel for views over the WTC Memorial. Construction noise has not been bad during my visits. Business center is passable, but the computers are on stands with no desks, so it is largely limited to online work or printing materials. The BLT Bar and Grill has been good in the past, especially the burger, but last call for food and drinks is as early as 10:00 PM. Worse, on my last visit it had a "B" rating.

Very nice hotel. Still feels like new. Very clean and comfortable. More a business hotel than anything. Poor location for families -- except for WTC of course. As a Plat member I wasn't upgraded despite eligible rooms being available. But didn't fight it. Just remember this if your a Plat member. You might have to fight your way into the upgrade you deserve.

For how much it costs, the W downtown is really poor value and poorly designed. The checkin took forever, and our rooms weren't ready for the check in time. The desk clerk couldn't follow simple instructions or requests, like to have the bags taken up to the room ps as soon as they were ready. In order to get to the rooms, you have to go through the bar. So every time you go in and out, you feel like an inconvenience because the staff are more interested in serving the clubbers, who are paying $250 for a take on the bar balcony. Rather than looking after the hotel guests who've paid to use the facilities. Then when we got in the room the style over substance continues..1. There were no sockets next to the bed.2. The radio didn't work3. There are only two small draws in the entire room, 1 under the bathroom sink and one next to the bed.4. The head board doesn't extend the full length the bed, so one person can't sit up comfortably.5. The bathroom door handle was loose6. The sockets in the bathroom were loose7. The walls were scuffed, and not just low down high up as well. So need repainting8. There is loads of space, and no where to put anything!9. If you want a coffee, its $6+ $6 delivery +20% gratuity! No hot drink facilities anywhere!10. There is one mirror In the bathroom and no seat near a mirror for make up etc, and you can't do a full length check in the bathroom mirror.11. There's this great big bedside lamp, that doesn't swivel or do anything useful apart from take up precious space.Overall we felt like an inconvenient unwanted guests to some trendy NYC night club. Go stay at the Yotel, its far superior.1. There is no greeter or valet to welcome you to the hotel.2. It

In a city with already a great many 4.5/5-star hotels, this W, part of the W Hotels chain at many of which I've stayed globally, this location excels in all areas: superior location, stellar service, lobby is the usual mind-blowingly chic W Hotels excellence, interior decorations & custom commissioned art are custom to the location, rooms look brand new thanks to their high levels of servicing, balconies and views are amazing (friend's fiance had the famed Wow Suite for bridal purposes), and the vibe is true NYC glitz.I stayed for a friend's wedding & the "Whatever Whenever" level of service to the bride was played out before our eyes with every request understood and done at a sensitive & demanding time of my friend's life.I can't say enough about this hotel. Stay here for life elevated.

When my travel agent suggested this he said it was an out of the way 4 star for less than the price of a 3. I was so impressed from the moment I walked in. Very hip and modern reception and bar. The rooms were just as modern. They were cosy but generally it was a place to put my head. The 1 train is just around the corner and drops you at Times Square in about 20 minutes. Just got to be careful on weekends as sometimes the subway isn't running due to maintenance. There's a few eating places around, but you generally need to go further afield although and OK on on the corner.Wasn't I pressed with the breakfast in the Hotel, but I'm still giving it a 5 as I was very impressed and will definitely stay again next time I visit

Interesting location across street from 9-11 Memorial. I got put off right way however, by the alleged valet service when I got out of my car. A odd fellow from the hotel quickly told me that it would be $65 (I think its $36 at the W in Union sq) for the service in a tone that seemed to be meant to discourage me. When I agreed to pay it he then asked me if I could get back in my car and park it in a space behind me! When I looked at him like he was crazy he said that the valet service wasn't part of the hotel and thus he couldn't move the car! Wow what a deal for $65. Fortunately things went uphill after that. Rooms are best described as space aged pods. Very modern and quite sleek. Had drinks and a shrimp cocktail ($16-4 good size shrimp) on the terrace. Nice service... Dinner at BLT was quite good and fairly reasonable. Definitely try the polenta with cheese and bacon as a side. Excellent!

My husband and I travel to the city numerous times a year as it's my favorite place to be. We have stayed at several different hotels in several different locations throughout Manhattan. At our last stay in the city, we had admired the looks of the the W Downtown from our room in another neighboring hotel we had been staying in.So for my birthday we decided to book our stay at W Downtown. Our check-in was speedy and the staff friendly. The hotel was very trendy and almost futuristic looking. It was neat, but not usually what I would go for. Our room was clean and plenty well stocked with lots of little things that you could buy. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom, was nice, but no bathtub, the lighting in the room was TERRIBLE!!! There was not enough of it and what was in there kept flickering and was dim. Plus they charge for everything and the prices are high and no free wi-fii.The crowd that was staying the hotel seemed to be a younger crowd (my husband and I are in our 40's). There was a couple of young boys there skating around on roller blades and some with skateboards. This seemed odd to me because I thought it was more of a business hotel.Room service was good and the food delish. I caution you however, to be very careful when ordering from the breakfast door hanger. It is very misleading. We ordered our breakfast from it the 1st night we stayed and when it arrived the next morning, they double charged us for everything ($90.00) for a breakfast ($12.00 for coffee, $6.00 per cup for juice, our breakfast $41.00). The door hanger made it appear as if the coffee and the juice was included with the 2 breakfast dishes we had ordered. Plus there was lots of extra taxes, room delivery fees, services charges, etc. When I had called to speak to someone about this and get a copy of my bill, it took almost 6 hours before I had gotten it resolved and numerous phone calls. The manager, Courtney I think her name was, was very nice and eager to please. She immediately fixed the bill and sent a copy up to our room. I was grateful for her.I was also disappointed with the Acura service that they offer. 2 nights in a row I tried to book it to get to our evening events and was told both nights that they were booked. The 2nd day I called by 9 am for 5 pm that night. He told me they only have 2 cars for 200 rooms and they book up quick. Perhaps if you're going to offer a service for that many rooms, you should have more cars. I was very annoyed with this.We had a very nice man visit our room from engineering as we couldn't figure out how to open the fridge. He was very nice and helpful. That is the the biggest plus of W Downtown.........the staff were all very friendly.On the day after my birthday they did send up a card, a peice of cake and 2 bottles of water to our room. I thought this was very nice.All in all, for what you pay and what you get, I much rather prefer the Bryant Park Hotel or Marriot Downtown. I probably wouldn't stay here again.

Starwood hotels charge you extra if you want wifi in your room, and it is fine, but in my last visit the Wifi in W Hotel in the Financial District in New York didn't work 80% of the time. It is trendy as many other W Hotels in the world but nothing spectacular. The rooms are as expected but it is overpriced. Specially if the extra services you request are not effective.

The hotel was clean and the staff were nice but there were a number of things that disappointed:1. TrendinessI've not stayed in a W Hotel before so this may be reflective of the brand rather than thin particular hotel but I'd found it tried way too hard to be modern and hip, yet missed the mark. I'm talking about little touches like placards saying things like "have a bite" that was placed beside snacks near the mini bar. When I saw this my impression was originally "oh wow that's nice" and then I realized there's a menu and it shows you how much you have to pay. There's lots of these little placards around and I didn't see the point of them....2. Nothing is freeOk ok... Put out peanuts, chocolates, biscuits whatever.... But those little placards telling you to eat them or drink them or use them.... Then showing the price of them, hmmm. There's even a price displayed for the umbrella amongst other things. And why is breakfast not complimentary? Ditto wifi?!3. LocationGood for business... Not a great hotspot for tourists other than battery park, world trade centre and Wall Street which I think is easily achievable and better if you stay somewhere else and visit as a Half day trip.4. Room sizeLastly.... The room size was tiny, rivaling the hotels I've stayed in Paris for space at a premium. My room barely contained the bed and a small space around it for calf stretching.In all.... Adequate but not good nor poor, hence three stars

'Whatever Whenever' says the button on the phone. This perfectly describes the experience of staying in this hotel. The service is excellent. Nothing is too much trouble. We flew over from London for a leisure weekend and then a week's business trip and above-all needed a hotel that could make this busy trip go smoothly and relax us. They helped us move from another hotel that fell way below expectations. They took us to Central Park as part of their complimentary (yes, free) drop-off service. They gave us an incredible room with a view over-looking the WTC site (bit odd as a view but feels special to watch New York putting the area back together again). The bar is great. The facilities are great. The gym is brilliant. The atmosphere is special and luxurious without the pretentiousness of other places I've stayed. I will definitely come again and definitely recommend it.

We normally don't stay this far downtown but decided to because of the business that brought us back to New York. It is really a poor location for anything other than seeing the World Trade Center memorial. Also the hotel room was kind of beat up with lots of scuff marks on the wall. The pros: -Decent sized room for New York. -pretty nice views because the hotel is on high levels- swanky atmosphere and bar area typical of any W hotel I've encountered-the bathroom was small but made of leather which was very different and kind of cool to seeThe cons: -Even with a do not disturb sign on we were disturbed 3 times! What's the point of the sign if housekeeping and the mini bar checkers do not respect it?! -at check in there were three people at the desk but only one working. So we had to queue up in a long line with our heavy bags before being helped. I don't understand why everyone who works there is so inept and unhelpful. - in the middle of the night there was some sort of alarm - so I called the front desk and they said they were aware of it and it would be taken care of soon. It wasn't for over an hour until like 4am. Unacceptable. -the elevators are really noisy and almost every room on every possible floor centers around them. So you constantly hear the noise from guests waiting for the elevator as well as the noise from the machine. -location is subpar if you're looking for a convenient place to experience what NYC has to offerWe will not be back.
user_name:
luxurylover86
New York City, New York

review_body: We received an upgrade 'cause they didn't have enough King standard rooms. We were on the 16th floor overlooking Ground Zero. Spectacular. Lots of tourists, lots of cops, lots of activity for Bike New York, but the room and the view were outstanding.One issue--baggage storage and car valet service was pretty bad. Not enough people doing it. One woman had her car ticketed when it was double-parked in front of the hotel after the valet parked it there. Apparently, they couldn't find some of her stored luggage. Talking to the cops about removing the ticket? You guessed it!

After the disastrous experience in W Union Square, we were dreading our stay at the W Manhattan for one night on the way back to England. But what a refreshingly wonderful experience this was. The staff were excellent and courteous despite our check in at 1 AM ! Quick check in with all requests taken care of within 10 mins. The rooms are very nicely furnished and are sleek and contemporary with a modern feel. The frosty glass wall in the shower area is not for everyone but looks great. The size of the 'Spectacular' room is perfect even with a baby cot in with a convenient wardrobe. We had large suitcases from all of our shopping and it didn't feel cramped at all. The location is excellent. Our room had a large picture window overlooking ground zero and manhattan. The hotel is in walking distance to Century 21 shopping mall and lots of lovely eating places ... Great location to explore Manhattan from. Highly recommended.

I treated my girlfriend and I to a weekend in NYC and spent Friday night in the W Downtown. We heard great things about the hotel, and it more than met all of our highest expectations. The corner room we stayed in was nothing short of spectacular with an incredible view of the Freedom Tower and the 9/11 memorial. The architecture of the lobby and the room was very cool. My girlfriend was in love with all of the bath and shower amenities. Everyone at the hotel was very nice and helpful at directing us where to go. The only difficulty with the stay was not wanting to leave the room!
user_name:
Drew G
State College, Pennsylvania, United States

review_body: Comfortable room with a great view of the World Trade Centre memorial and the Freedom Tower. Great location downtown. Breakfast is not a buffet so allow at least 30 minutes for fresh cooked fayre. Nice and leisurely, though would like it to be a little swifter during the week. Breakfast was good quality. Bar and reception area is nearer a night club rare than hotel lobby which is different. Balcony of the bar overlooks the WTC. Altogether so far so good. Attentive staff are helpful.Some Gym equipment was broken. Disappointed there is No pool, sauna or steam room.

Typical W feel of trying too hard to make 40 year old business men feel they are hip.It is a pain having to switch elevators at the 5th floor lobby... An area the keep "club" dark and is miserable to navigate.Room was nice, small, and unadorned... But ok.No major complaints, but surely there is better.

Having stayed at the W downtown a few months prior, I was treating my sisters to a night in the city and decided to go for this hotel again as it was so good the last time and the location/connections are fantastic! Second time round, the wonderful team at the W did not disappoint. We were checked in by JaVonn who was very friendly, got to the room, which was impeccably presented, clean, bright and with a great view of the memorial. We had some 'Wheels' booked for later (the hotel's complimentary guest drop off service) but were told when we arrived for the reservation that the Acura was stuck in traffic and our reservation could not be honoured. 7PM on a friday in Manhattan is pretty sketchy anyway, but how would we make our reservation for dinner with no way to get there? This is where the team really shined...they apologised and offered to pick up the tab for our cabs there and back (i don't think this happens often but who am i to say?), and were very amicable when we returned to the W living room, chatting with us and making us feel very welcome. Upon return to the room, a little set of gifts was waiting on the table with a lovely handwritten note from Chelsea.you made our Manhattan night out all the more special and memorable, and the team at this W need to be recognised for their professional, discrete fun and friendly approach - a great example of what customer service should be. They really did go 'above and beyond' my already high expectations I have come to get from W Hotels. I will definitely be staying again when i return! The only thing i would say was that i enjoy the W living room DJ mixers, they come up with some very unique and atmospheric beats (Check their app!), but the DJ on that night didn't seem to be playing regular songs instead of being a bit different and original. It's such a small thing that it's hardly worth mentioning! Many thanks to Chelsea, JaVonn, and Robert and team W Downtown. Again!

Fantastic welcome from lovely staff for our family including a 4yr old and 9 yr old. They will never want to stay anywhere else after our stay. We had 2 interconnecting rooms with great views over the 9/11 fountains. Extremely comfy beds - none of us had any difficulty sleeping! V well situated for getting out and about - all the main attractions are within easy reach. great atmosphere in the bar and restaurant area. Really lovely to grab a free tea or coffee and sit in the lounge while we planned our daily outings. quite a few local cafes and diners if we wanted a change from the hotel restaurant. although it's in the financial district it has plenty for tourists to do. Very relaxing chilled out week for us! Thanks to everyone at the W. We had a great time!

This hotel s directly across from the 9/11 memorial. Near the WFC. This is a. Dry cool hotel where a dj plays house music in the lobby after 600. The king beds are great. My only issue is that you have to switch elevators in the lobby. This is the same in London and Fort Lauderdale. I hope W doesn't continue with this annoying feature. No pool

This hotel is beautiful. Ultra modern, very clean, and friendly staff. The room was probably a little bit bigger than a normal NYC room- which is still small, but its decorated so well and so clean that it doesn't feel as small. They fill the bathroom with Bliss products, which are incredible. The only complaint I can think of is that the shower leaks out onto the floor and there is no vent or fan in the bathroom. Don't worry about the floor- there are loads of fluffy white towels. Complimentary robes too. They also supply great coffee, tea and a rockin' mini bar....expensive, but worth it when you don't want to leave the room. Oh, 24 hour room service with a kids menu as well. We requested more coffee and they were there in minutes. Housekeeping was very good as well, and extremely nice.The area is across from Ground Zero, and it is an extremely busy part of town in the morning and afternoon, at night it's fairly quiet. We faced Ground Zero and were never affected by the noise.The hotel is close to the subways. I got a great deal on the room; I think the construction of the freedom towers across the street may deter people. The restaurant also had a beautiful bar and restaurant, however, we had a toddler with us so it wasn't really a kid friendly atmosphere- very dark and chic, would have loved to had a drink there. Front desk staff great, they gave my son a little car to play with, and were always smiling and helpful, check in was a breeze. Really great experience.

This was my third trip to NYC and my second stay at a W Hotel. I was spoiled from my first trip in 2005 but thought I would never be able to afford to stay here again. For my recent weekend trip with a friend, she found this hotel to be lower in price than some others that we had researched. Given that we shared the cost, it made it a little more affordable for me so I was happy that we were able to secure a reservation. The location was great for us, close to a store that we wanted to check out and walking distance to other locations like Battery Park City, Wall St., Trinity Church, etc. We had a great view of the 9/11 Memorial and it was stunning and shocking to see this up close and realize that it wasn't a dream at all, it had actually happened. The room was quite spacious given that it's NYC and real estate is at a premium. The concierge and hotel staff were all wonderful. The bed was amazingly comfortable! I liked the added touch of free coffee in the club/lounge area next to the check-in desks - while we had a coffeemaker in our room, the coffee was better in the lounge. We didn't receive enough condiments for our coffee/tea but requested it and they were quick to oblige. I absolutely LOVE the W and will try to make a point of staying there each time I visit NYC; unfortunately, the cost is usually out of reach for me. If you want to splurge and know that you're getting a great, comfortable space for your stay, it's the only way to go.

Whenever I'm in NYC for work, I always opt to stay at the W in downtown. The style, service, and amenities are excellent and true to the W brand. This W is located in the heart of the financial district. It is directly across from the world trade center memorial and the room I stayed in had a direct view of the twin fountains. It is also walking distance from century 21, brooklyn bridge, and battery park. One thing that always stands out about the W downtown is the exceptional service. Everyone I encountered; the bell hop, front desk, concierge, bartenders, and cleaning ladies were all friendly and helpful! The staff here really go out of their way to answer any questions I have and ensure that my stay is pleasant. On my last trip here, I was particularly impressed by Robert, the concierge. He is a friendly and knowledgeable man with the inside scoop on the hottest places to wine and dine in NY. With the hundreds of options to indulge myself at in the city, it's nice to have someone who can filter through and pinpoint the best options according to my personal taste. Thank you so much, Robert! I will be back again!

Following my last (disasterous) stay and mail exchange with the GM I tried again. I even warned them that I was coming back. No record that i had been in touch, or stayed before (even though SPG). The first room had to be changed - even though check in knew that I had previous problems they still thought that a room next to the lifts was a good idea. However eventually things got sorted and turned around. The rooms are small but it is very convenient for downtown

We love the W properties---haven't had a bad stay yet. This particular location is in downtown NYC very near the financial district. The service excellent, hotel staff is friendly and helpful, Bliss products in the bathroom, nice bar, nice workout room, very modern rooms with nice furnishings. In the morning, there is free coffee & tea along with an assortment of newspapers (New York Times, USA Today and WSJ). They even change the elevator mats 3 times a day to greet you! (Good Morning, Good Afternoon and Good Evening).The only drawback with this hotel is that it IS at Ground Zero which we found painful, to say the least. I don't understand the tourists with their cameras and the vendors hawking souvenirs at such place. It seemed very macabre to me.

This hotel is right opposite the Freedom Tower which is quite a view to wake up to in the morning..The hotel is fairly new, beautifully designed and very well maintained. The rooms are small but modern and comfortable. It is very quiet. The gym is small but does the job very nicely as you would expect at a W. The restaurant was very good for breakfast. I liked the vibe of the hotel and found the staff particularly welcoming and helpful.The area is hardly the heart of Manhattan. If you have business uptown, this location is not for you. If however, you need to do business in the area ( our corporate office has moved nearby), this is a great place to stay. It is top of my list in this end of town.

Just in front of Ground Zero, this hotel is amazing. The lobby (located in the 5th floor) becomes a "night club" on late evenings with nice music...I checked-in at 09:00 am, when I was supposed to do it by 3:00 pm. And this is one of the things I value most... If you have a room open, let people check-in and don't say "you're about to check-in in 5/6 hours, but now I'll let you go...". I hate attitude...Anyways, the room is small and the internet (free on the lobby) is paid on the rooms.Good location if you are in Financial Distric or don't bother jumping the Subway when heading anywhere but F.D..

one of my top preferred hotels! Amazing every single part of it: location, view, room's conditions, color combinations, F&B incredible. Staff is great and very kind... if you are going to NY you should stay here, or if you are looking for something more in the middle of manhattan... never mind, you should also step by downtown when you visit Ground Zero and have some drinks at the hotel. Great music... completely W!
user_name:
OscarAlcocer
Mexico City, Distrito Federal, Mexico

review_body: We managed to get a great last minute deal at 230/night, which is fantastic for NYC, and even more fantastic for a W. also, during booking, the booking engine crashes, so only one out of our two reservations went through. Once up again, the price had jumped $170/night. I contacted SPG Platinum chat, who again called the hotel, and they sorted out the bookings. Excellent service!The hotel is located in the financial district, with plenty to see in the area. Brooklyn bridge is within walking distance. There are also plenty of subway stations within a few minutes.We both got upgraded at checkin, and my room, as a Platinum was one of the huge Cool corner rooms overlooking World Trade Center. Very nice, but be aware that construction starts early in the morning.The room itself was nice. A nice reading area by the window, as always a very comfortable W bed, iPhone charger, dock, huge munchie box and nice minibar. The interior was surprisingly light to be a W.The bathroom however was disgusting. Housekeeping had not cleaned the toilet, and the seat had urine all over. The rest looked fine. Nice big shower with Bliss products.The lobby/lounge/bar is very popular, and we really enjoyed it. Cool design, especially the ceiling. Great bartenders.I would say for the price I paid, the value was ok. But not sure I would return.

Room didn't get cleaned first day or 3rd day. Staff asked if I had told them I wanted it cleaned! Carpet in hallways and in room needed better vacuuming every day. It feels shoddy and a bit dirty as carpets are never clean and baseboards and wallpaper is peeling.Didn't replace complimentary bottle of water any day of 4 day stay. Asked for more towels and didn't get them.Dirty glasses left out side door for 1.5 days.Housekeeping needs huge improvement in both attitude and attention.Food from Room Service and Breakfast is very good.Beds are very comfortable and it was quiet if you get a room away from construction, Air conditioner no matter how it was adjusted was either off or way too strong/cold.

I booked it for Valentine's Day weekend, and the rate was so good that I was hesitant. I was honestly expecting horrid service or something, and I figured out what the something was the next morning...construction at the 9/11 Memorial site. I was on the 16th floor, and, although the view was great, the noise woke me up...at 8:00am, which is surprising that they were working since they can't seem to get the thing completed.That aside, the hotel is wonderful! The staff was the best I have experienced in a W Hotel, which in my opinion, is often an IKEA that allows you to book an overnight stay. That is to say, it always looks chic, but they service never matches. The W Downtown - NY had the service to match during my stay. Sabrina at the front desk, James at the door, and several of the maids (I apologize for not catching their names) treated the property like a 4 star hotel.The room, I booked an upgraded size room, was much bigger than I am used to seeing in NYC. The location is a short walk to the subway (Cortland St, if I recall), so it makes staying in the financial district convenient.My recommendations: If you aren't afraid of high floors, book as high up as you can! The standard size room is sufficient, the upgraded room isn't really any bigger, so save the extra money for lunch.

As with most W hotels this one is darkly lit. there were not enough lights in the room to really work in bright light but i do understand the W may be more for the younger crowd that doesn't necessarily work alot in their rooms! The lobby and bar are on the 5th floor which is differenct but the service of the bell and front desk were excellent. The bed and pillows are definitely good which is the main thing i care about when staying at a hotel. The rooms are small but that is normal for a new york hotel. The annoying thing for me was the lack of plugs (none actually) next to my bed to plug my blackberry/alarm. The plugs for the lights and alarm were built into the furniture and you couldn't unplug them to even put in your own. So i would say the hotel is average. Adding the plugs would have made it one rating higher for me. (excellent view of the 9/11 memorial site if your room faces that direction)

If you are staying downtown, this is a more 'hip' alternative to other staid, 'business' hotels in the area. Typical high level design of W Hotel's. Rooms have excellent view of the 9/11 Memorial site, and in close walking distance of the other sites of interest in the downtown area. Free coffee service in the morning, and excellent concierge staff, particularly Nicole. Only minor complaint is that sometimes the modern design theme is taken too far - hard to find on/off buttons on table lamps, and would also note that the frosted glass 'peek a boo' panel on the shower area also allows one to see you while utilizing the toilet, so be aware of that if you are staying in the room with another person. Overall, a great and different choice of hotel in the downtown area, that makes for an enjoyable and memorable stay.

This hotel is well located, it is less than 1 block from subway and within walking distance of Battery park etc. The rooms are small but that can be said for most NY hotels, Bathroom is a good size. We had booked 2 rooms and had some issues getting checked in due to room availability, asked to come back in 60min but still not resolved, it took some further escalation before we finally got the 2nd room.The front of house staff could take a lesson from the doormen who were always polite.We ate in the restraunt on the night we arrives, food was goo and had a good atmosphere. I would stay here again.

Definitely a nice W, not as nice as the one on Lexington. Doormen are super nice and helpful so a great 1st impression. Check-in lobby nice, but a bit dark. I'm not a huge fan of the white modern furniture look, but the bed was super comfortable with great linens. Great large desk area. Amazing view of the 9/11 memorial. Bathroom was nice, but I was put in a handicapped room so the shower chair took up a lot of space. LOVE the bath products so much! Bliss gained a customer because of their placement in these hotels! Will absolutely stay again at this hotel.

This is a great W hotel. The lobby has the feel of a cutting edge nightclub. I travel on business and don't have much time for just hanging out - but enjoy experiencing the nightclub feel of the lobby for the few minutes while I am checking in, waiting for the elevator, etc. The rooms are contemporary with white built in furniture with curved edges - a motif that carries through into the bathrooms. The sink does not have a lot of room for toiletries as the edge is small and is taken up by a stack of glasses, soap dish, make-up mirror - a shelf would be a nice addition. There is a long window seat as in many W hotels. Not much to do in this area in the evening, but there are restuarant options within walking distance. Have stayed at several hotels in the financial district and the W and the Ritz Carlton are my favorites.

The W Hotel is on the top of my Hotel Loves list. Rooms, interior design, decor, ambiance, lounges - everything is just AMAZING. The change of the 'Good Morning' to 'Good Afternoon' to 'Good Evening' mats in the elevators and attention to other details continue to make the W a top choice for fun, quirky travellers. The W is NOT the Palace or the Waldorf-Astoria, it's in a class of it's own, perhaps a class much better than the aforementioned.The staff at this location were amazing and very helpful. The Lounge on the 5th floor overlooking the new World Trade Center is accessible to all and has a DJ playing most days. You can head over to this lounge to chat with people and make new friends or just to enjoy the weather from the outdoor seating area and overlook the city. My stay here was amazing - and if I visit the south of Manhattan again, this would be my go to hotel. The W also has a Times Square location for Midtown travellers.

I stayed here for 3 nights to visit with friends from out of town. I stayed the previous 3 nights for business at Club Quarters right aross the street, and my friends were all at the Marriott also across the street. The W was a bad experience. I've stayed at a few and it was a favorite choice of mine, but not any more; that constant Euro beat and creepy nightclub vibe just feels old and cheap now. My room seemed a little dirty - in all the cracks where it might not be noticed by everyone. The service was poor, i made three phone calls trying to get water in my room (which was supposed to be there on check-in), finally got dressed and visited the front desk and felt like i was disturbing the party asking how one goes about getting water. I couldn't wait to get out of that hotel. I should add that I was so pleased at C Quarters, and regretted moving, but I was using points for my stay at W. I got a pretty good look around the Marriott and wished I was there also! All of these hotels are in a good location for the World Trade Center area, but C Quarters has the best view from their restaurant with outdoor balcony. I don't like writing negative reports, and i never thought I would about a Starwood property, but this one is definitely up to NYC standards.

We stayed here our first night and then moved to Midtown. That was the plan all along, but this W is not as nice as others I have stayed in. Everything was perfectly fine, just not above and beyond. Our room overlooked the 9/11 memorial which was very neat, but because of all the construction it is hard to walk around in the area.

We live in NYC and decided to shake things up and have a staycation downtown. This was a great choice. Great location close to many subway options. Room service food is delicious. We were upgraded to a spectacular room with a perfect view of ground zero. Service was above and beyond with everyone we encountered. I would highly recommend staying here if you are staying downtown. One of the coolest things is they offer free pick ups or drop offs in their Acura if you let them no ahead of time.

I booked my room a month before Hurrican Sandy hit and I was concerned because I had to stay in the downtown area near Battery Park City but the hotel remained closed until just before my arrival. (All of the other hotels in the area were closed as well.) The W website had a directly email for information and the general manager assured me that they would be open to welcome me. I arrived on what was their first day open after cleaning up after the storm and I have to say that they really had their operation going full-speed-ahead. I was greeted warmy by doormen/bellmen and registration was a breeze. I was in room 2107 without delay.My room faced north and I looked upon the WTC/Freedom Town/9-11 Memorial site (see pics). By NYC standards the room was pretty roomy (if you've stayed in NYC before you know that even pricey hotels often have smaller than average rooms). The bed, as always, is comfortable and the design is very modern: zebra-pattern carpets, lizard-skin pattern bathroom tiles; it's just really cool interior design. Oh, bar area is really nice too, a number of my friends met up in the "Livingroom Bar" and had several rounds before dinner.The bathroom is very bright and minimalist with a pocket door. Although I liked the bathroom, I think that someone with a lot of toiletries would be frustrated wtih the lack of counter space around the vanity. My room had no tub, just a glass enclosed shower stall with a frosted-glass wall separating the shower from the room.A bottle of water is provided and a welcome box of small salted gourmet toffee. Robe, iron, hair dryer, and safe are all there. They also offer the Acura Experience but you must plan ahead a bit.My only complaint is that my room was near the ice machine and what I think was a service door because I could hear the ice maker motor running from time to time and once at 3:10 a.m. a maintenance worker's press-to-talk phone volume while in the hallway was so loud that it woke me up.I read others' reviews that complained about the entry/lobby/bell stand but I don't see what the problem is. I was greeted warmly and directed to take the elevator up to registration. Baggage hold is at the ground level so make it when you need to leave. Also, although I was facing the WTC construction site, I didn't have a problem sleeping to 9:00 a.m. every morning; yes, there was construction noise but it's NYC and there is always gong to be some noise. If guess if you're a really light sleeper, try a room facing south.Kudos to the staff for getting things up and running so quickly while all of the other hotels in the immediate area were still recovering from the storm. (The Marriott next door was still pumping water out of the basement.)

We were upgraded to a corner room which was huge compared to any other room I have stayed in in NYC. The beds are divine, so comfortable! We had been worried about being downtown and a but this location turned out to be perfect and we loved our stay here. We were unfortunate to be caught up in hurricane Sandy on the last day of our trip but the W group ensured we had accommodation in other hotels during our extended 8 day trip. I can't fault the service offered by the W and Starwood group in what was quite a stressful time for the whole city.

We stayed in the Cool corner room 1810 on the night of January the 26th. While the service at Check in was friendly and prompt, we found the room to be a lot smaller than the other W Hotels we had stayed in before (W Boston, Cool Corner in 2010 and the W New York, Wonderful Room in 2008 and 2006). The design of the rooms is stylish, but the color palette they use is uninspiring. It is basically all white, all the time. The size of the room certainly did not justify the premium over a regular room.Unfortunately we also had one of the housekeeping staff enter our room about 2 hours before we were due to check out. This wouldn't have been an issue if not for the fact that she asked us directly when we stopped her from entering "When are you leaving?". Not what I would expect from a staff member in Starwood's premium hotel chain. We did bring this up with the staff at the front desk, who were apologetic and offered us SPG points as an apology which we did appreciate. Unfortunately I can't recommend this hotel, it falls flat from the Boutique style hotels I've come to expect from W. Really, it felt like a chain where as the other W hotels i've stayed in before have felt unique and whimsical. Starwood, I'm not sure whats up with this particular hotel but you should probably take a longer look at the W New York Downtown.

Location - The W is located barely couple of blocks from the World Trade Centre. It has a beautiful view of this building from the rooms facing west. The WTC memorial is right across the street.Access and Subway - The Cortland subway access is closed which is the closest to the hotel. The rector stop is the next closest and the WTC subway stop is reasonably close too. The entire area has construction going on and hence subway is the easiest mode of transport and cab access needs a short walk too.Decor - I stayed for couple of nights in late Jan. The lobby is on the 5th floor and you need to take a lift to check-in. The check-in was smooth and I was given a room even when I was at the hotel by around 12 PM. The hotel has a trendy vibe as can be seen from the photographs at the hotel website. Weekend there is a DJ playing music in the bar lounge on the 5th floor and was quite a nice environment.Room - The room is quite clean but is reasonably small. The interesting architectural design to improve the space occupancy in manhattan is to have all the rooms having windows on at least one side. It had a nice comfortable bed, working table, refrigerator, 42 inch flat tv and a shelf having storage space along with a combination lock.Bath - The bath was quite spacious and was excellently furnished and had bliss bath products. The water pressure was slightly on the lower side but was quite acceptable. There were couple of bath robes which were very comfortable.Internet - The Internet access is free only in the lobby and needs to be purchased.Food - I did not try the food menu in the hotel and there is a BLT restaurant in the ground floor.Summary - The hotel provided a decent rate in off season time of Jan (around $150). It has gorgeous views of WTC and is worth trying for folks willing to stay in downtown and willing to catch the subway.

I am happy to express that my stay at the W NYC - Downtown was quite a different experience from the last time I stayed last year. From the very moment I stepped out of my taxi, I was cheerfully greeted by the bell staff. The front was quite courteous and professional. The room service food quality is superior. My view of NYC was incredible. This is what I have come to expect at the Starwood Hotels...The manager emailed shortly after my posting to acknowledge my disappointment and reassured me that I would not be disappointed a second time. He was right and I commend him for his attention to detail and for replying. Keep up the great work and I will see again soon!!!

The staff at the hotel gave us some of the best customer service we ever had from the moment we were there until we left. The hotel a great young and hip feel and made us feel like we were truly in NYC. Rooms were kind of small but expected that in NYC. The hotel had a DJ in the lobby in the evenings. The furniture was very modern and the beds very comfortable. Bathroom and shower were great as well. Hotel was close to subway which gave us access to the rest of the city. Hotel has a front row view of the 9/11 memorial. I would recommend to people traveling to NYC who are looking for a modern young hotel but remember you are paying top dollar to stay here!

This hotel has an amazing view of where the Twin Towers used to stand. It was chilly when I was in NYC and the line to view the memorial was pretty long. I was pleased to see the great shot of the entire memorial when I raised the blinds. Room was clean and comfortable, the staff was very amenable, and the lobby is super trendy. Not the best place to sit when hungover, but still very stylish.

Stayed at W in NY Downtown in June 2012 for 3 x nights.Our room overlooked the freedom towers and the waterfall. It was nice to sit at the window and just watch in awe. The room was clean and nicely set out. The bathroom was quite big and the toiletries great!NY hotels are expensive but this was worth the money. Initially I thought this hotel was in Times Square, but it was kind of nice to be downtown and close to the financial district.The staff were friendly and gave us tips on where to get some of the best bagels (Leo's bagels - only about 5-10 min walk). The reception area turned into a bar on a Friday night and the place was buzzing and had a nice balcony. The music wasn't loud and you couldn't hear it in the rooms.I really enjoyed my time at the hotel and would recommend this hotel for couples and business.

After travelling a very long time stayin at this hotel was something we thought would be worth the extra $$$ we were very excited to be staying at a W hotel due to their worldwide reputation. Unfortunately I have to say I was disappointed with the dim lit hotel and lack of services later in the night. The staff are not very friendly and I was surprised when one or two of them took the time to look up from their desk to actually look us in the eye whilst talking to us! Expect to pay for everything in this hotel including internet if you want to sit in the comfort of your room, but dont expect it to be fast. The room was clean and for what I belive probably on the larger size for a NYC hotel, the doorman Chris was friendly but the positive reviews stop there. The location is so far away from everything in NYC and to add to that there are road works and construction work that surround the hotel so when you do catch a taxi its never a direct route. Its only close to one subway route as well. Save your money and stay somewhere central

This is nice to place to stay, specially if your doing business in the financial district. I say that cause to get to Time Square, Theater District, Museums, its a $20-25 cab ride (that's if your not to subway savvy or just want to get there quick). Outside of that, our room was very comfortable and had a great view of Ground Zero. The food at BLT's was tasty, thou pricey, which is to be expected in any hotel. Check in/out was a breeze and the staff was not only supportive but also very helpful and knowledgeable. We stayed there for NYE cause it was just to damned expensive to stay any closer to the above areas during that time, but we were not disappointed at all!!!

I was really looking forward to staying in the W as I had read previous reviews and thought I was in for a first class experience however I found the whole experience very average for an outrageous price. After flying in from the UK on the first night I was looking forward to a good nights sleep ready for a day out in New York. I was in room 1113 which is directly opposite 1112 on a side from the elevator. It would appear that the previous occupants of 1112 had set their alarm for 7am and when the room was vacated no one had thought to reset the alarm, I tried to ignore the noise for some time before I rang reception to ask if they could go in and stop the alarm, I thought this would happen fairly quickly unfortunately it took another phone call at 7.50am after the alarm had been going for nearly an hour for Sabrina to get someone to come and stop the alarm.
