Not good enough.It would appear there is a problem in the turnover/change of the rooms as our toilet did not work either however I felt that I didn't want to raise this as well as the alarm straight away so my partner called down and said could this be fixed during the day whilst we were out. However surely this should have been sorted before we were given the room as the toilet was not clean when we first entered our room.There were 2 of us in the room however we were only ever given one dressing robe, why would this be the case? Also the towels were thin, old and small. Every day when we came back to the room the mattress was not fully on the bed, which shows whoever was cleaning our room did not pay attention to detail.I was concerned to come back one evening and see that my shopping bags from the previous day appeared to have been gone through.4 days into our week long trip the carpets had not been hoovered outside as the same pieces of white plastic were on the floor.I throughly enjoyed every part of my trip other than the lack of attention to detail in the hotel and will think carefully before choosing a W again.

It could be so much better: shabby and well worn around the edges. The carpet was threadbare and the room was looking a bit tired. The bathroom needed a good clean, particularly the shower, and lacked surfaces on which to put toiletries. The smell of food lingered in the corridor, no matter the time of day, which sometimes drifted into the room. The lobby is extremely dark with music played at one volume all day, every day. The complimentary Bliss toiletries were a nice touch (although other W Hotels give full sized Bliss products...). No tea/coffee in the room (free coffee served in the lobby until 1000 only...) and bottled mineral water $7 for 500ml. Don't be fooled by the complimentary fresh fruit at breakfast: it is an apple. That's it. Free wi-fi in the lobby only (almost everyone, everywhere in New York has free wi-fi these days) and could not claim SPG points for staying at the hotel because we had booked through a third party. The location is good: close to downtown attractions and a short subway journey to the busier uptown and shopping area. We found the staff service was also very good.

Stayed 3 nights at the W Hotel Downtown in a corner suite overlooking the World Trade Centre Memorial. I must say, compared to the W on Lexington, this W fared much better in just about all aspects. Perhaps unfair to compare, but that’s what we’re suppose to do, right?The décor of the common areas was much more modern and well-kept. The doormen polite, accommodating (especially Christopher!) and available. Couldn’t recall seeing any doormen at the Lexington location, come to think of it. The room was actually roomy, well laid-out, with lots of window seating which doubled as luggage rack and shelf for assorted stuff one casts about during travels. The bed was super comfortable and the pillows not too funky smelling. The bathroom was done in faux leather-look small tiles in chocolate brown, paired with grey striped large tiles, creating a visual and textural contrast that is really quite sophisticated. The A/C unit was a bit noisier than white noise, and the vent blows air quite forcefully across the room. Had to turn the system off in order to sleep undisturbed. The hotel is across from the Memorial site, which is still heavily under construction, so street noise starts early and definitely audible even through the insulated windows. My husband said that some rooms have a noise-cancelling device that plays different soothing sounds. Not in this one though.Complimentary scalding hot, strong coffee and tea are available every morning at the bar area off to the right of the elevators on the 5th floor, a much-needed and welcomed perk. The Sweat gym on the 3rd floor is smallish, but outfitted to take care of your every needs. The machines are easy to use, and there are towels (wet or dry), scented Bliss facial wipes, disposable ear buds, cold bottled water in fridge or water cooler, newspapers, magazines and green apples available to make your workout pleasant and complete. This W is right across the street from the Memorial, so it is a easy jaunt over to the building where you can pick up timed, free ticket(s) to go through the Memorial at your own pace. You do, however, have to go through a security scan, remove jackets and assorted equipment, and show the ticket to about a dozen people before you enter the serene grounds of the Memorial. It is worth the pilgrimage, just to reflect and meditate within such peaceful surrounds, upon a site devastated by so much hatred and violence.The W Downtown is definitely a hotel I’d return to and recommend for others to stay at.

First off, I love Starwood. I hate their NYC hotels. Let's start with check-in...does it really take 15 minutes to check someone in? I'm not talking about waiting time in line. I'm talking about the time it takes to swipe a card and make a photocopy. Ok fine, no biggie. I can let it slide. BUT, when you go to your room and discover that the toilet isn't clean, that's where I draw the line. This is really a category 6? Come on Starwood, you can do better than that. I called the front desk to let them know and they volunteered to clean it right away but I said hold off (this was late at night) and do it the following day. The following day, when someone was supposed to be sent right up to call, that took 35-40 minutes. If you sent a guest to a room with a dirty bathroom, there should be someone waiting outside my door jumping to clean it. What really makes me angry though is that I told the front desk that I wanted the manager alerted of this. I'm not a picky traveler and I don't ask for much. Efficiency at check-in/check-out and a clean room should not be too much to ask for. If you don't provide that, the hotel should be compensating me for a lot (at least a hotel of this supposed caliber). But, no manager called to apologize let alone compensate me for anything. The W gyms in general suck and the layout is very inconvenient because it's 2 elevators to get to your room. Totally impractical. Also, I got upgrade to a King room with a view that's about 5 feet from the elevator. You can hear the elevator beeps, which I really don't enjoy. I think the Westin hotels are much better. But the dirty bathroom was the beginning of the end for this W Downtown. Starwood needs to re-think this hotel or the manager needs to wake up.
user_name:
cobra_commander
New York City, New York

review_body: The W Hotel is at best a Modern, Sleek - Hotel, that being said it is rather dark. I didn't find the staff friendly or helpful with out a fight. The Acura was not available as they advertise. The plus side of this Hotel is the Beds are very Comfortable and Great Pillows, the 1 (red)Train is close which is nice because it can get you up and down Manhattan and right into Time Square. The area is still recovering from Hurricane Sandy, therefore the area looks under construction. The Restaurant/ Grill in the W Hotel is excellent & Great Staff. I suggest taking a cab from the Airport versus a Shared Shuttle.

The W Downtown was great experience. We were in NYC for a concert at Madison Square Garden and decided to stay downtown for easy access to all parts of the city. The W is a new building with full amenities and a lobby/living room which is very club like at night. We enjoyed the view of the World Trade Memorial from the cool outdoor terrace. There are 3 subway lines within a couple of blocks that take you anywhere in the city, one goes to the east side the others to the west side(including a stop directly under Madison Square Garden) and the airport. The service was excellent and you are walking distance from Tribeca , Wall Street, Battery Park and the Hudson river walk. A great bonus is that there are no midtown crowds to deal with. A new purpose built property with new bathrooms and fixtures in an old historic part of New York with great public transportation can't be beat and will make your trip.

Had a fantastic time over the weekend before thanksgiving at the W Downtown. Everything was great! Staff attentive, Acura service good (although felt it was quite a hard sell of the car rather than focusing on being a complimentary shuttle) the beside lamp in the room was not plugged in properly and you could see quite a bit of wiring around the desk area, but I am sure this could be easily sorted. Upgraded to double spectacular with a view of the memorial which enabled me to treat my sister to the W experience... Bar was great, coffee and tea in the mornings is a great idea! Loved the hotel fragrance, reminded me of the W Hong Kong! Would definitely star again. Thank you to Chelsea who made our stay all the more special.

Just returned from a very welcoming stay at the W Downtown. The views from the rooms are superb. The staff are friendly and welcoming. The breakfasts were good quality with a good range on offer. Overall, a very enjoyable stay.

From our room we could look down at the two reflecting pool of the World Trade Center Memorial ... We could see it at all different times of day plus got to watch the building activity! The food was great as well as a wonderful bar with amazing views from it too. Due to construction not the easiest to get to BUT accommodation and view make up for it. Easy walking to shopping and restaurants. I will be going there again.

Is a nice hotel, modern and clean. We stayed two nights. The lobby is awesome!!! Rooms are nice for a couple or a single person. There is coffee and tea complementary during the mornings. The beds are very confortable. The closer train station is not working because of Sandy. Is just in front of the Memorial. The staff is great!!

The W Downtown is a great hotel that has very small (but normal for NYC) rooms, with beautiful bathrooms, and great views. As some other reviews have stated, it's very trendy, with the lobby being on the 5th floor with a really neat ceiling. You do have to go from the street to the 5th floor, and then around the corner to room floor elevators, and at night you do have to walk through essentially a night club/lounge. These things really didn't bother me though, it's just worth noting. The staff was really friendly and helpful. My only 2 complaints were that 1. the wireless internet was only free in the lobby, not the rooms (this seems to be normal practice though), and 2. the hotel is a little far downtown. There are a few subway stops very close though, and they were easy to navigate. I would definitely stay here again.

Every room (except the suites) either adjoins the elevator shaft or is directly across from the elevator doors. Don't get an "11" room. It has 2 common walls with the elevator and 1 common wall with the ice machine. They turn off the elevator "ding" at night, but it is quite disturbing during the day. Both people at the concierge desk were helpful and pleasant. Stunning view of the World Trade Center site from the fifth floor bar. The front desk in on 5 and the ceiling is an undulating art piece. You need a flashlight to find the button for the elevator to the rooms. Low light, black granite floors and walls. I don't need a dj in the lobby or a $20 glass of California cabernet.

We stayed here for two nights and were upgraded to a room with a breathtaking view of the World Trade Center site. Got a good deal on our stay, and considering the prices of poor-to-average hotels in NYC, we considered the W a great value and well worth the cost. The staff, in particular, were absolutely fantastic. People might expect snobby service in a hotel that looks as great as this one, but they'd be wrong. Thanks for a wonderful stay.

This Hotel is in a great location and the staff are pleasant and unobtrusive, which is welcome as American service, good as it is, can be overbearing.Low lighting hides tired walls and fixttures and ho hum 10 years on trendiness thats boring and pedestrian. Ok mid priced for Manhattan, no wow factor but serviceable and all that low lighting hides late NY nights better than cover girl.

Got a fantastic deal for a 5 night stay at the W Downtown this October. The hotel is very modern, the bar wasn't our cup of tea, but the rooms and service were all brilliant throughout our stay and we don't have a bad word to say about the place.

We enjoyed our stay here. Got a decent deal through Expedia, probably because it was a weekend. The rooms are pretty spacious for New York - nicely decorated, clean, comfy beds etc. Nothing remarkable about them, except for the view over Ground Zero, which is excellent. We did get a bit disturbed from the construction there, but nothing too bad. Not too keen on the bar area, which is like being in a nightclub, especially on a Fri/Sat night! You can barely even see the lift, as the lights are so low and the wave effect on the ceiling looks cool, but makes it difficult to see where you're going. Staff were pretty good and helpful. Overall very good, although I probably wouldn't stay this far downtown next time, as it's a bit far away from most of the bars, sightseeing, restaurants etc.

I am writing this in appreciation of one of the staff at the W Hotel Downtown New York. While on a walking tour of lower Manhatten I was separated from the group and my husband. After a considerable time I became very distressed. I approached the doorman, Victor, to catch a cab. He was very friendly, calmed me down, took me inside for a refreshment, rang my hotel and got hold of my husband. He is a good ambassador for this hotel and his kindness to me is something I will never forget.

Be sure to request a room overlooking the World Trade Center Memorial - the view is incredible and showcases New York and the USA's response to 9/11. The hotel immaculate and the lounge on the 5th floor offers the best views is the Memorial. If possible - book the package that includes cocktails and an appetizer. The value of the package is easily $70+ for a couple of glasses of wine and a first class and generously sized appetizer. Also, go to the Highline (nearby) and Eataly (Batsli's fresh market and restaurant emporium). Hopefully the hotel weathered Sandy - Godspeed NYC and the Northeast! We look forward to returning soon!

I fully appreciate the extreme weather that NY has faced this week and it was not entirely surprising that the W NY Downtown should be closed.However what has shocked me has been the complete disregard the hotel has had for its guests:Over the past 48 hours i have received numerous conflicting emails from the W and Starwood Preferred Guest services stating that the hotel was both open and closed. Finally this evening I have found out that the hotel is indeed closed and will remain so for the rest of the week and that i should make alternative arrangements at my own expense.The hotel has said that it would refund the cost of my booking, but that it would not arrange replacement accommodation. Clearly, since the storm hotel costs have sky rocketed but the hotel and the Starwood group feels that it has no duty of care to its guests in this regard.I have found alternative accommodation which will cost me an additional ca. $500 which the Starwood group has managed to extract from the sorry situation that New York finds itself.Poor show to profit from such circumstances i feel.

We asked for a double as a friend was joining us later in the stay. Super VIEW, SUPER people, Very young vibe, first time I felt "old" as a traveler, when the DJ music was blasting at check in! :)Nice rooms, bigger than the W Lexington. As always the BLISS products were awesome. The W at 57 has a spa! None here. But the view on the fifth floor overlooking the Freedom tower is Awesome!Q A++++++++++ And the bar staff are super too! On the fifth floor!

The service was great, really like the location, beds were comfortable and the bathroom was fine. I was 'upgraded' to a room with double beds when I requested a king, but that's not a huge deal to me. Great views of the WTC site and I didn't hear construction noise....though I could hear the room next to me.The place was just a bit too trendy for me. After a long day of traveling and meeting with colleagues, I don't want to walk into the lobby of the hotel at 9pm and be assaulted by a DJ playing loud music and have to, essentially, walk through a club /bar to get to the elevators. I realize I'm probably not in the target demographic for this hotel, but I just found it far too much like a nightclub and less like a hotel where I was paying 500/night.

Great location in lower Manhattan directly across from WTC site and convenient to Century 21 and World Financial Center. Rooms are W-small and W-dark, which are par for the course for NYC and W-style. For business travelers, the walks to farther flung financial headquarters can he harder to get to, but walks along Battery Park are quite easy. For families: there's barely room for a crib in standard king size rooms -- ask for handicap accessible rooms for more space flexibility. Thoughtful touches: the free hotel shuttles, coffee station in the lobby in the mornings, walk around deck off the check-in lobby level.

A nice addition to Lower Manhattan. The hotel is relatively new and in good shape. Great views of the WTC, obviously. Convenient to C21. The lobby area was pretty packed and noisy at night, but my room was quiet and comfortable. Standard W hotel, lots of tourists. Bathroom wasn't as clean as it could have been... a few hairs here and there. Wasn't as easy to get a cab as I would have thought, though maybe that was just my luck.

Booked a last minute girls weekend trip and we were pleasantly surprised at how roomy our double room was. From the 15th floor we were able to appreciate the view of the WTC memorial (the effect of the waterfalls was very touching). The room was very clean and comfortable, with nice amenities. The staff were polite, bartender very attentive when we checked out the lounge (live DJ's on the weekends). The outdoor terrace and lounge area has plenty of comfortable inviting seating, great for spending time relaxing with friends. Though some may consider the location out of the way, subway stops are close by (rector st stop one block around corner), tribeca only one stop away and when we went to our broadway show it was a quick 20 minute ride up to the 50th st stop.Nice hotel out of the overcrowded, touristy bustle of midtown.

We had a great time here. The rooms were very clean and nicely decorated. Everything you would expect from a W Hotel.They also have a great service with a car where you can book a journey every day (first come first served) for free to basically anywhere in Manhattan. Make that the first thing you do every day!It was conveniently located near several subway stops and a great location to stay in New York as a tourist. We thoroughly recommend George's Cafe round the corner for breakfast!
user_name:
Rebecca S
Dubai, United Arab Emirates

review_body: I chose the W Downtown because it's trendy, upbeat, and in a great location just across the street from the World Trade Center Memorial. (If you want to go there, you'll have to get a pass in advance.) The W has an outdoor terrace on the 5th floor with a view of the Memorial. The rooms are modern and well equipped; the beds are totally comfy, and the bathroom toiletries are Bliss Spa products. Look across the corner to find O'Hara's Tavern which serves a great hamburger or the tastiest pub grub like fish 'n chips or shepherd's pie!

We enjoyed 5 days in NYC to see friends, tour the city, and enjoy food.... The W was a bit of a surprise after our last year living in SPG hotels in Asia. The staff was nice, helpful, the room was nice but small, location was hard to get to and from, and the hotel lacked the servies we have grown accustom to enjoying in Asia. Its not bad just not great.... W is a party place not a work or service oriented hotel.... We enjoy the BLD in Hong Kong a great deal but found the BLD within the hotel very expensive and not worth the effort and found going outside better food worth the pricing.

First, a general comment about Starwood: (not really reflective of this hotel)I have gold status and like the spg program, however, its pretty confusing to navigate. Any time I call the hotel, call starwood, or do an online chat with starwood, I am given different information, usually conflicting, with varying degrees of friendliness. I think the people that work in these different areas are confused, and it is obvious. Part of the problem is that when you try and book a room through the W website, starwood website, or starwood ap (calling the hotel directly seems to get a less desired rate) there are different packages available. So my overall advice with Starwood is shop around their different various websites and don't take one person's word for it when they tell you something. I was told by multiple people my room was prepaid and could not be changed, even though my confirmation said otherwise. In the end, I had no problem making those changes, but i wish i didn't have to go through the hassle. Some of this is relevant to my stay at the W, because the front desk person did not understand the package that was booked, and then when I got my invoice, I had to call and go back to the front desk to get the charges taken off. This is really a minor inconvenience but it goes back to my earlier point of general ignorance so I am sure it happens on a systematic basis. That said, they fixed my bill, but why deal with this at a luxury hotel brand? A wise man once said " details, gentlemen" they really do matter.Ok, on to the hotel, I felt that I got good value, package included a couple drinks and an Amex gift card. The room was REALLY small....I am local, so I get the whole NY real estate thing, but cool corner is advertised as >300 sq ft. My first NYC apartment was 600 square feet, so I'm calling BS on that...other than that, the bed was super comfortable, the shower was great, nice bathrobes, and it was a nice room. Living room bartender Trevor was friendly as all staff we encountered were. The location is a little weird, I mean, its FiDi, so there is easy access to Tribeca/SoHo and battery park. I noticed alot of out of towners love it there because of the whole world trade center thing which seems really bizarre. I didn't want to stay in midtown, and because of the close proximity to downtown neighborhoods, and the room rate, can't really complain about the location.I was there for one night with my wife as a night away from our daughter for my birthday, so the size of the room was pretty inconsequential. I am not sure how expensive the room would have to get in order to be large enough to accommodate families, although I always find it strange when families stay at W's--they are not really geared towards families (i know every W hotel manager would probably dispute that though)It has an ok gym too, workable to get a little done while you are there, but it is more of an afterthought.Overall, be aware of the location and if its what you want. The rooms are great, but very small.Friendly and professional staff. Very reasonable prices for NYC (even considering the room size) If you have business in FiDi, its probably a good place to stay, although might be worth checking out the prices at the Ritz too. I would stay again with my wife, but if I were to come back with kids, I think i would want to stay more uptown.
user_name:
adambr14
New York City, New York

review_body: Perfect spot in NYC with a classy bar literally overlooking Ground Zero and the new towers. Service is like that which you can usually only find in Asian hotels where the staff actually cares about the guests. Walk to everything the tip of Manhattan has to offer. Or just seconds to a Subway entrance

Stayed one night, quiet room, much quieter than mud-town hotels for sleeping. It is annoying W's have pay in-room wifi. But I applaud the recycling program. I hope to return soon. Great shower. Large room and bath for NYC. Seating in Living Room lounge was not comfortable, but LED lights in room were great. I liked the energy saving elements in the room that turned off power when you left the room.

The staff at this hotel is not to be trusted so remember to use the safe provided in the room for your valuables. Let me first start with the positives since the list is pretty small. Proximity to downtown if thats where your work is and to the WTC memorial. You can actually see the memorial from some of the rooms. Close to discount shopping at century 21. Ok thats where the positives stop.Negatives - lets start with staff honesty. Bunch of thieves. I had my iPad stolen from my room and let alone an apology from the hotel they wouldn't even acknowledge the theft. Head of security Bill Masterson had no concern about the theft (I hope they fire him) and refused to return my calls. Only after numerous attempts did I get an update. So please folks use the in room safe for your valuables at this hotel, I didn't and I paid the price for it. Another big negative Construction noise. The location is in the middle of a construction zone and its going to be that way until 2015 so avoid this hotel for the next 3 years if you can. Its so out of the way that their bar/lounge is never packed you will get a smattering of after work crowd but it peters out after 8pm.So all in all this hotel is to be avoided not a W by any measure.
user_name:
wysiwyg25
New York City, New York

review_body: My stay at the W hotel downtown New York...was great...beautiful hotel...excellent location...busy yet not like time square....our room over looked the World Trade Center exhibit..very modern and clean rooms...alittle small..but we made due! Great staff...my only compliant is that we receive horrible service from the staff in the lounge..bartenters was horrible and made our second round of drinks in the same glasses and reuse the same garnish(there were three of us...so who knows which glass belong to who)......we complained to the manager...however didn't let it ruin any part of our trip.....overall an awesome hotel....and I would return...when visiting New York.....be ready to shell out BIG bucks to stay here though....

Large rooms, the friendliest staff I have encountered in quite some time. The bellman took me from the cab to check in, to my room and showed me all there was to see in the guestroom. large closet, floor length mirror, impecable Insiders, the outdoor terrace is gorgeous. You feel special when you are staying with W Downtown. The acura service starting at 8am is a reason alone to stay here.

We had made our appointment to see the 911 memorial, and it began to rain. We ducked into the BLT (at the W) for a snack and some shelter. We ordered the pizza margarita and some sodas. Perfect. Their pizzas are a great size for 3 ladies, and since we were having lunch after seeing the memorial, we didn't want to fill up. It was a terrific pick-me-up. The wait staff was friendly, the food was excellent, and the sodas were cold. Plus, they got us out in enough time to make our appointment. Loved it. I can't speak for the hotel, but their cafe was superb.

This is a nice property for the most part. However, if I am to pay for a 4.5* hotel, I expect a bit more. The staff at recption was friendly and efficient. The rooms are well appointed but small. As I have a young child, I was annoyed that much of the shelf space in the room is taken up by the stuff for sale that was also within reach of my child. When I requested they be removed to afford more space in the room and less of an attractive nusiance, I was told there would be a $35 charge to do so. The room was mostly clean but a room needs to be FULLY clean. My child was playing on the floor and found a full vial of some type of single dose drug. When I brought it the front desk I was thanked for it. NOTHING FURTHER WAS DONE. Had I not seen my child pull up the mystery vial, I may have been taking a trip to the hospital. THIS REQUIRES MORE THAN A THANK YOU. Had the rooms been properly cleaned, I may have been more impressed with the rest of the place and less upset about the staff's inability to cope with a very upsetting customer experience but..... I might stay here again, but would never pay the standard rate as it is not worth the price. I question the current 4.5* rating. I stay in NYCa great number of nights each year and have had better experiences at a number of other less expensive alternatives. It is my hope that this review will serve to assist management with avoiding big problems in the future,

This property is beautiful - great views of the WTC site and a very stylish lobby. The lobby, while very cool, can feel a little crowded and loud. The customer service is not attentive. When I arrived I stood at the desk for a while before anyone came over. I think the staff was watching a youtube video or looking at something on the internet - they were all crowded around one computer and didn't notice that I was standing there for a while. Also, I was overcharged on my hotel folio. I sent an email to the GM's email address as instructed on the folio, but I got no response.

I'm currently staying in the W Downtown (September 15, 2012). Here are some factual observations. 1. Upon check in: i) the sheets on the bed were stained, ii) one bath towel had someone else's hair all over it, iii) another bath towel was stained with a brownish substance, iv) the carpet by the door is stained with some white substance, and v) the cabinet door to the minbar is broken and half-hanging on by one hinge. This may be a relatively new hotel, but it doesn't seem like it. 2. The rooms themselves are fine. Not overly large, but I've seen a lot smaller. The design of the room is really futuristic (even for a W). 3. Room service came pretty quickly (within 20 minutes of ordering).4. The gym is useable, but sub par for a hotel. 5. Internet is $15/day.

I love this hotel! It is WONDERFUL! The staff was very nice and the hotel is in a great location. I had a fabulous room on a high floor that looks out into the 9/11 memorial. The hotel is very trendy and chic and the outdoor terrace is amazing! The rooms are spacious and the beds are very comfy! They include sound machines which was great especially if you need calming white noise to sleep! Would definitely return. Only drawback is that the nightly rates are so expensive!

Wonderful hotel..Wonderful Room..Wonderful staff..My room on 11th floor overlooked the memorial site - comfiest bed i have ever slept in..views are beautiful..Can't fault my 4 night stay..Thank you W!

If you are visiting 9/11 memorial, this is a perfect hotel to stay in. The hotel faces the entrance to the memorial and be sure to sip at the lobby bar or even better, the outdoor balcony for a superb view of One WTC and the other upcoming WTC towers. Inspite of the the on going construction (which doesn't really bother me) the area is bustling with tourist and within minutes of Soho and lower east side. The WTC subway station is minutes away nearby century 21, or the Lexington line is a couple of blocks on broadway. The 5 th floor lobby is ideal and feels isolated from the main tourist traffic and 9/11 memorial crowd, unlike the other nearby hotels. The wonderful/spectacular rooms are fairly designed and seems normal with enclosed bathroom unlike some of the other Ws. We had a corner room facing south east. The service is just about average and somewhat 'cold' at the front desk, but that didn't really bother me since I'm not a high demanding guest and don't expect too much in terms of service and attention. However, some may find it to be rude and unattentive. At night, ther area tend to be on a quiet side after the memorial closes. Nevertheless, you could gawk at the brightly lighted 1WTC tower from the lobby bar balcony. The lobby has a good selection of costly drinks and nibbles. we we fortunate to have a package deal which offered complimentary drinks. Heading out to nearby soho is about a 15-20 min walk or a short subway ride. I give this 5* Just for the location and property but 4 * for the service. Would consider staying here again when in NYC. Note: if visiting the memorial , make sure to reserve free online tickets for designated time slot entry to the memorial.

Sometimes of the day, the front of the hotel is almost blocked by tourists visiting nearby attractions. When I arrive there was no way we can park and I had to be offloaded a block away. In the evening when I have to get a taxi it was impossible no cabs and the hotel not have a bellman service!!! My room was very dirty, battery capsuled on the phone was broken, bathroom not maintained. Turndown was very quick and they often missed things such as washcloths and bath amenities. Room service and bar/restaurant was sloppy. At breakfast they forgot to serve my tea and they wanted to charge me. Death banana fly in my white wine at lunch. Room service delivered still instead of sparkling water. My minibar in the room was not refilled during my stay and its was not refresh before my arrival. A lot of noise from the A/C installed on roof at neighbour building!

My wife and I traveled to New York for our 20th wedding anniversary. What could have been a disaster [having to leave home 2 days early because of Hurricane Issac] was enhanced by the staff of this wonderful hotel. From the doorman, with great directions, to the upgrade to a corner room at check-in and the gift from the manager, everyone was sensational. After 5 days and 4 nights in NYC, 2 days at the US Tennis Open, 2 plays, we returned to Atlanta for our 7 1/2 hour drive home to a yard full of limbs and an empty refrigerator [no electricity for 4 days] and discovered that my wife had left her earrings in our room. Not to worry, they had been turned into security and were FEDX'd in response to her call. Besides the incredible staff, the room was gorgeous, the view of the WTC site was excellent, the restaurant was tasty and we both loved our stay.

Stayed there in July 2011. The hotel is very good and clean. It was a little bit noisy since there's a construction at Ground Zero. Quite expensive, but you pay for the location, I guess. Room was very clean and nice and newly done, with a nice decor. Downstairs in a lobby there's always like a club atmosphere with music and people hanging out :). We stayed on 16th floor, did not hear any music, only some Ground Zero construction noise. I don't know how it is on lower floors.In general, very good hotel and location.

Arrived on a Saturday of Labor Day weekend and left Tuesday. We had a party cancel last minute that was with us and they said they would refund the rooms, even though we had not purchased directly with hotel.It was the 40th birthday of one of our members and they comped 4 free drinks.Atmosphere was great of the bar/lobby area. Rooms were nice, not extremely spacious, but had great view of 9/11 site.Very helpful concierge and staff. Glad we stayed here!

Last minute booking with a great fare and we had a wonderful evening. Arrived to be upgraded to a "spectacular room" overlooking the 9/11 Memorial site and the Freedom tower. The woman at check in couldn't have been nicer. We got two free drinks and an appetizer with our room rate, so off the the very cool bar we went before our evening activities. Our waitress was wonderful, drinks and food delicious, view amazing as the sun set and the lights of the city came up. Never mind that the entire hotel smells amazing. I could get picky about a few little things in the bathroom, but why bother - the view was awesome, the bed really comfortable and we didn't even know there was AC in the room - that's how quiet it was!!!!! I would stay here again when in downtown Manhattan in a heartbeat.

From the great staff starting with Andrew at the front desk, to the great interior architecture, to the well appointed room, we had a wonderful time. Lots going on even on the weekend, which was a surprise. Easy public transportation options nearby. We will be back again soon.

We arrived in the evening on the 9th of August. There were standing so many people in front of the hotel, red carpet, loud music... the security asked if he could help us with the luggages, but we were all fine. He managed us the way thru the crowd of people and we arrived at the beautiful reception on 5th floor... yes – the music was loud and we could barely hear what we were told, but it was fine.. and it was funny.. as it was a good atmosphere and no one was “pushing”. This was the only night in that week with loud music, the other days it was on a normal volume. Then we arrived at the room, which was SPOTLESS! Congratulations for the housekeeping.. Everything was “in position” and I didn’t see one hair in the bathroom. On the 5th floor you can go for free coffee in the morning! Nice idea! All of the staff was so polite and nice! Housekeeping is twice a day! The room is big for new york standards! And the entrance is right next to the 9/11 memorial (this might helps if the taxi driver doesnt know how to reach the hotel!).It’s nice that I finally found a hotel in Manhattan, which is easy to reach (as R and 1 subway is within walking distance), not to get overrun by 10000 people (like on Times Square hotels) and seeing a staff which must truly like their jobs and have fun on doing it! "W" can be proud of this hotel!

We stayed at the W NY Downtown for 3 days/2nts in Aug 2012. Overall, this is hotel is very clean, chic (typical W style) and great view of the 911 Memorial! The location is perfect for lower Manhattan visit and all within 30min walking distance including SoHo, Little Italy, Chinatown, Seaport, Manhattan/Brooklyn Bridges, etc. There is no need to take a taxi or subway.The lounge (on the 5th floor) has a bar including an outdoor for the afternoon or eveninng, which is quite relaxing and good drinks. Restaurants are everywhere within walking distance or even a short cab ride (in the evening). The hotel restaurant/bar downstairs also has good foods if you are lazy to walk.The concierge and bellhop (Reggie) are very friendly and helpful! The room is small so we have to book two rooms for our family. The rooms are very clean. We did experience a few minor issues like very low water pressure for the shower, missing complimentary water and not enough outlets to charge electronic products. Hopefully these issues can be addressed in the future.Besides the great gym facility, I wish there was an indoor pool. I would have given this a 5 star rating.I love the daily compliment coffee, tea and green apples in the lounge. A good cup of coffee goes a long way especially when you are in a hurry in the morning for various activies. The coffee is actually strong and good, not water down. :)We will be back here again in the future.

We had a good deal for this hotel, never stayed in this part of the city before. The construction works didn't bother us, never heard any noise, we stayed on the fifth floor. Big room, especially for NY standards, clean and lots of light, we really liked it, also the beds. Staff very friendly, we had lunch at the BLT once, very nice burgers for prices to be expected in a hotel bar. We used their complimentary car service twice, a very nice touch. If you need to be uptown a lot, then this hotel is quite far. But you can easily walk to soho and the village. Hudson river park is also few block away, nice to go running.

Had never stayed in this part of NYC before and it's definitely interesting to be somewhere new. This hotel is not my usual choice in the city but was chosen by a friend. I found it quite pretentious - it's hard to even find the entrance and you get the impression that this is deliberate. Once you do find it, you have to get into a lift just to reach reception which is hard when you are struggling with multiple bags. Check-in was an endless line with just 1 member of staff and you had to stand there while she gave the same instructions to each guest. Then, it's into another lift to get to your room.The room was pleasant enough - very white and sterile though which is not to my taste. A nice window seat which was comfortable and afforded a good view out over the 911 memorial. Bathroom is far too small and cramped with no storage space around the sink. You have to keep walking from bathroom to room to get your make-up etc. Very annoying.We ate lunch at the BLT grill at the hotel which had good food and pleasant staff. In all, it was OK as a place to stay if you like this sort of hotel but I would not rush to return here.

We stayed at the W Hotel for 2 nights in June, traveling with our small dog. Overall, the stay was magical! Unlike nearly every other visit to NYC, we were able to sleep soundly through the night with no outside noises. Our room (the Splendid with two queen beds) was so chic and extremely soundproofed. We were directly across the elevator but never once heard the elevator "ding" or people coming off or on. Nor did we hear any construction noise from Ground Zero. The Bliss amenities were lovely and everything about the hotel was so cool and design-y. The mats in the elevator change based on the time of the day, the lighting is super cool and the lobby is very futuristic. Excellent service all around including lovely servers in the lounge. Super easy to travel uptown, to Central Park, Soho, etc. -- a line of cabs awaits outside the door and an easy walk to Battery Park. Best of all, the hotel is so dog friendly! As soon as we checked in, the bellman brought up a dog bed, W doggy bags, food and water bowl, and a beautifully decorated treat. Everyone was so kind to our dog and they served us in the uber-cool hotel lounge where we had wine each night and our dog had his own bowl of water. First class all the way - made our stay unforgettable. The only complaint was that there is a $125 pet fee charge at this location. It had been omitted from our final bill and when I called to request a print out, they noticed and tried to put it back on the bill. Finally the accounting department apologized and took it off. Even with this fee, I will gladly stay at this or other W hotels each time I travel with my dog.
user_name:
travelgal30
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The W Hotels are not my style, they're too flashy for me, but I got a great deal here so I decided to give it a shot. Checked in rather early, they were able to accommodate me and upgrade me for free, which was much appreciated. Had a corner king room with a spectacular view. The windows really are amazing, highly recommend splurging on a corner king room. View was directly onto the World Trade Center site, the hotel is literally across the street from the memorial. Keep in mind this means dealing with A LOT of tourists. The street is constantly busy with tourists. There aren't really any restaurants nearby, the hotel is in no man's land as far as restaurants and shops. Staff was very friendly, bed was very comfy, no details were overlooked in the room (even had a charging station for iPhones, and a sound machine -- amazing!). The scent piped into the elevators was annoying me to no end. Also, later at night, you have to walk through their "club" to get to the guest room elevators. The elevators really should be in a separate area -- not all of us are there for the scene. I was a bit annoyed overall as I was there on business, but I also realize the hotel was great, just not a great fit for my needs on that particular trip. If you're younger, if you like the scene, if you like a lot of glam, this is the place to be.

Stayed there for 5 days. One of the coolest hotel i've been to, even for NYC. Great modernistic design in reception, bar and rooms. Had great room heading south from 20th floor with view to hudson river and the ferry. Incredible. We didnt experience noise from the building site. Great staff who where very helpfull in all requests.Highly recommendable. Got great deal, 4 nights in exec. room for 900$.

My girlfriend and I stayed here for the weekend and it was really wonderful! The staff was helpful, the room was incredible (corner room) and the view from it towards ground zero was really unique. I would definitely recommend it to my friends and would come here again!

Stayed there for 4 days 3 nights in May 2012. It's on the quiet side of the Manhattan. Away from the main attractions, like Time Square, Central Park etc but there's a subway station near by so traveling around is no issue. The room is clean but no privacy in the bathroom (no lock on the bathroom door). The lobby turned to be a party place (loud music) everynight. For people who like party at night it's great but not for the people who just want to relax after a long day walking around Manhattan . We really didn't have any major issue while we were there until we came back home and noticed they charged us $28 for eating their in-room refreshments which we didn't touch at all. After exchanged serveral emails with them for a week, they credited the money back. However, this ruined my expression of W Hotels.

First off, I NEVER WRITE REVIEWS!! But this hotel was so awful that I can't keep quiet! The location is great, right next to the World Trade Center and 9/11 memorial. We had a view of the Memorial from our room which was nice to wake up to. It all began when we arrived. I was there with 2 friends for a little vacation after a long business trip. We arrived at the hotel around 1pm. The room wasn't ready...ok, no problem...except that we had to schlep all 11 of our bags up to the 5th floor, where checkin is, by ourselves only to be told that our room wasn't ready and that, no, the bellman would not come to the front desk to help us with our bags. If we wanted to store our bags, we would have to schlep them back down to the first floor. We were generally ignored by the doormen and don't bother with the Wheels by Acura program...no one seems to know exactly what the rules are for using this "complimentary service". Finally got to the room to find no outlets by the beds. We each have phones that are used as our alarms and need to charge them. A VERY nice maintenance guy came and brought us a couple plug strips. Much appreciated. I went to the concierge to ask about arranging a car to the airport since we had so much luggage...after I was ignored, she rudely answered it would be $120 to the airport! SERIOUSLY? Overall, any time I asked for something, I felt like I was a MAJOR INCONVENIENCE! We rented a car for one night and parked at the hotel, upon check out I find that I have been charged for parking on all 3 nights!! Then the girl at the desk was trying to argue with me telling me that according to her computer I parked my car there all 3 nights...How is that possible when I only rented the car for one night???? Do you want to see my rental agreement????? Eventually, after a bit of arguing, she removed the 2 extra charges. I have no problem paying for the service used, but don't try to charge me for something I didn't use! And don't argue with me about it either!! I definitely WILL NOT be staying here again and will let my friends know not to, either! One redeeming moment...the girl working the front desk gave us great instructions on riding the train out to Citi Field for the Mets game! She was awesome but I didn't get her name...but, thank you so much!!

I stayed with a friend in one of the corner rooms - enjoying an absolutely excellent view and enough space for the both of us. Room is well equipped, good minibar, big 'munchy basket' (that we didn't use, but it's good to know it's there... :) ). Service is very personal; from compliments on your hairdo to inquiries about the origin of your name. Decor is impressive, the bar is OK (5th floor balcony has good views over the WTC construction and memorial). The hotel tries hard to give you an 'experience' and partially succeeds. Small cute things like changing the floor mats from "good morning" to "good afternoon" and "good evening" show the effort that was put in. I would stay here again, or pick the W uptown that does have a spa.

My husband brought me to NYC for my birthday, and it rocked. Not only did the surprise trip rock, but the hotel he chose (the W), also rocked, and was perfect in every way. I'm an SPG Gold member. They knew it was my birthday, and they were ready! We got upgraded to a corner room, and there was a (very yummy) piece of cake waiting for us when we got there. Bed was super comfortable, bathroom was clean and big enough, equipped with Bliss toiletries (which I love!).Our room overlooked the 9/11 memorial which made it very convenient to visit on Day 2. Just cross the road to get to the entrance. Make sure to book your tickets online beforehand. Wall Street is also a 5 min walk away.Note, reception is on the second floor... same floor as the bar. At night, it turns into a bar/lounge/dance club. Yes, the music is loud, because that's the way it is, but once you get on the elevator, you won't even know there's a party going on.The reception architecture is very interesting. I've never seen anything like it, and I loved it. Look at the pics on-line.A very special thank-you to our concierge, Kareem, and Lauren for making my birthday weekend very special!! Kareem's restaurant recommendations were bang-on and we were sad to leave because we could have eaten some more. We will definitely stay here again.Happy travels!

treated the Wife here to a night out, very impressed, Hotel staff very helpful, Rooms were great, only complaint was they assigned me a Handicap room, in the future they should hold these for folks that might need them. Outside bar a little pricey even for NYC but can't beat the location- right across from the 9/11 memorial. I would recommend staying here if you want a Great Hotel away from the busy tourism crown of midtown or time square. Plus you can walk up to the river front from here and get a nice Jog in.Thanks W Staff.

Very average experience for the price I was paying. First - no upgrade for SPG platinum. The best room they could muster was a mid-low level room facing the WTC site. Nothing like the view they had on their website - looking out to say the Chrysler Building. Second, room size was average. The deco felt plasticky and a little cheap, to be honest, but I suppose that's the style of the W. Thirdly, service was average. For a 5-star price, you were getting a 3-star service. Staff were trying to be more cool than helpful, cept the bellhop who was extra proactive and helpful. Choose this location if you activities was going to center around Wall St, i.e. for business. If you were visiting the city as a tourist, choose something in mid-town.

The location is downtown, so you are either looking for a cheaper upscale weekend lodging or are in town for business at Wall Street. The subway ride to Midtown or even further North is quite long. NB, they currently offer a one-time free transportation in Manhattan in cooperation with Acura. I didn't get to use that and it doesn't got to any of the airports (outside of Manhattan), but it seems a generous thing to give that away for free.The hotel itsel is W-standard-cool, and - contrary to some other W's in NY - it's a new property with nice and newly furbished facilities. The terrace bar overlooking what will be the new WTC site is good for TGIF drinks, and tart cocktails with nibbles.The rooms are nice, although a little bit on the small side. You better press hard to get your SPG Platinum privileges honored -- and you have to press hard, otherwise they won't.All in all a great stay in a modern property.

Love the location and if you want to stay in a hotel that has club music playing all night, then its the perfect place for you. It was a little too loud for me, but I had a great time. Great view, friendly staff and love the Bliss toiletries.

traveled to nyc for business in the city, as well as into jersey and long island. the hotel was in a great spot to get on and off manhattan with ease. there was an amazing view of the world trade center memorial from my room. beyond that it was a little far from where i was headed during free time. times square was about a $15 cab ride, $10 to west greenwich village. the room was standard and very clean. the highlight was by far the food. i ordered room service--margarita pizza, italian meat plate, and lemon potato octopus. the food was extraordinary.

Traveled with friends for this visit. Hotel lobby was reminiscent of a club with blaring music (late afternoon/evening). Overall great decor. Concierge very helpful and friendly, with great recommendations. Quality of the room - beds were a bit small. Location of hotel was generally good - hectic due to tons of construction going on (not just the WTC site).

I stayed one night at the W in lower Manhattan while in town for business. I arrived in a raging rainstorm during an event at their restaurant after 7pm and had an easy, smooth check-in despite the hectic scene going on outside and within the hotel. MY SPG status was noted and I had reserved one of their corner rooms that overlooked the World Trade Center memorial. The room was very comfortable, a good size and the cushions in the large windows were great for sitting and catching the views (although it was rainy that night). The bathroom is very large, but the shower has a very soft water spray and it takes some time to completely soap off if you are used to a stronger shower head.Because I had such a long day and because of the storm, I did not go down to the lounge or balcony bar, but this appeared to be a lively and fun hotel and I could envision some good entertainment for happy hours and late night. I ordered room service for dinner and it is a bit pricey. The burger was cooked to order but the meat had been heavily salted for some reason; almost inedible. I had breakfast the next morning in BLT bar and grill; decent and filling but I noticed that my bill was double-charged at checkout, so I am contacting them to follow up on that.I would definitely like to stay at this W again and take in more of its amenities, but it is very much the lower Manhattan neighborhood experience and there is a tourist crowd around going to the WTC memorial and other sites. There is also heavy construction in the area, but I did not notice any noise from my room.

My son, cousin and I made the trip to NYC for baseball, food and museums. This hotel is across the street from the Freedom Tower; an amazing sight. The property is geared toward a younger crowd than mine, and the boutique style of the rooms makes it difficult for more than two to comfortably sleep in a room.However, the staff was quite good, the rooms clean and well-appointed, and the rate was not too bad. Location, as mentioned above, is first-rate.

This was the first time my wife and I stayed at a W property, and we must say overall we were very impressed. Concierge was most helpful, especially with reserving our tickets for the 9/11 memorial. The only complaint I have is that the staff at the BLT restaurant were polite, but very slow....and there was hardly anyone in the restaurant. I can understand if there was a crowd, but there wasn't. The food was delicious, however. Overall, a very positive experience. We will be back in the future.

This was a pleasant stay for 3 nights. The room was comfortable and the air conditioning worked well, bed was comfortable. Room was quiet. Nice bath products. Loved the big windows with city view. Did not like that it took 15 minutes to figure out how to turn on the lamps...W is like that. Used room service a few times due to being in a hurry and I tell you the prices were just ridicules. A pot of coffee was $22. On the last day I found a little tiny sign tucked away in the shelf that said you could request a coffee maker for the room....oh now you tell me. All staff members were really outstanding and I commend them for that.

We were not guests of this hotel, we stopped in only for a cocktail while waiting for our time slot at The 9-11 Memorial. It was a nice prelude to the Memorial Tour. We sat outside & had a bird's-eye view of some of the construction. The lounge is very trendy & comfortable. Bar tender was talkative and drinks tasty!

My husband is a long-term guest at the W and I recently visited him for about a week. The service is top-notch (the Director of Sales called to check in on us-very nice), concierge is knowledgeable and, despite sitting directly adjacent to the new WTC site, the room was very quiet. If your travels require you to stay far downtown/Battery Park area, I recommend this hotel!
i love the location. Facing the beautiful big new WTC tower and peaceful 9/11 memorial pools. Room is comfortable and big enough.
user_name:
iHenrique
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed there for 3 nights in July and I must say that this is a fantastic hotel. Friendly and helpfull staff (service-minded), great location ( 9/11 Memorial park), a good choices of breakfast options nearby (the hotels own breakfast are over-priced) The only cons is that they charge you big money for internet in your room!
Everything about this hotel was great. The staff, the rooms, the location were all great. We would definately stay here again.

The W Hotel excels at providing cool, comfortable and stylish accommodations in a somewhat hectic area. Construction at the WTC site makes getting to and from the hotel somewhat challenging although most taxis have seemed to have figured it out pretty well. I did however find it a bit on the noisy side and out of the way to where I spent most of the time while in NYC. Perhaps next time, I will book at another location. I enjoyed my stay at the W and can only reiterate what his previously been mentioned by other guests. Rooms are kept spotlessly clean, cool and stylish. Loved the bath products and the very comfortable bed. Service was polite and efficient if slightly cold. On the good side - I did get an upgrade to a better room with my SPG membership.On the other hand - After I had checked out and arrived home, I was surpised to find that the hotel had charged me $147 for the box of munchies which had not been touched. I did get a reply from the hotel that this error will corrected swiftly and I am hoping to see a reversal of the charge. -- errors are forgiveable if corrected quickly.

I stayed last Saturday for just one night. Check-in is on the 5th floor and I did check in at 11am with no problem. My preferred room was not available until 3pm so I took the room they gave me. It was very, very small. Smaller than NY hotels averages, if I was staying a few days I def. would have complained but I knew I was just using the room to shower/sleep. The elevators are a little slow and I was right in front of the WTC construction site and didn't hear anything. I do have one complain I did have to tell the housecleaning staff to keep the noise down, they were way to loud. The locale (and I am from here) is great, you have 3 subway lines with 10 min of each other that will get you anywhere. The morning "wake-up" coffee is a perk and the terrace on the 5th floor is something kind of nice to grab a beer and start your evenings. Overall, it was a nice stay but I think with all the spg options and the room size, you may be able to score a better deal. def. not worth it if you have to pay full price.The staff was great as well, one went out of their way at 5am to walk me to a store to p/u cold medicine, that was pretty cool.

have just returned from the most amazing trip to NYC - the location couldn't be better. A stones throw from the historic area and good bars/restaurants around South Street, a great place for a jog along the river early morning. Subway stations to head uptown are one block away, the hustle and bustle of the Financial District is on your doorstep and the fantastic shopping around Soho is well within walking distance. The staff really go out of their way to be courteous and helpful and treat guests with a warm respect. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. With regard to the construction going on around the World Trade Centre, it is fantastic to witness the regeneration of this area first hand - and you can't make an omelette without cracking eggs. It changes daily and it's really interesting to witness the development. It's New York - no one said it was quiet!

Generally really liked the W New York Downtown, with a couple tiny issues. As an SPG gold i wanted a view of ground zero, and they gave me a great spectacular room overlooking the grounds and a direct view of the new buildings. room was really nice and we especially liked the design and little details (kids loved the ocean sound machine for going to sleep, and DVD player is a necessity if you have kids since they don't have a 24-hour toddler channel ala PBS kids/ Nick Jr).the service in general was great, including a call to confirm all is well, bringing me a personal coffeemaker (but unlike Westin's and Sheraton's, this one had only medium starbucks, not the dark flavor we prefer and have gotten used to). they brought us free unlimited bottled water, and even came up with a bottle opener to open a beer for us (we bought it in a deli a few doors down for $2 instead of 6-7 in the minibar). They also allowed late checkout at 3pm (could have stayed til 4) the next day (SPGGold). That said, i didn't like that they didn't respect my free night (Best Rate Guarantee program) to allow me to have an SPG Gold amenity, but that could have just been some confusion. the bathroom and room in general is funky and cool, and i loved the lemon scented bath bar etc., but the shower pressure could be better, and we found a little bit of hair on the side of the shower wall towards the back.if you are staying here with a car, would suggest using the Groupon deal or a coupon (from the icon website) at the Icon parking lot just a few buildings down on albany street.Our kids especially loved the battery park water sprinkler area that was a lot of fun (it was 90+ when we stayed in mid-june).

The W - downtown was wonderful. Located right across from the 9/11 memorial and a 10 minute walk from the Statue of Liberty/Battery Park. The staff was beyond friendly and helpful. Attending to our every need and answering the million questions a tourist like me has. =] We got what was called a wonderful room. It was perfect! The bed was beyond comfortable and the room was quite.

As a frequent traveler for work and business, I have stayed at many W hotels. This one was, by far, the most disappointing experience. While the location is ideal for a business trip, it is hard to get to because of the construction surrounding Ground Zero. The hotel is trendy, but not in a good way. There is only one restaurant (if it can be called that) at the ground floor and another bar in the 5th floor lobby, which during my stay, was always unavailable in the afternoons due to private bookings. The rooms are not exceptional and small. You sacrifice a lot for the name and for the price, there are far better hotels in New York. My advice: give it a shot if you are adventurous and/or want something right by Wall Street, but otherwise, seek a nicer hotel.

A relatively new hotel directly across the street from WTC site. Several blocks from Wall Street and Battery Park. We stayed for 5 days and were thoroughly delighted by the location, staff and overall cleanliness of the place. Nicole ( Concierge) was great and very helpful in info and getting us passes to the WTC. Melanie ( front desk) could not have been more pleasant. Steve ( lobby) provided unsolicited mini-tour explanation of hotel and WTC history. Ray ( front lobby) does a spectacular job in shining and polishing and exhibits a super pride in his work and workplace. Zemina ( housekeeper) was excellent and took pride in her job. Location is good for downtown and easy walk to all we wanted. Subway just a few feet away around the corner. Two blocks off Broadway and shopping close by. Several good deli's and a nice Asian / Sushi restaurant just around the corner. Will certainly return when in downtown NYC.

My first stay in downtown NYC after 20+ trips. Not an exciting location on the weekend but easy access to more interesting neighborhoods to the north. I suppose many travelers will be interested in the WTC location; I'm not one of them. The construction mess, security zone atmosphere and hordes of gawkers are not for me. The hotel itself is nice. Room was stylish and modern but on the small side as is often the case with the W. Seemed larger than Lexington or Union Square properties, though. Good value in terms of rate. The onsite restaurant (BLT) is really good with very friendly staff. It's worth visiting. Front desk is polite and efficient. Only complaint re: staff is in Living Room bar. Extremely slow service with a definite attitude. Maybe it's all the WTC visitors milling about.

I booked a room on Hotwire at the W Downtown for two nights while in NYC on business. The location was great as I needed to be close to Wall Street. Very clean rooms and efficient service makes this hotel stand out. The downside is, having booked the room through Hotwire, I felt I was not treated as well as I would have been if I would have paid full price. I had a room with two double beds overlooking Ground Zero. I asked for a king on the other side of the building away from the construction but was told there was nothing available without the staff even checking. I guess at the lower price I should have been apply with what I was given. Great restaurant on the property and an outside bar does make this a fabulous property.

I have not stayed downtown NYC for some time. This is right by the WTC - so the area is perhaps over run with tourists. The rooms are not generous in size and this particular W needs aoverhaul. The checkin staff was pleasent but the room lacked towles and supplies - quickly brought but housekeeping needs to be aware. Over a 4 night stay this was a repeated failure.My reservation was in 2 blocks and although they managed to keep me in the same room I did have to return to the front deak and get the key revalidated. WHY.

As other reviewers have commented this hotel us perfectly located in the heart of downtown. The entrance is not very welcoming as it is essentially some double doors and a lift! Things get better when you get up to the reception where there is a cool vibe and funky decor. Rooms are very clean and comfortable with all expected amenities including a great shower. Not everything is perfect though as the ironing board was useless and the aircon was like an uncontrollable stallion - occasionally galloping off in the middle of the night and generally difficult to control. The surrounding area is still a bit short of great places to eat but these will come in time. Wifi was included in my tariff but beware if it's not as you seem to be paying for each appliance. In conclusion it's an interesting hotel but there are probably better ones elsewhere downtown for the price.

The W Hotel was a pleasant surprise on a late night. My husband and I arrived just after midnight to find the lobby bustling with music and people having a great time. It sure made us feel like having fun too! The hotel is very sophisticated and well decorated. Our room was average size for NYC, but had everything we needed. We booked the room for 3 nights on Hotwire and got a terrific rate. The location was close to several subway lines and there were plenty of places to grab a quick breakfast in the morning. It's also right across the street from the 9-11 Memorial Site so that was convenient for taking the tour. We would definitely stay here again as the location is great and there were plenty of attractions within walking distance. (Wall St, Battery Park, Brooklyn Bridge, City Hall, Staten Island Ferry)

W Hotels are known for their great service, and this one was no exception. The employees were friendly, rooms were stylish (as usual) and the hotel was very clean. Location-wise, this hotel worked well for us as most of our activities were in the downtown area, but it was pretty far down and for a tourist, it might be more practical to stay closer to Soho or Tribeca near good shops and restaurants. Walking around the construction to get to the subway stops was kind of a hassle.Speaking of construction, the noise was a non-issue for us and we were right in front looking down on the site. I was worried we might wake up to the sound of jackhammers, but it didn't happen. What we did wake up to was the sound of our neighbors turning on their TV at 3:30 AM. I think they had a baby who wouldn't go to sleep and were trying to drown out the baby with the TV. I was never able to gauge whether they had the TV very loud or if the walls were just really thin, but that part of the stay was unpleasant. The other concern was that The W would feel like hipsterville. Not the case. There was a perfect mix of trendy people, tourists and business types, so we felt right at home.

The W Downtown is a nice hotel with average-for-New York sized rooms. The staff are top notch and the best thing about this hotel. Javonn at the front desk is the perfect example of what a reservations/check-in person is supposed to be - smiling, courteous, efficient and helpful. I was very impressed by him and by the rest of the hotel staff, including the housekeepers and bellman. I did not try out the bar or restaurant, so cannot comment on either. The rooms are clean and trendily decorated, which may not appeal to all travelers. The hotel abuts Ground Zero, which is both mobbed by tourists during the day and an active construction site. Ask for a south facing room away from construction, if possible.

As a regular in the financial district, I've stayed in many of the hotels but hadn't tried this one until now. While I was expecting something pretty good considering the price, I've been disappointed. The rooms are the standard Manhattan small, the decor is faddish but uninteresting, and the gym... There's only one treadmill. Really?Save money, go next door.

I stayed here for one night on business in NYC. The hotel lobby is one of the most architecturally interesting (in a very modern, trendy sense) places that I've seen. I enjoyed the bar later at night with colleagues and a great breakfast in the morning. The service at the bar was excellent, but a little slow at breakfast. The room was comfortable, though of course small, but it's downtown Manhattan. Comfy bed and a good shade to get the room very dark, despite lights outside. One downside to the room was some construction noise from Ground Zero, but on the other hand it was quite amazing to sit by the window and see the on-going construction at the site.

Our family drove to New York City over the Memorial Day weekend. We wanted to stay in the Tribeca/Financial District and after searching for and reading the reviews for hotels in the area, we decided on the W New York (Downtown). In a word - Outstanding! Because of the reconstruction of the buildings in and around ground zero, there is a bit of a challenge to get to the front door, but once there, we were very happy with our choice. We were whisked up to the fifth floor for our check-in and Andrew (at the front desk) was very helpful to us. Check-in (for our two adjoining rooms) was a pleasure and a breeze. He explained the services and facilities and answered all of our questions. The bellhop brought us to our room, explained everything to us (including how to adjust the A/C) and left us with a smile.The room was clean (some scuffs on the white walls that could use a bit of touch-up though), well sized and the bathroom was larger than we thought it would be. Well stocked snacks and bar (if you wanted to indulge) and a bed that was probably the most comfortable bed we have ever slept in. Our room faced the construction site and we could see the Empire State Building in the distance.It's the little things that would make us to want to come back. VERY good coffee served in the lobby every morning (which was replaced by iced lemon/lime water during the rest of the day) and floor mats in the elevator that were changed every 8 hours that read "GOOD MORNING", "GOOD AFTERNOON" and "GOOD EVENING". Simple, but impressive.The location is great. A few blocks away from Wall Street, Battery Park, the river, Century 21, and a few subway lines. We have stayed a few times in the Times Square area and although that was very convenient for the tourist attractions, this location was a lot quieter and easier to get around in. We will be back.

Wow what a hotel! Great rooms, restaurant and bar. Very good service, especially from consierge. Nice view of memorial place. If you look for hotels downtown this is the place to be. Easy to go to other areas, quiet and close to shopping.

My husband and I spent 4 nights here and it was fabulous. We had an interesting view of the new freedom tower and the reflection pools. My husband had been anxious about this construction but it was not a bother at all (never heard any noise).We loved the ultra modern design of our room. Very comfortable bed and fabulous shower. We recieved excellent customer service throughout our stay. We arrived very early and expected to store our bags until afternoon checkin but our room was ready so they allowed us to check in at 9am. What a bonus:-)The bartenders in the lobby bar were sweet and poured very generous single malts. The tuna tartare at BLT is a must try.Great location easy subway ride anywhere you want to go (take it!cheaper and ALOT faster than cabbing it anywhere).Tip: If you stay here make sure to take the 5min walk to ``Century 21`` for great deals on designer clothing.Enjoy!

Checked in to the W in New York for 3 nights and had a wonderful time. The hotel in general continues W's urban chic styling and seems to bring the excitement of New York right into the lobby.The rooms are very modern in their design and will not be for everyone, but offer all the comforts of home and of course the uber comfy W bed.Staff we are very pleasant and helpful and genuinely interested that a great stay was being enjoyed.Whilst the construction of the WTC site continues, the noise we never overly intrusive, and the 9/11 memorial site has a peaceful and beautiful vibe to it, and being at your doorstep really deserves a visit.If you want chic and happening, it's all here. If you prefer something more relaxed and a 'refined' old style hotel, then this may not be your hotel.

Stayed at the W for 4 nights with a girlfriend for a "chick weekend". The hotel was really good....we were in the hotel and checked in within 10 minutes. We requested a room on the far side of hotel which was granted and we were never bothered by the noise from construction at the world trade centre site. The room was small but not any smaller than other places I've stayed, in fact maybe a little more room than usual. The room was clean, well appointed and well taken care of during our stay.While there isn't alot of action right by the hotel, nothing is really far away. Cabs were easy to find and we only had traffic problems on the Friday night heading to Broadway. The concierge at the hotel, Karim (sp), was fabulous. Friendly, engaging, knowledgeable and very very helpful. Got no bad advice :) The hotel isn't necessarily "hopping" but the bar is a nice spot to stop on the way back in the afternoon or on the way out for the evening and the service was great and friendly.I would definitely stay there again and have already recommended it to friends (maybe not with kids unless you can afford two rooms).

We had a staycation here with the kids recently. I met the family there after work and ditched the kids with room service and went to dinner in Brooklyn. You meet the doorman on the street and go up to check in, all worked fine. We were given interconnecting rooms overlooking the WTC sight. Amazing sight of the construction and the simply beautiful memorials.The rooms were typical W, modern, sleek and over designed which make them fun! Excellent beds and linens as always. The kids had a great time with room service. We got back from dinner in Brooklyn at stupid o'clock and as always the W lobby had morphed into a club. One more for the road. Ouch.Couple of tips:The building site is noisy and lit up at night. Did not worry us we felt honoured to be able to overview it and the sunrise on the Freedom Tower is amazing. However a few nights of this would be trying. If you don't want noise ask for a different aspect.The W is fun, edgy, loud and party central but wrapped up in a great hotel. If you want refined old school chintz head up to the Plaza.If your new to NYC this hotel is downtown in the financial district so make sure the location suits your trip requirements.Good hotel and I happily recommend it.

The W downtown is a design hotel, thus designed to be hip & happening. But sometimes the design is there but the vibe isn't. Even if it is personal. Athough staff is actually pretty good with a special compliment to the 'welcome desk', top notch, what really ticked us off was the noise from construction on the new WTC location, even on the 22nd floor, where construction noise started at 6.30 in the morning which proved too much even for ear plugs.... Although given the sight location you almost feel guilty complaining about about noise but at these rates this simply isn't acceptable. Not a big problem but is was a bit of a dissapointment that the courtesy car was always fully booked...(we were there for 5 days).

Our room was very clean. The main, huge problem was the lack of a doorman. There is no welcome desk or personnel in the lobby to help with bags or provide directions. We had to wait until another guest showed up to ask where to find the check-in desk, which is on the 5th floor. We then had to bring our luggage up to the 5th floor, where we were told to take them back to the entrance for storage until our room was ready. During our three-day visit, a doorman was only in the lobby one time to get a taxi for us. I also had called the hotel to make certain that the room came with Internet access. After we checked in (which took 1 hour), I found that the Internet fee was $7 per half hour of usage.......NOT free. In other words, do not bring your work with you if you plan to stay here.

My husband and I spent four nights at this hotel in May 2012. We had a great experience - the staff was friendly, the hotel was convenient to the subway, our room was spacious and clean, the bed was super comfortable and it was very interesting to be so close to the WTC site. Having said that, I would not pay full price to stay here in the future. We got a great deal through Hotwire and definitely have no complaints for the price we paid however, we would have been disappointed had we paid full price. There were some very obvious construction errors/sloppiness, our bedside light was burnt out, the towel rack in the bathroom was coming off the wall and the very white walls are showing a lot of wear and tear even though the hotel is only a couple of years old. I don't want to sound like I'm full of complaints, because we really did have a great stay however the quality of the room unfortunately doesn't match up with other hotels of similar star rating/price.

This is a hip hotel in a convenient location. There are subway stops for most lines within 1-5 blocks. And the blocks in lower Manhattan are much shorter.
