The lobby is on the 5th floor and in the evenings there is a DJ. My son thought this was the coolest. He danced his way to his room.We found the room to be small but the design and layout made it not that big of a deal. The bed was extremely comfortable, though I found the pillows to be not as firm as I like them.We had a view of Ground Zero which was fascinating but also weird. Though it gave us a chance to teach our son about what happened on 9/11.The bathroom and shower is on the other side of the bed, with see through glass at the top. The proximity would be my only complaint. You can hear everything that is going on the bathroom. With the room being so small perhaps a fan or other noise canceling option should have been considered. The bathroom also features products from Bliss. Once of my favorite Spas. I’ll be honest the extras find their way into my suitcase.The room service was quick and yummy. One other feature worth mentioning is our room had a i-pod docking station, which came in handy for charging our phones.

I have stayed at this hotel 5 times over the past 18 months. Each stay has been just great. The location is wonderful if you have business in the financial district. You can pretty much walk to where you need to be, or take their free Acura car service (I usually have to book this the night before, if I want to guarantee availability). The room are small, but they are thoughtfully designed and well laid-out. The beds are extremely comfortable - same type you'll find in any W hotel.Lobby service is great, if you fancy a cocktail overlooking the World Trade Center site. The bar bites are tasty and fairly substantial.I have only eaten breakfast at BLT. The menu is a little limited, and the service can be incredibly slow. The coffee they serve there is great, though.The only problem I've ever had at this hotel is a small one. I asked if I could borrow a BlackBerry charger on one occasion, when I left mine at the W Union Square the previous night. To my surprise, the Anything/Anytime (aka 'concierge') said they didn't have one, couldn't get my charger from the other hotel , and directed me to a T-Mobile store to buy one. There were several closer stores (Sprint and Verizon, even!) I just found the whole episode a bit odd.But overall, a good hotel, and my lodging of choice when I'm visiting downtown.

We came here with another couple and could not be more satisfied with the W Downtown. The location is unique and very bustling for downtown.The rooms are great, the bed was very comfortable, the shower was awesome. We had a fabulous Southern view. The decor in the rooms was great, although there were some minor signs of wear. Also, the thermostat controls were a little buggy so our room was cold most of the time, but we just stayed under the covers and it was fine.The lobby decor is great and it is fun to come into a lounge at the end of the night, although we were so wiped out. One tip -- this hotel is one of the best NYC hotels within walking distance of Brooklyn. We walked there and back through all sorts of great neighborhoods. Brooklyn is such a blast these days -- anyone who likes to burn off calories between great meals should consider walking the Brooklyn Bridge and getting up to Smith st...Sunday am we walked up the Hudson River all the way the Hi Line. Amazing walk, great views.Good work, W!!!

We had a small group of travellers that all stayed at the W hotel - the one downtown near wall street (123 Washington). It was a very pleasant stay - while we booked online through a third party website, they still honored my SPG gold status, which was nice and we received an upgraded room.The upgrade came with the caveat that it was facing the World Trade Center construction site, so there might be some additional noise. We were open to it, however, because it sounded interesting, and while there was a constant stream of construction it was generally quiet in the evening. I think getting a birds-eye view of the site was one of the most interesting things about the stay, so unless you sleep during the day a lot, it's worth experiencing.The check-in is on the 5th floor, so you have to take an elevator up to reach the proper lobby. The lobby has a bar, which is open in the afternoon/evenings, a good spot to catch a drink before heading out. The drinks aren't cheap, but the pours tended to be generous. The room itself was well appointed - the bed was comfortable, the bathroom had a nice shower, and my wife was quite happy with the bath products offered. As we did have a slightly larger room, I was disappointed that there was no sitting area or at least a lounger chair to relax in. It seems all the rooms have "sitting" areas on the window ledge, and part of the built in furniture, but they weren't really comfortable to sit on. To each their own.The hotel restaurant was the BLT Bar and Grill - it was quite good, and a nice perk. We had the burgers and some other munchies and they were all excellent. It seems to have a great after work scene - bit crowded, but very lively. I'm a bit surprised by some of the negative reviews of the food and staff - we had a good experience and I like to think we're experienced diners.The service at the hotel - in particular the doormen and the floaters - was excellent. Normally I wouldn't mention it, but in this case they did seem to go above and beyond, which really improved our stay. Some of our group members needed some additional assistance and the staff here did an exceptional job of assisting with cabs and arranging transport. I would recommend this hotel - it is good value for NYC and especially well located if ground zero is an important part of your trip. As a point of reference, we've recently stayed at the Hotel Andaz on Wall street and the Omni Berkshire around mid-town. This hotel compares well with those others - with a definite edge in service to the W if that is important to you. The rooms at the W appear to be slightly smaller. The Andaz has the free soft drinks and munchies, but the service was poorer. The Omni was the most traditional and anonymous of the three, but the room was very comfortable.

This downtown hotel is extremely modern and chic and has great service. We were a group of 4 people and stayed in a room with 2 double beds. The beds were extremely comfortable and the room had more than enough space for all of us with our unnecessary luggage.The window gave us a direct view of the construction that was going on for the 9/11 Memorial Site and the Freedom tower which was cool to see.The reception desk was able to give us plenty of advice and information regarding the city and places to visit.The perks of the room: Spacious walk in showeriPod Docking station.Bliss bathroom productsSuper comfortable bedGreat viewsCons: The bathroom had a sliding door which was a bit weird and at times hard to shutYou have to pay to use the WIFI which I found weird since even crappy hotels and motels will give free internet accessParking was $55 per day, but that also seems to be standard for NYC.

I would definitely recommend getting a room on the south-facing side of the hotel, since the north side faces directly on the 9/11 site and there is pretty much constant construction going on in the area.The bed and bedding is really very special. We slept so well. The bathroom is best for tall people since the toilet paper is across the room from the toilet (!) and I never got within a foot of the shower head in order to adjust it (I am 5'2".We also loved the free coffee in the morning and the complimentary New York Times every day we were there.The location is close to Wall Street, Battery Park and the Staten Island ferry. It doesn't have the best subway access, since there is only the E train close by.The DJ music in the lobby was just annoying--lots of electronic noise without much talent.

Nice room. clean and good view over ground zero. Stayed 5 nights, traveling with a friend. 16th floor, 2 double beds. Thi hotel is announced as one of THE best... well I've stayed at Hilton Garden Inn Times Square and Hilton on 6th ave before and both those hotels are way better. Not ideal location if you want to see a lot of Manhattan - better to stay in midtown. Cons:- One of the lamps in bathroom did not work and we did ask for a replacement twice but it did not happen. - For space saving reasons (probably) there was a sliding door to the bathroom, this was hard to close.- Not enough power outlets in the room. - AC was very hard to adjust, too hot or too cold. - When asking for help with luggage this took 30 mins. - There is a complimentary car service that can take you up to around 80th street - it is never available though so why announce?! - Small fitness room - and 2 of the cardio machines were out of order.

In the W Hotel, BLT Bar and Grill offers burgers, sandwiches and salads for lunch. The waitstaff needs more training. The kitchen staff should not be making food before diners place their orders. The food is tasteless but I understand there are so few places to eat in the area that business people eat here. We won't be returning. They need an entire overhaul in training staff, from management to kitchen staff.
user_name:
srk60
New York City, New York

review_body: After reading a lot of comments about how 'hip and trendy' this hotel was we weren't quite sure what to expect but to be honest the majority of the people staying here are families and a few business people. There was music with a DJ in the lobby at night but only on the weekends. I think the hotel is trying to create a cool bar vibe but it doesn't work - the area is too small and it doubling as a lobby kind of spoils the mood.Anyway... We chose this hotel due to its downtown location as we didn't want to stay midtown. The location for us is excellent, near to little Italy, soho, battery park etc. It is minutes from several subway stations so has excellent access to many lines.The rooms were very nice with lovely bathrooms. Yes there was dust on the mini bar items as other people have said. The Bliss toiletries smelt nice but really dried out our skin so take care. The beds are amazing and we slept very well indeed.Tip - book through Hotwire for good deals.We would definitely stay here again and recommend to people who want a great downtown location.

I stayed here for the Easter long weekend with my girlfriends and originally booked a room with 2 double beds. I booked the hotel on sale so it was a decent price for NYC. I've listed the pros vs cons of this hotel below:Pros:- Decently close to a major subway stop (Rector) which has access to good line that takes you into the central part of the city.- Duane Reade and a small convenience store (Joe's Gourmet) is reasonably close by to pick up water and such. - Easy access to Taxi (via intersection of the hotel) or via the doorman in the front of the hotel. - Modern decor inside and very clean. - LOVE the Bliss toiletries. No need to bring your own favourite ones b/c this one is high quality (Also sold in Sephora and it's not cheap)- washroom was nice and modern. The shower area was quite roomy. - Front desk was very friendly.Cons:- Construction noise outside (rebuilding of the WTO site) is VERY loud in the morning. You have to use earplugs, or else you will be awake quite early. - We were told that the "double beds" room was sold out (first time it ever happened to me that a hotel told me this --i guess i have been lucky with my hotels until NOW). Front desk man squeezed 4 girls into a corner unit with a king sized bed and a rollaway bed. I mean, he was nice about it but we did not pay like almost $300 to sleep on an uncomfortable rollaway bed for 1 night each. was VERY disappointed with this. Also, their "corner unit" large room was not large at all. But this is prob b/c of the size of all NYC hotels. - location was definitely not the most convenient if you are there to shop (not sight see).- on the last day of our stay, the wind was so strong in NYC that it blew our 19th floor window open (approx 25 degrees in angle). Mind you, you can sit on the ledge (cushioned ledge couch style windows) so imagine if someone was actually sitting and leaning on the ledge/window at the the time the window all of a sudden gave in "by itself"... getting shivers thinking about this. Overall, the was a decent stay but I don't feel the need to go back to W, considering that there are a lot of hotel options in NYC.

Generally love the Starwood products and usually W's. Definitely a young vibe so may not be the most ideal for families though our kids were with us. They loved the hotel and room. Had a great view and though they only had a king for us four they brought up feather beds with ample bedding so the kids were happy. Restaurant was OK.

Rooms are average to small with some very oddly designed lighting (note to push the on button on the side near the base, but not on the base). As characteristic with some of the other W hotels (Times Square, for example), the lobby is on an upper floor, so that helps getting and out of the hotel (not having to worry about the traffic on the ground level). Note that the hotel is directly facing the Ground Zero construction and visitor sites, so it can be a little messy, crowded and noisy. That said, the hotel is nice and clean with good amenities. I wouldn't recommend the hotel for families, but then that isn't traditionally the market for the W hotel chain.

My wife and I stayed here in this hotel for a wedding one night that was close by. We booked on Hotwire and got a fair rate. This was my first stay at the W.This hotel is located right next to Ground Zero and the new WTC 9/11 Memorial, there are a lot of tourists at ground level and it can get a little hectic. That said, you are in one of the best areas of downtown.Check-in was fast, we had a nice room with modern decor. There were some parts, like the bathroom that I thought were really odd, but overall nice. We had a great view of the memorial from the 9th Floor and could see the new Memorial Waterfalls which I think was awesome.On the rest of the hotel. The elevators and other areas of the hotel are jazzed out with style, it was all a little overwhelming. The food at the bar was average but ok (nice tap list) and the bar at night has a DJ and is a place to be seen. Expensive but innovative cocktails.So why isn't the hotel more than average? Noise. The hotel is loud and in a loud area, you won't get much sleep, in spite of the very comfortable bed. For the price we paid, you expect a good night's sleep. I just think that goes without saying. We had a heating/air vent that zoomed on at 3 AM and woke us both up, never did get back to bed. Overall, if you are a light sleeper and can get a deal, this is a great option, for me the noise didn't ruin the hotel, but took it down from something I can truly recommend to one that I recommend caution with.
user_name:
Reason88
New York City, New York

review_body: I stayed there 4 nights for business and this is first time in this area, the service on 1st floor bar and grill was horrible, me and my customer were sitting at the bar area for 15 minutes and no one ask if we want to order, we finally wave to the bar staff and witness the dispute between the waitrer and bar tender that no one wants to work in that area, they finally took our order but like doing us a favor. Internet was terrible, phone reception in the room was horrible, and then the life music at the lobby area was so loud that if you stay from 9th floor and below, your can't escape music even you in the room.

Stayed here for New Years 2012. No major complaints. Was upgraded to a suite. The room was spacious with modern decore. Only downside was that I had to have housekeeping re-clean the room upon arrival.There were M&M mashed on the carpet.

Rates on SPG site per NBR code state 159, however, nowhere is this rate available. After spending over 50 minutes on the phone and speaking to 3 different people, I was told this was a mistake on their website as they couldn't find this available rate anywhere either! Would not honor the rate because they couldn't reach the hotel front desk directly!!

I spent one night at the W Downtown while participating in the New York City Half Marathon. There was a large contingent of people from the race staying at the hotel, as it was close to the finish line. My experience was decidedly mixed. There is no escaping the fact that this is a dreadfully hip establishment, and I'm fairly certain that I'm not hip enough for it. When I arrived at 6pm it was already getting challenging to navigate the lobby, due to the mood lighting and the DJ. By the time I returned from dinner at 10pm the lobby was so darned cool that I could barely find the elevators in the dark. More hip music selections in the (pink lava-lamp themed) elevators, and you'll surely want to buy the cool CD of W music that's available in your room. The rooms are full of more hip and cool stuff. Looking like it was designed by folks who fancy themselves as minor league Jonny Ive types. Few opportunities are missed to do something in an out of the ordinary way. Like, even the toilet flush was unusual. You might really like this, you might not. I found it cute, but not a reason to choose to stay there.There are plenty of things that are good about the hotel. First, the beds. The mattress was a little on the soft side for my taste, but the bedding was heavenly. I so wish I didn't have to get up at 4am for my race. And the shower is outstanding -- very, very well received after the race. My room was on the 17th floor on the north side, where it directly overlooks the 9/11 Memorial and growing Freedom Tower. Amazing view. This might not persist, as there's another building under construction between W and the WTC. The coffee in the lobby in the morning is rather good. The rooms don't feel too tiny by NYC standards (I had one with 2 doubles).Then the not so good. First, $17/day for wifi is a joke. We know it costs them very little to run it (that's why the less pricey hotels don't charge you for it). Second, it feels like the room is more of a product placement experience than a place to stay and rest. And that relates to my main complaint, which is a bit of a rant about the difficulty of getting a morning coffee (... given how much I had paid for the room). Most normal places have in room coffee. But there's no space for that at W, given the amount of real estate that's needed for product placements. But there's a little note hidden in an alcove that says that you can request a coffee maker if you'd like one. Great! I really could use that for the 4am start. I ask the concierge: "Sure, no problem". By the time I get back to my room she's on the phone saying that they were fresh out of them. But that's no problem, as they say that you can get it in the lobby any time in the morning. "I have to be up at 4am, which is on the early side for that kind of thing." "No problem." [... too few hours of sleep in the wonderful bed ...]. At 4:15 when I go to the lobby, the new concierge looks at me like I'm nuts when I ask about coffee. He seems kind of annoyed to see somebody at that time of the night. I know this isn't a huge deal, but it just seemed symptomatic of where this hotel's priorities are. Being a hipster shouldn't mean that you can forget the basics.I was foolish enough to bring my car with me to New York. Fortunately, the Icon garage around the corner from the W has a $35/day rate for W guests, which is not bad for NYC prices, and much better than their regular $62/day rate.

I stayed here with some girl friends as a mini reunion. We all went to school downtown- we love and are familiar with the area. The hotel is easy to get to- lots of subways within a few blocks.The room was really clean. Everything was sleek and modern. If you don't want to be naked in front of who you are traveling with, let the shower steam up first. We had a room where the glass shower wall was the only wall for the bathroom...even though it's not clear glass, you see everything! Hotel staff was really nice and helpful. Toiletries are Bliss brand and I loooooved them. There is still a lot of construction going on in WTC- hearing that noise in the morning was obnoxious. The bed was soooo comfortable. I slept like a baby until a jackhammer woke me up.Bar had good drinks- kind of expensive. Overall, If you're into the modern look, this place is probably for you. Im not...but I didn't dislike it- I'd come back.
user_name:
ms_golightly19
New York City, New York

review_body: Fantastic hotel in a great location. Loads to see downtown but at night things are a bit quieter, you are not barging past crowds to get from A-Z like you are around Times Square. I stayed for 3 nights in a twin, double room. Best bits, the beds are sooooo comfy to sleep in, crisp, white linen, super soft pillows and lots of them. The room was a really good size, the best size I've experienced in a NY hotel ; so rare. The shower was amazing, powerful and easy to operate/find the right temperature. Bathroom came with decent toiletries inc bath robe and a powerful hair dryer (ladies you can leave yours behind at home)! The room had all the mod cons: plasma TV mounted on the wall, DAB radio come iPod dock, air con, in room mini bar. There was ample storage and wardrobe space for a short stay. The view from the bedroom window was fab, you walk in and are instantly drawn to the big windows, lots of light floods in. I had an amazing view of the financial district's skyscrapers and the Ground Zero memorial site. Seeing it from 17 floors up was very impressive. So what else about this hotel? It is über trendy in its design, you could be forgiven for thinking you'd walked in to an upmarket bar rather than a hotel. It is clealry trying to appeal to the hip young, clubbing, crowd. Just to the side of reception you’ll see some DJ decks for the evenings ambience. Despite this, I never heard the music or the crowd from my room. The scene may or may not be your thing but it's not intimidating. I don’t consider myself trendy nor does my old man, who travelled with me, but he was fine with it all, if not slightly bemused.All staff I met were friendly and more than happy to help. Check in was quick and easy, within moments I had key card in hand and was catching the lift to my room. The hotel was quiet, no noisy neighbours, my room was directly opposite the lift and I didn't hear a peep.The hotel includes a couple of bars/restaurants - the one bar has a balcony on three sides which might be nice on a warm evening. There is also a gym - I didn't get chance to explore these options but its there if you need it. Every morning they put out free coffee and tea which you can help yourself to - nice little touch before you head out for a day of fun in the city. For me this particular visit was about comfort. Knowing I wouldn't be in my room much but would be totally exhausted when I was, I wanted comfort and quiet so I could get a good kip in. The comfort of the bed, the space to move around the room easily without tripping over suitcases and each other is why this hotel worked for me.As for rate, well I believe I had a steal. Booked last minute-ish via Expedia and paid £350 for 3 nights for two adults, sharing a twin, room only. The acid test...would I return...Yes, Yes and Yes. I can't wait until I have another reason to return to new York/W Hotel.

I stayed downtown this trip as a result of having a meeting in the area. A word about the area - it is uneventful really. Another reviewed called it "soulless" and while I wouldn't go that far, I would say that there are better neighborhoods to stay in. For the hotel, I think this hotel was nicely done. I have an issue with the lobby check in simply because it's small and if there are a lot of people trying to check, it could be crowded. I really enjoyed the decor (even if modern / trendy isn't my personal taste). My room was clean and comfortable. Like many other W's, there was alot of snacks and other items taking up space on the desk. Speaking of the desk, it was slightly small for my business needs. I'm sure a larger room wouldn't have this issue. I absolutely loved the window seat they had. I sat there while preparing for a meeting instead of the desk. Bed was of course, very comfortable. I agree with another reviewer who said it would have been nice to have towel hooks. The counter space was also small. Shower was great though. I used the gym once and preferred the gym at The Westin, mainly for the equipment and space. However, the gym was still good and really my only complaint is having to walk through the lobby to get to the second set of elevators to use the gym. I found the staff to be very friendly here too - not annoying friendly but just enough. BLT restaurant was cute and I really enjoyed my lunch. If I don't stay here again, it would only be because of the location. Otherwise, a great option!

From the time I called, to the time I left, it was an extremely pleasant experience. We called up in advance to tell them it was my birthday. The next thing I knew, they were asking me what my favorite snacks were and top favorite songs.As soon as we arrived at the hotel, I was mesmerized by the modern architecture and gorgeous decor. The staff were very friendly and helpful and checked us in a jiffy.When we went upstairs to our room, we were greeted with my favorite songs playing in the backround off of the flatscreen T.V., and my favorite snacks sitting on the desk.The beds were very comfortable and we slept like babies through the night. The next day, after we enjoyed a restfull night and enjoyed ourselves in NYC, we came back in the evening to find that the beds were turned down and were left W brand water bottles.We were also informed of the W Acura Experience, which enables you to have a free ride there and back to any destination city wide by appontment.Overall, I would highly reccomend this hotel to anyone who is visiting the big apple. Although this hotel is currently rated 4 1/2 stars, I would definately give it 5 stars. We had no issues whatsoever and would definately stay here again the next time we are in New York City.
user_name:
Yaniv M
New York City, New York

review_body: This is a relatively new W hotel. With most of the W's being "cookie-cutter" lately this one stands out a bit. Very sexy Lobby Lounge on the 5th floor--thats also where you check in. In the evening it becomes a scene and the music picks up. That's also what you come to a W for, so if a tranquil hotel is what you are looking for, this may not be for you. The service was very good and attentive. Hotel is clean, sleek, and chic. Very friendly staff. We checked in as SPG Gold members and they gave us an enhanced room upgrade and your choice of the new benefits, with a 4 PM checkout. Overlooks the WTC construction and reflection pools. One minor issue my brother had was that the construction site is pretty well lit up all through the night so the roller-shade really doesn't fully block out all of the light. It didn't bother me at all, but for some it may. Bathrooms- nice and very clean. We had lunch at BLT Grill after we checked in which was very good and they make a big martini! There are a lot of nice restaurants in this area which the concierge will be more than happy to help. I would suggest Capital Grill which is an excellent steakhouse within walking distance. All in all a great hotel stay.

I loved our stay at the hotel. Im a nanny and travelled with the family for business. I was responsible for booking the hotel where we stayed which was stressful. However, the W exceeded all of my boss' expectations. She said that she will only stay here from now on. Every staff member we ran into was beyond friendly and helpful. There was one staff member that stood out during our stay... Nadar the complimentary Acura driver we were assigned to take us into uptown. The service only provides a drop off so I was nervous about getting back to our hotel. I told Nadar this and he gave me his phone number and told me to call when we were ready and he would come pick us up. I can't even explain what a relief this was since I was alone, 6 months pregnant and had a 1 year old with me. He was kind, friendly and a real life saver. I highly recommend this hotel.

W hotels have a brand all their own. They are stylish, modern and very hip. If this is what you are searching for then you will not be disappointed. In addition the room was surprisingly large for a boutique hotel in New York. The sleeping area was superb and the bathroom was a real luxury. The staff were all very courteous and attentive.That being said there are one or two drawbacks. First of all I a, not a fan of the financial district. It is a soulless part of an otherwise vibrant city. In future I would opt for a hotel in Soho, the Village, or possibly closer to Union Square. Second of all, I personally feel that the W chain takes itself too seriously and often feel that the modernity comes at a cost of some basic practicalities and creature comforts. The room was marvelous but the bathroom lacked some basic fixtures for hanging up wet towels for example. The darkness in the lobby and bar areas seem cool at first but when black greets you in every room even at 9am it becomes a little tired very quickly. The most irritating aspect of the stay was the so-called complimentary Accura car service. Upon check-in you are told that there's is one free complimentary drop off in the city with the hotel's Accura fleet for each day of your stay. We tried to book this on three separate occasions without success. We also witnessed other guests being told that the service was unavailable. One of the basics rules of hospitality is under promise and over deliver. By turning this old adage on its head the hotel left numerous guests feeling disappointed.

I agree with most of the reviews of the W New York - Downtown: it's a great hotel, very clean, with an amazing view of Ground Zero and the 9/11 Memorial. On the positive side, rooms have a nice decor, mini-bar is well stocked and everything seems to be well kept. Definitely a 4-star experience. On the negative side, the lobby mobile DJ/club "thing" is indeed a bit annoying, especially if you have to make your way through the crown to the elevator with luggage. Additionally, I was just a few floors above the lobby level and was able to hear the sound coming from the dance floor. I didn't really care about it, but it might be a good idea to ask for a room in a higher floor so to avoid trouble. Overall a good experience, would definitely do again.
user_name:
DDBSB
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: My Husband and I were in town to celebrate his birthday, take in the WTC Memorial and see a broadway show. The W Hotel was a wonderful place to stay. Rooms were exceptionally clean and comfortable. I have only two minor complaints....1) You have to take two sets of elevators to get to your room. Once you get off the first elevator you have to walk through the night club to get to the second set of elevators. They are renovating so I am not sure if this will change. 2) My husband and I wanted to grab a drink at BLT after a show. We walked in the bar at 11:00pm on a Saturday night and the bartender informed us that they had already called last call. At 11:00 on a Saturday night???? All in all those were very MINOR complaints. Also, take advantage of the Acura Free Ride offered to guests. It was such a pleasant experience after spending the day using public transportation.

My trip to new york was amazing, I had been before but 1) had never seen the statue of liberty and 2) longed for a trip aroun central park in a horse and carriage. My family and I stayed at the 'W' hotel across from the twin towers memorial fountains, every day there where hundreds of people lining up to go in top see the amasing sight that I got every time I looked out of my extremely large windows. It was beatiful to say the least and so serene.I was not at all intimidated by the extra large sky scrapers surrounding the hotel and to be honest some of the best deli@s 6that new york had to offer. The saying a cop on every corner was an under statement as there were about 6 on every corner and I felt very safe even in the early hours, The hotel was amasing the beds offered the best sleep I had had in a long time even as far to say better than my bed at home !!!!! there was nothing to much for the staff who were friendly and plotie , even quite funny as my aunt flirted with the conierge. They offered us a car to take us where we needed to go and gave us refreshments when we said we had our own. Best hotel I have ever stayed in only there was no parking and we used local parkin @ $70 for the night and most of the next day . There was also a terrace bar overlooking the city that would be amazing in the spring/summer.

Came up to NY to visit with friends. Be aware that the W is not so quiet on the weekends, when I came in at 1 AM on Sat night the party was still going. I had never been in the Wall St. area so the W downtown's location made it easy to take part of a morning to wander around and take in a few sites and is located immedaitely across the Street from the World Trade Center memorial. The W was very relaxed during the day Sunday and my room had a super comfortable bed. I was in a corner room which had good space and a unique padded seating area under the windows. I was not up high and also didn't have a view of the WTC Memorial from my room but the view from the 5th floor lobby was exceptional. Service met my expectations and the staff was quite responsive to all of my requests. Room service always showed up at my door ahead of the promised 15-20 minutes and food was delicious. Will be staying here again.
user_name:
ChrisS_DC
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: ....I found in this hotel. Our room was located directly next to the elevator. I panicked at first, but it was super quiet and we never heard a sound! It was clean and comfortable with a beautiful view of the harbor. The surrounding neighborhood is quiet at night, but it was perfect for us. We were still able to be out late at night, enjoy wonderful pizza right around the corner, and had easy access to public transportation. We arrived home just today, and I can't wait to stay here again!

I like hip, up to a point. But at some point it starts to feel as though this hotel is trying too hard. The entrance is under construction now and it's a bit awkward finding your way in but you need to get an elevator to the 5th floor. In the spirit of hipness, it's dark at the check-in desk-very dark. So dark that when you go to the elevators, you can't see the buttons to press. It's very loud on that floor.Very,very loud. Did I mention that it was loud? You ascend to your floor and then struggle with the hip touch-card door key, trying not to feel silly, and eventually figure it out. But even in your room you can still hear the techno from the lower floors. Not too bad, but, you know, it's techno. Hard to ignore as a background thump.Room is fine -pretty standard. Not the hotels fault but LOTS of construction noise from World Trade Center construction which starts pretty early in the am.Service too is a little bit...lacking. No newspaper delivery as promised. No restocking of the mini-bar, No restocking even when called. Room does not appear to be nicely tidied in the day.All in all, an overage of the average. This place is I think a little over-hipped and maybe over-hyped. Think of it as a dark (and noisy) Hilton.

I love the beds at the W… every W I have ever stayed at. Always a huge plus. The food was really good at the bar, really enjoyed the ambivalence as well. Hip cool vibe you would expect at the W. I am not much of a hipster, but wasn’t bothered at all by the music or the crowd, it is exactly what you would expect at a W. They do cater to the young and hip, if your not comfortable with this, you should look elsewhere. I also do not mind the downtown location but it isn’t for everyone – if you are looking for a quick weekend and want to be in the middle of everything, you may want to consider other neighborhoods. The service was OK, not great – we waited a while at check in and to get settled. When we got to our room, our key didn’t work so we had to go back to the desk – the whole thing just took way to long. The biggest disappointment was the cleanliness of the room – huge turnoff, and the main reason for the poor rating. The walls were scuffed up, just looked very dirty. There were hangers in the closet from another hotel. I wouldn’t stay again just for the cleanliness factor – it wasn’t dirty enough to make me check out, but dirty enough to make me uncomfortable and not want to hang out in the room. Not what I would expect from the W or at that price point. One note - we stayed here on a weekend, so it was pretty slow. It was also prior to the 9/11 Memorial opening, so it may be busier now.

If you are looking for a good time in NYC, this is a great hip, cool and trendy spot. Also romantic for couples. We upgraded to spectacular room, a little pricey, but nice view of WTC and cool looking room. If your older or a wet blanket, check in to a Hilton, but if you want a real NYC experience, go here! You won't be disappointed :)

Don't stay here unless your looking to check into a night club instead of a hotel. This property tries to be chic by literally turning their lobby into a nightclub with DJ at night. So you end up yelling so you can be heard as you check in. You have to navigate past the DJ booth just to get you and your family to the elevator. The music resonated all the way into our 7th floor room until 2am and then we got to listen to the patrons stumble to their rooms for another hour.Overall the rooms and staff are truly 4 star, but need to remind themselves that hotels are not destinations but rather places to get rested and refreshed. There are plenty of nightclubs in New York, putting a mobile one in your lobby makes no sense.

Good: clean, decent place to stay.Bad: title says it all. This place is crawling with sock-headed hipsters. The Carlyle is less pretentious and a lot less annoying. I know that The W is targeting a certain type of visitor, but they really missed the mark on this one. Let's start with arrival- You enter on the fifth floor, where the front desk is located. Attached to the lobby is the lobby bar (ok, so far sounds normal, right?) but then they decided to fill the empty space with... A DJ setup. You then have to walk across an empty dance floor with the DJ on your right and bar patrons on your left, disco ball overhead, just to get to the elevator that goes to your room. When you are travel weary and carrying luggage, believe me this is not a relaxing welcome. The following morning we woke up to No Coffee in our room. A small sign indicates that there is complimentary coffee on the fifth floor. Great, I'll go grab some cups and dance my way to some java. I'm redirected to the second floor. 8 bucks plus tip later, I have my coffee. Apparently, the coffee is only complimentary on the fifth floor between 6-10am. That's just lame. Oh, I can request that a coffee maker is brought to my room. Too little too late. Coffee and disco atmosphere aside, it's a clean hotel and a decent place to stay. Grow out some ironic facial hair and get ready to boogie your way to your room each night- you'll fit right in.

The W Downtown is a perfect location for anything in the FiDi. Right across the Freedom Tower and close enough to Battery Park if you're planning on checking out the Statue of Liberty/Ellis Island. Standard rooms are small (it is NYC after all) but well appointed, bright and modern. I of course love the Bliss amenities! The desk staff were welcoming and friendly. I would love to visit again in warmer weather as it looks like the lobby bar opens up to a terrace. Would be great on a beautiful summer night! For breakfast in the morning, we went right around the corner to George's Diner rather than eating at the hotel and were not disappointed. Overall a great stay and would definitely return.

Booked this on Hotwire, so we didn't know what we were getting until we paid.Very modern, clean. Very comfortable beds. Our room overlooked the 9/11 Memorial, which was pretty cool.However, getting to and from the hotel was a bit of a pain. Tough to get a cab and then when we did we were stuck in downtown traffic. It's out of the way. Staff was friendly at the desk. If location was different I would stay there again.

This was a very memorable weekend. The hotel is located next to the World Trade Center memorial. Firstly, I found the hotel easy to get to from LaGuardia airport..cab fare was $30 plus tip. The hotel is a very tall glass building with a great welcome at the curbside by the staff. A very zen elevator ride to the 5th floor introduces you to one of the many "wow factors" of this hotel. The lobby is beautiful with cool music, fresh fragrances, and very friendly check-in and concierge staff. Check-in was very fast and we were in our room within minutes. More "wow factors" were the fabulous room we had. Obviously, the room was done with a designer's hand and mind. The room was fantastic and they did not hold back on the furnishings either. The room had a very nice sitting perch against the window and the room desk was very large for working the laptop. The w/c was amazing with a large shower and very modern furnishings in the toilet area(not to mention the Bliss Bath soaps). The bed was a king with an amazing quality to it. The bed helped after a long day of marching around NYC and we were in "cloud nine" within minutes. My next trip to New York will be another stay at this great hotel.

Pros: it was located right next to ground zero in the heart of the financial district. the concierge was very helpful with tons of recommendations, the W beds are always comfortable, the gym had all the usual gym equipments including a boxing bag and headphones if you forgot yours. Cons: the showers are a bit see through if you are traveling with friends, there are some chips and marks on the wall so it needs a little bit of a touch up, lots of one way streets so be careful if you are driving down, its a great location if you are there fore business, a long cab ride away if you like to spend your time partying in soho, meatpacking, or tribeca.

Completed my second stay at the W, and surprised by the relatively low ratings. The hotel and its staff are top notch. Friendly, customer oriented (when I was a few minutes late to get the last of the free coffee at breakfast, even though it was put away, the staff poured the last bits out of the coffee maker for me!) and helpful. Rooms are big (for New York) and views are lovely -- even over Ground Zero, as somber as it might be. It is true the neighborhood is still developing and it is not easy to get a cab in front of the hotel, but that's true of all the hotels in Lower Manhattan. For someone who knows their way around a bit, it's a great location -- near trains and buses, a Whole Foods Market, coffee shops, stores, Shake Shack. Good enough for me.Would be nice if the restaurant served a full menu later -- there aren't a lot of late night choices in the immediate few blocks. Looking forward to returning

If you literally want to stay next to ground zero (and the financial district) and that too in the most modern and chic places, this is where you want to be. The lobby area transforms into a lounge at night (or at least on Saturday nights).The only thing I did not like was that the lobby is on the 5th floor so you take elevator 1 to get there and then elevator 2 to go to your room.

I just wanted to say that this was the highlight of our trip to New York City. My wife and I were traveling in from The Netherlands and this was the last leg of our anniversary trip. New York City was the surprise for my wife, and she was truly amazed by the service and good nature of the staff at your hotel. There are a few people at the hotel who really made the experience magical. Robert at the door is truly incredible. He always greeted us with a smile, and he was always helpful with pointing us in the right direction on how to get around in the area. The Acura driver, I believe his name was Nader? was a true pleasure to be around. He showed us some amazing sites while we drove to our destination, and he even played the music station that we liked on the radio. Please tell him that we did try the pizza that he recommended, and it was incredible. Finally, the front desk staff at this hotel is truly top notch. Please forgive me if I mispell their names, but Jevon and Yahayra are truly a fun duo to be around. You can really tell that they enjoy working together and they are EXTREMELY funny. It was fun to share stories with Jevon about The Netherlands, and we even liked the same beer from there lol. Both Jevon and Yahayra always greeted us with a smile and were always able to answer any questions that we had for them. They even upgraded us to a suite since it was our anniversary and gave us free drinks at the bar. The view of the site was truly breath taking, and it really gave us a chance to take in the history that we were experiencing. It is because of them, that my wife will never forget this trip that we had.The room was excellent and it smelled amazing. I am still trying to figure out what it is that they spray the rooms with, as I want to get that for my own house. The drinks at the bar are strong, which is a plus, and the hotel is conveniently located next to all the major subway lines in the city so getting around was not a problem for us. Please make sure that everyone gets word of how much we enjoyed their service and accommodating attitude. We have told all of our friends about this wonderful hotel, and we will be back soon to enjoy it again.

Located next to Ground Zero, the #10 Firehouse, Ground Zero Memorial and Finance District, the really cool and stylish W hotel is a place to be in NYC. Rooms are comfortable with large windows, a really good King Size, iPod Dock. The bar is really doing great Caipis and Staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Every week the lobby is a get together place for young New Yorkers having drinks and live Dj music. I really enjoyed my stay there.

We stayed here one night. Everything was great. The hotel was clean, attractive, and modern. The staff was helpful and polite. On check in the staff helped us by printing our tickets for the show we were going to see that night, The hotel is in a nice location and there are taxis available and there are multiple subway lines available within very close walking distance. We took the subway up a couple of stattions to check out Little Italy and Chinatown. My favorite part was the bed. The linens felt really nice, they seemed to be really high quality and the matress was amazingly comfortable. It was a dream! There was a plush down comforter and pillows.

Great location - close to Wall St for business meetings I had to attend, and also great view from the hotel overlooking the 9/11 memorial. Funky designs in the hotel lobby, cool stylized furnitures in the room. The rooms are slightly smaller than most standard ones, but comfortable.

This hotel shines because of its staff. This week, I spent two night at the W and met two front desk attendants, two concierges, a bartender and 4 bellmen. To a person, they were friendly and helpful -- I felt that that all really enjoyed their jobs.My concierge, Kareem, was a super helpful. He helped me plan 3 business meals -- a breakfast, a lunch and a dinner and arranged the Acura car service and got me a ticket to the 9-11 memorial across the street. His restaurant selections were spot on and he couldn't have been any faster in helping me. That kind of service is what more W's should strive for and this one achieves on a regular basis.While this property has some challenges -- there is huge and noisy construction project across the street and for the first time, I heard the elevator with noisy guests late in the evening -- the warm and helpful staff makes up for that.I should also mention Nadir and the Acura car service. Though availability is limited, do take advantage of this service. Nadir drove me all the way to the Metropolitan Museum of Art at no charge. When I mentioned I had skipped breakfast that day, he made several suggestions of restaurants nearby -- I opted for a neighborhood bagel place he recommended. It was perfect. What a friendly guy who really loves New York... and sadly, the New England Patriots. (But that's another story!)Again, a great staff experience. I wouldn't hesitate to return on my next trip.

The moment i step foot in it's unassuming lobby, I knew I will like it. The smell of elevator was like fresh linens. The lobby was uber chic and cool. The views were magnificent. The best part about it -- It's not too crowded like the other hotels in city. The staff were friendly and warm. My room was on the 22nd floor facing the 9/11 Memorial which was very melancholic yet empowering. I love my room. It was modern and sophisticated. The noise from the construction site didn't really affected my sleep so it wasn't really a big deal. The subway stations were less than 3 blocks away which was perfect and easy to navigate. I'm definitely recommending this hotel to all my friends and family.

the hotel is well located downtown near the R subway 3 mins walk. Ground zero work stopped at 10pm and wasnt really loud anyway. Room was clean and still pretty new feeling. Recommended to stay here. Staff friendly and all a fuss free hotel to stay at.
user_name:
judManhattan
New York City, New York

review_body: This was my first time staying at a W Hotel and it was a good but not great experience. The first impression was fantastic - friendly and cheerful staff, a funky interior design and I was impressed with how they paid attention to the small details (ex. the carpets in the elevator say "Good Morning / Afternoon / Evening" depending on the time of day). All this goodwill started to slip away once I had a better sense of their customer service. The concierge was terrible at fulfilling simple requests (ex. on two occasions, I asked for a bowl to be sent up to the room in the morning only to realize that it was never going to come) and miscommunication by the staff was not handled professionally at all (ex. I was told that I could have the front desk print a document for me and that I should bring it down on a flash drive, but upon arriving at the front desk, the rude clerk told me they can't extract information from flash drives at the front desk and that I needed to email it to her. This was after she spoke to her colleague about me in a condescending manner...while I was standing in front of her). It's hit or miss with the staff - some of them are fantastic while others definitely need to be replaced.Also - be wary of rooms facing the 9/11 memorial. There is tons of construction taking place so there's noise throughout the day (including early mornings and late evenings). Thankfully it didn't affect me much (I'm a deep sleeper) but might be irritating to others.

Stayed at this hotel 3 days in december 2011. The hotel was clean, no bedbugs, rooms are average size for NYC, bathroom was clean and modern. If you plan on visiting the Ground Zero memorial, the hotel is perfectly located, just accross the street from the fountains. Didn't hear any noise whatsoever, I found the room to be well insonorized, althought it was just besides the elevators and electrical room (I think they gave us the worst possible room location ever, even if the hotel was half empty - perhaps because we had a special rate). The view was insignificant, in the back of the hotel. The location of the hotel is great for visiting downtown/Financial District and very close to the subway station. It is up to par with the W standards. Expect a cold reception, a cold atmosphere. Cleanliness and design are the keywords here.

Be warned that there is still heavy construction being done on ground zero, and one side of the hotel is subject to very loud construction noise including a jackhammer. Construction does not stop until 11:00 p.m., and starts back up again at 6:00 a.m. The hotel did move me to the other side for the second night of my stay which was much better. The room was about half the size, but it was a fair trade off for the noise which was unbearable.This hotel also charges internet access in the room, which is a pet peeve of mine. Two machines in the work-out room were not functional. I was less than impressed with BLT - tuna tartare was good, but I think I got yesterday's lobster on my risotto and did not eat about half of it. I survived, however. Bar staff very nice.

We were moving my son to New York to start his new job. My wife surprised us and booked a room at the W, around the corner from his apartment. We have stayed at "W" hotels in the past so I was expecting great service! This location was exceptional! The rooms were very comfortable, yes, they are small, but this is New York! There were three employees that were phenomenal! Dominique, Christine & Kristine. They went above and beyond to accommodate us! We will definitely be back here again soon! Thank you "W" hotel staff!

Too bad. The hotel location was great for our purposes. The rooms were clean and spacious enough. BUT the staff was so cold and abrupt, it just turned the whole experience on its head. How about a smile, folks? And then there was the extra charge to our credit card for something they claim was taken from the mini-bar. We took nothing. In the same cold manner we experienced while there, the woman told us that she could not tell us what, exactly, the charge was for. She transferred me to the restaurant manager who was not available. Turning this place into a nice experience would cost the management nothing but the time it takes to make sure that the few interactions experienced by guests while checking in and out are accompanied by pleasant, inviting staff. The money on your paychecks comes from us-- how about a smile?!

I stayed at this hotel the first week in December and loved it. Although I must agree that the hotel room was small, it was more than sufficient in meeting our needs. It was most definately the most funkiest hotel we've ever stayed in too!! We found the staff to be extremely helpful, especially the concierge. The could not do enough to help us with our sight-seeing expeditions. It it a little way out of town, so the only way to get around is by the subway or cab, but it is a 5-10min walk to the ferry to take you to see the Statue of Liberty, and also we had a grand view of WTC. My overall opinion is very positive, but I would prefer to stay a little more mid-town next time we visit NY.

Please do not book this hotel for your stay in NYC! The location is a nightmare if you are driving. It's surrounded by ground zero which kind-a creeped me out.The moment we entered in this hotel it gave me negative wibe. The staff was friendly and helpful but the hotel was not at all what I expected it to be.The room was tiny and the bed was uncomfortable. The bathroom was clean but very small and the toiletteries provided were disgusting!We actually cit our trip short here and moved to a hotel at Times' sqaure to get some peace of mind and feel happy about our stay in NYC.I will NEVER go back to this hotel and to this specific location.

I love everything the location is walking distance to a ferry going to Liberty Island. All the front desk staff are nice.. Its a cool place... The design of the rooms is so nice evrything is nice! nice! nice!
user_name:
samantha b
New York City, New York

review_body: When you stay at a W (at least in NY - I've stayed here and the one on Lexington), you should know you're going to get a small room. They're pretty tiny from my experiance, just a bed and a washroom - that said, there's enough room and that's really all you need. Just don't try packing more than two people in there and don't bring 3 suitcases. The service here is great, the hotel (like all their hotels) are big on style, and there are also a lot of fun little details built into it. For a reasonable price you get a boutique experiance and a great location... with the constuction it could be noisy, but nothing overly intrusive.

This a very chic trendy hotel. I was blown away by the level of detail. However, I felt basic hotel services were sorely lacking in that detail. 1. The outside temperature in Manhattan during my stay (12/15-12/19) was from 25-35 degrees. The heater was not working and had to be serviced. 2. My first night, I ordered room service twice (at different times during that night). The first order came within a respectable 30-35 minutes, but the second order had never come up. When I called back, they insisted the order had never been placed. Rather than argue, I told the Whatever Whenever person I would cancel the order and find food elsewhere, as I had been waiting for over 45 minutes. They then persuaded me to stay and wait for meal...the meal did come and it was not added to the bill. The next morning, I ordered room service and the pancakes were not cooked correctly. I was leaving for a meeting, so I didn't complain. That evening, I ordered room service again and the meal was fine, but the delivery person confronted me about the last night's order. WHY? I again told him that I had placed two separate orders that were about 30 minutes from each other. But he was more interested in tellling me that he filled my order. I found that to be unprofessional. 3. On Sunday, 12/18, I called Whatever whenever around 10:05am to have valet retrieve my car. I waited about 10 minutes before going to get it. When I got there, the bell person told it was on the way. At 10:25am, there was still no car. We proceeded upstairs to the front desk to ask them where the car was. She checked with the valet service and said it was on the way. Rather than wait downstairs in the freezing hotel lobby, we decided to stay on the reception level floor for another 10 minutes. We went down to the lobby about 10:40am and there still was no car. We had gone back the front desk to say that we had been waiting over 30+ minutes for our car. We had to show her the ticket again, describe our car in full detail. After 10 minutes of phone calls and her rationalizing this mistake, the car was returned to us about 10:55am. Normally, I wouldn't raise an issue about a slight mistake, but I found that the staff didn't take responsibility in their mistakes and should not engage the guest in what went wrong. Sadly, this hotel failed to meet the basics or service during my stay. I left feeling undervalued. It is however a cool place to hang out if you're hipster.

This is a great hotel. I stayed here one night a couple weeks back and its nice to stay at a new hotel here in NYC. Just a word for the wise, the rooms will be be quiet anytime soon with the constant construction work at the WTC. The upside to this is getting a great view of the Freedom Tower and the surrounding area of downtown Manhattan. I stayed on a Friday night and the bar/lounge had a DJ there.
user_name:
MJL395
New York City, New York

review_body: My family decided to take my Dad to the city to surprise him for hist birthday and we stayed at the W Downtown. A nice, secure hotel right next to the 9/11 memorial. We had connecting king and double rooms that were spacious and clean. The beds were quite comfortable and size of the bathroom was very reasonable. Service was quick and efficient while still personalized and we had no problems during our stay. The view of the memorial from our room was fantastic. The only downside to this property is that it can be really difficult to get a cab at night and the few choices for dinner, drinks, etc. in the evening. It is the Financial District however so if you're looking for action, try another part of town. Complimentary coffee and tea in the lobby (living room) each morning and an interesting bar scene at night. A key card is required to use the elevator which adds an element of safety, at the same time, can be a nuisance. Very friendly staff overall.
What a view!! We stayed here 2 nights in November 2011. The location is great. The room was luxurious and we had an amazing view onto 9/11 Memorial. The service was very friendly. Great value.

I stayed here with a friend on 12/3/11 and stayed in room 1009. It was the smallest hotel room I have ever seen in NYC. There was about 2 feet on each side of the King size bed. The bathroom was large though. Besides the room being small, I was very underwhelmed, There was no "cool" factor like other W's in the city that I have stayed at. The walls were stark white and it felt like I was in a hospital. The staff was very nice. The views of Ground Zero (from the lobby) are amazing. The restaurant, BLT was pretty standard. Overall just an average hotel.

Great room, very classy and modern! The hotel feels fresh and young. I only stayed there for 1 night but wish it was more, I would've liked to stay and listen to the DJ and have a couple of drinks at the bar! Bed and pillows very comfortable. Nice snack selection in the room (pay). No free wi-fi (a bit dissapointing). The subway station is just around the corner (rector st), takes you to Penn Station / Times Square, which I found very convenient. Will definitely stay there again.

My wife, two boys and I stayed for just one night over Thanksgiving weekend using Starwood points. We arrived late - around 10pm - and it looked like the hotel was closed (entrance on Washington St. was dark and no one outside.) I popped into the foyer and immediately a doorman/bellman, Richie, was out to greet me and assist us. He could not have been more pleasant, accommodating and helpful. He made our stay with his wonderful demeanor and friendliness, offering unbelievably above-and beyond help with parking, as well as unloading our bags, recommendations for breakfast, etc.! Every hotel should have a Richie! The hotel was very modern and funky; the room spacious, we felt, for New York. Our room on the 22nd floor directly overlooked the WTC site. It was fascinating and sad at the same time. We could hear the construction noise, but it stopped at 11pm (it began again in the morning, however it wasn't so bad.)We called the concierge (Tela - sp?) after checking in seeking help in obtaining passes to visit the 9/11 Memorial the next day. She could not help us then as tix were not available, but said to call the concierge in the morning. I spoke with Kareem the next morning and, to our surprise, he was able to obtain tickets for us, as well as the family members we were visiting (9 in total!) He was extremely pleasant and helpful! The tix were for different admission times a half-hour apart, but he said it shouldn't be a problem. However, he noted that if when we got there they gave us a hard time he said to call him and he would come across the street and speak with the WTC staff. An amazing offer of service! We checked out of our room and stored our luggage for much of the day before returning to find Richie again who shlepped our luggage - more than a block away - to load our car.Although we were only there for one night, we enjoyed our stay tremendously and felt very well-cared-for. We will be back (and hope that Richie and Kareem are still there!)

The hotel itself was very nice and great access to the subways. In addition to the noise from the WTC construction site I found several things to be a bit annoying since I expected a little more class from the W. We stayed 4 nights and not once were the minibar and toiletries replenished (although after reading the paperwork in the room I read that the minibar is restocked upon request. Really??). If you want wifi in your room that is an additional cost and the BLT restaurant I found to be very over priced for the food quality. Also, the service was not the best. They brought the wrong appetizer and when we ordered a second round of drinks they didn't arrive until after the check arrived. The most unbelievable part of our stay was the offer of a free ride within certain parameters of the city in the hotel's Acura. We booked it for my daughter's trip to Penn Station. It was a sales job!!! They had her watch an infomercial and tried to sell her the car!!!! Beyond tacky. I wouldn't recommend this hotel and have serious reservations about booking other W's. I didn't expect to be nickeled and dimed at a W.

It was reccomended to us as the hot spot in N.Y. The disappointing was very big.We could not sleep the entire night.The next morning we asked to give us another room on the quite side of the bulding.This was the answear from the front office manager.They cannot help us.He wont comp the room fro the last night.We will never return to this hotel.We will not reccomend it to any one.

I had stayed at the Andaz before and vowed never to stay elsewhere in NYC - however, couldn't resist trying a deal from Hotwire. I was pleasantly surprised to find out that I was getting a room at the W downtown, but after reading several reviews I wasn't sure anymore if it had been a good decision - it turned out it really was a good deal!Arrived at the hotel before noon and was not only promptly given a room but was also upgraded to a king room with incredible views of the World Trade Center memorial. Javon (sorry if spelling is wrong), at the reception desk, was extremely polite and efficient and my experience with the other staff was always great. Room was a decent size, washroom a little small but fine. Room was very sterile but I'd been told W's are like that and I didn't really mind it - it did feel that the materials used in the construction were a little cheap looking, but again, didn't bother me.Bed and pillows were incredible, the best I've seen in any hotel. I was on the 18th floor and besides a bit of noise during the day from construction at the WTC site, nights were absolutely quiet.Location is great, a very short walk from Rector Street station and with direct access to all attractions in Manhattan. A couple of restaurants around that were convenient for breakfast and a late night snack, but in general area is quiet in the evening (not necessarily a bad thing).My only problem with the hotel was the dark (and I mean really dark) lounge area leading to the elevators. Honestly, it's borderline ridiculous that the design team thought it was a good idea not to have any lights there - luckily I had checked in during the day so learned my way around.....Internet in the rooms was quite pricey but free wifi in the reception area was fine.Overall a nice experience.

This was the perfect location for our visit to the WTC Memorial (literally across the street) and our visit to the Statue of Liberty. There is a subway station truly "just around the corner" which made getting into Times Square and other mid town areas a breeze. We got a fabulous rate on Hotwire. It is a "chic" hotel and rooms may seem smallish to some but that is NYC. They are well appointed and met our needs well. We booked two rooms and the hotel put us in small corridor off the main hall where we were able to open our doors and move freely from room to room with some privacy. Nice touch. W hotels have nice amenities- Bliss bath products, great morning coffee and papers. The staff was SUPERB!! They handled all our requests quickly and with a smile. They were incredibly friendly and helpful and made the stay a terrific one. We did not experience any issues mentioned in other reviews. No problem with construction noise- the front door men easily got us cabs when needed. We had a fantastic time. I plan to return in February with my husband and want him to experience this hotel!!

Not at all deserving of the 4 1/2 stars they claim. New, yes, but the finish construction in our room was no better than a lousy roadside chain. Nothing "hot" about it-the place was empty on a Saturday night-and the accomodations are one step above a college dorm room. The designer should be unemployed; very poor space planning. We are both Starwood Gold and were not upgraded. Check-in lengthy as they were understaffed. Missed the Ground Zero experience because the concierge didn't know what she was talking about. No bellman showed when we called for help on check-out. All around, a very disappointing experience.

If you want a stuff hotel stay at the crowne uptown like i usually did to go to the un, shows and big musuems - oh shopping too. this is lower downtown and the crowd and design of W is hip hop chic. the construction goes on next door after all it is the trade center and the time table is behind time, but the major stuff people below complained about are gone. taxis troll outside - had one follow me for a fare. the lobby is up on the 5th but i was told the ground space is so you can undress on a very cold nyc day first. the "living room" is your check-in, bar, terrace which was closed, why i dont know. the decor looks like inside of the belly of a whale - now at nite it is dark and boomy with trendy music so if you are checking in adjust your eyes before wondering to fin the lift. just this scene should tell you this is a very different sort of starwood property and if you want a sheraton why are you here? the hall ways are narrow to max property i guess. i was up graded to a corner room - opposite side of trade center so i didnt get that view nor i guess the noise. the panel of windows was remarkable - i could catch a glimpse of the river and trade center. at first the room looks small but it is larger for an urban downtown city. it is very modern and trendy design - no lounge chairs - window box cushions you snuggle up to the window. i had a very long flight so the bed was very comfortable. shower was good - yes if you are older and don't have your things in a hanging bag you would have to put them in the draw below the sink. bathrobes nice so your outside neighbors don't see you in the nude. and you know this is for the ipod generation because the clock is a nice player. oh i dont recall a hotel print or painting on the walls - well there is hardy any wall space to talk of. as spg guest there was a nice (free) reception in the living room. nibbles were free so i cant run them down as were the drinks. reminds of the starwood club floors. oh yes and it is in the living room you get free wifi. there is a room charge for wifi - don't do it. century 21 is near by, hardy a show in the area, better restaurants are further away - you need to do your homework on that - occupy wall street mob just a walk away, trinity and st paul's and of course the trade center. you need to get a "pass" from the visitors' center near century 21 to get in line to get in. its free but a walk away. the emotion was high as it was when i was just in berlin. overall: it was nice to feel very young again at the W. it is not a place for old farts - go uptown we are usually there around the park anyway.

I live in SF and know that when traveling to NYC I would arrive at mid night. I booked my reservation through http://hotels.com and paid for the entire stay upfront, several months before my arrival. The reservation also included a note to the hotel indicating that I would be arriving at midnight and I called http://hotels.com to confirm that the note would be sent to the hotel. I also received a copy of the reservation where there was indeed a note that I would arrive at midnight.So after a 5 hour flight from SFO I arrived at the W hotel at midnight only to learn that the hotel had given away my room. That's right, the room that I had paid for upfront had been given away and now they were going to "walk" me to another hotel. What they really meant by "walk" me was to put me in a cab to New Jersey, yep that's right they had the cab drive me to another hotel in another state.The next day when I returned to the W downtown I received a message that the hotel wanted to make up for the situation and turn my stay around and that they were going to send me up a package. For 2 days and 3 calls to the "Whatever whenever" front desk we finally got our "let's make this better package" - a bottle of water and a plate with 1 orange, 1 apple, 1 banana, 1 kiwi fruit. Yep, that was supposed to make the stay better after giving away my fully paid room and shipping me to New Jersey.I usually stay at the Marriott, Farimount or Four Seasons and in my 12 years of traveling for work (and pleasure) I've never had my room given away. Unfortunately this was my first time at a W hotel and it will definitely be my last.The hotel itself is in poor condition - carpet pulling away from the walls and a constant stench. It smells like an old hotel that is trying to cover up the old hotel smell by spraying something to try to make it better, but the old smell with the spray makes a stink. It reminded me of someone with BO trying to hide it by overloading on aftershave.AWFUL - STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE, there are plenty of better NYC hotels in the same price range

during a recent business trip to Manhattan, the staff at the W downtown were a breath of fresh air.Scott, front dest manager, Troy bell ca, Fermin welcome ambassador, Claudio and Nam at the door. Even Monica and Bella housekeeping were a pleasure. I will forgo my uptown hotel for this service anytime. Barbara S. and Mark M.

Had a decent stay at the W. Some things were better than others.Pros: The BLT restaurant is excellent- great food and service. The concierge was super friendly and helpful with her advice. Good views and location.Cons: The bed isn't very comfortable and the pillows were terrible. The noise from the WTC construction is really loud. There is no in room coffee- have to go to the lobby.

I love this place except for the location, not ideal for weekend stays but that is when you get the deals at this w location (kinda far from soho, times square, tourist spots). Not too bad of a cab ride though and door people will hail you a cab promptly. Excellent location for business travels. Very clean, super comfortable, very friendly staff. The bars and restaurants at the hotel are good with great service (but when you run out of olives and someone orders a $25 martini, please have someone run down to the corner market and grab a jar!).Rooms were surprisingly big for Manhatten, very modern, everything you could need or want in the room. Would definitely be a top choice if traveling to NYC for business.

The New W hotel here aims to please. Offers the typical cool, laid back W attitude/service that is a little more style over substance, but still fine. The rooms are on the small side, which is a common W thread, so no surprise here. Nice little touches show they care... complimentary car service (by appointment), ordered room service and they added a Dylans Candy chocolate bar to the tray as a nice surprise. Hotel is right across from the WTC bldg so lots of construction and sometimes streets may be blocked. Location can be a bit tricky to get to from some directions.All in all, a good option if you want to be in that area. It's close to the Ritz Carlton, which is a bit more money... and in a little less congested area. I'd look at both (ie. rates) before booking either for a comparison. Food option better at the Ritz, but W is ok... not as fancy.

We stayed here to be strategically in place for the 5 Borough Bike Ride, New York's nod to spring and the great outdoors. The hotel is gorgeous, with a front row seat at Groubd Zero but the staff was absolutely spectacular. Spec-ta-cular! They ferried our bikes up and down to and from th front door, hustled us cabs, sent drinks to the room and in general, acted as if they were personal assistants instead if desk clerks, doormen and oom attendants. Unbelievable! We had a wonderful wonderful time and now, irrespective of what we're doing in New York, we'll never stay anywhere but The W Hotel Downtown.

Do not stay here unless your room does not overlook the world trade construction area. Unfortunately, at least half the rooms do. It is all night construction and my two colleagues and I all were awake by 3.45 to 4 AM and had no chance of getting back to sleep. To make things worse, the lobby is essentially unlit so that at 7 AM it is too dark to read the paper or talk to anyone. Looks like a bad Vegas show room

We bid on a room through Priceline and received a very small room, but it had everything we needed for one night. Better not to be overlooking the construction site, since it's 24 hours of noise. Service was very good.

Not the most convenient of the W properties. It does face directly over the 9/11 Memorial. But, the traffic of people going there makes it difficult to get in or out of the area. Not to mention it is in the heart of the Financial District, if you try to get out of the area for dinner, good luck with that. The nearest subway station is at least 4 blocks away. You can try to wait for a cab, but it's infrequent. Best bet, go down to Marriott on West Ave and go to the taxi line. Better yet, go across the street, there's alot of cab drop off and it's easier to pick up a cab there. The hotel does have a drop off service that goes as far uptown as 82nd street, but it's essentially a glorified sale pitch they partnered with Acura, which they show you a little video and ask you to fill out a feedback card. They do ask you make a reservation ahead of time, you can chance it last minute. If you do have a chance to check out the balcony bar, you should, it's awesome.

This hotel charged me $500 for a reservation adjustment five minutes after making the original booking. I got nowhere with the staff over this. A complete fraud. Also the neighborhood surrounding is devoid of nightlife . So many other hotels to choose from.

I stayed in NY for two days in October on a business trip and our hosts treated us to dinner in the upstairs restaurant at the W hotel. We had a semi private area and a set meal - and as I wasn't paying I didn't see the bill but the quality of the food and the service was great. The set meal includes a choice of starters and main courses to share - put on the table "family style" as the Americans called it. We had some really great dishes - a tuna tartare with wasabi starter was excellent and the New York strip steak main perfectly prepared. The wait staff looked after us really well and made suggestions for drinks etc. A great find if you are in this area.

The newest of New York W Hotel locations offers sleek, modern rooms in a very unique location. It directly overlooks the World Trade Center building site and memorial. The 5th floor lobby includes an observation deck that doubles as an outdoor lounge, offering World Trade Center views unlike any others in the city. If you get a room on a high, north-facing floor, you'll get that, as well as million dollar views of the entire city. While I managed to get an upgraded, corner room, my view wasn't great, but the room itself was fantastic.Decor is very modern - almost Jetsons modern - with stark white walls and white furniture contrasting with chocolate brown carpeting and bathroom tile. The corner room included an L-shaped padded window seat that was a nice bonus for taking in the views.The pros for this hotel: 1. Easily accessible by subway. Take the A Train from the Howard Beach station to the Fulton street exit. The hotel is about 4 blocks away.
