To get pretty much anywhere uptown, take the 1 train at the Rector street station around the corner. There are several subway stations in the area, but this one is closest.2. Swanky lobby with cool bar, observation deck and evening DJ. Order drinks, order food, see and be seen.3. Comfortable room with great bedding. Bathroom has a big shower with dark tile that almost looks like brown leather. Try to get on a high floor. Even if you don't face uptown, the views can be excellent, regardless.4. If you're visiting the 9-11 Memorial, the entrance is literally across the street. Be sure to reserve your entry time in advance.The cons:1. The only downside to the room was that I thought the bathroom lighting was kind of dim.2. Now that the 9-11 Memorial is open, there are a LOT of people in this part of town. The Wall Street area used to be very quiet on the weekends because there isn't a ton of tourist stuff to see. That's changed.3. Construction noise is constant during the day, including Saturday. The hotel is so close to the WTC site, you hear it all. However, they stop at night, so sleeping isn't an issue. But don't plan on a peaceful afternoon nap.4. There aren't very many good dining or shopping options in this part of town. But it's so easy to get to all of the great neighborhoods by subway, that didn't really matter to me. Subway is definitely quicker than a cab through the narrow, clogged streets in this area.All in all, I would recommend this hotel. It's a very different experience than you would get versus staying in the Times Square area, which is so tourist focused. I'd prefer to be away from all of that unless going to a show or dinner. Aside from the WTC, you're also closer to the Statue of Liberty, the Brooklyn Bridge and not too far from SoHo. The hotel can also offer some pretty good rates during non-peak times. Be sure to check spg.com.

Love the W New York Downtown! Its very modern and the rooms are a great size for NYC. We stayed in a corner room on the 17th floor. We could see the WTC memorial site from our room. You can also see it from the living room bar on the 5th floor. When we arrived on Friday afternoon, the lobby and living room bar area was a bit crazy because a lot of people were coming up to get a glimpse of the memorial. There is construction still going on and I know that some people have complained about the noise from the construction - I don't think its any different than staying in times square. It didn't bother our sleep at all.The bathroom is a good size, not much room for storage though. We'll defiantly stay here again!

My husband and I stayed at the W Downtown, NYC on September 16-18, 2011. I really don't know how to explain our experience. We arrived late because we were driving from the Boston area. When we arrived, we were greeted cordially by a doorman and escorted to the lobby on the 5th floor.When we arrived on the 5th floor, there was an incredible blast of music! The music was somewhere between disco and rap. My husband and I owned a discotheque for six years, so we were not too shocked. What were disconcerting were the lights on the curved ceiling that reflected off the floor. The experience was not good. We had to navigate to the next set of elevators. The optical Illusion was not comfortable; we felt like we were drunk.  At first, we thought since we're older than the target demographic, we couldn't make a fair evaluation. However, after talking with young people (late twenties to forties), they felt the same way. They told us that they were upset and disoriented by the lights, music, and layout of the hotel.  Our room 2211 was clean but extremely small. The bed was very comfortable and probably the best part of our stay. The bathroom had very little space. There was nowhere to put a toothbrush or any cosmetics. Maybe, this would be a great room for a single business person. If you would like to see how you look before proceeding to a meeting, you would wonder, where is the mirror? It's on the backside of the closet door. If you open the closet door, lean against the other door, and you're really thin you might be able to see yourself.  We stayed at the W in Boston, and it was one of the best experiences in our lives. The "W" NYC Downtown needs to take a look at what other "W" hotels do.  Our children live in NYC, and we visit often. This was our first stay at the W Downtown NYC. We won't be back. The location was bad; the streets and sidewalks were blocked off due to construction. We couldn't even take a walk. We were trapped like rats in a maze. Our advice to the "W" Downtown is to:1. Expand your target demographic and redesign the lobby and guest rooms to meet the needs of a more diverse clientele. All guests whether they are 20 or 60 want a quiet, clean, comfortable place to relax. I believe all travelers, business people, and tourists want the same thing. 2. Put a shelf in the bathroom so guests can store their toiletries. 3. Install a full-length mirror on the outside of the closet door.4. Repaint in the guestrooms and hallways—this would freshen up and brighten up these areas. 5. Work out a plan with the cab companies to actually come down the street for customers. Your doorman told us to just go take the subway!6. Visit some great hotels in the area like the Andaz and Gild Hall to pick up some pointers.7. Rearrange the elevator configuration. Going up five floors to the lobby is not a good plan. Guests should not have to wangle their way from the check-in desk, go across the dance floor, and walk in front of the DJ to get to the next bank of elevators which will eventually take them to their rooms.8. Tone down the elevator music. Find music that is appealing to all. 9. Supply the correct email address when sending out a survey. GMWolfgang.Wehen@whotels.com is not a valid email address. The email gets returned. Remove the GM—we called to get the correct address.Unfortunately, you cannot change your location! Maybe in about ten years when the construction has stopped this will be a good location. Sincerely,Mike and Jane (Starwood Preferred Guests)The GM, Wolfgang Wehen, actually read and responded to our concerns. This is a step in the right direction! Retrain or fire you current employees. Focus point: Customer Service. I think in this economy you will be able to find people who actually understand and believe in the adage: The customer is always right!

This hotel could not be any more lovely. From the moment you step onto the curb and are greeted to the check in, the staff could not be more accommodating or lovely. The hotel handled our group of 44 effortlessly. Convenience to WTC and Tunnel to Towers activities was incredibly. This part of town is coming into its own and this hotel makes it all the more exciting.

Great hotel, right across the WTC site. I got the 15th floor, so got a hgreat view of the monument and the site. In spite of the work going on, it was very quiet inside the room. Very spacious and well furnished. Will stay agin if visiting downtown. Will definitely recommend it.

I just got back from a trip where we stayed at the Ritz Carlton in Battery Park, and in The W in Union Square. How unfortunate that we stayed at The Ritz first! What an poor contrast for the W. My review for the W is as follows: The lobby is kitschy and attractive, but with a strong dose of citrusy potpourri that I didn't care for. The hallways have a most unpleasant dirty carpet smell that they try to cover up with air freshener, and are dark and dingy. The whole hotel had a humid feeling that wasn't appealing.Our $3,000.00 per night "extreme wow suite" looked nothing like the photos on line. I realize that there are different suites, but the decor in ours was pretty dated. It was muggy and stuffy when we opened the door. The tub was clean, but there was dirt in the grout around the tub and shower in the bathroom. Not what you expect to see for that kind of money. Also, it is very small. They told us when we booked that the room would sleep 6 people. There is ONE queen-sized bed, ONE bathroom, and a small living room with stained, not-so-fresh smelling furniture. They brought in 3 roll-away beds for us with fresh, clean sheets, but they had lumpy mattresses, and because fire safety laws limit the rollaways to 3, one person had to sleep on that couch. The patio is large and beautiful, but the cushions on the outdoor furniture were sun-faded and grimy, and one of the planters smelled as though the last guests urinated in it. There is very dim lighting out there, also. If there were another bathroom, it would be a fine place to have a party, with the large balcony, and great sound system, but then your guests would have to leave because there is no place for them to sleep.About the amenities:They knew they had 6 guests coming, and there was ONE 2 inch bar of nice smelling soap, and one each of some sample toiletries. Come on, not even a separate dinky bar of soap for the sink, shower and tub? One roll of toilet paper on the spindle and another far away in the hall closet. Two wine glasses, and a few champagne flutes with fingerprints on them. One of the wine glasses had lipstick on it. They gave us a bowl of beautiful green apples in the living area, and the one I took off the top was delicious. The ones on the bottom had brown rotten spots with mold in the centers on the underside, leading me to believe that the service staff replaces only the apples on top between guests, leaving the bottom ones until they ferment.A word about how that "whatever, whenever" slogan : Baloney. The concierge never answered the phone him or herself the whole time we were there. You are expected to leave a message. I decided against room service after seeing the moldy apples, and went down to the continental breakfast at the bar area. I found the domes that contained the baked goods smeared with fingerprints, so I chose a yogurt. I asked for honey to top it, and was told they had it, but then they couldn't find it. The clerk sighed, and said she COULD run downstairs and get it, IF I wanted to wait. I did not, seeing as how it took 10 minutes to purchase a cup of yogurt.I found some of the staff friendly, but some sullen, as though they were tired of listening to the complaints of their customers. Friendly or not, the service is quite slow.All in all, I thought this hotel seemed to be a dated partiers crash-pad type of place, and not at all what I expected for the money. I was excited to come here, and tried hard to like it, but I didn't.

I stayed here once and loved it. Room rate was cheaper than most hotels in its category. The girl who checked me in was very pleasant and checked me in fast. The lobby is gorgeous and the outdoor balcony is nice. Elevators are like works of art. My room was a corner one, with lots of windows, which I LOVE! It was spacious. The bathroom was cool and the shower is very large. There's a lot of storage space and the television has Showtime and HBO, so I was able to watch my favorite series! Of coarse the bed is like any other W bed and the robes were too. Cool thing about this hotel is that you must leave your key in a pocket at the door to turn the lights on. The idea is great. You only have to wave your key near the door also to open it which makes it much easier to get in when you have bags in your hands. There is a free coffee, tea, breakfast thing in the morning near the concierge desk, but of coarse I missed it because I didn't wake up until 11. This place is great, especially for the price. Location is great if you have to be in the Soho or meatpacking area during your stay. I will be back!!
user_name:
Vivaladiva1
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed here in mid-September. If noise is an issue, ask about what side of the hotel your room is on. Our room faced the Ground Zero construction site (which was very sad to look at, because it constantly reminded us of the great tragedy there). Construction goes on 24 hours a day. That's right, they run that pile driver all night. Other than that, the room was contemporary and nice. The bar/lounge/lobby area was very comfortable. Again, if you're looking for something low-key, this is not it; they have a DJ in the lounge most afternoons/evenings. The concierge gave us some excellent suggestions for a cool bar and great Chinese restaurant.

We stayed here Sept 15-18, 2011. The hotel is in a good location. Is is right beside the WTC area. The hotel terrace overlooks current construction going on at Ground Zero. This may be a plus or minus, depending on how you look at it. We thought it was really neat to see this in progress and the construction noise didn't bother us, although you could definitely hear it all through the night (just didn't bother us). After all WTC construction is complete, the view will be amazing. The hotel sits just south, so rooms on the north side would give the best views of WTC. The hotel is right around the corner from the Rector St. train (lines 1 & R). It's easy to get around the financial district on foot and midtown Manhattan is very accessible via the Rector St. trains. The area seemed very safe and there were plenty of small restaurants nearby. There are delis and cafes and pizza places unique to NYC and a Burger King, Starbucks and Subway all just a short walk from the hotel. If you are visiting The Statue of Liberty from Battery Park, the ferry station is also a very short walk from the hotel. It would probably take longer to take the train.The hotel's BLT Grill has very good food but it's very expensive. We ate there one night and our bill for two ran about $140. The food was VERY GOOD. The service was not great. The waiters were friendly enough, just seemed to be overworked/busy and our food took forever, glasses were not filled, I received a white wine when I ordered a red, etc.The hotel's interior is very artsy in a youthful contemporary way. A lot of attention to detail is given. When you enter the elevator, the floor mat will say GOOD MORNING in the morning, GOOD AFTERNOON in the afternoon and GOOD EVENING at night. The rooms also looked as if they were designed by an art student. I was pleased with the look and everything was very clean. The room was EXTREMELY small. That was fine with us. There were two of us and with a king size bed, we had just enough walking space for luggage. Speaking of the bed, it was VERY COMFORTABLE. It was probably the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever experienced! I liked the down pillows and comforter. There were marks on the wall as I've seen in several reviews. The hotel is very new and it did look older than it is. I have 2 small kids and have lived where I do 10 years and my walls are less marred. So, they probably should give the rooms a new paint job. There were two things that bothered me about the room. One was, the bathroom door (which was a sliding door) required TWO PEOPLE to close it and it was only with great effort at that. Another issue I had was that there is a red light which stays on in the closet. It looks really cool when you open it HOWEVER, at night, when your lights are off, you can see a little light coming out of the closet. That was a little annoying/distracting. Other than that, it was nice and comfortable and seemed safe, just not as new looking as it should look and small. By the way, the bathroom was a decent size, it was only the bedroom that was micro.One more thing I'll add... You can get internet access for your room for about $15/night. We wanted that but didn't realize, it was not $15 for the whole hotel room but for every single device we had on the internet. We had a laptop, an iPad, a GPS device and an iPad Touch and we accessed the internet with all 4 devices which cost us $60/night - ugg. So, watch out for that.

An enjoyable stay for our family of four with pre teen kids. Not really a family hotel but v cool and rock n roll. We all liked it. Great rooms, service. Not a very big hotel. Reception on 5th floor. Complimentary taxi to uptown whilst we stayed. Complimentary coffee and wi fi in lobby. Location is a little away from the hustle and bustle of 5th ave and time sq. But we liked that. It's virtually on wall St, near the ferry terminal for station island and statue of liberty. Plus you can explore all the places in between downtown and central park. great stay overall.

Half of the Downtown W overlooks the WTC site. Great views of the entire site. Unfortunately with construction going 24x7 you can also get the sounds and lights. I still recommend this property - if you like the W ambiance, you will like this hotel. Relatively new property. Great location for the financial district.

The W is directly across from and overlooks the construction site for the Ground Zero memorial. You've likely seen news coverage (esp. NBC) where the news anchors were on a glass-fronted balcony perched above the site - that's the W. My room was a typical W - lots of white but very nicely sized for Manhattan. The bar on the lobby level looked like a typical meat market - it was dark and difficult to get an order. I finally gave up! The outside bar would have been perfect but it closed way-y-y-y-y too early. The concierge staff was very helpful and the Acura Experience free car service to deliver you to your appointments was much appreciated.

I stayed at the W NYC Downtown one weekend in April 2011. I love the W Hotels so I always make sure to stay at a W if the city has one because the W Hotels are not your ordinary hotel. The lobby is not on the ground level, it's up on the 5th floor where the bar is located at. This hotel is right across the street from the 9/11 memorial and they have a balcony that you can view the site at your sit and have some drinks late at night outside. The bed was comfy, the view from my room was fantastic. I only had 4 issues, (1) the bathroom lighting was not the best when I went to put on my makeup; after my stay, I did notify the hotel of the bathroom issue. They are aware that the lighting is not that great and said they would look at how to make things better for the femal guests (2) my safe was not working so make sure your safe is working or ask for another room; (3) my last issue was the Friday night really late, a couple of the guests were really loud from their room so it was hard to get any sleep that one night; (4), I went to use their internet system to log onto my computer, I had trouble getting to my email account to check my flight information and no matter what I did I could not get to the website and I still got charged for it. Very frustrating so don't use their internet service unless you absolutely have to.The staff was friendly and always had a smile on their face, very helpful. This hotel is within walking distance of the Statue of Liberty and the financial district. There is a Starbucks around the corner. The hotel food was not that bad, but since this is NYC go out and find a nice restaurant to eat at. Since I didn't do alot of sight seeing, the hotel restaurants are pretty good and if you need a taxi, the bellhops will grab you one immediately.Again, I do love the W Hotels so I would always recommend a W Hotel and you can always buy the W products that are in your hotel room.
Perfect location in NYC. Great condition to travel with pet. Free wi-fi for SPG guests huge +

I was very excited to be staying at a W, as I am a huge Starwoods fan and have stayed at the W in Midtown and had a wonderful experience. Unfortuently, I was very disappointed with what I saw at the Downtown location. I was upgraded to a corner room on the 8th floor - not a great view. The room was small, and there were black scuff marks on ALL of the walls. While I realize that travelers have suitcases and are not always careful with the rooms - the W is a luxury hotel chain and they should at least attempt to fix things like this. I also had a few additional quams with my stay - no full length mirror, the door to the bathroom was a "pocket-door", the hair dryer was old and didnt work very well - no ear-swabs/cottenballs on the sink - again if this was a Sheraton or an Element - I would have been satisfied with my stay - but this is a W - when I'm paying for a superior experience - I expect more.

I stayed here on a combination business/pleasure trip. I had never stayed at a W before although have stayed at many Starwood properties before. This hotel is not for everyone but it is for alot of people, myself included. It is in the financial district so there is not alot going on in the general area for tourists, but if you are a tourist and are aware of that, then you will have no problem. You will need to take the elevator up to get to the check in area and then another set of elevators to get to the rooms. The hotel is entirely non smoking and has great views from some of the rooms, especially of the Ground Zero and memorial area. The fitness center was well appointed and I had it to myself most of the time.The rooms are bright and well appointed with ammenities for both business and pleasure. For example. there was candy from Dylan's but also highlighters in the desk should I need them. I was upgraded to a Corner Cool room which means I had wrap around windows. The room is really not different from other rooms. This hotel is definately not traditional so therefore, not for everyone however if you like Ws and something a bit different and are aware you are in the Financial District, then you will like this hotel. I would definately stay there again.

Stayed here last week for one night. As a Plat, I wasn't upgraded upon check-in, though when I asked I was given a cool-corner room, which was very nice. A couple of quick thoughts: It's a very nice property and all very new. The staff was very friendly. I booked the $50 food and beverage credit rate and upon check-in they didn't even mention it??? When I went down and asked they acted as if they were surprised and said 'OK, you have credit.' Gee, thanks...As for location, this is directly across from the WTC, for better or worse. Great location for the financial district, but not if you plan on shopping or seeing shows. It's a very quiet neighborhood, with the exception of the construction...The bar is great and literally hangs over Ground Zero, which is kind of cool and creepy...Overall, a very cool and nice hotel.

This is a great hotel if you are working downtown or doing business at one of the World Financial Buildings. I enjoyed the room amenities and great service at the hotel. This W surely meets the trendiness you expect to receive at a W. The only drawback of staying at the hotel was the noise throughout the night. I know it is not the hotels fault, but even on the 19th floor I could still hear the construction down below throughout the night.

Very noisy as 24 hour building site operating across the road on the world trade centre site- stay here only if you don't wish to sleep. Staff very unhelpful. Computers and phone system continually down. Far from everything and not many dinig options close by. give this hotel amiss.

This hotel is a 3.5, but Trip Advisor won't let me do that.It is a cut way above the W in Leicester Square, but it is below the W Riverfront in Chicago, the W Hollywood, the W Los Angeles, etc. It is all about trendy, but in an odd spot for trendy. Wall Street isn't trendy, so this sticks out and brings a breath of fresh air. Having BLT is great. Not having a Bliss is not, but there are Bliss products in the rooms.The hotel suffers from having 1/2 its rooms facing the World Trade Center site and the hole occupying the site of the Deutsche Bank building, which finally came down earlier this year. The hotel does have blackout shades if you are on that side, so you aren't bothered by the 24/7 (no kidding, they work those hours for real) work on the Trade Center site.When the construction is done, these rooms will be fantastic.The rooms here are palaces compared with those at the W Leicester Square, which shows the difference in customer service and attitude. Hotel rooms in both London and NYC are small, but there is a huge difference.There is also a difference in the attitude of the staff. Here they are warm and helpful. They aren't top-notch or as accommodating as at other Ws, but they are better than average and than at the W in London.Great beds, as usual.I was surprised that BLT, which is great, doesn't provide room service and that you have to go down to get it as "carry out."I was surprised my request to have the lightbulb replaced in the make-up mirror didn't happen.I was surprised the hotel didn't have any washcloths available at 8pm on a Friday night - they were waiting for laundry to come back.I was surprised the 5th floor balcony/terrace isn't open for breakfast. It would be a great place to just chill and have your coffee, but I was told they had to wait for it to dry because it was slippery.I was surprised a washcloth in my room was stained/dirty.Probably the most surprising was the wear & tear on this hotel, as it is just over a year old! Because it is dark each and every nick and bang shows. The marred surfaces show on the mouldings, doors and sides of the elevators.

This Hotel is localized on the Financial District of NYC, Downtown. We stay on a weekend on a special rate. We were expecting no activity during this time of the week since the major activity should be on weekdays/ business hours. To our surprise, it was crowded and with a lot of tourism. The Hotel lobby is actually on the 5th floor with a view to the ground zero new construction. It was sad to see the area were so many people died on 0911. The terrible attack that change our history forever!.The room was small, with modern/ minimalistic decoration. The bed was very comfortable and all the amenities and services that characterizes W Hotels.Our returning flight was late evening and we asked for a later check up. To our surprise they let us stay until 400 pm w/o extra charge! This worked perfect for us, we were able to rest before our scheduled delayed flight . I highly recommend this hotel, although is not in the Center; close to Times Square, like most of the visitors prefers to stay. If you look somewhere out of this busy area, this is the place to stay.
Awesome place to stay. The extremely modern hotel, the rooftop bar over looking the 9/11 memorial, and quick access to the subway made this a very enjoyable stay.

I always love visiting this hotel, I have stayed here many times, most for business and several fun visits. I love the lobby and decor, this is a stunning property, I like this design and decor the best in Manhattan. I also like the noise level, just right, super clean with a very nice health club. Staff is outstanding, I base this on my many visits to W Hotels around the country

We spent 3 nights here while our daughter was on film camp. We booked through discount website and got a room with a view over the 9/11 heritage site with 2 double beds. The beds were very comfortable and the room well appointed. No bath but great shower and the best shampoo.Nice flat screen Tv but problems with signal feed meant that we weren't charged for the film. Staff were all greaty and patient with NYC first timers. Nearest subway 5 minute walk. The area is under development so is noisy in the day but quiet at night. A great hotel. - really. Shout out to Nicole and Kareem on the front desk in particular. Just remember - get the lift up to the lobby to check in; it's not on the ground floor. The lobby is more like a nightclub than a hotel - you'll feel most comfortable wearing black!

The staff bent over backwards for us and the new space has a lot of bells and whistles. It is your typical funky, eclectic W hotel. Worth checking out if you want to stay downtown. It is right across the street from Ground Zero, so it can be a little heavy at times.

Checked in on Friday evening 9 p.m. Restaurant was closed.Had dinner on the terrace overlooking Ground zero, a hole with mud and noisy construction work...food tasted good but my daughter was sick with the hamburger she ate. Sat. breakfast at the hotel restaurant was a excruciating experience! Rotten service with very obnoxious waiter and manager. We left without eating our meal after waiting 50 minutes...gentlemen that were having breakfast at the next table said that we were right to leave because they were also unhappy about the poor services...Concierge did not know anything, nice but not helpful at ALL!Last and not the least, the shuttle rides that they promote were never available during out 3 days stay there. I say, they really need toGet their acts together!

My wife and I stayed at the W for the weekend. We booked the reservation through hotwire. The staff was friendly when we arrived. They accommodated my request for a south facing room to avoid the WTC construction. The room, a corner room, which I think is supposedly a bit bigger than their average room still seemed small even for NY standards. Even though the hotel is new, there was something about it that just didn't quite meet my expectations for a 4.5 star. There were pencil markings on the wall, looked like lines drawn for leveling the headboard I guess from when the bed was installed. There were a few patches on the wall, the room and the pillows had a light odor..like there had been a wet dog there before or someone had smoked in it.The location, while I knew it was not a lively area I did not realize it would be as sleepy as it was. A bit of hike to the areas North (the Village) where the vibe is a little more exciting and there are interesting places to shop, eat and drink. I never ate or drank at the hotel but I did try to get a drink of water from the bar when we got home Saturday night (12:00/12:30ish) but it was closed. I asked the front desk if I could get some water or if there was a vending machine. I was informed that there was no vending machine but that there was some place on each floor that dispensed water, I found the ice maker, but not the water [maybe I misunderstood]. Water was available in the room for a $8 bottle but I was unwilling to fork over that much mula for H2O.

Positives-good location for downtown business, good value for money for NY, very friendly staff. Negatives-interior is in dire need of an upgrade; it is dated and feels run down. If you decided to stay at the hotel, ask for a room away from the elevators, it gets noisy in the early hours of the morning as people return from their night out.

We were extremely disappointed in our stay at the W New York Downtown.We were two adults and two children ages 7 and 9 and we had booked for two double beds and when we arrived after several hours of driving, we are informed that this is not possible because there is no room available with two beds.They proposed a room with a king size bed. We refuse and demand two beds. After several minutes with the clerk at the reception, she proposes the addition of a rollaway bed for our two daughters. I ask for another one and we were told that this is impossible because there is not enough space. The bed provided is clearly inadequate to sleep two (even if they are children). At the reception desk, no way to have the service and the clerk is eager to serve other customers.I will not hesitate to post on every forum possible my disappointment and poor quality of service received at the Hotel W. I travel a lot, I have many friends who travel and I have friends that own travel agencies. I will recommend to all not to encourage stays in this hotel chain.Richard BélangerAngry customer

The new W downtown will have amazing views when the freedom tower is finished but for now it is next to a construction site with all the dust and noice thta conveys. Like other W's you take the elevator up to reception. The rooms are typical in that they are comfortable but kind of small. There is a BLTSteak in this hotel and while the food was pretty good it was expensive and there are far better steakhouses downtown. My overriding sense was the hotel was still on its maiden voyage and was working out the kinks. I am sure given time thta this property will meet the standards the brand usually delivers

My wife and I stayed here our wedding night and the next night in NYC. First off, the second day we stayed there, the elevator we were in did not accept our room key so we went to the front desk only to have the woman at the desk try to convince us that we weren't staying at the hotel! We spent 30 minutes trying to tell her that it was our second day there and all of our stuff was in our room! She would not listen to us and was very rude. Finally somehow she decided to contact a manager who then made us aware that the elevator was not working properly and that you had to swipe the card, then press the button on the opposite side of the elevator in order for it to work properly. After this ordeal we received no apology. Another frustrating part of our stay was the facT that nobody EVER answered the phone when we would call from our room! I've NEVER been to a hotel where they don't answer after a few rings, let alone don't answer at all!!! We had a problem with the TV in our room and not only did my wife have to come downstairs because nobody would answer the phone, but it took 45 minutes for someone to come fix the TV! On top of all this, the day after our wedding we're laying in bed and a window washer on a scaffold stops at our window and stares at us in bed!!! We couldn't believe that even on a high floor we had no privacy in the room! For the money that we prepaid for the room I couldn't believe that we were treated so rudely by the whole staff. Not one person congratulated us for being married or said anything even remotely nice to us, maybe this is the attitude of the hotel but we couldn't believe how unbelievably rude everyone was. When we checked out the gentleman working the front desk didn't say one word to us, he just handed me a receipt. I had to ask if everything was OK because he wouldn't even speak to us! I hope something is done about this staff because we've stayed in many hotels and have NEVER had an experience this bad.
user_name:
TChristy
Long Island City, New York

review_body: I stayed at the W New York– Downtown while visiting the city in July 2011. This is an acceptable hotel (though not a credit to the W brand), but I would be unlikely to return to this property.The front desk staff was enthusiastic and helpful at check-in, and once someone arrived at the front desk, he was very efficient at check-out, as well. We were generally greeted by the doormen at the hotel entrance. The fifth-floor lobby of the hotel is a cool appealing and whimsical design, though fairly dark. The shower was the best I have had in a W hotel (combining aspects of the rainfall shower without the anaemic water pressure). Other reviewers have noted noise issues at this hotel, but my room was very quiet. Glimpses of the river could be caught between buildings from the room. These were the high points of our experience at the hotel.Other aspects of the hotel were somewhat disappointing.The room was quite small (even by New York standards), and it should probably have been outfitted with a Queen instead of a King bed. Even with the corner room’s windows (one of which was able to open), it felt very cramped and probably ill-suited for more than one person. The pocket door on the bathroom seemed cheap, but it is unclear whether there would have been clearance for a proper door. Despite having been booked directly through Starwood, this had the feel of the rooms I would get at the Grand Hyatt in New York when I booked through Hotwire/Expedia as a student. At less than one year old, the room in which I stayed was not wearing well. The white walls were scuffed in various places, and there were obvious patches that had been made. There were a couple of drips of water coming out from between the panels underneath the sink. In addition, while the room size is not an issue that can be overcome, I would have expected the room to be slightly cleaner, as there was visible dust in several places when I arrived (including on the mini-bar snack tray items). I was also disappointed that the terrace off of the lobby was closed when I tried to go out in the afternoon and that none of the staff in the area offered any assistance (or even telling us that it was closed) as we tried multiple doors. Finally, this is the first W at which I have stayed where I was overwhelmed by the brand’s signature scent. A friend and I had to literally hold our breath in the elevator from the street level to the lobby at one point. None of these were enough to ruin my stay, but there are certainly better hotels in the area. I expect better of this brand. In this area of Lower Manhattan, I have previously stayed at the Ritz Carlton Battery Park and the Millennium Hilton, and I would recommend the former if you can get a decent rate (it is a couple of blocks further south, but its rooms are quite large with harbour views and telescopes for looking at the Statue of Liberty). I am not normally a huge fan of staying off the island when visiting New York, but given the proximity and convenience of the PATH station (both to the World Trade Centre and the hotel in New Jersey), SPG members needing to be in Lower Manhattan should seriously consider the excellent W Hoboken. The hotel is located across the street from the site of the World Trade Centre. Once the pavilion opens, it will be easier to get around this area (including to the PATH station on the other side). There seemed to be a shortage of taxis on the hotel’s street, but they can be more easily found a couple of blocks to the east. There is a Starbucks across the street from the hotel, and we went to Tribeca to eat because there are not very many options in the immediate vicinity of the hotel.

Just a quick review for now, while I am kept awake in my room that is above the lounge. Unbelievable that they would put a family in this room (especially one that is a rewards member of their program). The noise is so loud - we are hearing both the din of people and the music. This room should be used for young "hip" people that won't be in their rooms until later. NOT RECOMMENDED if you want a good nights sleep.

So glad we experienced this W. My 13 year old was with me and previously we had only stayed in Midtown. Our 19th floor room was a little small given we reserved a Spectacular room (it may have been b/c we used points) but had fabulous view of the WTC..we saw them testing the waterfalls in prep for the 9/11/11 opening. The only construction sound problems we had were the night I didn't seal our window shut..ooops! Pros... great concierges..1 block to Subway (a main line)..even on the weekend lots of cafes and shops to get food/drinks w/in 2 blocks...Battery Park super close...amazing view of history in the making. Cons..rooms had a "cool factor" but not the best W finishes..flat paint was scuffed several places...not totally polished.. Great experience overall

Downtown was not exactly our first choice for a hotel location, but we got a great deal on Hotwire so we thought we'd give it a shot. The design of the lobby is pure sexy. Black textured walls, a low organic ceiling, and beautiful wrap-around terrace create the sexy design-driven experience you expect from a W. We had one of the Wonderful rooms in the back of the building. A nearly vacant lot allows for tremendous amounts of sunshine through the windows, and the white decor makes the room feel even lighter. I had read reviews about construction noise, but thankfully we stayed here on a national holiday so it was blissfully quiet.The short and sweet:Prossexy lobbygreat terrace overlooking WTC memorial (although it just looks like a mess right now)wonderful W bedcleanConslocation - very limited for places to eat around here. Though it is walkable to Tribeca.cab deficientsliding bathroom door, as in the old crappy wooden ones that pinch your fingersno HD TV. You expect to have the same or better quality cable as you have at home
user_name:
GummyTeeth
New York City, New York

review_body: Everyone on the staff was so kind, helpful and friendly. The room was clean and tidy and the food in the restaurant was delicious. Thank you to you and your staff for making the weekend fun and friendly. We really liked the reception being on the fifth floor - as we were required to take another set of elevators to our hotel room. The furnishings and decorations in the fifth floor reception area are very stlyish and the area provides an open air balcony view of Ground Zero. It makes the ride back to the room more interesting than just riding the elevator directly to your floor.

This hotel is style over substance. It has the look of an LA nightclub. The decor seems to be designed to shock the senses. I don't mind something different, but I was hoping for a better hotel for business. My room was small (European small) with white walls and a black snake-skin textured carpet. The white color scheme wasn't a good choice. The walls show marks and scuffs. While the bed is nice, the rest of the room doesn't have the quality to match the $380 price. And, as some reviewers point out, you have the noise of WTC construction.
user_name:
AlanGP
New York City, New York

review_body: When I came to this hotel, I had very high expectations, since this is a W hotel, and I have a gold Starwood Preferred Guest card. To say that my expectations were met would be an understatement. The hotel was as clean and new as can be, and the service was extraordinary. When I arrived at the hotel, I wanted something to eat, so I went to the BLT Bar and Grill. I ate the filet Mignon, which was great. After my lunch, I checked in. One of the staff members helped me with my luggage, and showed me to my room. Because this is New York, I realised that the rooms would be smaller. However, at the W, this was a nuisance. The rooms are very modern, clean, and efficient. This hotel does have a high price tag, but it is justified. Even though the hotel is located in the middle of the downtown, the whole city is accessible because the W give complimentary rides to about anywhere in the city, in an Acura MDX. I really loved this hotel, and it's location didn't bother me, because there is a subway station less than 700 feet away, and the Acuras can take you anywhere.I definitely recommend this hotel to others.

We stayed here because we were looking for a downtown location and wanted to use points. The Union Square location required too many points for all the rooms we needed. I thought the location would be too far removed from everything but we ended up loving the location. Quick walk to Tribeca restaurants and we never had a problem getting taxis either. There is so much to do downtown, I never go to midtown anymore. If you have things you need to do in mid or uptown this may not be a good choice. Walked along the Hudson in the morning- just beautiful. Bad part of the location is the sound of construction- it was loud by 8am. The hotel itself is super modern, maybe too modern. We liked the lobby bar for happy hour and the terrace was great. Great spot for a pre-dinner cocktails, esp on Friday. On Saturday they had the elevator and terrace music blasting first thing in the morning. I think it was set at the level from Friday night and no one bothered to turn it down. They didn't do this on Sunday, so either someone complained or a manager finally picked up on it. We were trying to relax with our coffee on the terrace but we couldnt even hear each other talk it was so loud. I just thought it was strange that a manager would allow it. The rooms were so-so...painted white so it showed tons of scuff marks on the walls. They had a worn look already for such a new hotel. Bathrooms were tiny and seemed to have poor construction. Our room had a funny smell...I should have had our room changed but by the time I realized the smell wasnt going away I didn't feel like packing everything back up, etc. The blackout shades allow light in through the sides...this is a MAJOR design flaw!!! Ive never stayed in a hotel that this happened. At 8am it looked like we had spotlights on in our room! If you are looking to sleep in and relax, stay somewhere else. We faced ground zero so maybe if you stay on the south side the light isn't as bad. Cleanliness wasn't an issue and the bed was extremely comfortable. Service was ok, on par with other W's. I feel as a whole W's used to have amazing service but over the last two years they have been average. I believe rooms start around 200$...that is a steal for nyc. I think you can put up with the shortcomings for that price. Don't expect the four seasons when your not paying four seasons rates.

Breakfast took too long even though the restaurant was empty and they could not findmy order to charge to the room, they had me waiting 10 minutes....Icould not get into my room because the card wasnt opening the door, I had to go down three times....... took me ten minutes to get into my room, I expected a better service.I asked for a wake up call, I never received it, lucky I had put my Mobile alarm on.When I complained at reception the only response was, ´oh Im sorry¨!!!´Thats not satisfactory...... I guess I will have to try another hotel in New York to which I travel every month......

My husband and I booked this hotel for a three-night stay (July 4 weekend) and it proved to be an enjoyable, comfortable experience—especially for our dog, who was treated with a welcome bed, food bowl and treats (he really loved the latter). Room was a bit small, but the bed was very comfortable and amenities (especially Bliss toiletries, and a small but well-equipped gym) much appreciated. We stayed on the South side of the hotel, which had a great view—we could see a bit of the river from the 21st floor—and was extremely quiet. We found the service to be excellent: fast check-in/check-out, helpful bellhops and an especially accommodating desk clerk who found a packet of theater tickets we left behind while checking in (he brought them directly to our room himself, without any prompting on our part—we hadn't realized we'd forgotten them!). We didn't try the bar or restaurant, nor did we use valet parking (too steep; we got a much better deal at a garage nearby). Subway is close by, and the downtown area has some great parks, biking, shopping (Century 21—I could have stayed there for hours!) and sightseeing. We'd definitely stay there again, and would recommend to anyone who is interested in exploring downtown Manhattan.

not only is this location in "construction hell," the management rents out space to loud, obnoxious parties and has zero concern for their other hotel guests. After calling the desk multiple times with noise complaints and being assured that the party would be over at 9:30... then 10.. then 11pm on a Wednesday (when I had to wake up at 5:30 the next morning!) I finally went out for a walk. Even then, I could still hear the music all the way down the street! Terrible sleep. Terrible service. Terrible location. Only perk was that it is a new building and clean. Overpriced given its brand.
user_name:
michelingirl
New York City, New York

review_body: nin2727 hit it on the head: the W is facing a construction site that never stops. I spent a weekend at the W and was awakened before 7 am on Saturday; deafening noise continued until past 10 p.m. that night. I tried turning up the fan to drown it out and froze from the air conditioning.Beautiful room, friendly and helpful staff, soft sheets, wonderful BLISS products--cannot make up for the noise. This is true of the other hotels facing the giant hole in the ground at Ground Zero, perhaps for the next 3 or 4 years (Club Quarters and likely the Marriott next door). To be avoided for those who care about peace and quiet or sleeping in their hotel rooms.I had prepaid the room so I was stuck. If I hadn't, I'd have left after the first night; I doubt that changing to the other side of the hotel would have made much difference.

First of all, you have to like the W concept to even consider this hotel. The lobby and bar are distinctively decorated (I smiled every time I walked through), but the rooms are stark submarine-like pods. The carpet is dark, the walls are ceiling are the same shade of white, and the only color is a few small dashes of red (piping on a throw pillow). There are no pictures or decoration of any type on the walls, and all lamps and accessories are very high tech looking (though not very functional). If you ask for a room facing Ground Zero, you'll have an awesome view of the construction, as the crews work 24/7 to complete as much as possible by the 10th anniversary on 9/11. (If you don't like the sound of heavy construction equipment at night, ask for a room on the other side.)The W is also located close to Trinity Church, Wall Street and numerous subway stations. In addition, the complimentary Acura Experience service offered by the W is great when you don't feel like taking the subway.Our disappointment with this property was the maintenance and the service. The bathroom tiles looked like leather and snakeskin, but the bathroom layout was not very functional. In addition, every towel rack or hanger in the bathroom was loose and wobbly, so that things literally fell off the walls. While most of the staff members were very friendly and professional, there were some very notable exceptions. One of the concierge staff members was rude and acted like her job would be great if she didn't have to deal with pesky hotel guests--what a bother. In addition, our two experiences with the bar were disappointing. The outside bar overlooks Ground Zero, but you have to put up with indifferent service and ridiculously overpriced (and bad) cocktails. When we sat down in the inside bar on another evening, the staff didn't even acknowledge our presence, so we left without being served. On a positive note, when I mentioned these things to the front desk, they apologized and a manager followed up with an email. Hopefully these issues will be rectified for future guests.

My first W experience!! Check in was quick my status allowed me a room upgrade and a free bottle of water plus a car ride to almost anywhere in manhattan. Although not used but it was a nice touch. The lobby was very funky and modern. The rooms were tastefully decorated but be warned that if you face the 9/11 site I could hear the construction at night and if I wasn't so tired it would probably bug me. Upon opening the dufet, found several stained marks on the bed sheets. This was a severe surprise as I did not expect that from a Starwood property!! A quick phone call and 5 minutes later someone came to replace the sheets. No apologies from phone operator or the house cleaning staff which I found strange but I was tired and moved on with my life!Next morning I found stained face towels and asked for a toothbrush but it never came in the 45 minutes after call and had to run to my first meeting. The hotel fell short of my expectations again.I must say that Nicole at the concierge desk went over and beyond to help me locate a plastic bag. She was very pleasant and genuinely tried to locate a bag that would fit the toys for my nephews. I would give her 110% for service excellence. A simple request but she made me feel good!I heard so many good things about the W and I really enjoyed the atmosphere of the hotel from the funky lobby, an elevator that smells nice to chic rooms. But I am very disappointed with the housecleaning staff: stained sheets towels to inconsistent housecleaning staff experience. Come on W Hotel and Starwood you can do better than that!

The W was a great hotel, and the staff was pleasant and helpful. There are only a few issues the first was my room did not have a striker plate on the bathroom door frame and this prevented the bathroom door from locking. Also there were many black scuff marks on the white walls in the room. Finally, the window is very difficult to close once you open it.

We had a great stay at the new W Hotel Downtown NYC. The hotel is beautiful, the rooms spacious and comfortable, and the staff exceptionally helpful. Of special note was the desk clerk Jason who made our check in fast and welcoming (and made sure we knew all about the property), and Anari the concierge who was well connected and set us up with fun activities for our Saturday night in the East Village. Despite these two shout outs, I would say that all the staff from housekeeping to doormen were excellent and always made us feel welcome.As it is a W Hotel I would caution people who don't like a lively hotel atmosphere that this may not be for them. But anyone who appreciates a bit of fun, a supremely comfortable room, great views and chic interiors should definitely stay here!

This hotel is phenomenal in several respects. We had a view of the World Trade Center construction site. Overlooking the site is still a little creepy but the views beyond were excellent. Attention must have been paid to minimizing noise because the room was relatively quiet and the construction did not affect us. Once construction is completed, the view of the site will be wonderful.The lobby is artfully designed and a great location for hanging out. It seems like an excellent place for meeting friends or for post-shopping for drinks. There is a bar with adequate indoor and outdoor seating that's great for groups. The bar service was not that great but it did offer a relaxed atmosphere and no one rushed us to leave. The rooms were clean, large, and had everything one could need. With few exceptions, the staff was quite accommodating. The room service menu was varied and the food and service were excellent. Strongly recommended.There is an outdoor skating rink adjacent to the lobby that the kids just loved. Otherwise, once we left the hotel, the area was nothing to write home about. Much construction all around. Maybe one day in the not too distant future soon the area near the hotel will be more enjoyable.If you are looking for something different in NYC, quiet, relaxing, away from the hustle and bustle, this W fits the bill.
user_name:
NYWillTravel
New York City, New York

review_body: I stayed overnight for a business meeting the following morning. It's brand new, very trendy with state of the art amenities. Very nice service and an excellent restaurant. Not many shops or attractions in the area, but you're close to the subway which will get you throughout the city. Will definitely stay here again.

Sofia L. Vandaele, general manager of W New York Downtown, sent us an email upon reservation. “We're looking forward to your arrival," she wrote. The W may have a well-meaning GM, but delivering consistent service isn’t one of its strengths. “Do you have a bell boy here?” we asked a en employee lounging by the entrance “I’m the bell boy!”, he replied, but showed no intention of helping with our luggage until we urged him to do so. The check-in process was pleasant enough, and the concierge was both congenial and chatty. This, however, can’t be said of the bar staff, our next stop. Deeply engaged in conversation when we approached them, the servers didn’t let our presence interrupt their chatting. The bar tenders didn’t seem acquainted with the menu, and couldn’t tell the ingredient of a standard cocktail it contained. And their conversation continued even as they served our drinks. After an enjoyable night at the well-appointed yet quirkily decorated room, we attempted to check out. A humdrum event in most hotel properties, this checkout was a weary experience. It required four or five iterant revisions to our bill, a quest to recover luggage we left earlier, and then multiple phone calls to the hotel after our departure due to mysterious charges to our credit card. Before leaving, we asked to be contacted by the front desk manager. We are still waiting.

Stayed here on a Saturday night, 2 Dbl rooms with 8 girls. The rooms were a bit on the small side, but the beds were very comfortable and we loved the Bliss Spa products in the bathroom. We were celebrating a friends 40th and the front desk sent up a slice of cake with a candle and a few wine spritzers which was a nice touch. We had apps and drinks at the bar on the 5th floor adjacent to check in which was nice start to our eventful evening out. In the early morning there is complimentary coffee here, no coffee makers in the room. Valet parking is $55 but $65 if you have an SUV. Our rooms overlooked WTC construction but there was no noise Sunday morning. Due to the large glass window/wall separating the shower and sleeping area, I had to wash up and use the facilities in the dark so I wouldn't disturb my friends while they slept. Once you turn on the lights inside the bathroom, the entire bedroom lights up as well due to this glass window.(design flaw) Overall, nice hotel and I would return when visiting the area.

We booked this hotel through Hotwire for about $120 on a Saturday night - it would have been an amazing value at twice that price as the hotel is brand new, very well managed and located in the heart of downtown NYC. Some reviews decribe the rooms as small but we found them very reasonable for downtown New York.

My wife and I were staying overnight at the W Downtown for a private party at the hotel organized by a local trade organization. The first impression of the W is a combination of amazement and confusion. Amazing because everything is so wonderfully trendy and clean. Nice details are the floor mat in the elevator ("Good morning" "Good afternoon" "Good night" depending on the part of the day) and a welcome note in the room. Confusing because, yes, I'll have to check in on the 5th floor and also have to figure out how to get lighting working in the room (use room key and look for a tiny switch on the bedside lamp). The view from the room on the north side is spectacular: the Ground Zero construction site. Indeed, since construction in going on from early morning till late at night, you may want to ask for a room on the south side if you want to sleep in. Although not the biggest room size I've experience in the city, definitely sufficient, comfortable and very clean. The staff was very friendly, without an exception. Also the restaurant (BLT Bar & Grill) was above my expectations: food was very good and although filled to capacity, we didn't feel rushed out. The W did also everything right to make the private event at night a wonderful experience.The only suggestion to the W would be to include free Wifi. The target customer profile for this hotel are those that want to be connected, all the time. Overall, if you like a trendy Euro style hotel with a lot of attention to customers and details, you'd like this hotel A LOT! Stay away if you're looking for stuffy country style rooms with flower motifs :-)

I stayed here for the weekend with a friend. When we first walked in the building we were in awe of the modern and trendy the design of the inside of the hotel. Second reaction- THE STAFF WERE ALL SO FRIENDLY!!!!! We arrived in the morning expecting to store our bags in a room, however, even though check-in is not until 3PM, we were in our room by 10AM - this was a nice surprise. The rooms were great, comfortable bed, and the Ipod docking station is a definite bonus. Had cocktails on the bar patio and the atmosphere was great, bartender so friendly, he even recommended night life that he felt would suit our style and needs. The concierge was great with directions around the city and extremely friendly- you could sense she wanted to help. Finally, the BLT restaurant on the 2nd floor offered a delicious menu, not too expensive with a tasty breakfast. We will be staying here next visit, no question.

I've stayed at quite a number of different W Hotels around the world and this W really makes the experience - WOW.We checked in on a Saturday (over the memorial weekend) at about 7pm. The bellman, Jimmy, was very pleasant and greeted us when we arrived. He was quick to assist us with our luggages and shopping bags (all these filled the trolley all the way to the top). While we were on our way to the 5th level for the check in, he was informing us about the different facilities in the hotel. The front desk staff was helpful and the check in was a swift. Jimmy, the bellman, showed us to the room. He told us that complimentary coffee and tea are available everyday from 630am to 10am. WIFI is free on the 5th level. It's free in the room for the privileged SPG members (if I remember correctly). The gym is on level 3. He continued to tell us more about the restaurant and bars in the hotel. He really impressed me because none of the bellmen that I've come across in any of the W Hotels is as detailed as him. Well done Jimmy! We had the corner room so it's rather quiet (partly because we stayed over the Memorial long weekend). The room is very nice (avoid W at Lexington, it's really not worth the money). And my bathroom does not come with the frosted glass door feature.The gym is consider big when compared to most hotels. And it's well equiped with weights and treadmills. Our package came with compimentary drinks and nibbles at the bar. Even though it's nibbles, some of them can be considered as main courses if you are not a big eater. The nibbles are really good. My favourites are the grilled octopus, shrimp cocktail, crab dip and pappardelle ragu. We were there for three consecutive nights and Cassandra, the hostess, was always very helpful and friendly. She's partly the reason why we decided to host some of our friends at the bar during our stay there.Nicole at the concierge desk was equally helpful. She helped us to book the complimentary ride (advice is to book at least 24 hours in advance).The only thing that I don't like about the hotel is its location. We tried taking the subway but due to the long weekend, the train service was infrequent and irregular. So be prepared for it if you are staying there during the weekend or public holidays.On the whole, the staff at this W does not behave as if they are club bouncers. they really make the efforts to ensure your stay is pleasant and enjoyable. Well done.
We had a great stay. Rooms were very nice, staff was friendly and helpful, and the hotel has a great feeling throughout. Will definitely recommend it to friends, and will certainly be back.
user_name:
rickNnyc
New York City, New York

review_body: This is a very nice hotel. Very clean and hip looking. However, there is one design flaw that I did not like-- the shared wall between the bathroom and sleeping area is frosted glass. Although this can be very sexy if you are traveling with your spouse, it is not if you are traveling with a parent or a friend. You can see the outline of whoever is taking a shower! This really didn't bother me. It was the fact that the light, when turned on in the bathroom, shines into the sleeping area-not good at nighttime when you are trying to sleep! If you are traveling with someone who gets up at night to use the bathroom, this can be irritating. There was some noise from the construction until 9:30 at night, but after that did not hear anymore. If you want to take a nap during the day, the noise could be irritating, but at night it is quiet. In fact, I like how quiet it is here compared to midtown. Midtown is much, much more noisy, especially at night! Overall, I enjoyed my stay and thought the hotel was very nice. Food was very good and the bar area in the lobby was hip and comfortable too. Liked the complimentary coffee/tea in the morning and juice/water in the afternoon.

This was our first time at the W hotel downtown - we got a really good deal on their website and we thought to give it a try. We brought our bicycles and even prior to coming they said they can accomodate either in storage or in our rooms (which we preferred). Upon arriving, the door ambassadors greeted us and helped us readily. They were very helpful and friendly. We were upgraded to a larger suite (complimentary) because of our bicycles and signed us up for an SPG card. The ambience was very hip but we thought the staff was really friendly and down to earth and seemed to personalize everything! The room was spacious and the bed was comfy and the products were superb. There was only free wifi in the lobby or "living room" and there was a cost in your room $14.95 a day per device. We chose self pakring $35/day versus valey $55/day which was only a block down the street. Location was great, especially for us who biekd the city. Easy access to bike lanes, brooklyn bridge and the bike paths along the hudson river. We will be definetly coming back here again and try other W hotels.

I love W Hotels, but honestly, they are hit or miss. The properties are always distinctive, but you never really know what your experience is going to be because of the people who work there. Sometime employees are really down to earth, other times they can be rude, surly and arrogant. I'm pleased to report the team at the W New York - Downtown made a recent one night stay a real pleasure. It started at the front door. I was warmly greeted, my bags were taken upstairs to the lobby, and a team of smiling employees met me to get me checked in. While I waited, a bellman brought me a glass of complimentary sparkling water from the bar.W takes care of details. This particular hotel is across the street from the Freedom Tower construction site at the location of the World Trade Center. The employee made sure to check me into a room on the side of the building opposite of the construction site where jackhammers start at 6 a.m.The bellman showed me to my room and explained that the hotel was an eco-friendly hotel. One interesting touch: to turn on the lights in the room, you insert your room key into a special device near the room's entrance. Remove the key and your lights go out on a timer. Keep the key in and the lights stay on.As I think about it, every single employee I encountered at this hotel was pleasant and helpful. The concierge helped me get show tickets and recommended a nearby restaurant. (It had opened 4 months earlier and was excellent.) Later in the evening, she recommended a special cocktail to try at the hotel bar. Before she left work for the evening, she stopped by the bar to be sure I liked it. (I did.)Speaking of the bar, the bartenders and cocktail waitress were real pros. It was like they were welcoming me into their home. Later, the next day at breakfast in the hotel's restaurant, I had terrific service from everyone I encountered -- the hostess, the waiter, the busboy.As I departed, the bellman thanked me for staying with them and asked me to come back soon as he loaded my bags into a taxi.I can't remember the last time a hotel staff -- to a person -- was so gracious and personable. Even a housekeeper greeting me in the hallway singing as I made my way to check out.The only bad thing I can say about my experience was the housekeeper neglected to remove a previous guest's dirty brown sock which was laying on the room's brown carpet. That's it.Oh, and I scored this room on Priceline for 160 bucks on a Sunday night.I would definitely stay here again. While the location is not walking distance to much of Midtown where tourists and business people want to be, the R Line has a stop at Rector St 2 blocks away next to Trinity Church.

My job required me to travel to NYC on several short trips and I stayed at the W for one of those trips. Big mistake. The construction noise is unbearable. The hotel is literally across the street for world trade center construction. When I asked to be moved to a room on the opposite side of the building I was told nothing was available, which I find hard to believe. I ended up getting less than 3 hours sleep as the construction does not stop overnight. The next day after complaining again about the noise, especially since my stay was for business, not pleasure and I needed sleep, I was moved to an itsy bitsy room behind the elevators....again noise! Also, the rooms are in dire need of refurbishing, the walls and carpets are dirty. There was a ball of hair in the bathroom, ewww... Would not stay here again, that's for sure.

This hotel is tragically hip. I have stayed at Ws before and haven't felt this way, so to me there's something about this one in particular. It started with the completely black foyer with only an elevator and the far away door to the bar. This is a very sparse and non-welcoming way to be greeted. Then I went to the 5th floor to check in, and walked into a lounge that was trying really hard to be a club. Unfortunately, I couldn't hear a thing the woman at the desk was saying because of the pounding club music from the DJ table a few steps away - so I had trouble hearing important things like "your room number is..." My hotel room had no TV remote, and while someone did bring it, it was annoying that it was missing in the first place. I ordered room service at one point, but the dessert I wanted was no longer being offered. The clock radio was set to 4:45am when I arrived at 9:30pm. The lighting in my room was WAY too white - I had to play with the various switches to make it less industrial and more "homey." The lighting was a problem in the bathroom, too, because it shined right down on me, creating shadows when I was trying to do my makeup. I had to use the scary magnifying mirror, so I did my makeup hunched over the sink to see into the little magnifying mirror. Also, I find it rather forced to be called by my first name by hotel staff. (Who wants this? I would think young people who would like it couldn't afford the W, and older people would appreciate a little less familiarity.) I'm not an old lady - I'm 37 - and I wonder how middle-aged guests view this familiarity. The wi-fi is rather pricey at $14.95 PER DEVICE per day, and the signal wasn't the strongest, either. I only used one device (my iPod) and was charged for two, so I was unable to use the automatic check out on the TV, as I had to go discuss the charge with the front desk. At least, during check out, there was no DJ blasting music, so we could actually hear each other. Finally, the W offers a free ride to certain parts of the city as an Acura promotion, but when I tried to use it, it was totally booked. Seems like there may only be one or two cars, so book immediately upon your arrival if you want to use it. On the plus side, I really liked the shower products, and the bed, as always, was very comfortable. The room service dinner was quite tasty, so I appreciated that. And the bathroom was fantastically clean - not a single stray hair from a prior guest. In all, I think there are a lot of kinks to work out here. I still like Starwood hotels, but might not choose this particular one again anytime soon.

My Husband and I have stayed in many W Hotels and the service and decor is always excellent. I'm surpirsing him with a trip to NYC where we'll spend our Anniversary at the new downtown W which will be new for us. The reason I'm writing this review before is because I just got off the phone with reservations and the woman who helped me was so darn nice and helpful. She not only made recommendations to fit my budget but also wished us well on our Anniversary and told me how she was celebrating her 20th Anniversary this year with her Husband. This kind of personalized treatment is a what sets certain luxury brands ahead of some others. Thanks to her for getting my special day off to a great start before I even check in!

I stayed during hotel's soft opening so my comments are general as many services were bedding in.The hotel is downtown and with a bit of walking it's possible to get linked into subway system and go uptown. I think the immediate area around the hotel lacks any good restaurants and bars. Rooms were not up to usual standard for W Hotels and on the small side. The bathrooms were also small and I think poorly appointed and sterile. I continuall had to ask for shower gel as it was never replenished but I'll put this down to hotel training new staff.All in all an ok hotel but wouldn't stay here, even with substantial discount, unless I had business in the immediate area.I

Location: Close in distance to: SoHo, Chinatown, Statue of Liberty, Wall Street, and South Street Seaport. The WWC is right across the street; although there is construction- we did not hear anything inside the hotel. The PATH train is about 1 block north of the hotel. I definitely recommend taking this from New Jersey. We also never had a problem finding a cab on the weekends. The hotel is a perfect location for business travel yet perfect for people there on leisure who don’t want to be near the madness of Time Square.Rooms: Rooms are on the smaller side (smaller than the Westin at Times Square) but very clean & modern. Enough room for two people who really aren’t spending much time hanging out in the room. To get power in your room (lights, etc) you have to insert your room key in the slot in the wall- hotel is going green.Hotel: Hotel is very secure. You take an elevator from the bottom floor to the lobby. To get to your room, you must use a different set to elevators and swipe your room key card. This I like because no one from the outside world could take the elevators for a ride. The lobby had a darker night club feel. We stayed on a Friday night, so there was a DJ and guests relaxing in the lobby at night. This was a nice perk! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. When leaving, they held our luggage so we could enjoy the city for the day at no additional charge. Our stay at the W Downtown was absolutely wonderful and we cannot wait to go back!

I stayed at the W downtown for just a night and had an amazing time. The hotel is so beautiful!! The room was very comfortable and I slept so sound in the bed. They have a beautiful wrap around balcony behind check-in which I can imagine will be great in the warmer weather. The hotel is located next to ground zero. There is a little market shop right around the corner that sells everything you might possibly need if you can't find it at the hotel. We ate at the restaurant in the hotel for dinner and also lunch the next day. The staff was extremely helpful and even brought me my favorite coffee that they don't have in the restaurant, only room service! :)

My impressions in a nutshell:+ access to all subway/metro lines within walking distance of the hotel:+++++!!!!+ nicely located in the upcoming Financial District+ views on Ground Zero+ original design+ cool rooms+ very nice & friendly staff+ trendy bar with nice music/good deejays!Shortly, I had a very nice experience, it's very nice to be in this part of town, close to Soho, Tribeca, the Village, etc and it's really unique to have so many subway lines closeby .........can't wait to go back!

My recent stay at the W downtown was wonderful! Upon checking in we were told that we were receiving a free upgrade due to the fact that the room we had booked was not available. We were given a room 20 stories up overlooking the ground zero site which was very eye opening! The hotel was trendy and beautiful, the staff warm and friendly. It was a great trip!

Ok so the hotel is a little far from the touristy times square but worthwhile. It's a brand new hotel, with amazing interior decor. Just an fyi - our room bathroom shower had the frosted glass wall which was an adjustment that we didn't expect.There was a few hiccups in the beginning with the bedding arrangements in the room but the front desk staff did eventually accommodate our group of four. There were also great recommendation from the helpful and brilliant Joy!! Ask for Joy.

This week I finally got a rate at the W New York Downtown that was in my expense range. Looking forward to walking to the office, i egarly booked it, looking forward to visiting this new property.The layout is much like the W Times Square with a lift from street level to a Lobby on the 5th floor. The design of the lobby is quite cool. Dark, with a illuminated curved ceiling. This is probably the halmark of the property. Check in was courteous and attentive.I was a little dissappointed with the room. It seemed quite small, even for Manhattan standards. The TV was missing the AV input panel i've seen at a number of the other Sheraton properties. Too bad because I like to watch a movie from my laptop occassionally. For a new hotel, i think this is a oversite. In the bathroom again, i think there were gaps in quality, in favor of style. There were gaps in the trim, and some globs of caluking in some of the seams in the shower. Overall, like the location, would stay again if the rate is good, but with summer coming, might not be very often.

The hotel staff were very helpful and extremely pleasant. On my first ,morning there, I realized I had left my cufflinks at home. One of the staff at the front desk went back into the offices and came back with a brand new pair of W cufflinks for me to wear. He truly saved the day! (I dropped them off at the front desk when I was checking out for some other forgetful soul!) The lobby setting was very, very cool and my room was excellent as well. A 10 if the scale would go that high!!Thank you and your staff for making my two days there so enjoyable.

The staff of the hotel is super friendly and helpfull. The Belgian manager is great. She knows what her guests want. The view into ground zero is unreal, so I'am looking forward to its realization and would prefere for the next time the South side.

Impressive lcation overlooking Ground Zero. We got the other side for our room, very quiet. Rooms are small (like in most hotels in NY) but well arranged, modern and confortable. Hotel is modern, trendy and staff extremely helpful and fast. They did all our restaurant reservations giving us also advice and maps to get there easily. They have a free car service (you can use it once) but we did not book enough in advance but it is great to know. The Gym is really good ,clean. The only thing to improve is the room not 100% clean as we can expect for such a high standard hotel. Of course good but not spotless! Overall very recomandable and we would defib¡nitely go back!

Superbe experience, very smooth check in , very nice room, got a corner room , very convenient. Breakfast experience great, a lot of food, high quality. Had one dinner, same experience, very high quality and extremely nice staff. Overall a very nice hotel. Absolutely advisable.

We just got back from our long weekend in New York. All in all, staying at the W was an amazing experience. Despite not being a fan of the constant loud music playing, once we were in the comfort of our room, we were completely happy.The only downside to this stay was that we were travelling with my younger brother, and had specifically requested two double beds. Upon check-in, we were told there were no double rooms available, and we would have a roll away bed. Though, instead we had a mattress on the floor waiting for us in our room.Also, our bathroom door was not lockable. This wasn't a huge issue, as we're all family and could easily tell when someone was in there. Aside from these two issues, we had a fantastic 3 nights! It was super convenient, very clean, and the staff were very nice and helpful when asking for directions and restaurant suggestions.

My friends and I stayed at the W Hotel for 3 nights. The hotel just opened in late 2010 and has yet to open all floors.
