Pros:- The hotel is right next to the World Trade Center so it's a great location if you're in NYC for business around the Wall Street area. However, if you're traveling for leisure, it can be quite a pain since it takes at least 15 minutes by subway to get to midtown. The subway is a quick 2-minute walk from the hotel. - The rooms are very spacious for a NYC hotel. The decor is consistent with the W brand and creates a very clean and modern look. I also love the Bliss Spa amenities.- We utilized the Acura car service as much as we could. It's a free service and can take you anywhere in Manhattan up to 90th street. You definitely need to book ahead though since it's a very popular service. I believe the hotel only has 2 cars available.- The employees were helpful and provided quick service. They were all friendly and very knowledgeable about the area.Cons:- The convenient location to Wall Street comes at a price. We arrived around 8:30 pm on a Thursday night and ended up switching rooms since we could easily hear construction of the World Trade Center. The front desk agent said the construction was supposed to end at 8 pm but it continued until about 9 pm. The noise must be very frustrating for business guests who are trying to work in their room. The front desk agent was very accommodating though in switching our rooms but I can see the noise causing a huge issue when the hotel is full with a limited number of rooms away from the construction.- The quality of construction seemed a bit spotty. Our bathroom door would always slide shut and the paint in certain areas of the hallway and lobby was already wearing thin. - If you're a leisure traveler looking for nightlife around the hotel on the weekends, I'd recommend a different location since the area will be dead. The hotel bar was also very empty on a Saturday night.- There is a kiosk in the lobby to check-in to your flight and print your boarding pass. I tried to use the kiosk twice and both times the system timed out. Though it's a great feature, the hotel needs to first make sure the system has no faults.- The TV channels were spotty with no reception on Saturday morning. This may have been a one-time issue since it only occurred then. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the W Hotel though it was a pain to be so far from midtown. I recommend the hotel for business guests and it'll be a great choice especially once construction of the World Trade Center is done!

I took a break from the W brand (I've stayed in nicer Westins with better service) after being a fan of the brand since the very get-go in 98. I stopped W'ing a few years ago because of a series of catastrophic FAILs. I even avoided most Starwood properties. I relayed this info to Sofia, the GM who is amazing at staying on TA to address the negative (and postitive reviews), alerting her I was going to try the brand one more time. My needy emails to the property were answered quickly and I was super excited to see if the Whatever/Whenever mantra was back. "So far so good," I thought.Due to massive weather issues at Newark and ORD my flight was delayed. I got to the property at about 330am. And then my card had a fraud warning so I was stuck on the phone for 30 minutes getting it lifted. They brought a chair for me to sit on hold. I was thinking "OK, my snafu and these guys are getting me a chair. W/W is back."Easter Sunday was the tipping point for me (but please, don't let my kind of negative review dissuade you entirely, I simply have a W black cloud over me). I had confirmed the Acura Experience THREE times via email and in-person to be on the UES at 9:30 to see pals... Car is nowhere to be found. Plus, they had me leaving the W at 930 when it was communicated I needed to be up there at 930. AND, to keep adding more insult, they had another family booked for the car at the same time as me. A valet who was doing his best not to yell at me for yelling at him (yes, I lost control and they didn't so kudos to W for that) but he kept saying "I don't know" whenever I'd ask a question on reservations and car/driver location. So, they called a cab and reimbursed me. Big whoop! The whole point of these value-added services is to ADD VALUE. Why they didn't offer car service for their screw up is beyond me.The MOD came to see me while I was checking out and I'm sure they wanted me to leave with a smile not the "I'm mad so you get a bad review on tripadvisor" scowl. He was nice and cordial and I liked him but with all my past hiccups with the brand I told him I was done with Ws. To me, the Whatever/Whenever mantra was blasted over the car issue. I know that's a bad reason to give a property an "average" but the devil is in the details. Do you think this would happen at the Four Seasons or Mandarin? ABSOLUTELY NOT.That said, I don't know if the W is entirely responsible as they couldn't find the Acura driver. But the fact is quick-thinking hotel staff at premium properties are empowered to make every guest's experience seamless. Hailing a free cab is not a lateral move from an Acura Experience.Bar staff were fun and engaging, desk people were immensely helpful and all the various management people who I spoke with were all great. Everything but that car issue which seems nitpicky but anyone who has made this far into the review knows how one small, screwed up detail on a holiday will leave a funky taste. You will have fun and enjoy it. I have a dark cloud so I'm done with Ws.One quick tip, if you're flying out of Newark, make your cabby set his meter from the W to the airport. It's WAY cheaper on the meter going to the airport than it is coming to the hotel. Something with NJ/NY cabby rules or something...Oh, this stained towel remained in my room the whole weekend. How does that room with the stained towel get released in the system? Does housekeeping not see the stain at the fold of the towel? Also, I had the largest category room and they're typical NY rooms, nothing great. Save some cash and reserve a base room.

Nice rooms - downtown NY location. Dinner at BLT restaurant was excellent. Broken bathroom door that would not close and could not be fixed but we did not want to move (they did give us some Starwoods points) and terrible valet services. There was no one there and we waited about 45 minutes for our car.
user_name:
Happytravelinfamily
New York City, New York

review_body: Opened in August 2010 this is a fabulous hotel. Overlooking ' Ground Zero 'its in a great position for either a business or a pleasure stay. The staff are fanastic and so helpful. The 'W' concept is one of high class, modern and 'hip', and so well designed.It has a great atmosphere.Right next to the underground so everywhere you wish to go is easily accessible - we cannot wait to return.

I called a few weeks ago and added on an additional night to my reservation. They couldn't adjust my original reservation, so made me a new one. This really should have been seamless to me as a guest, but for whatever reason was not. I went down to the gym, and my key stopped working so I could not get back to my room (elevator requires a key) then I had to wait in the lobby, they requested ID which I did not have since I just went to the gym. Then I had to wait for a security escort...just annoying. The car service they include is a nice perk, especially if you are a tourist and are headed uptown. I wasn't made aware of it ahead of time or would have reserved, it was booked up for the next day by the time we checked in.We ordered room service last night, hair in the salad. Bathroom is dirty and the lightbulb burnt out. Gym was not cleaned, half eaten banana on the treadmill...I was there for 90 minutes and it was there when I got there so I am not certain how often they check/clean gym.I'm usually not to high maintenance, but just found the service and rooms to be sub par. I have stayed at the W on Lexington and it was much better.

I absolutely love this hotel. I stayed here before for valentines day and was so happy with the room and service that I decided to return. I spent the weekend here for my boyfriends birthday and he says that it was the best birthday that he's ever had. Everyone from Nataly in the whatever whenever to the concirge Joy were very helpful. The front desk person JJ was really cool. When I told him that we were here for my boyfriends birthday he upgraded us to a nice corner room where we coudl see eveyrthing and even gave us free drinks at there lounge. He even remembered our names from last time which was very impresive! Thank you so much to everyone for making our weeked so special. We will definitely be back!

New W Hotel is beautiful with the friendliest staff that appeared to enjoy doing all the nicest things for our stay. We were warmly greeted and given details that would make our visit exceptional. The room offered every bit of comfort and style. The "whatever whenever" attitude is absolutely true from our request for an extension cord to a complimentary ride in their Acura. The genuine kindness and hospitality was so very appreciated.

The W Hotel in New York's financial district sits directly across the street from the World Trade Center site. It is new and a touch gaudy for my taste.Our room, while small, was very comfortable and sound insulated (either that, or no one else was on our floor!). Bedding was deliciously comfortable, there were ample and large towels, toiletries, and an $8 bottle of $2 water.A couple of complaints: the bathroom sink (room 1811) was missing a stopper and there was no shelf in the bathroom.More importantly to me, Giovan, the receptionist, was aloof. I waited while he checked in a guest with whom he seemed friendly but his attitude toward me was not friendly. Additionally, I heard tell the preceding guest about a complimentary car arrangement that he failed to mention to me. I am not looking for friendship but do expect to receive good regard. All other hotel employees were friendly and helpful.
We stayed 4 nights in this hotel. We enjoyed the quality of it, the friendly and helpful staff and we would advise it as a wel situated hotel for a visit to NYC.

Service truly great--not the I'm cool young hipsters I've had at other W's--truly helped-car service good but you need to reserve that free Acura--- only problem is getting a taxi --because of location they are not going by and note since it's new several drivers didn't know it and I had to supply address. Staff works hard to get you one but it's tough

The hotel is nice. The beds were incredibly soft and the room was clean. The bathroom could use more counter space or a place to put down your clothes, but overall was fine. My only complaints are the construction noise (jackhammering early, early, early in the morning) and the cost of the drinks in the lobby. Our most expensive drinks the entire trip were here! Also, one of the people we talked to at the front desk had no clue about any of the places we wanted to visit (like very popular museums and tourist stops), but did send our request on to another employee who was able to help us.The location was fine. It is super close to Battery Park to visit the Statue of Liberty and close to subway stops. We were never able to use the hotel's Acura service because it was always booked. But, we still had no problems getting around. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay!

My brother and I stayed in the W Downtown NYC last Friday. We had several problems in the hotel. I called 3 times to confirm that we have 2 double beds because I was with my brother, that did not happen and it caused a very uncomfortable situation and a sleepless night; my brother arrived several hours before me but he was not allowed to check in because he had a foreign debit card and the front desk lady didn't have the courtesy to offer that he or she could call me and I could give a credit card number over the phone, so he just had to wait in the lobby for hours after a very long trip. The people that I spoke with on the phone were very rude - I was interrupted in my middle of my sentence several times with "Hold on." and put on hold for long periods of time with no explanation. The Whatever/Whenever lady gave me a very strange look when I asked if there's a vending machine in the hotel where I could buy a soda. Do stay away - I've stayed in many hotels in NYC and never before have I had any problems.
user_name:
kate987
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: While we usually stay in Midtown, we decided to try a downtown location. I imagine this is primarily a business hotel but it treated the tourists well. Our room on the 29th floor overlooked the construction site of the 911 Memorial. Fascinating! This is a new hotel that has all the amenities you would expect of a good hotel but was complimented by a great staff all around. Room was very clean and ultramodern, complete with a peek-a-boo shower, Easy to get taxis despite the location. Perhaps not the best place for "New York" excitement there were still things to go. It is rather long taxi ride uptown but do-able. Room rates were very attractive due to the construction, etc. Would definitely recommend this facility.
user_name:
CarpeDiem45
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: After I stayed here before, expectations were high on our stay in the last week of March 2011. And again we were not dissapointed. I took some friends on their first trip to NY and the eastcoast.The staff at this hotel makes the difference - again. I stayed at several W's and the staff at the door, the bell desk and the concierge make this a wow-experience again. We felt at home and taken care of again.
user_name:
Koen B
New York City, New York

review_body: We loved our stay at this uber-hip new hotel. The decor is fabulous, the service was friendly and efficient, and our room was awesome. Clean and comfortable and the bed was great (not your typical hard-as-a-rock hotel mattress). Love the Bliss beauty products too!Overall, we had a great stay and would definitely return.

Stunningly beautiful design & bright colors, fantastic rooms. I called in advance & got a great rate for a 3 night business stay, I love the living room, with it's breathtaking decode & outdoor bar. Truly outstanding & professional service. I even met the General Manager who really cares what each guest thinks about their W experience. I highly recommend the Acura MDX shuttle for a free ride throughout Manhattan, far better than any car service or taxi. Great SUV & free :D

I have stayed there twice and booked a deal on orbitz spending only 180 per night, which made it affordable! The hotel is great and it has SUPER comfortable beds, very clean, and friendly staff. The hotel is very close to ground zero, so we heard construction but otherwise it was a perfect stay.
user_name:
mab2247
New York City, New York

review_body: The staff was super helpful - directions on how to use the subway, finding a neighborhood cobbler (Stanley's on Thames - excellent!), comping my cab ride when their complimentary car service was down for the day (what a great feature). Everyone there was so helpful - Sam was amazing & so friendly. I was also nervous about the location being so far downtown & it really wasn't a big deal at all - it's 2 subway stops from soho & 15min max to times square. Room & bath were clean - no bed bugs! I will definitely stay here again!

We had a wonderfull experience in this hotel. We were upgraded to a spectacular room.I have visited NY before and have never stayed in a that spacious en luxuries room.As well the reception, as te carservice, as the GM (espacially the GM) made us feel welcome. We simply had to ask something en it was done for us.My daughter even cried when we checked out; That says enough.We will certainly come back tho this hotel.GreetingsBruno

I'm really glad I took advantage of a weekend deal at this shimmering property. From the moment I drove up, service was fantastic. Young Sam at the front desk was supremely helpful in checking in this traveler, overloaded with bags -- as well as super friendly. I was more than a little pleasantly surprised that the property offered an Acura car service and that I was able to take advantage of it a mere 90 minutes later. The common areas, the bar with its interesting concoctions and plenteous eye candy, and my room on the 20th floor with view of WTC construction bore that sleek W brand I've experienced at other properties. Yes, there is construction noise; and, yes, catching a cab isn't as easy as you might think. But the friendly and remarkably proactive staff here and the wonderfully appointed property are worth a stay for anyone who loves NYC and anyone who loves the brand.

I just stayed at the new W Downtown with my mom and sister for a girls weekend. The weekend started on a high with the friendly staff at the door and at the Welcome Desk. The lobby and bar are fun and lively on Friday night with a cool crowd of New Yorkers and out-of-towners. We loved the room - hip and spotless yet understated and full of great treats - from the Bliss products to the fun mini-bar! And, of course, the comfy W beds. The restaurant downstairs, BLT provided a delicious late night snack & drink (try the chocolate hazelnut cake!)
user_name:
ASKNYC
New York City, New York

review_body: We chose the hotel for location as we prefer to be in the financial district when in NYC. The room felt like it had not had a decent clean, we think the housekeeping department could not be bothered and wanted to be out of the room as soon as possible. Front desk were excellent. We might return (if I knew the room would be ok) but I think next time we will stay at the Marriott!

The W Hotel downtown has a fantastic staff! The doormen went out of their way to take care of our bags, find a taxi (not always an easy task by ground zero), and advise us on the best way to get around.The concierge staff were extremely responsive, answering questions prior to my arrival and arranging dinner reservations on the spur of the moment. Not to be outdone, the cleaning staff were particularly friendly as well.Its a new building and the room was larger than I'm used to in NYC however some of the hallways were quite dark, its party of the trendy atmosphere perhaps but it made my significant other feel uncomfortable.BLT, the restaurant in the lobby was also fantastic... I ate the BLT burger and shared the Tuna. Great staff there as well!Overall, thanks for a wonderful stay- Cameron

Between the tooth sucking, sighing complete with eyeball rolling front desk representative to the bellman repeatedly being sent to the wrong room to the fire department having to rescue trapped guests in the elevator and security knocking on our door to ask us if we had a wire hanger to help get them out to not having the correct rooms reserved having made the reservations six weeks prior and confirming every two weeks up 'til two days before check in- it's LAUGHABLE to think that ANYONE, anyone at all, has had any proper training of any sort at this hotel. There are plenty of wonderful hotels in this city even other "W" Hotels but this one is without a doubt NOT one of them. STAY AWAY!
user_name:
manvilleboy54
New York City, New York

review_body: We always stay in and around the Financial District when we visit NYC, with the Millennium Hilton and Embassy Suits having been our regular hotels.We decided to have a change this trip and booked into the W. Overall it was a very good hotel, very modern and great location.As a Gold SPG member I got my complimentary upgrade to a larger room overlooking the WTC site.The Acura car service is very good - we made use of it to go to dinner one evening.My biggest complaint was the cleanliness of the room (especially over the weekend period). The carpet and bathroom floor didn't appear to have been cleaned when we arrived and the overall room servicing was patchy (often with toiletries not replenished etc).Overall a hit, but it has been open for 6 months or so, they need to bottom out these issues!
I am a business traveler who stays all over NYC. This is the best hotel in the city. Marvelous room, especially the bed. But the best was the customer service. Great value for a 4 star.

Everything about the hotel was top drawer. The guest services Yeshare who checked us started our trip off on a positive note. The room was clean and cozy as stated. The bar was a great place to visit prior to heading out for a night in New York City. I normally don`t bother writing a review positive or negative but this hotel warrants the praise for outsanding merit in there abilities to meet guest services needs all around. Conceirge services, door man, housekeeping were all great. I would not hesitate to recommend to anyone to consider this hotel.

It was a good experience staying at this hotel. The amazing decor is a top point. The room service is fast and great, also the restaurants. The happy hour is a good time to stay there between some wall street cuties.I just didn't like the room size (it was smaller than I expected) and also the early noise..they are building the WTC complex

At W hotel in downtown new york, my family and i were overwhelmed with the over all quality of the hotel including the service, cleanliness, value, and appearance. We were more than satisfied with everything; specifically, their employees were outstanding with their friendliness, and helpfulness. The front desk employees such as Michelle Chang and Mark were very helpful and polite. Their porters Victor and Kareem were of great assistance when it came to helping out with luggage. Lastly, one of the drivers Ben was extremely friendly and a safe driver. All in all they provided us with quality service and a friendly environment.

W Hotel Downtown is in a great location. Lobby is absolutely beautiful. Check in was very quick, very friendly and courteous staff. Lobby bar and BLT restaurant are simply wonderful!! As a very frequent guest of Starwood properties, this W is a great choice over neighboring hotels. A+++ for rooms, staff, service and location.

A very sharp hotel squeezed into the Financial District. The room looks directly down on Ground Zero. That ceiling in the lobby is simple wild. Staff is very friendly. You'll want to hang out in the lobby before heading out for the evening.Outstanding restaurant in the hotel, BLT

Check in quick and friendly and though we arrived early rooms were quickly sorted out for us. Concierge staff very helpful...everyone from front office to the housekeepers were quick, pleasant and efficient.A really fun modern hotel and wonderful location -- would recommend to anyone. Rooms on the small side but everything you needed was there...great Bliss products too!

I stayed here for almost a week on business as my company is located literally around the corner from this hotel. Rooms are ok but generally small, the beds are comfortable and showers excellent. There is an ipod speaker and a flatscreen tv in the rooms also. During the week this is an ok location with bars and restaurants but come weekend it is a ghost town. I also had issues getting cabs back to the hotel from other areas of New York city as they did not want to go back to Manhattan.Service is ok, building noise was not really evident and the car service was also ok.This is an ok hotel if the location is important to you, but I would say its probably over priced.

Just came back after a free night here using my SPG hotel points. The biggest problem with this hotel is its location. Their Acura drop-off service is a joke and no taxis will come to this area on weekend unless a hotel guest is arriving back to the hotel and taxi agrees to take you. The hotel is 1.5 blocks inside a main street with nothing but construction going on. The hotel is OK for weekday business crowd who are staying for business in downtown financial district. If you are arriving here for weekend (or weekday) stay for NYC attractions, look elsewhere unless you are getting a free night with your hotel points and all other starwood hotels in prime spots in NYC are not available. We had to wait 15 minutes for a taxi and I can see guests waiting for longer than 30 minutes during peak evening times to get one. It is about $18-19 each way from here to time square area by taxi. The contruction noise was not an issue for us as the contruction was not taking place on Sunday morning and it was raining, but I can see that as a problem also as noted by previous reviewers. The staff is friendly and extremely helpful, lobby is wonderful (but no action at all when we were there on a saturday evening during prime Christmas time), and rooms are nice and comfortable.

Great hotel design, especially the lobby and bar are breathtaking! the hotel staff was very friendly and helpful! Sofia, the GM was amazing! Thanks Nicole for the restaurant reservations! Robert, it was great seeing you back! very clean and beautiful rooms with modern design! It felt as a home away from home!!!

This location is worth a look if you want a place that's not bang in the middle of all that NYC has to offer on the weekend, but is close enough to get to it, or if you want a place from which you can easily get to a waterfront view for a quiet walk, this may be for you. The hotel sits next to the WTC construction site which is sobering, but that project is progressing quietly, and was not intrusive. W hotels have become favorites of mine and this one did not disappoint. From the lower deck entrance to the check-in experience in the visually impressive 5th floor lobby, to the clean, well-designed, quiet room, to the accommodating staff, to the lack of significant construction noise by the time I checked-out on Monday morning, to the very gracious general manager who came to meet me before I left to see how things were that weekend.....it was a good experience, and I'll be back.
user_name:
Vigi06
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Yes, it's new. Yes, it's a W. Means the lobby becomes a throbbing night club at night and the halls are dark during the day.Yes, the construction was ongoing until late in the night. SInce I'd read comments on TripAdvisor, I requested a side room instead of the larger room booked that faced the DB construction. It made a huge difference vs. my colleagues who had rooms facing the street. There are only 1-2 rooms not facing construction per floor and these rooms are small. I'd also be concerned about the rooms that are not open yet; they back on to the elevator shafts.The thing that distinguishes this hotel from others in the city is the staff. They made a point of remembering guests and engaging them. They handled any & all requests with a can-do attitude- such a pleasant change from NY hotels.The gym is very small and with limited equipment, but no one seems to use it. The bathroom only has a shower and there is no hand held shower head. The rooms, although new, are basically comfortable, but utilitarian. Nothing "luxe" here. I appreciated the new heating system- it worked vs. the last hotel I stayed in in NYC.

This hotel is directly across from the WTC building site so the jack hammers work from 7:30am till dark every day except Sunday. The WTC project is about 4 years from completion.The hotel believes in loud techno music and uncomfortable seating everywhere in the hotel. The staff said this was a W "soft opening", we thought it a "hard opening". Rooms were tiny but the site across the street at least interesting! Beds were good and staff tried to be helpful but nothing quite worked from our heating unit to our friends' safe.Lots of money for a hotel that fell short of what it should be!!!

I stay several weeks per year in New York. Discovering this new W-hotel last week was a pleasant surprise. The hotel is located close to 3 subway lines (1, R, 4+5 are within three blocks from the hotel), and very close to the ferry lines. The people at this W exceed expectations, both in efficiency and genuine friendliness. The staff in the hotel is among the best I have encountered in my recent stays in similar hotels. They are friendly in a very genuine way. They made me feel at home from the moment I arrived here. When I stayed here last week, some construction work at ground zero was taking place, but none of it affected the rest during the night. In day time, one can hear the noise of the workers, but not interfering with normal life. The room I stayed in is very spacious, has lots of light and is - in W style - very nicely decorated. The hotel itself has a very cozy atmosphere. The lobby on the 5th floor is designed to create this great W-atmosphere. The Sweat/workout has all equipment for a complete workout, and the BLT bar at the ground floor attracts not only hotel guests but locals from the nearby Battery Park as well. Great atmosphere: try the lobster ravioli!To be short: I will be happy to stay here again any time soon.
user_name:
Koen B
New York City, New York

review_body: I stayed at the W New York Downtown this weekend with my husband. We wanted to get away for the night without the kids and had not been to this hotel in NYC yet. I had heard about it through some articles and was excited to have the opportunity to try it! When I checked in I was completely wowed by the decor of the hotel. The lobby design was really unique, especially the arched ceiling made of light. The front desk staff was very accomodating and they gave us a lot of information about the hotel services, including the restaurant BLT, which we tried for brunch and loved! Our room was very nice and it was great to stay at a hotel that was so new. We went out in lower manhattan for dinner and the doorman was very accomodating in helping us get a cab. There is still a lot of construction going on near ground zero, but it was very quiet in the room and during the weekend it was relatively quiet around the outside of the hotel. Overall, I would recommend this hotel, especially if you want to be in downtown New York.

If you want to see the amazing progress on the memorials and new buildings at Ground Zero, the new W in downtown Manhattan is the place. It's located right behind the Deutsche Bank building, which is nearly down, so the views into the heart of the construction will soon be amazing. The hotel is fun - good restaurant and bar and work out facility. We were able to arrange a free ride to the west Village for dinner from a joint promotion with the W and Acura. We normally stay in midtown when visiting, but the new W exposed us to new restaurants and sites we normally don't visit. A very enjoyable trip.

Just spent the weekend in NY and stayed at the W Downtown. This hotel looks to the future - towards the completion of the World Trade Center and surrounding buildings and memorials. Once complete, I have no doubt the W downtown will be full to the brim with the hipster crowd downtown.It's only fair to disclose that the hotel looks over the World Trade Center construction site. This is not something the hotel has any control over but be aware that notwithstanding the hotel's best efforts to insulate the rooms, there is an audible amount of construction noise. I didn't notice any noise at night, but I only stayed over the weekend. OK - with that caveat, the rest of the review is entirely favorable. The coolest thing about check-in is the amazing lobby and light installation in the 5th floor lounge. It really transports you to another place and says you have arrived somewhere very special.The rooms were a nice size for NY - king size bed and the usual fabulous Bliss products. No bathtub, but it's not expected in NY where every square inch of the room has a functional purpose. The interior is super cool with white leather headboards and banquettes by the window, and very innovate and chic cabinetry which serves multiple purposes including desk, safe, closet, TV wall, bar fridge among a dozen other things while retaining a very sleek feel.The workout room is signature W and very well equipped, and the hotel bar and lobby areas are really cool. This hotel is recommended and will only improve with time and completion of the World Trade Center projects.
user_name:
mmppwwzz
New York City, New York

review_body: My husband and I stayed here for my birthday weekend. The location is spectacular, with the downtown going through a renewal period. There is so much to see and do we never had to walk more than a few blocks for anything. The staff and management at the hotel were always available for any questions we had, Jason was especially kind, and we were very happy with everything at the hotel. The rooms are a bit on the small side, but that is what you get when staying in NYC. The beds were very comfortable and the gym is amazingly well equipped (I was very impressed with the gym and the fact that they don't charge extra to use it). The other extra touches like coffee in the morning, water and pressed cider in the afternoons were really nice as well.I will absolutely be staying at this hotel again, and if they do put a park on the site of the old Deutche Bank Building the views of the WTC memorial and Freedom Tower are going to be unbeatable. We may have to bring our kids next time (or maybe not).

New York is said to be the City that never sleeps. Unfortunately at W-Downtown in our recent stay, sleeping was not an option. Construction noise was running at in excess of 80 decibels inside our guest room. On a number of nights construction noise ran until well after midnight, on the day we were checking out (which incidentally was a Saturday) construction noise began around 7.30am, which I guess was to be expected given that it had started at that time for the remainder of our stay. Half way through our stay I complained about the noise, the staff were courteous and apologetic and offered us another room. A room which would have been far too small, and did not appear to offer additional benefits with the exception of being on the side of the building and not facing Ground Zero. On the second last day of our stay, a voicemail came through at 10.04am (according to the message) to advise us that there would be no hot water in the hotel between 10am through to 4pm. I called Whatever Whenever (the Concierge Desk), to be advised that they did not know when hot water would be back on, and they would contact the company who had the gas off, hardly the pro-active response I would have expected from representatives of a Starwood hotel.Apart from the above, the hotel is new, has very nice and spacious rooms, with the exception of the side room that we were offered as an alternative, and has all the amenities you would expect in a W. I expect that the W Downtown will age fairly quickly given the white interiors, and I noticed in the room we were staying in, dirty black marks which had not been cleaned off, and some of the linen was already showing wear, particularly the towels.As you would appreciate I was extremely disappointed at the above inconveniences during our stay, particularly given that I had made it clear to the Starwood agent who had taken my booking that we would be on vacation, and we stayed in the hotel for 9 nights. My personal opinion is that Starwood either should not have opened this hotel, until the Dueche Bank building has been completely demolished (which the W’s staff told me would not be before at least the end of the year), or should be warning potential guests of the possible inconvenience, something they certainly did not do with me, although the manager on duty when I made further complaints on the day before we left told me he would ensure that happened in the future, something I will believe when I hear it with my own ears! All in all a very disappointing experience, and Starwood’s response has been to “gift me” points which I can redeem for a night’s accommodation. It hardly makes up for 9 very sleep disturbed nights, where we paid good money to stay in what should be a lovely hotel. I have stayed in Starwood hotels in at least seven different countries, all of our prior experiences have been positive in their hotels. I have never provided feedback such as this on a website previously. I provide this summary as a warning to potential guests of the W Downtown, so that they can make an informed decision before they commit to staying in this hotel. I should also add that I have passed on this feedback to the General Manager of the hotel in question some two weeks ago, she promised a response within three days, despite two follow up’s and two weeks passing no response has been received. Undoubtedly, indicative of what you can expect at the hotel.

I can only recommended this hotel to everyone because they are extremely professional and carefully, if you will visit New York there is one place to be and that is W hotel downtown Sven Baele Belgium

I took my girlfriend to the w in manhattan and we went to the oasis bar. They had excellent service. We were greeted by a bartender named marianne who added to the ambiance of the hotel with her wonderful charm.

Stayed at the W over the weekend of 9/11 during Fashion Week.As Starwood Owners, we had high expectations for the new W. Absolutely world class service, the concierge directed us to all the Fashion Week events and each individual staff member extended personalized service. Accommodations were exceptional, chic clean lines, well maintained, sufficient room for our stay - all that we expect for NYC W.Location fine, easy access to wherever in the City one needs to get to.Clearly, they have set the bar high, which in today's service industry is much appreciated.We will stay here for all our forays to NYC.

I am always so amazed at how efficiently the W hotel rooms are decorated and arranged. I always take a moment and think "What is this like 250 sq. ft. at most? And they managed to fit a queen sized bed, flat screen TV, full sized desk, closet, decently sized bathroom, all while STILL having room left to extend a multipurpose area by the window (which we all know is the coolest part of any W hotel room)??"How do they do it??Sigh* Only after five minutes of scanning the room do I manage to calm my brain down from the mysteries and wonders that can only come from superior interior design. Say THAT five times fast.Moving on: a half star docked because I just cannot understand why the shower (in its effort to look retro chic) has only a half-door. All the water splashes everywhere and leaves a mess. Eck.The staff at the W Hotel in Manhattan were extremely doting. I mentioned that I preferred a room above the 7th floor (less noise), so they assigned me to a quiet room on the 17th floor. In addition, after noticing that I placed a towel on the floor outside the (in my opinion, unfinished) shower area, housekeeping left a nice fluffy rug in its place when I returned. Thank ya much :)The concierge staff was supremely knowledgeable, and provided excellent directions and suggestions for the quickest and cheapest ways to get where we wanted to go. All I had to do was ask, for example, where I could find the best market for fruits within a walkable distance. And *poof* like magic, I would have three or four places to choose from within a matter of minutes. They sent me on my way with notes, directions, and a copy of that day's Wall Street Journal, and even a cup of lemon/lime infused water. It's the small touches.Overall, it was a very comfortable stay at one of Manhattan's most conveniently located hotels. Plus, W Hotels are home to Bliss Spas (which means, of course, they stock their wonderful mini goodies in room). Bliss girls everywhere, rejoice!

Only open just 7 weeks, we were surprised to see just how smoothly everything runs at the new W New York Downtown. We learned, over the course of our 5 night stay, that many of the staff have been with W hotels for many years. They must have chosen the cream of the crop for opening this new location. Every single person we met was friendly and solicitous and if they did not know what to do, they did not hesitate to find someone who did. We were made to feel as valued guests.Hip,sleek, shiny, modern and pretty...... as you would expect from a W. The rooms were a good size for NYC standards. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom and shower was great. Linens were top notch and the towels new and plush. Kind of everything you would expect from the words "W" and "new." Coffee in the am and apples and water in the lobby was a nice touch.Although you are waayyy downtown, 3 major subway lines are within a block or 2 walk. The hotel has a Acura service that will drive you anywhere in the city for free. Just be prepared for a marketing pitch on the Acura. Not a hard sell though and it was a nice feature.We ate at BLT for dinner and it was outstanding. Still quiet but the food and service was great. Breakfast was just "ehh."Our only complaint involved noise. Understandably, the dismantling of the building across the street is beyond their control. All of lower Manhattan in transforming and building. No one knows what might be built in it's place but the current construction will be short term. We also heard no noise from room to room....a pet peeve of ours.But..........It is a tall and narrow building and almost all rooms on the floors have close proximity to the 3 elevators. The elevators did not create a problem in our room but the doors to the hall do not block the sound of the guests standing waiting for them. No one seems to realize how loud their voices are and how they carry once they are out of their own rooms. As the hotel becomes more occupied, this might be more of an issue.I don't know how they can fix our biggest issue. Late into the night (2-6am), when all external noise has subsided and the air-conditioner is not running, the music from the lobby can be heard through the air ducts. Our first night, we thought the speakers for the outside terrace bar had been left on. The next night, we thought it was a nearby rooftop club? Then we thought it might be from the elevators..... but the sound was coming from further inside the room. It wasn't until 3 nights into it that we figured out what it could possibly be. The Front desk said they have never heard anyone complain about this issue before. Maybe it was our room location or proximity to the lobby (were were on floor 8 and the lobby is on 5) or just the fact that we were up at that time??? I haven't heard anyone else mention this issue and cannot make recommendations as to how future guests might avoid this problem.Other than that, we had a wonderful stay.

Just wanted to let let other TripAdvisor users know how much we enjoyed our three night stay at the W Sept. 23-26.From the moment our airport shuttle pulled up to the door, to ourdeparture in that awesome Accura, our stay at this fine hotel wassublime. The staff members are so polite and accomodating!We loved our super-clean, modern room, especially the window seat with the view. The bed was perfect and the shower and Bliss toiletries were five star.The lounge/bar is so beautiful I couldn't believe it.The complimentary coffee and papers in the morning was much appreciated.After our stay at the W ran out, we headed over to another hotel to take advantage of some points we had saved. The service there was good, but the surroundings seemed very drab in comparison. I tell you, our "W" experience spoiled us for allothers.We look forward to staying at the W Downtown again sometime in the future. We highly recommend this hotel.

I had a wonderful experience at this hotel. The hotel staff was top-notch and very friendly and extremely accomodating. The hotel also offered a complimentary one-way car service by Acura that was a wonderful perk. The rooms were beautiful and the beds were extremely comfortable. I will most definitely stay at this location again in the future and would recommend it to anyone traveling to the NYC area!

I just wanted to wirte a quick note about the wonderful experience I had recently at The W New York Downtown. Whenever I travel to New York the W hotel is always my preferred home away from home. I have stayed at several of the W properties in New York and this newest addition is by far my new favorite. Everything from the atmosphere to the accomodating staff really embodied the W's promise. Whatever whenever and wonderfully too. From the concierge (whom also helped me book my massage at the Bliss Soho, another assisted me when I left my key card in the room) to the bell hop (who gave me the full tour). The hotel design was breathtaking. The idea of using reflective lighting & keeping it simple really lends to a clean elegant atmosphere. I especially liked the watering closet in the lobby. As well, they've put some thought into efficiency by being eco aware. Recycling in the rooms and lighting activated by your key card.I hated for the experience to end. Rest assured I will be staying again and looking forward to it. I was definitely WOWed.

Checked in last week using Star points. The hotel was easy to find. Check in was easy and staff was great at check in. I will talk about all aspects of the hotel we used.Room- Kinda upset. Door was dirty. Scratches and dings all over the flat white walls. Spoke to GM and regrets using flat white paint. Room didn't have towels or hand soap on arrival. Great beds, great tv, cool phones, Apple docking system, descent size for NY. Seen smaller bathrooms. Rain shower was nice, but if your going to put a rain shower in the shower be sure to have multiple shower caps. Girlfriend needed to request.Elevators were cool, although you need to stop on the 5th floor then catch another to get to the ground floor. No way to go from your room to the ground floor. But as you exit at the 5th floor there was always someone to greet us, fresh water and apples were available.In Room Dining was not good. Presentation was cool. Ordered a cheese plate one night and it came with nothing. No breadsticks, crostinis, crackers, etc.. Just a few grapes? Never in my life have I had to pay for crackers or bread with a cheese plate.Location is 2-3 minutes from NYSE, Freedom Hall, Lehman, AIG, Trinity Church, etc. Will be one block from the new Freedom Tower when it's completed.View was not good from 801. Looking directly down at the construction cars and site, trash bins, etc... Reconstruction of the Freedom Tower is very important but the view from that side of the building is currently not to good. Will be great in 3 years when the building is completed.Living Room and Lounge were great and comforable. The Acura Experience was great, use it if you can. Way better then a cab.Staff were pretty good not great. Phone etiquette needs a little work. I know those paying between $400-$800 a night for a standard room don't way to be told to "hold on" or "wait a minute" wouldn't happen at the Ritz or Four Seaons.Would stay here again, but would definitely like to see a few changes implemented first. There are just to many options in NYC to be mediocre when people pay the rates they do in NYC.

I have a love hate relationship with W hotels. Yes, they are hip and sexy and make me feel even less of both. I will say my gripes are not with the staff, they are uniformly excellent, and the beds are the best. But the W Downtown has some serious issues. First of all it overlooks a construction site, the work at which begins promptly at 7 am with pile drivers and jackhammers. Its not any construction site either. Its the Freedom Tower site, AKA Ground Zero. I asked to be moved for my second night but they explained that none of the rooms on the south side of the building had been opened yet? Really? Who's brilliant decision was it to open the rooms facing a major construction site first?And here is the thing that really pisses me off--no outlets by the bed. This is a BRAND NEW hotel and all hip and wifi-ed and stuff. Has the W designer never traveled on business? We want to plug in our phones on the night stand and use our laptops in bed and you hide the outlets behind immovable furniture? Scores of business travelers wish a pox upon your house. (at least the desk outlets are above the desk).And really, why is wi fi free at Motel 6 but $15 a day here?I guess if you have business on Wall Street, it is a great resource. But otherwise, the location sucks. The neighborhood is desolate after 6. Quiet. But empty.

"It's brand new so the rooms are clean and the staff is eager to make sure everything works well and any problems get immediate attention. Sofia the manager and Bobby the bar manager really went out of their way to make sure me and my friends and co-workers were well taken care of. And Rachel the waitress was amazing, smart and friendly. Also Patty with the "Whatever" desk made sure my breakfast order was perfect and if it wasn't she check on me and fixed it immediately.

Thank you to the staff at the W New York Downtown who made my birthday staycation a pleasure. My boyfriend and I booked the W New York Downtown for a 3-day birthday getaway. I was upgraded to a Spectacular Room by the GM Sofia and when I checked it, the staff recognized it was a special day and personally wished me a happy birthday. Lauren was my W Insider and she had left a birthday gift plus a signed birthday card from the staff! Inside my room was a tiny birthday cake and two cans of fizzy white wine. There was also a gorgeous tissue-stuffed bag containing a special texturized beach book, beach wipes and sunblock. Lauren knew from my boyfriend that we were going kayaking out in CT for a day. On the second day, I got another birthday card plus a rubber W luggage tag (very cute!)Note: Prior to my stay, Lauren contacted me and asked if I needed any help with reservations or suggestions. As a New Yorker, I didn't need any recos but took up her help in getting reservations to a notoriously difficult-to-get-reservations restaurant. Lauren and Joy (W Concierge) were able to score the reservations I wanted. Brilliant!ROOMThe room itself was very comfortable. I'm not usually a fan of such modern design but it was very chic and warmer than I thought from the pics on the website. The bed was extremely comfortable (like all Starwood properties!) The shower is small but no smaller than most New York hotel rooms. The downside is the construction over the WTC. You'll get awesome views but construction starts at 7am Mon-Sat. We were on the 7th floor and across from the elevator. The walls are thin and so noise travels. We had an issue with the guest next door playing music (all rooms come with an ipod docking station) starting at 7am on a Sunday, the one day construction didn't occur. Luckily, we enjoyed his taste in music. The W also caters to a young crowd and our unfortunate location across from the elevator meant we heard noises until late into the night. LOCATIONThe location isn't ideal unless you live downtown and are looking for a stay-cation or are specifically coming to NYC to check out the WTC, the Statue of Liberty and other downtown sights. The subway is just a few blocks away so travel is convenient. Taxis are easy to pick up. Food and nightlife options aren't the best so far downtown but it's NY so it's still a good time. Walk about 10min and you'll be in Tribeca, a very hip part of NY filled with restaurants and bars. AMENITIESWe tried the new BLT and it was amazing! Food is delicious and service is warm. We received a VIP card that among other things entitled us to 15% off all future visits. The Living Room Terrace at the W is gorgeous and drinks are well-made. Overall we enjoyed our visit immensely and would give this property 4.5 stars which the service really being a stand out.

I don't like posting negative reviews, or ranters, but I had to share- you make the call- am I being unreasonable here? Wife and i split up on Friday night- she to the ballet with her friends, me in the village with my friends. She had the only room key b/c we lost the other one. Came back before her- at 1 AM. Staff wouldn't let me in because "I wasn't on the reservation" even though the reservation was under a shared Starwood account and i was there at check in (and they gave out two keys at that time.)  Kept me waiting in the lobby for 45 minutes, didn't offer sympathy or kindness let alone a drink or a snack or anything and actually had a security guard posted in the lobby mad dogging me for the last 15 minutes of my wait. Can you believe that? I'm a criminal defense lawyer, so I know what it is like to be treated like a criminal- and they treated me like I was a criminal. So that's what happened to me at the W New York-Downtown this weekend.

Starwood really got it right with this one-- from arrival to departure, a stellar experience. None of the standoffish service I have experienced at other W hotels, this one was very friendly and helpful in every sense. A staff member greeted you at every turn.My "spectacular room" was indeed that, very large with funky space age decor that I absolutely loved. The window seat was a nice touch even if the scenery out the window wasn't anything to write home about. The BLT restaurant was good as was the Living Room bar. The bartenders there were especially friendly.I hope this hotel keeps the same quality standards after it has been open a while. I would definitely return if the price was right.

I planned a meeting there with some colleagues coming in from Europe and N. America the first week it was opened - Aug. 11-13. It was FANTASTIC! I love the design and the service of the W Hotels, but the W Downtown was beyond my expectations! The guest rooms were nice (view over looking construction of WTC site and the Deutsche Bank being taken down floor by floot), but I did not hear any loud noise. The meeting room was perfect for our group (plus a direct hook up from computer to flat screen TV so no projector needed). The BLT restaurant was very tasty for lunch. They helped me from everything hairspray to reservations for dinner before a show. Everyone from the door man to the General Manager and especially my Conference Service Manager were fantastic! The ONLY small complaint is the alarm clocks in the adjacent rooms would go off too early in the morning (I believe it was because the hotel had just opened, no one had set them properly). I believe they will figure it out soon, so I can imagine that problem will go away!

We went to NYC for one night and had a great experience at the new W in downtown. From the organic cool lobby to the outside area (bar still to open), and the room, the hotel looked great. It just opened a few months ago and hotel staff was excellent. Would definitely go there again. Room was beautiful, pretty large for NYC standards. Right around the corner from Battery Park, Wall Street, WTC, Soho and Chinatown in walking distance. Also had lunch in hotel. Great quality!

Staying in W downtown whistle on family holiday to US Open tennis. Hotel is everything you could want for a good city break. Some very minor teething problems as recently opened hotel e.g. No shower caps, slippers in rooms but all issues easily remedied by hotel staff.There are plenty og good places to eat nearby, particularly Stone Street, a pedestrianised area with maybe 20 or 30 eateries available.This W compares very favourably with other W's I've stayed at and the service level is probably the best to dat. Highly recommended.

Stayed at this property in late August 2010 after it had been open for about 10 days. Upon entering the ground floor where the hotel restaurant is located, I did not see any signage directing me to take the elevator to the 5th floor to check in but ultimately found my way.All the staff I met were very accommodating and helpful. Recognized Robert and Floyd from the W - Court property that was sold in spring 2010. Was given a complimentary red luggage tag which might be a promo as a part of their grand opening. The two greeters who welcome guests to the hotel and help flag taxis were very friendly. It took about 15-20 minutes to hail a cab at 7:30 pm on a Wed night so give yourself time. A couple subway stops are within a few blocks of the hotel. Acura service will not start for a couple more weeks.Was upgraded to a "Cool Corner Room" on the 9th floor. Bed was comfortable, room was spacious, and A/C blew nice and chilly. Only issue w the room was that the morning sunlight seeped through the blinds because of a gap in coverage. As well, Ground Zero construction seemed to start by at least 7 am. Noise may not be an issue on higher floors, but it was definitely audible on the 9th floor.

This place definitely made a lasting impression, and it was unlike any hotel I've ever visited. Is it for everyone? Likely not, so you should be prepared for what you're going to encounter.My colleague and I were greeted by the bellmen down at the street level, but their tight black outfits suggested that we were entering a nightclub, not a hotel. The lobby is decked out with an undulating lit ceiling--which is definitely cool--but the LED's stark white tone make the place feel more like an operating room instead of a welcoming hotel entrance. (It also hurt my eyes a little, but my traveling companion had no such complaints.) Coming from Los Angeles, I expect places that look like this to be a little snooty and cold, but the front desk staff was quite helpful and friendly, even if they followed the script a little too closely. (To wit: "Thank you, Mr. Regular Guy. I hope you enjoy your experience with us.") My biggest complaint about this place was the strong scent that they piped into the lobby (or maybe it was candles?). It was welcoming when I first arrived, but I quickly started dreading having to pass through the lobby for that reason. In addition, the hallways were quite dark, with pseudo-black lights overhead and dark wallpaper and carpet on the remaining three sides. Cool? Maybe for the rave crowd, but not for me. I had a hard time spotting my room number. Once in the room, the lighting is appropriate, although it would be great if there was some art on the walls. (You don't realize how important hotel art is until it isn't there.) The work space was adequate, the shower stall spacious, but the bathroom ventilation was not operational during my visit. In addition, the drain in the bathroom sink didn't work very well.For the future, the gal at the front desk said that they're currently dismantling the old Deutsche Bank building directly to the north, so the W should have some pretty spectacular views once the new World Trade space is complete. Specifically, the outdoor bar on the lobby-level (not yet open during my stay) will be a pretty neat place to get a drink. However, for the time being, all of that construction means that this place is pretty noisy, at all hours of the day. Requesting a room that doesn't face north might help that problem.Overall, this place strikes me as ironic performance art. It seems like all of the elements--the co-ed bathroom in the lobby, the whimsical in-room breakfast menu, the custom-designed stationery, the ever-changing elevator mats, etc etc--all poke fun at the concept of the boutique hotel instead of serving to reinforce it. So I'm left wondering: is this place beyond hip, or was it outdated even before the first guest arrived?

was a guest at the brand new W downtown in the financial district.lobby area is sensationally designed,adjacent terrace area serving cocktails and appetizers overlooking the financial district..Service is outstanding,right from the greetings from the doorman welcoming you to the receptionist trying to accomodate you. I was upgraded to a spectacular room,unfortunately the view is of the partially rebuilt new World trade center.Rooms are modern with a very comfy bed, HDTV and the usual accroutments you can expect from a W hotel.expect the lobby scene will be jamming in the fall esp. for the wall street scenesters.i could not get the Post in the am, was offered the Times (not recommended for light reading in the morning!) instead.Had breakfast at Blt on the groundfloor, excellent service(i was the only one there!),delicious preparation, would def. recommend it.only major drawback is ,this is the Boondocks as far as Manhattan goes, the only company on the weekend wlll be lost tourists! night life is nonexistent, then again im sure the lobby scene will be plenty fun soon. Ideal for wall street businessmen looking for an unstuffy place to retire.Century 21 is right round the corner, so you can shop cheap to your hearts content.

Spent the night at the W Hotel Downtown (123 Washington Street) for a bachelorette party. Got to the hotel which is right near the WTC construction site. Before booking this hotel, you should really have a plan as to where you are going to be hanging out in NYC. This hotel is really out of the way from the touristy sites, unless you plan on hanging around the financial district (it's deserted on weekends), South Street Seaport (a 10- to 15-minute walk away), Battery Park City. There are subways close by, but still something to consider if you are not the subway type and prefer to take cabs. Also many of the rooms face the WTC construction site, a constant reminder of 9/11. Parking is available closeby for $50 (non-SUV) though I was able to find overnight parking for $25 10 blocks away at 20 Trimble Place (near Duane Street). The first lobby you get to see is pretty dark (dark walls, dark floor) and there are elevators when you first enter. Take the first set of elevators to the 5th floor to get to the reception area. There wasn't a sign telling guests where to go - I had to get out of the elevator and ask the doormen. Not sure what's on the floors between. The reception area is very pretty. The ceiling with waves of lights looks like something you'd find in a modern museum. The staff was friendly. On the reception floor are the outdoor patio bar with black and red plastic chairs and tables, an indoor sitting area with couches and an indoor bar. Cocktails were around $14 each (this is the going rate for that area, so not just at the hotel). We had a light lunch (pizza, paninis) at the outdoor bar. Outside, there are also giant wooden Jenga games for guests to play with. The next set of elevators brings guests up to their rooms. You need to have your room card ready to scan in the elevator in order to go upstairs. Got to the 14th floor where my room was. (BTW, the elevators run VERY fast - you can actually feel the G-force in your legs as it gets to the lobby) The hallways are very dark with small lights, just enough for one to see. Our room, which happened to be right in front of the elevators, was very nice. Very clean. Two queen beds enough for 3-4. The view from the room was the WTC construction site. The bathroom was very nice - no tub but a roomy shower area instead with glass doors. There is a frosty pane of glass between the shower room and the sleeping area - FYI - if you turn on the light in the middle of the night, the light reflects through the frosty glass into the sleeping area. (You can see this in one of my pictures) Others in our party did not have that frosty pane of glass in their rooms, so only certain rooms have them. Note that the humongous windows in the room open so one can actually fall out of them - note for anyone who has kids. Got back to the room pretty late and could not get to sleep. It wasn't so much the bed, which was very comfortable. But the air conditioner in the room was blasting really cold air and it sounded like a loud fan. It did that every hour it seemed. In addition to that, the elevator right outside my room was stuck/broken and making a dinging sound every 15 minutes. I called the concierge and they said that they would send someone up to check it. The dinging would stop but then would start again. This continued on until the morning. I probably could've asked to have the room changed but the person I was rooming with was still out. Also, I could hear anyone coming out of the elevators chatting away. So, in short, the hotel is very nice and the location is just okay. Hotel rate was normal for that location. Also, as with any hotel, make sure to ask for a room away from the elevators.

Just checked out the new W New York Downtown - WOW. A fabulous property all around.The lighting throughout the hotel is incredible, especially in the Living Room / Reception area. It makes you feel like you are in a movie wonderland. Just gorgeous.The rooms are spacious and very well thought out. Had dinner in the BLT restaurant which was amazing. Very comfortable and stylish with great food.Definitely worth checking out!

We stayed here on the hotel's opening day and really enjoyed the experience. Reception staff was very welcoming and helpful with our sightseeing tour. The rooms were very clean and stylish and we had a great night in the very comfortable bed! Showers are spacious and bath robes were very cosy. Breakfast and dinner was very tasteful. Overall, our experience was a WOW experience! We would recommend anyone to stay here.
